story:
Summary

It's been mere years since the Nekos were freed, but things are little better now than they were before. Though they don't slave away at cafes for perverted shop owners, most live in slums and some are forced to take jobs few would wish for... Now with rumors of a political movement to send them back into slavery, a charismatic, charming, influential, likable, intelligent, and compassionate man is tasked with mending the division between Neko and Human.

Unfortunately however... the world got you instead.

 

CGs

 

Characters

 

Why Indiegogo?

We acquired the rights to Neko Club because the prior devs were unable to finish the game. Though it is generally against our policy as a team to ever do a crowdfunding campaign when we still have unreleased games that have been crowdfunded, and especially not to do a second campaign for one game, this is already an unusual circumstance. Essentially, the budget was nonexistent when the project was eventually handed over to us, and we want to ensure that the backers receive a high-quality finished game. To do that, we're crowdfunding the necessary funds to complete the missing content.

story:
WHO WE ARE
In June of 2018, we opened Level 419 in Northwood, Ohio. Our goal from the beginning was to provide a variety of arcade games, from classics to Japanese music games. With over 80+ games and growing, we offer the best arcade experience in the Toledo area! We also provide console gaming and tabletop gaming , with a wide selection of consoles and games!

It's been over a year, and it's time for us to move to a better location and continue making Level 419 the best arcade in Toledo!

THE CAMPAIGN
We’re running this campaign to raise money to move to a better location. Most pressingly, Our current lease agreement ends in April, and we need a new location in place before then! We’ve been searching for a new location for a while, however, in order to provide a higher quality place for our customers to hang out and enjoy our selection of arcade, console and tabletop gaming!

Our first step is to move to a better location in order to create a better customer experience. Our currently location is a sublease, and we have little to no control over the quality of the building or repairs. The comments about the condition of our current building have not been ignored!

A better location allows us to improve what we can offer our customers. We’re talking more tables for socializing and tabletop gaming, an enhanced console setup, a gaming museum, live events, a more robust food service, and other plans we’re keeping under wraps for now!


Our goal is to purchase a building to help control costs and secure our space for the long term. This requires more upfront costs, but is a better investment down the line. Leasing space has a lower cost to begin with, but those costs remain high overall and don’t offer true investment for Level 419 long term. 
 

A commercial retail lease is about $3000 per month, other expenses not included. A down payment on a building is 20% of the purchase price, which is a larger chunk of change, but is equal to about one year of a lease. Of course, the building would still have to be paid for, but the monthly cost to a bank would be 50% of the cost of a lease and is more sustainable.

The purpose of this campaign is to provide the seed money to move out. We already have most of the equipment we need to get up and running, including the games, chairs, and tables! The business is already up and running!

story:
VR/Desktop Social Platform

A VR and desktop social platform that expands the limitations of creativity, social interactions, and community involvement using Unreal Engine. Create content (avatars, worlds, etc.), share them with the rest of the community, and play with others.

 

 

Create.

Creative components is one of many beloved features that a game has to offer, which is why I’ll expand more upon it. Players will have the opportunity to create, creative and artistic avatars, worlds, home worlds, and more. Everything can be edited and customized in a platitude of ways. Assets can be modified by shaders, colors, animations, particles, mesh, etc. Avatars can be customized even more thanks to additional features on them. Avatars will be able to lip sync the users voice using premade animations for vowels or facial tracking, have custom intro and outro animations, support eye tracking, full body, and even full finger tracking. Content can be created using FBX or any other supported format by Unreal Engine. This game encourages creators to create unimaginable things.

 

 

Share.

Creators will find it more easier to share their creations to the world. With the help of our SDK, create and effortlessly upload content. Creators are able to share things from worlds to avatars and make them public so others can see and experience them. Creators can also upload assets to our in-game market, where we'll be hosting our own assets that users may use. This gives the creator the opportunity to contribute to the community and be recognized for their work. The creators opportunities are endless and with the help of us, we'll be able to encourage and promote their work.

 

 

Play!

Explore from many worlds and avatars made by the community. Players will be able to play among many others or with their friends. This project won’t just be for players looking for a game to just play. This game will add more functionality to a broad demographic. Those who love media and entertainment will be able to do astonishing things like capturing full body movements, real time scenes of other players acting out scenes, and actual tools to develop films. One might get some friends together in an instance of the game, be able to act out scenes, capture it using a variety of in game cameras with filters, and export it. Architects will also find multiple uses for this game. They will be able to design and apply their designs in a surreal environment. This game will also offer tools for education. For example, teachers can pick an environment that’s similar to their class. This class will have good lighting, a whiteboard to write on, and themes. They could pre record their lecture or broadcast it live to the students. Play it your way!

 

Rewards

  • With a backing of $10, you'll get a personal thank you, along with a background for your username and a badge. You will digitally earn this exclusive background that will be placed behind your username, along with a badge. This will present to others that you have backed the game in the early stages of development.
  • With a backing of $20, not only will you get all previous items obtained in the first but also get 2 weeks of early access, reservation of a username, and get the game at a 33% discounted price.

 

Other features

 

Market

To encourage, innovate, and help creators envision their creations, we will develop a market that can be accessed from in-game. We want to make it easier for users to find assets and create with ease. The market will host a variety of assets, some being avatars, animations, props, and more. Players who like an asset, can either download it or buy it, depending if it's free or not. Players are able to help creators out by buying from them or even in a form of donation. Creators who show their passion and help the community, can also earn a verification badge, certifying their work. The game will also host a virtual market, where players are able to physically walk around vendors. Creators will able to collaborate with others and market.

 

Achievements

We wanted to add achievements to those who like playing games with an objective in mind. We plan on implementing achievements that can be earned by playing, doing tasks, and more. Achievements are a great way of encouraging players into engaging with the community and add another level of playability. Some achievements will help toward leveling up or earning cosmetics for their account. We also plan to be working side by side with community creators in the future, to add achievements dedicated to their worlds.

 

Events

We plan on implementing a variety of events. An example of some events that the community can be expecting are seasonal events. Worlds would be modified with decorations and tasks depending on the season. Almost in every event, there will be limited timed and exclusive rewards for those who participate. Events are made for the community to have something to look forward to and also for the community to be more involved with one another. Events can also be done randomly to surprise players when we drop more content. We also plan in introducing new game mechanics or features in the form of events. To show gratitude toward helping the development of this project, the first event will start shortly after launch of the game.

 

Social

We love the idea of players being social and connected to one another, so we decided to develop an app for that. The app will aide players into keeping connections with their favorite friends online, finding communities, keeping up with events, and much more!

 

Game mechanics

We plan on implementing fun game mechanics that can be used by creators. One fun game mechanic that we will be providing at launch is a climb mechanic. This let's the player be able to climb about anything or only limited to specific meshes by simulating actually climbing. We will providing a more depth and sophisticated functionality in further development of the game.

 

Priority

Some of our current priorities are optimization, community involvement, and creativity. Optimization when it comes to VR is really important. Optimization ensures that the player is well immersed and that the player will not get sick. Worlds and avatars will vary in depending on the creator but with the right tweaks, we will make them more effective when rendering, making them less likely to drop performance while ensuring optimization. Community involvement is also important, when developing. We want to make a game that is creative, yet effective that the community is able to easily access, create, and engage with the rest of the community. Lastly, creativity is another priority when it comes to the development of the game. We want to help ensure that creators are able to create and do the unimaginable.

 

Compatibility/cross-platform

We will be developing our game with optimization in mind for all hardware. Whether your on desktop or VR, never feel afraid of losing performance. We plan on developing the game with even the Oculus Quest 2 in mind. With the help of a in-game graphics management page, change from preferences to graphical settings. We also plan to implement more ways for desktop users to properly interact and play with VR users.

 

Goal

My goal for this game is to unite players alike. Whether you're playing the game to make friends, create amazing architects, films, experience worlds outside reality itself, etc. I want this application to be easily accessible and help people find or form groups that they can interact with. I also have high hopes that people will be able to make some of the best creative content and share them with the world. I want the game to constantly push the limits and innovate others in doing the same. Hopefully, this will also ease players into using Unreal Engine. There is a misconception among many that Unreal Engine is only for Triple-A games. I would like to show them that everyone is capable. Thank you for giving the opportunity for us to give back to the community.

 

Funds

All the funds raised from this site or anywhere else, will be invested directly only into the project. Funds are important for the development of our game because of time consumption, hardware, assets, servers, lack of documentation, and workers pay. If the project doesn't reach the goal of $250,000, the remaining funds will still only go into investment of the project. I'll continue to develop the game with some colleagues, using the money to invest in essentials to developing.

 

Risks & Challenges

With new technology, means more hurdles to jump over. Since VR is still fairly new, the development of the project will slightly take longer than a typical game. The lack of documentation on developing VR games using Unreal Engine is very well limited. We also need to account of time and resources to properly implement profiles, in-game market, and more. Not only will we have to keep in mind of our SDK, optimization, we will need to also worry about how to incorporate them. A lot of our time in development will be used on researching and developing new and beneficial ways of getting our result. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways in contributing to the campaign! Either spread by word or share our Indiegogo page to friends or family!

  • Visit our official website here.
  • Visit our official YouTube channel here.

story:
Due to multiple requests, from people who could not support the original campaign, there is a last chance to back this project and obtain all the backer extras.

 

CAMPAIGN BACKERS WILL RECEIVE A DIFFERENT VERSION OF THE GAME, WITH FEATURES NOT AVAILABLE IN THE RETAIL VERSION. 

 

The perks offered in this campaign are exclusive to backers and will not be

available at any other time.

 

ALL BACKERS OF A CARTRIDGE VERSION

INCLUDING THE ORIGINAL KICKSTARTER BACKERS

WILL RECEIVE A DIGITAL COPY

 

Hi there, thanks for visiting our campaign.

So what is Galencia?

Well for those of you who are unaware of our 2017 Commodore 64 game, what better way to introduce it to you than a video review by the esteemed Rob Caporetto?

Galencia was a huge success in 2017 and we aim to make it bigger, better and lot more varied for this sequel, scheduled for release in November 2018.

Galencia won the coveted Reset64 Game of the Year and we want Galencia Khaos Sphere to be a contender for the 2018 award - the competition will be strong, but so are we!

Please click the above banner for more information.

 

Jon Eggleton's Galencia Fighter Bitmap

 

Gameplay Overview

THESE NOTES ARE FROM THE IN-PROGRESS DESIGN DOCUMENT AND ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE

What we have planned is a Shmup, with 3 different core elements.

Vertical scrolling (detailed backgrounds)

Reference points: Starforce, Xevious, A.S.O, Halley’s Comet

Static screen (2d starfield)

Reference points: Galencia, Astro Blaster, Galaga 88

Perspective (3d starfield)

Reference points: Gyruss, Tempest

All 3 different elements will be inspired by the stated reference points but will not be direct clones. If you think how Galencia was inspired by Galaga, this will give you an idea of the concept. To be clear, this will be taking the essence of the reference points, adapting to the Galencia lore and presented using the C64’s strengths. There will of course be many original elements and the reference points are provided to give you a feel of what to expect.

There will be other, smaller in scope, aspects to the main elements with a  selection of mini games, these will be kept under wraps until release.

Scrolling example

 

Perspective example, Note this is a work-in-progress video clip

 

Meeting Princess Bathory

 

Ship Selection screen by Lucan Monks

Flow of the game:

After the introduction and title sequence, the player will select their game preferences and then plot a route through the Galaxy Map, each step of the path will be one of the 3 above gaming styles. As you approach the selected system, you will run a risk of interdiction. The first half of the map will have a risk of the Federation stopping you on your descent and the last half of the map is too dangerous for the Federation but is scavenged by Pirates, they will interdict you from time to time. These interdictions can be avoided by skillful manoeuvres and sometimes by bribery, if these options don’t work - prepare for a fight!

There will be 2 main boss fights, with additional smaller bosses to fight in various systems. There will also be traders indicated on the map where you can trade your collectable Promethean stars for Save Games, Electronic Countermeasures (ECM) and other enhancements. The stars are not just for points in this game, make sure to prioritise them on your journey.

Upon successful completion of a system, you will encounter a cut scene on the dropship, this will usually be between Ace Harper and Amy Starbanger, but there will be other characters. The tone of the scenes will vary, with some being serious and others being light hearted, there is a dedicated writer working on the story elements. Some of these scenes will advance the story and others will require decisions to be made. Depending on the decisions you make and your performance in game, there will be multiple endings to the game.

Ace and Amy on the dropship

 

A selection of options above what has been seen in Galencia will include: 

English/Spanish language

6581 or 8580 SID chip

Story mode on/off

Gameplay variety

As well as the player being able to plot their own path through the game, there will be a choice of 3 player ships:

Galencia - fighter class - The all rounder, a firm favourite with rookies and seasoned pilots

Gundola - nemesis class - Slightly slower than the Galencia but with much heavier firepower

Spartan - interceptor class - The fastest ship on the roster with a rapid but weaker weapons system

Blueprints of the player ships

Remember you also have the ability to choose your character, that’s a lot of different ways to play!

The sprite multiplexer has undergone some significant changes and now allows for some truly huge enemies, combine this with the immediate access to data from the cartridge and we have all the ingredients for some spectacular battles with no significant loading delays. There will be animated introduction and end sequences, these will feature full screen bitmapped graphics.

3D rendering

Galencia Fighter 3d model

 

This is the first project for Team Galencia where we have made use of 3d modelling and rendering, this was introduced for Stretch Goal 3 - the 35mm model of the Galencia Fighter. This model has been invaluable for many other design purposes and translates well to the C64, ready for both bitmap and traditional artists to touch up and look amazing. Correct ratios and lines give a very consistent look to the visuals. This opens up the opportunity to model the Spartan Interceptor and Gundola Nemesis player ships to offer the same graphical fidelity as the Galencia ship - please see Stretch Goal 4 for more details.

We would like to take this opportunity to offer a very warm welcome to Jon Eggleton, whose bitmap images have caused quite a stir in the C64 scene.

Jason Aldred - Design and Code 

Saul Cross  - Sprite, Character Graphics and Maps

Pulsebot - Music and Sound Effects

Jon Eggleton, Lucan Monks, RailSlave - Bitmap Screens

Commodore 64 Club -3D Modelling and Concept Art

Please find a selection of media below to introduce you to various aspects of the game.

Please note this media is pre-production and is subject to change. 

 

Amy and Ace sprites with hi-res overlays

  

Example sprites with different backgrounds

Work-In-Progress Box Art

Concept storyboard images

Reduced frames, sketch style render

  

 

Back Story:

After the success of the Galencia fighter and the defeat of the Yenoh Armada, Earth returned to peace and soon after, its old ways of greed.

The unstoppable wheels of industry kept turning, destroying all in their path. No thought for life, beauty or the future. All eyes are on the present, never happy with what we have, we plough onward for more material possessions.

The great war was soon forgotten and the before we knew it a darkness that no one expected was cast upon us, the time for man was quickly coming to an end. The Khaos Sphere has descended and its curse unleashed.

Galencia Khaos Sphere is an an exclusive C64 Shmup available on 512k cartridge only, for PAL and NTSC systems.

Features:

80 levels including scrolling, static and 3d perspective stages

Rich story telling

Branching level structure giving various, non linear, routes though the game

Play as Ace Harper or Amy Starbanger

Choice of 3 players ships: Galencia, Spartan and Gundola

Unlockable achievements

Dual soundtracks tuned for 6581 and 8580 sid chips

Pilot profile and status saving direct to cartridge.

Massively multiplexed sprites as seen in Galencia

New members will be added to the Team Galencia banner to bring you an exceptional experience never before seen on the C64, these members will be announced on successful completion of the Kickstarter campaign

Galencia Khaos Sphere will support both English and Spanish language straight out of the box

 

Risks and challenges

Winning the coveted C64 Game of the Year award does not happen by accident, it happens through relentless revisions, making tough decisions and the drive to make something special.

Galencia Khaos Sphere will take the design principles and ramp them up to 11, we intend to bring something beyond the imagination of what is possible on the C64.

Such an ambitious project is not something to be taken trivially and I have been working hard on the design brief to make this happen. I have a strong support network with like minded developers on this endeavour and we are all committed to making this happen.

There are both artistic and technical challenges, from filling the 512k cartridge with high quality assets, a coherent story but most of all scaling and challenging gameplay to suit a wide range of player abilities.

Without the assistance of external funding, this project would not be possible - it is simply too ambitious to be self funded. I hope you can feel the passion of the project and help make it a reality.

 

All aspects of this project are constantly under review and are subject to change to deliver a higher quality end product.
story_txt: Due to multiple requests, from people who could not support the original campaign, there is a last chance to back this project and obtain all the backer extras. CAMPAIGN BACKERS WILL RECEIVE A DIFFERENT VERSION OF THE GAME, WITH FEATURES NOT AVAILABLE IN THE RETAIL VERSION.  The perks offered in this campaign are exclusive to backers and will not beavailable at any other time. ALL BACKERS OF A CARTRIDGE VERSIONINCLUDING THE ORIGINAL KICKSTARTER BACKERSWILL RECEIVE A DIGITAL COPY Hi there, thanks for visiting our campaign.So what is Galencia?Well for those of you who are unaware of our 2017 Commodore 64 game, what better way to introduce it to you than a video review by the esteemed Rob Caporetto?Galencia was a huge success in 2017 and we aim to make it bigger, better and lot more varied for this sequel, scheduled for release in November 2018.Galencia won the coveted Reset64 Game of the Year and we want Galencia Khaos Sphere to be a contender for the 2018 award - the competition will be strong, but so are we!Please click the above banner for more information. Jon Eggleton's Galencia Fighter Bitmap Gameplay OverviewTHESE NOTES ARE FROM THE IN-PROGRESS DESIGN DOCUMENT AND ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGEWhat we have planned is a Shmup, with 3 different core elements.Vertical scrolling (detailed backgrounds)Reference points: Starforce, Xevious, A.S.O, Halley’s CometStatic screen (2d starfield)Reference points: Galencia, Astro Blaster, Galaga 88Perspective (3d starfield)Reference points: Gyruss, TempestAll 3 different elements will be inspired by the stated reference points but will not be direct clones. If you think how Galencia was inspired by Galaga, this will give you an idea of the concept. To be clear, this will be taking the essence of the reference points, adapting to the Galencia lore and presented using the C64’s strengths. There will of course be many original elements and the reference points are provided to give you a feel of what to expect.There will be other, smaller in scope, aspects to the main elements with a  selection of mini games, these will be kept under wraps until release.Scrolling example Perspective example, Note this is a work-in-progress video clip Meeting Princess Bathory Ship Selection screen by Lucan MonksFlow of the game:After the introduction and title sequence, the player will select their game preferences and then plot a route through the Galaxy Map, each step of the path will be one of the 3 above gaming styles. As you approach the selected system, you will run a risk of interdiction. The first half of the map will have a risk of the Federation stopping you on your descent and the last half of the map is too dangerous for the Federation but is scavenged by Pirates, they will interdict you from time to time. These interdictions can be avoided by skillful manoeuvres and sometimes by bribery, if these options don’t work - prepare for a fight!There will be 2 main boss fights, with additional smaller bosses to fight in various systems. There will also be traders indicated on the map where you can trade your collectable Promethean stars for Save Games, Electronic Countermeasures (ECM) and other enhancements. The stars are not just for points in this game, make sure to prioritise them on your journey.Upon successful completion of a system, you will encounter a cut scene on the dropship, this will usually be between Ace Harper and Amy Starbanger, but there will be other characters. The tone of the scenes will vary, with some being serious and others being light hearted, there is a dedicated writer working on the story elements. Some of these scenes will advance the story and others will require decisions to be made. Depending on the decisions you make and your performance in game, there will be multiple endings to the game.Ace and Amy on the dropship A selection of options above what has been seen in Galencia will include: English/Spanish language6581 or 8580 SID chipStory mode on/offGameplay varietyAs well as the player being able to plot their own path through the game, there will be a choice of 3 player ships:Galencia - fighter class - The all rounder, a firm favourite with rookies and seasoned pilotsGundola - nemesis class - Slightly slower than the Galencia but with much heavier firepowerSpartan - interceptor class - The fastest ship on the roster with a rapid but weaker weapons systemBlueprints of the player shipsRemember you also have the ability to choose your character, that’s a lot of different ways to play!The sprite multiplexer has undergone some significant changes and now allows for some truly huge enemies, combine this with the immediate access to data from the cartridge and we have all the ingredients for some spectacular battles with no significant loading delays. There will be animated introduction and end sequences, these will feature full screen bitmapped graphics.3D renderingGalencia Fighter 3d model This is the first project for Team Galencia where we have made use of 3d modelling and rendering, this was introduced for Stretch Goal 3 - the 35mm model of the Galencia Fighter. This model has been invaluable for many other design purposes and translates well to the C64, ready for both bitmap and traditional artists to touch up and look amazing. Correct ratios and lines give a very consistent look to the visuals. This opens up the opportunity to model the Spartan Interceptor and Gundola Nemesis player ships to offer the same graphical fidelity as the Galencia ship - please see Stretch Goal 4 for more details.We would like to take this opportunity to offer a very warm welcome to Jon Eggleton, whose bitmap images have caused quite a stir in the C64 scene.Jason Aldred - Design and Code Saul Cross  - Sprite, Character Graphics and MapsPulsebot - Music and Sound EffectsJon Eggleton, Lucan Monks, RailSlave - Bitmap ScreensCommodore 64 Club -3D Modelling and Concept ArtPlease find a selection of media below to introduce you to various aspects of the game.Please note this media is pre-production and is subject to change.  Amy and Ace sprites with hi-res overlays  Example sprites with different backgroundsWork-In-Progress Box ArtConcept storyboard imagesReduced frames, sketch style render   Back Story:After the success of the Galencia fighter and the defeat of the Yenoh Armada, Earth returned to peace and soon after, its old ways of greed.The unstoppable wheels of industry kept turning, destroying all in their path. No thought for life, beauty or the future. All eyes are on the present, never happy with what we have, we plough onward for more material possessions.The great war was soon forgotten and the before we knew it a darkness that no one expected was cast upon us, the time for man was quickly coming to an end. The Khaos Sphere has descended and its curse unleashed.Galencia Khaos Sphere is an an exclusive C64 Shmup available on 512k cartridge only, for PAL and NTSC systems.Features:80 levels including scrolling, static and 3d perspective stagesRich story tellingBranching level structure giving various, non linear, routes though the gamePlay as Ace Harper or Amy StarbangerChoice of 3 players ships: Galencia, Spartan and GundolaUnlockable achievementsDual soundtracks tuned for 6581 and 8580 sid chipsPilot profile and status saving direct to cartridge.Massively multiplexed sprites as seen in GalenciaNew members will be added to the Team Galencia banner to bring you an exceptional experience never before seen on the C64, these members will be announced on successful completion of the Kickstarter campaignGalencia Khaos Sphere will support both English and Spanish language straight out of the box Risks and challengesWinning the coveted C64 Game of the Year award does not happen by accident, it happens through relentless revisions, making tough decisions and the drive to make something special.Galencia Khaos Sphere will take the design principles and ramp them up to 11, we intend to bring something beyond the imagination of what is possible on the C64.Such an ambitious project is not something to be taken trivially and I have been working hard on the design brief to make this happen. I have a strong support network with like minded developers on this endeavour and we are all committed to making this happen.There are both artistic and technical challenges, from filling the 512k cartridge with high quality assets, a coherent story but most of all scaling and challenging gameplay to suit a wide range of player abilities.Without the assistance of external funding, this project would not be possible - it is simply too ambitious to be self funded. I hope you can feel the passion of the project and help make it a reality. All aspects of this project are constantly under review and are subject to change to deliver a higher quality end product.

story:
Introducing the Neo-Retro series from Huey Games, where we select the finest retro-style titles for limited physical runs on our unique Collectors USB Cassette format.

Badged as release 001 in the series, the Collectors USB Cassette of Droid Assault is an exclusive physical edition of this classic game for PC and Mac (DRM-free), designed to slot seamlessly into your retro gaming collection. This unique format allows us to load the USB drive with a tonne of special features including soundtrack albums, artwork, retro archives and more.

Prepare for running blaster battles with hordes of rampaging killer robots! Discover a unique tactical arcade shooter, with the fun addictive gameplay of 8-bit classics. You'll need your wits and the help of your acquired droid squad to stay alive in this fast-paced retro actionfest. Wreak havok through 50 atmospheric levels of destructible scenery, avoid mines and turrets, and battle 48 different robot types from lowly Guardbots to the latest in Assassins, Special Ops and Battledroids.

With the aid of your trusty transfer beam capture your own squad of droids, armed with the latest hi-tech weaponry including lasers, rockets, grenades, flamethrowers and disruptors, boost their abilities with 17 kinds of powerup, and take on the formidable giant boss 'bots!

There are two types of Collectors USB Cassette available for backers, the £25 tier Collectors Edition and the £45 tier Ultra Edition. There is also a limited quantity Classic Signed Game tier at £80.

The Collectors USB Cassette comes shrink wrapped in a genuine cassette jewel case, with colour printed labels and inlay - exactly like your classic cassette games!

Upgrade to the Ultra USB Cassette for a premium, exclusive finish and extra bonus features:

In addition to the DRM-free PC and Mac versions of Droid Assault, the USB Cassette also comes loaded with a host of special features:

Play awesome Neo-Retro demos. Once you receive your cassette we will ask you to vote for your favourite to help inform the kind of games you want to see on future Collectors USB Cassette releases.

Heart-pumping soundtrack albums for two fantastic Neo-Retro games.

A digital collection of hi-definition retro and Neo-Retro artwork.

Over 2000 page scans of magazine covers, adverts, charts, interviews, maps, tips, contests, previews and reviews of Hewson games. 

Plus the Hints & Tips for Videogame Pioneers: The Hewson Interviews mini-documentary featuring over an hour of footage.

 

 

The Ultra USB Cassette includes an exclusive bonus folder of secret extra features.

To add one of the rewards below, simply "overpledge" by the amount specified. For example, if you selected the Collectors USB Cassette reward tier (£25) and want to add an extra Collectors USB Cassette with UK delivery, set your pledge level to £50 instead of £25.

Do you want to open one USB Cassette and keep another pristine in its shrink wrap? Or maybe you want extra copies to give to friends as gifts?

The inspiration for the series. Although Hyper Sentinel launched without a release number, it is technically release 000 in the Neo-Retro USB Cassette collection. Featuring the Steamversion of Hyper Sentinel, plus loads of bonus extras.

Featuring commentary and analysis from more than twenty retro gaming icons, Hints & Tips for Videogame Pioneers by Andrew Hewson tells the official story of his celebrated software houses Hewson (Uridium, Paradroid, Nebulus, Cybernoid, Exolon) and 21st Century Entertainment (Pinball Dreams, Pinball Fantasies).

Puppygames was founded in 2002 or so by Caspian Prince (yes, really - that guy in the films is a pale imitation) and Chaz Willets, two childhood chums from secondary school.

Our first game was Alien Flux. We've beavered away making neo-retro arcade games ever since, and in 2010 with the release of our RTS Revenge of the Titans, we finally started developing games full-time.

Huey Games continues the legacy of Andrew Hewson's famous 1980s software house, which published hit titles on cassette including Uridium, Paradroid, Nebulus, Cybernoid, Exolon, Avalon, Quazatron and many more.

As a modern developer and publisher, Huey's first title to launch on Collectors USB Cassette was Hyper Sentinel in 2018, which was also released on Nintendo Switch, PS4, Xbox One, Steam and iOS.

We're producing the Collectors USB Cassette for you to enjoy and appreciate, and we want to be as transparent as possible about the process. We vouch to provide regular updates on the progress of the project, and to let you know about our successes and challenges along the way.

*****

Risks and Challenges

Huey Games have run and delivered on successful Kickstarter campaigns of our own, and have worked on or promoted successful Kickstarter campaigns for other people too.

Droid Assault is a complete, fully released game, but we are dependent on our suppliers for the USB Cassettes. Having worked with the supplier on past projects, we have established a good business relationship and we trust them to deliver, but we cannot rule out all risk of problems or delays with the delivery of the USB Cassettes.

The majority of the bonus content for the USB Cassettes is already mastered, but there is a small risk of some content changing or being replaced before final delivery, especially for any stretch goal content which has not already been produced. As with our previous campaigns, we take pride in delivering quality products and will always aim to over-deliver and to replace any problematic content with content of equivalent or superior value.

Thank you for your support and faith. It means everything to our team.

story:
Introducing Gazintu™

Gazintu is a small device that lets kids control characters and interact with mobile games, stories, and music in revolutionary new ways using physical toys. Cute, fun and physical. From Virtual Reality and Force Feedback pioneer Dr. Beth Marcus.
 

What can Gazintu do?

Quotes

Here's what the folks are saying:
 BodiMojo:
"We’re firm believers that while technology can get a bad rap, it’s all about how you use it. Nowadays, people often lament that kids are constantly glued to screens–from video games to smartphones to tablets–and are missing out on real world play. And we agree. Kids need to take breaks from screens and allow their brains to restore and relax. But what if technology and physical play could be in harmony?"
Tonda Sellers, President, Digital Kids® Media:
"How exciting! I was just looking for a solution to assist my children with phonics - I have been introduced to a great program in our public school that uses plushies and auditory gestures to teach phonics, how great would it be to add in the digital age!!!!"
Patti Becker, founder WIT-Walmart Initiative:
"We're all concerned about kids' development and all the screen time they're getting. While iwe've all seen a roomful of kids playing with their ipads & iphones as though no one else is in the room. Playrific's  GAZINTU is a game changing new technology..."

The Gazintu Origin Story
Do you believe in Playonium, the secret ingredient that powers Gazintu?  Learn more about it on our Blog!

Perks

Here is some info about our perks

>> Plushie toys that come with Gazintu

You can choose from these designs for the Gazintus you order.

>> Special Perk:  Bedtime Story Edition

Read about this perk on our blog!

>> Special Perk: Motion into Music Edition

Read about this perk on our blog!

>> Concierge Perks

This level of perks has special, limited edition panache for the discriminating supporter:

  • Artwork - You get original "whiteboard style" artwork from our creative team, framed and signed.  Only 8 will be made, and you can have a short consultation with the artist to personalize yours! 
  • 100 Gazintus for Charity - Spread the gazintu love to your favorite non-profit like a hospital or school. Instead of donating plain ol' plushie toys, get those kids excited with gazintus they can play with!

How Gazintu really works (geeky perspective)

If you don't want to believe in Playonium (oh ye of little faith) here is another story:
  1. The gazintu compatible app sends information about what it is expecting of the gazintu, based on the specific activity that particular app supports.
  2. The gazintu uses its internal sensors to measure multiple, discrete user gestures. These are the "primitives" of the Gazintu Gesture Engine (the GGE). 
  3. The gazintu, using context information downloaded from the app on the device, determines what the child is gesturing.
  4. The gazintu GGE, based on what it was told about by the app being used, then sends back to the app the "verb" or action the child is gesturing.
  5. Later in the development cycle, Playrific will share development methodologies and tools to specific business partners under a non-disclosure agreement.

Put more simply, Playonium kicks in and makes things work.

Other cool stuff: Playrific is working hard on moving the art and science of gesture interpretation ahead. One of the things we are working hard on is new ways of social play with multiple children and multiple devices.

In collaborative or competitive social play, multiple Gazintus can be manipulated by multiple kids in a patent-pending, multi-user, location-based social play mode.


2015 - 2016 Timeline

April 2015 - Prototypes created, field testing with kids

July 2015 - Eval PCB design complete, eval firmware

October 21, 2015 - The day Marty McFly travels back to the future. (Something to do with the meteorite and the Playonium discovery?)

December 2015 - Finalize production PCB design (2016 edition)

December 2015 - Super-radical T-shirts ship!

February 2016 - Firmware complete

April 2016 - Base mobile app complete

May 2016 - System integration testing

June 2016 - Partner Developer Documentation Release (NDA partner only)

July 2016 - Production PCB

July to September 2016 - Field testing and tuning, low volumes

October 2016 - Revised PCB complete, volume shipments in progress

November 2016 - Shipping to backers
The team

Our creative and technical team consists of folks from a wide variety of gaming, IT, education, military, and sales and marketing backgrounds.  We're a little bit silly. But we're also a lot bit serious. Because fun is serious business.


What will Playrific use the funds for?

We have knowledge and expertise in bringing new tech to consumers, but our team will bring in other experts to make it happen faster and more robustly. Stretch goals start at 120K when we will add a Minecraft hook in, and include more software, more features and more cool games and other ideas you send us.

Our company's track record

Playrific, Inc., the company that is working on the Gazintu, was established in 2010 and has successfully delivered an "app factory" platform that helps family-friendly brands bring their characters and brand to COPPA (kid friendly) compliant mobile apps.  Our CEO and CTO have deep contacts in the hardware, software, and supply chain. They have both built and brought multiple firms to successful exits.
CEO Beth Marcus is a pioneer in virtual reality (VR), having designed, among other things, products for NASA--that are still used--as well as the SideWinder force feedback joystick that was acquired by Microsoft. Beth founded 5 companies, including Playrific and is on the faculty of MIT. 

The rest of the team consists of folks who have built billion dollar firms, educational marketing experts, military veterans, and artists and animators with deep talent.

If you have any questions, please email gazintu@playrific.com or post them on this campaign page.


Thanks for your support!

story:
Ninja Chronicle is a 3D Action Adventure game featuring items and collectables with a large emphasis on exploration and story as opposed to just platforming. The game takes a more serious and modern approach to the traditional collect-a-thon platformers seen on the Nintendo 64, by that we mean it focuses more on character development, story and takes more risks along the lines of the later Jak and Daxter  games. We don't want to force exploration but reward you for doing so by planting secret items and collectables. The collecting aspect is greatly inspired by Banjo Kazooie so expect to find lots of cool things while exploring.

NPCs in the game will offer you quests in return for Golden Scrolls which are the "Jiggies, Power Cells, 3D Mario Stars" of the game. The combat will have two modes, when you lock onto a character you will enter a 1V1 combat stance where you can do special combos and moves to one character and anybody foolish enough to be near it. This fighting style is similar to Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm. When Not locked on you are in an open mode where it's God of War like and you attack multiple enemies.

You will be able to play as two different characters each with their own unique play style and movesets which can be used to solve puzzles or reach places the other can't. Kori is a stealthy ranged fighter while Niko is a hack and slash brawler. The way you switch is similar to Donkey Kong 64 which means only 1 character can be in the world at a time and can be switched in certain parts of the world. We are planning on having some kind of Co-op mode but it will be a challenge to put in the game so it's going  to be a stretch goal.

The game will be on PC and if we get enough money we can get it on more platforms like Console and maybe even handheld.

Graphics

The game is currently being made with Torque 3D using the Action Adventure Kit provided by Ubiq Visuals as a base but if we get enough funding we can afford to switch to Unity, CryEngine or even Unreal Engine and be able to release the game on more platforms. 

Nintendo 64 Mode (if there's an audience for it)

Plans have been made to have a mode that makes the game feel like it was made for the Nintendo 64 with a low poly feel similar to how Shovel Knight seems like it's made for the NES. This was originally the way the game was going to be but after research many people didn't like the old low poly look and said it would seem lazy when that's not the reason at all. If there's an audience for a low poly N64 feel game we'd gladly make it and it will make it easier for us to make the game that way.

  


In brief without spoiling too much the game focuses on the story of Kori, a blue arctic fox whose village was destroyed while she was very young by the rival Wolf Clan and made her the last of her kind. She escapes to the South and meets Niko who introduces her to his orphanage and secret mentor who offers to teach her Ninjutsu which she accepts in order to one day avenge her Clan. Now that she's grown up she is on her journey to take down the Wolf Clan while Niko tags along and tries to find out what happened to his parents. 

Kori

A blue arctic fox, the last of her kind. She has a serious personality and specializes in ranged combat and stealth. When not locked on her fighting style can best be described as Tron Evolution  like. Her melee is not as good as Niko's but it does more damage from behind so stealth is key. Each weapon has a magical element like Shuriken is fire and Tomahawk is Lightning and when you get enough hits on a target you will unleash this power but each weapon has it's own rules and abilities. 

Niko 

A grey tabby cat who grew up in an orphanage with no friends and was bullied by the older orphans until he learns ninjutsu and befriends Kori. He is loud, immature, and egotistical pretty much the opposite of Kori. Niko is a master at close quarter combat and has a hack and slash style of play attacking multiple enemies at once or getting up close and personal when locked on to a target. He can shoot fireballs and transform his weapons mid combat and has a faster movement speed than Kori. 


 There are currently 4 major levels, 2 minor levels, and a central hub. Both characters wear different outfits in each of the 4 main levels. They can be swapped but will change color to blend in well with the level you wear them in. 

  • Lost Forest

A shady forest surrounded by a wall separating it from the West Barren Desert. Use the trees to your advantage and sneak up on enemies or get past them unseen.

  • West Barren

The largest level in the game with the most collectables and places to explore. The level has a western feel to it and has some landscape inspired by the deserts of Nevada, Arizona, Utah, and Mexico. Stealth is not a big concern here and both characters will learn mobility abilities to help them get around quicker.

  • Twilight Mountain

This level has a Fall like feel to it and a lake. Some parts of this level are very dark perfect for stealth but be care full of ambushes. The mountain is climbable with something waiting for you at the top.

  • Hazed Woods

A snow level that is completely controlled by the Wolf Clan. Thanks to the snow, running in some parts of the level is not possible and stealth is a major factor. It's often hard to see and wolves always attack in packs.

Minor levels include the Rural Hills which acts as the tutorial level and central hub which is located right above the Lost Forest and is adjacent to every level. 

Game Status

The game is still in very early development and all what you have seen has been made possible through our own wallets and resources. Even though the game is early it has gone through a very large amount of pre-production to ensure a quality game. With 2 years of writing, changing, producing and designing the game is so done that the producer has already worked on ideas for the sequel. Ninja Chronicle is just one of at least 10 games all that have been worked on over the span of  about 9 years by our producer. We have chosen Ninja Chronicle as our first game for many reasons but the main one being that it's just time for games of this type to be released. With games like Lobodestroyo and A Hat in Time being made we feel now is better than ever. Currently Torque 3D seems like the best choice for this game but if we get enough money we may be able to make the game using Unity or Unreal Engine.

Planned Budget

This is how we plan to spend the money and what we want to focus the most on. If we reach stretch goals this graph will be updated. Lots of little things are needed from each category like acoustic foam, voice actors, and a quality microphone for Voice Acting alone.

These stretch goals are simply estimates and what we would like to have in the game but are either a challange to add or just something that isn't really necessary but would help make the game better.

One of the stretch goals is to have the first cutscene be in 2D animation and will be provided by Studio Izune.


The music will be done by Brandon Washington (Ultralisk27) who like us loves Rareware games and makes songs fans will love. Here are some examples of his work, check out his channel for more songs and to maybe get a better understanding of his style. Below is a preview of music for the game (mostly from the Lost Forest level) and a game he made that should also show what he can do and where his inspiration comes from. 



                    

The original composer for games like Banjo Kazooie, Perfect Dark and Viva Piñata has agreed to make songs for our game granted we have enough money to hire him. The more that gets donated the more songs he will be able to make for the game.

                 


It would be almost impossible to make a game of this size and complexity on our own and with Indiegogo our dream of making games can come true. We don't want to resort to investors or publishers as it takes away our creative freedom and are against what we stand for. We will never sell our IP's or become exclusive to a certain platform and with your help we can keep that promise as we'd rather shutdown than sell ourselves out. We would like to dedicate all our time into the game and the more money we get the sooner and better end product we will be able to make. Help us reach even beyond the Stretch Goals. If we have enough money we could maybe take the game to PAX and other conventions.


Risks and Challenges

Video games are tough to make and we will try to make the most of what gets donated. Our goal isn't that much but would really help us get the game going, If we have to we'll make the game the way we planned with a Nintendo 64 feel while still maintaining visually appealing graphics. Rewards might be changed like the Promotional buttons to help reduce costs that physical rewards bring, 

Additional Notes

Most of the stuff you see here is placeholder like the logos, maps and music. All early stuff that will no doubt be improved upon in the future. The characters don't necessarily have official outfits as they will wear something different every level and these are just the ones we liked best. If you would like to see sketches of other outfits feel free to check the gallery.


Special Thanks and Art Credits

We want to thank and credit the fellow Deviantartists and who helped out with the game and make this campaign possible. If you like something from this campaign and need help with yours I'm sure they have some commissions available. Special thanks to Ubiqvisuals for their Action Adventure Kit for use on our game.

Umikit - Gallary Concept Art

Heavy Cat Studios - Game Logo Design and Campaign Art

Robaato - Story section Character Art

Eirhjien - Ninja Chronicle Map

Amena-dono - Campaign Card Kori

Figgy-licious - Campaign Card Niko

Torchicken - Fan art character Chibis

Conchay - Faze Studios Logo redesign

Ubiqvisuals - Action Adventure Kit
story_txt:
Ninja Chronicle is a 3D Action Adventure game featuring items and collectables with a large emphasis on exploration and story as opposed to just platforming. The game takes a more serious and modern approach to the traditional collect-a-thon platformers seen on the Nintendo 64, by that we mean it focuses more on character development, story and takes more risks along the lines of the later Jak and Daxter  games. We don't want to force exploration but reward you for doing so by planting secret items and collectables. The collecting aspect is greatly inspired by Banjo Kazooie so expect to find lots of cool things while exploring.NPCs in the game will offer you quests in return for Golden Scrolls which are the "Jiggies, Power Cells, 3D Mario Stars" of the game. The combat will have two modes, when you lock onto a character you will enter a 1V1 combat stance where you can do special combos and moves to one character and anybody foolish enough to be near it. This fighting style is similar to Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm. When Not locked on you are in an open mode where it's God of War like and you attack multiple enemies.You will be able to play as two different characters each with their own unique play style and movesets which can be used to solve puzzles or reach places the other can't. Kori is a stealthy ranged fighter while Niko is a hack and slash brawler. The way you switch is similar to Donkey Kong 64 which means only 1 character can be in the world at a time and can be switched in certain parts of the world. story:
So...


We are Escape Rooms Cardiff and we need your help in exchange for stuff and discounted games!

Escape Games are a new and exciting craze that's sweeping the globe and is now arriving St. Mary's Street, Cardiff.

It's a real-life escape game which requires up to 5 players to collaborate to find hidden clues and solve puzzles to escape a themed room before the 1 hour timer runs out.

This alternative new concept brings the popular on-line game into real life. Players need to use their intuition, teamwork skills and intelligence to accomplish unique and challenging tasks. The game is incredibly popular in Asia, America, across Europe and the UK. Now Cardiff is set to have one!

Currently we are on target to launch 3 themed rooms (with a 4th in the works) this December and need your help to raise extra funds to make sure that it's the biggest, the shiniest and as all singing and all dancing as it can be. 

The more we raise the more exciting it can be, giving you the best experience you simply won't get anywhere else.

After all, it's our No.1 priority that you have the very best game you can get! No second-rate jobs here!

What We Need..

Well, we don't have a specific list of needs... 

Without giving too much away, we already have the foundations laid down to bring you 3 very different and exciting themed rooms and an Escape Room experience to remember. 

Currently under-way, we have The Tomb, Finding Sherlock and The Great Museum Robbery (with a laser trap!!)

With your support we can scale up what we already have, making it bigger and better!

(Also, we have a 4th room in the pipeline)..


What we're offering..

We want to offer those that can't wait an opportunity to either support us from afar with a helpful 'hi' or, for those who want to be the first through the door, getting discounts off their first game experience! 

You can get Early-Bird Discounts for games, tickets to our launch party and special little ways which you can be a part of helping our business hit the ground running.


Strapped for cash??

If you can't find something on the list that fits your budget you can still help!

Find us on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram and like or share our shizz or simply just tell your friends about us.

Don't forget to share this page too! It all helps and we'd be eternally grateful! 


Thanks,


The Escape Rooms Cardiff Team.

story:
Who We Are

Hockey Expo USA is an event we designed specifically to benefit the hockey community as a whole.  Here's how:

  • Our guest speakers cover a wide array of topics including Better Shooting, Sports Nutrition, Concussion Awareness, Motivation, Goalies, Girl's Hockey and more.
  • We've chosen qualified coaches to host clinics on our synthetic ice rink and teach in our classroom.
  • You can sit down with our advisers to discuss specific topics and get advise on how to proceed with your or your child's hockey career.
  • Our vendors will have their products on display and in demos.
  • Kids will love the games and interactive items we have in store for them.  They'll have hands on opportunities to learn about hockey in a fun way!
  • Most Importantly, our goal is to teach and create awareness about our various topics, while raising funds for some great causes including the Give Bonnie Strong 77 Foundation and the Blackhawk Charities.


What We Need & What You Get

    We're looking for additional funding to make this first year event an even bigger success.  Funds collected will go toward additional advertising, entertainment and interactive games.  The bigger we can make the event, the more money we can bring in for the amazing causes we're working with. 

    Our perks include something for everyone!  Whether you're spending $1 or $1000 you can rest easy knowing you've become a part of a ground-breaking event that will not only benefit the Hockey Community but will give back to The Blackhawk Charities and the Give Bonnie Strong 77 Foundation.  You can choose from perks that include signed memorabilia, jumbotron shout-outs or  once in a lifetime opportunities to meet our celebrity guests!

    In the event that we don't reach our goal, funds brought in will still go toward creating an amazing experience for everyone, but the bigger our budget, the bigger the event! 


    The Charities

    THE BLACKHAWK CHARITIES

    We're really proud to be working with the Blackhawk Charities.  Their foundation gives back to the community in so many ways and our Silent Auction was put together for the sole purpose of raising money for the Blackhawk Charities.  They work to fund excellent causes in the Chicagoland area.



    THE GIVE BONNIE STRONG 77 FOUNDATION

    Founders of our organization find the Give Bonnie Strong 77 Foundation to be near and dear to our hearts and we want to give all we can to see this young foundation succeed. 

    Bonnie was a 12 year old girl who played for the Yellowjackets.  She lost her battle against Leukemia in 2014.  The Yellowjackets Organization retired her jersey, and her loss was felt throughout the families of the club. 

    Hockey Expo USA hopes to give the Give Bonnie Strong 77 Foundation a big push by creating awareness and raising funds to find a cure for and help families affected by Pediatric Cancer in Bonnie's Name.  Your contribution will directly support our goal.


      Risks & Challenges

      As a first year event, we've overcome some major obstacles to make this event a reality.  We've worked hard to gain credibility and get our name out there while putting together an event that will make Hockey proud. 

      Our biggest challenge has been to raise dollars for advertising and entertainment before ticket sales.  Regardless of our hurdles, we've had an overwhelming interest from potential attendees which has helped us to keep moving forward.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      There's no contribution that's too big or too small, but if you can't help out financially, you can still help by getting the word out.  Here's how:

      • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word on our story.
      • Share on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram
      • Talk to your friends and family about the event.
      • If you're part of a Chicagoland area hockey club you can let your organization know about our fundraiser and contest to win $25,000 for the club that sells the most tickets. 

      Thank You!

      Thank you for taking the time to learn more about our mission, goals and event!  For more information you can follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or visit us at www.hockeyexpousa.com

story:
The mission

Our small indie studio ‘CrazySoft Limited’ is operating from 2003 and from then has developed over 30 titles (games and apps) for more than 20 different platforms and operating systems!

Our current mission is to totally remaster (basically reinvent) an old award winning adventure game called Zeus Quest. Everything will be remade in FHD fresh vector cartoons, 60FPS fully animated characters and new music and soundtrack. The only thing we will keep intact is the hilarious plot and dialogues. The remake will be possible with the famous game engine Unity3D.

Zeus Quest remastered will be initially released on PC, Mac, Linux, iOS, Android, Windows Phone 8, Windows Store, Blackberry 10, Online (+ more to come). The final product will support English, French, Italian, German, Spanish and Greek languages. If everything goes as planned it will be released from the end of 2015 to the beginning of 2016!

Zeus Quest Remastered is a classic fully animated cartoon point & click adventure game, inspired by the old school unbelievable adventure games made in the 80s-90s. It has a wacky plot: Zeus the boss of Olympus returns to earth by a craft made by Hephaestus to save the planet with the help of a time machine. To achieve that he will have to start a huge adventure in the Greek islands with over 30 places to visit and hilarious mythology characters to interact.

Remastering process

What we do with the old graphics:
We take the old screens and process them pixel per pixel and break apart characters, objects and make them wide. Then we master them to vectors and reprocess all of it pixel per pixel again. If new graphics are needed we add them and then we are ready to program each screen. This is very time and effort demanding process and that is why we ask for your help.

Let the animation begin:
The old game didn't have any animation so here we can be very creative. We break the characters into pieces and rig them into puppets. This is how we can control their movement and achieve 60FPS animation on each platform. Then we synchronize sounds, speech, music and movements for each screen guided by the original plot, humor and dialogues of the game. These are only some of the characters Zeus meets:



Zeus Quest Places

The theme of the game is Greek Mythology and ancient Greek time-frame. The game has a huge plot which happens in 2 maps and in Minoan Crete. Zeus will end up abducting the girl Europe (continent named after her), transform into bull and travel to Minoan Crete to enable the time machine and save the planet.











Rewards

Go ahead and help us out and we will reward you with many cool things plus the game in multiple platforms. There will also be a way to save your process online and be able to continue playing in some other platform. E.g: Start playing at your PC and continue at your iPad from where you left of.

Our Goal

What happens if we don’t reach our initial goal? The game will be released no matter what. So don’t worry you will get your rewards for sure. That is why we have a flexible funding option. The final product will be translated into several languages and will have English Speech in some limited cinematic scenes only. Speech is expensive! If we make more than $22.000 we will be able to put English Speech in all cinematic scenes available. Our secret wish is to put English Speech everywhere in the game but this is nearly impossible since the text is enormous (almost 40.000 words) and the speech will be very expensive. But you never know…

Gameplay

What about the gameplay? We have prepared a small video showing the gameplay on desktops with mouse. This is only to get an idea how the game will be played on desktops. On mobile platforms with touch screens the gameplay will be different, adjusted to these needs. Also icons and texts will be bigger on small screens so that it’s played easier.


Frequently Asked Questions

1) Will Zeus Quest Remastered be released on consoles?
We can make this happen since we program with Unity3D. Its not planned but it can happen if a lot of you ask for it!

2) Will the game be available on Steam?
We are currently in the process of Steam Greenlight. This is not an easy task.
Your vote will be highly appreciated to make this happen.
Vote here: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=486603828

3)What specs will I need to run Zeus Quest Remastered.
Its too soon to say but a simple computer / tablet / phone will be fine.

4) When will Zeus Quest Remastered be released?
The development is going smoothly and it will be ready very soon. If everything goes as planned from the end of 2015 to the beginning of 2016!

5) Have you made other adventure games so far?
Except Zeus Quest we have already made another old image adventure called 'The Final Battle' and a newer one called 'The Odyssey'. The last one is FHD with little animation. Zeus Quest Remastered will be the best we made so far with full animation.
story_txt:
The mission Our
small indie studio ‘CrazySoft Limited’ is operating from 2003 and from then has
developed over 30 titles (games and apps) for more than 20 different platforms
and operating systems! 
Our
current mission is to totally remaster (basically reinvent) an old award
winning adventure game called Zeus Quest. Everything will be remade in FHD fresh vector cartoons, 60FPS fully animated characters and new music and soundtrack. The only thing we will keep intact is the hilarious
plot and dialogues. The remake will be possible with the famous game engine
Unity3D.
Zeus Quest remastered will be initially released on PC, Mac, Linux, iOS, Android, Windows
Phone 8, Windows Store, Blackberry 10, Online (+ more to come). The final product will support English, French, Italian, German, Spanish and Greek languages. If everything goes as planned it will be released from the end of 2015 to the beginning of 2016!


Zeus
Quest Remastered is a classic fully animated cartoon point & click adventure
game, inspired by the old school unbelievable adventure games made in the
80s-90s. It has a wacky plot: Zeus the boss of Olympus returns to earth by a craft
made by Hephaestus to save the planet with the help of a time machine. To
achieve that he will have to start a huge adventure in the Greek islands with
over 30 places to visit and hilarious mythology characters to interact. 
  Remastering
process What
we do with the old graphics: We take the old screens and process them pixel per pixel and break apart characters, objects and make them wide. Then we master
them to vectors and reprocess all of it pixel per pixel again. If new graphics are
needed we add them and then we are ready to program each screen. This is very
time and effort demanding process and that is why we ask for your help. 

Let the animation begin:
The old game didn't have any animation so here we can be very creative. We break the characters into pieces and rig them into puppets. This is how
we can control their movement and achieve 60FPS animation on each platform. Then
we synchronize sounds, speech, music and movements for each screen guided by
the original plot, humor and dialogues of the game. These are only some of the characters Zeus meets:

  Zeus
Quest Places
 The
theme of the game is Greek Mythology and ancient Greek time-frame. The game has a
huge plot which happens in 2 maps and in Minoan Crete. Zeus will end up abducting
the girl Europe (continent named after her), transform into bull and travel to Minoan Crete to enable the time machine and save the planet.










  Rewards  Go
ahead and help us out and we will reward you with many cool things plus the
game in multiple platforms. There will also be a way to save your process
online and be able to continue playing in some other platform. E.g: Start playing
at your PC and continue at your iPad from where you left of.  
  Our
Goal 
What happens if we don’t reach our initial goal? The game will be released no
matter what. So don’t worry you will get your rewards for sure. That is why we
have a flexible funding option. The final product will be translated into
several languages and will have English Speech in some limited cinematic scenes only.
Speech is expensive! If we make more than $22.000 we will be able to put
English Speech in all cinematic scenes available. Our secret wish is to put English
Speech everywhere in the game but this is nearly impossible since the text is
enormous (almost 40.000 words) and the speech will be very expensive. But you
never know… Gameplay 
What
about the gameplay? We have prepared a small video showing the gameplay on
desktops with mouse. This is only to get an idea how the game will be played on
desktops. On mobile platforms with touch screens the gameplay will be different,
adjusted to these needs. Also icons and texts will be bigger on small screens
so that it’s played easier. Frequently
Asked Questions
1) Will Zeus Quest Remastered be released on consoles?We can make this happen since we program with Unity3D. Its not planned but it can happen if a lot of you ask for it!2) Will the game be available on Steam?We are currently in the process of Steam Greenlight. This is not an easy task. Your vote will be highly appreciated to make this happen. Vote here: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=4866038283)What specs will I need to run Zeus Quest Remastered.Its too soon to say but a simple computer / tablet / phone will be fine.4) When will Zeus Quest Remastered be released?The development is going smoothly and it will be ready very soon. If everything goes as planned from the end of 2015 to the beginning of 2016!5) Have you made other adventure games so far?Except Zeus Quest we have already made another old image adventure called 'The Final Battle' and a newer one called 'The Odyssey'. The last one is FHD with little animation. Zeus Quest Remastered will be the best we made so far with full animation.

story:
*Devido à restrição de limite de texto da Indiegogo, consulte o site da levelup4good para informações detalhadas em português sobre as recompensas, os pesquisadores e Pousada Uacari.

Hi! I'm Alicia: just your ordinary IT professional. 

Because of my passion for IT, I always ask, "What IT solutions I use that will improve the overall experience of my life, or the lives of the people I work with, the community I live in, and the world we share?"

When we are financially blessed, it's OK to raise our standard of living; but we must also raise our standard of giving.

Getting a little creative this time with my extra-curricular IT efforts, I developed a couple of environmental conservation themed games for the iOS platform. One of which is Conserve the Amazon for Instituto Mamirauá for their work with the Amazon rainforest of Brazil:

· 5.5 million square kilometers of rainforest,
· Shared by 9 Nations in South America,
· 390 billion trees...from 16,000 species,
· 1/10 of all known life exists in the Amazon:
· MOST BIODIVERSE rainforest on the planet!

The game has a Know The Animal section educating us on why these animals are endangered, and how conservation helps.

We have seen success with the iOS games, so it seems only fair to give the Android community access to these educational games and awareness of their causes.

Development cost for the game is around USD $5,000

Gaming for a better world is our slogan.

When you back this project, I will personally send you a digital video made with my cool flying drone! This will give you a first-hand look at these special places illustrating why they deserve our awareness and protection.

Now, it’s your turn to show us:

  • by backing this campaign, plus
  • we have a whole list of goodies to give you as a way of saying thank you for helping us
  • spread the education and awareness internationally
  • with the Android version of these special games!

Check out the Level-Up 4 Good website for what I hope to achieve through games!

Thank you for your interest & support as a Backer! :D    ~> Tell your friends…

Alicia Choo
Founder & Chief Games4Good Guru
LevelUp4Good.com

*Click here for details of the scientist you can interact with and Uakari Floating Lodge T&Cs

===

Olá! Meu nome éAlicia e trabalho na área TI.

Por causa da minha paixão por TI, eu sempre me pergunto: “Que soluções da TI eu posso usar para melhorar minha experiência de vida em geral, ou as vidas dos meus colegas de trabalho, da sociedade da qual faço parte e do mundo em que vivo?”

Quando somos abençoados financeiramente, não tem problema aumentarmos no nosso padrão  de vida; mas isso deve vir acompanhado de um aumento no padrão de doação.

Usando um pouco de criatividade dessa vez com minhas habilidades de TI, eu desenvolvi alguns jogos para a plataforma iOS voltados para a conservação da natureza. Um desses jogos éo Conserve a Amazônia, um aplicativo dedicado ao trabalho do Instituto Mamirauá na floresta amazônica, que contém:

•  5,5 milhões de quilômetros quadrados de floresta

•  engloba 9 países da América do Sul

•  390 bilhões de árvores de ~16.000 espécies

•  1/10 de todas as espécies da terra

•  a floresta mais biodiversa do planeta!

O jogo possui uma parte educativa, “Os animais" explicando sobre as espécies presentes no jogo, o porque estarem ameaçados e como a conservação pode ajudar.

Os jogos para iOS têm sido bem-sucedidos, e assim gostaríamos que compartilhar a experiência de um jogo educativo e ajudar a divulgar a causa para a comunidade Android.

Os custos de desenvolvimento do jogo são em torno de US$5000

Nosso slogan é “Gaming for a better world”(Jongando para um mundo melhor).

Quando vocêapoiar o projeto, eu lhe enviarei pessoalmente um vídeo que eu fiz com meu drone sobrevoando cada uma desses ecossistemas especiais, e vocêpoderáver por si conferir porque eles merecem nossa atenção e proteção.

Agora ésua vez:

Qual presente vocêgostaria de receber como nosso agradecimento pela sua ajuda em divulgar a conservação da Amazônia internacionalmente com a versão Android do nosso jogo!

Dêuma olhada no site da Level-Up 4 Good para maiores detalhes sobre o propósito dessa iniciativa.

Muito obrigado pelo seu interesse e ajuda como financiador! :D > Conte para os seus amigos…

Alicia Choo
Fundadora & Principal Guru da  Games4Good
LevelUp4Good.com

*Devido à restrição de limite de texto da Indiegogo, consulte o site da levelup4good para informações detalhadas em português sobre as recompensas, os pesquisadores e Pousada Uacari.

story:
Imagine that people can to clone soldiers in unlimited quantities,
the limits is only in energy and time.
'Push' showing how will look like war in such a universe.
When infinitely huge army are moving on you,
in this situation the tactic will be only one - frontal assault with same big army and break up the enemy base with brute force.
You will move through randomly generated map, destroying enemies and would exploring new more powerful weapons. 

  •  Apple of Discord 

In a very far galaxy,  at a very far planet 'Zaris' was
found a new chemical element,  crystals with unusual properties people called it - Z crystal.
With a Z crystal, people learned to clone himself.
This resource can not be synthesized, the only place where you can find it - a planet Zaris.
The Z crystals became invaluable because of its rarity.              Immortality and thirst for absolute power eclipsed colonists eyes, they were divided into 7  camps, warring for control of the planet.

  • Passage

The player must destroy 6 enemy bases to complete the game
of them will be displayed enemy's coat of arms. 
The enemy can attack you and you will not be able to step back. Currently, each battle lasts from 5 to 60 minutes.

  • Randomly generated world

Each time you starting game from the beginning the map is randomly generated, received bonuses for winning randomly generating too.

  • Defeat

The defeat means the end of the game, the player will have to think through every move and spend resources wisely.

  • An arms race

Along the way to the enemy's camp the player have to destroy outposts.
When outposts will be destroyed player will getting availability to the new technologies.
  • Technology
Units are divided into 4 types

- Infantry
- Military vehicles
- Aircraft
- Flying infantry

War structures

- Turrets
- Defensive and offensive long-range guns
- Power generators

Special structures
- missile defense
- drones controls
- protective fields
and more...

                                               

  • Upgrades
Each military unit has a lot of upgrades that can cardinally change the unit. In the combat player can use only two upgrades for each unit. 

                                       A squad of thugs without upgrades

                                 


         Use upgrades rage (increased attack speed X2) flashing (Instant move)    

                                             


                                          A squad of thugs with upgrades  

                               

       


       

       


What will be after game release?
  • Game mode
The game will be two types of game mode campaign and survival.
Four levels of difficulty:
 - easy
 - normal 
 - hard
 - hardcore
  • Units
In the game will be 50 types of playable units.
  • Upgrades
In each unit can be 2-4 upgrade.
Totally 200 upgrades.
  • War Structures
9 turrets
14 defensive guns, player-controlled
2 plasma gun further action
10 long-range missiles
4 unique long-range guns
29 different defensive and offensive structures.         
 
         



I'm working on a game for over a year,
I can work on it only in my spare time,
but it is not a lot just a couple hours a day.
All the time spent on earning money.
If we manage to collect the required amount, I'll leave the work and spend all my time for the creation of the game.


Your deposit of € 10 or more - you will get a a Steam key of the game when it's released.
I will try to complete the game after half a year after it is ends at the company's indiegogo.
Pledging 25 € or more - you get access to the closed beta testing.
The exact date and details are still vague,
I tried to run it in a couple of months at the end of indiegogo.
