story:
Summary

"Operation Hardcore" is a retro-inspired action game launching for the Wii U in late 2015, featuring:

  • 8 levels of fiery, explosive alien-blasting mayhem
  • analog controls for 360 degree aiming
  • 3 player local couch co-op
  • HD output (720p and 1080p)
  • modern particle/atmospheric and lighting effects
  • persistent global score-board
  • multiple difficulty settings, upgrade paths and secret areas
  • modern sound design and music by me (Snug)


Project Hardcore is an ode to everything that is so awesome and so totally badass about video games. It's the game I would have made as a kid, if I knew what I was doing.

20 Years later and I know exactly what I'm doing. Now I need your help to make it a reality.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm looking to raise $5000 USD. A portion of this will go towards the cost of the Wii U development hardware, with remainder going towards the creation of original artwork.

Any extra funding (up to $2000) will go towards marketing and promoting the game (online advertising).

If I exceed $7500 during the campaign I will start adding stretch goals, including:
  • exploring the possibility of releasing on other platforms (Xbox One, PC)
  • increasing the scope of the game and/or exploring episodic content (i.e.  additional "badasses", another 8 levels)


In exchange for your support I'm offering several perks, ranging from early access to the game,  a copy of the sound-track, or your name in the credits. 

(Have an idea for a perk? Drop me a line, I'm more than happy to create custom perks!)

If I don't reach my funding goal I will be self-funding the difference. That's how committed I am to seeing this through to completion.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest known risk at this point is getting the word out there, I plan to get around this by investing a portion of any excess funding into promotion.

If I'm not able to use "traditional" advertising channels due to budgetary constraints (and even if I am), I plan on getting "social" and taking a grassroots approach:

  • engaging fans of the genre through social media channels
  • engaging independent game reviewers (i.e. YouTube), ensuring they have early access to the game
  • encouraging the gaming community to speed-run the game, record and share their results
  • hosting a local launch party

Other Ways You Can Help

If it's not in your budget to contribute, that's okay! But here are some things you can do to help:

  • Share my campaign (be sure to use the Indiegogo Share Tools!)
  • Vote for the game on Steam Greenlight Concepts
  • Follow me on IndieDB
  • Sign up for the official Project Hardcore mailing list

story:
Hey there, guys! We are a small team that has set their minds on making video games. We hope many people will find them entertaining and interesting. We worked with different teams on different projects in the past and this helped us gain experience and hone our skills—though there is always room for further development. However, it made us realize that all the stories we were coming up with were not up to par with some of their well-known and successful contemporaries. This is exactly why we would like to do something innovative and fresh and that is why the four of us came together to make a horror game that is actually going to be frightening and blood-curdling. We would like to make something that is not going to be like the thousand others in the video game industry that has been saturated with a plethora of titles that are ripping each other off. We believe that a game is like a canvas for personal expression and this is evident in the way we try to incorporate a piece of ourselves into it. If this campaign is successful we will be able focus on this project with all our might and we will give it our best shot.


 “Nox Aeternum” is a first-person horror game that mainly relies on storytelling and unpredictability . This game is for real horror aficionados and everyone who enjoys visually realistic games. The plot reveals itself through various notes found in the game, enemies and environment itself. Multi-layered story unwinds as the player progresses through the game. The game is situated in the 14th century after The Black Death. The protagonist is a liege lord against whom a cabal of shadowy figures conspire. We pride ourselves on the fact that we have not included any jump scares, or cheap scares in the game. Every monster in the game was individually and carefully programmed and is a completely separate A.I. Enemies have their own personalities and mood changes. Based on their mood swings, their actions change accordingly. We are trying to create environment that is ever changing and alive. This game features a non-linear gameplay in which the events are not sequenced in a particular order they completely depend on what the player does. Our main influences include H.P. Lovecraft, and several fantasy games.



1.  You will help us bring this game to life.

2.  Those of you who donate 10€ or more will receive a free digital copy of the game as soon as it is finished.

3.  Some of you will be able to participate in the making of the game.


We are trying to raise 10,000 €. Out of those 10,000, 15% will go to Indiegogo and other fees. Around 15% will go to a video game composer and audio equipment, and the rest will go to designers, programmers and graphics developers, since our team consists of a programmer, a level designer, a 2D artist, and a video game writer.

As for the perks—we will include many in-game perks, and other gifts of gratitude.


1.  Polishing and debugging of the internal game mechanics .

2.  More digital assets — 3D models.

3.  Possible adaptations for other platforms.

4.  Putting the finishing touches on graphics, testing, debugging.

5.  Composing a soundtrack.

If we do not reach our goal all the funds will still be utilized in the same manner. However, we cannot guarantee that the end-product will live up to its expectations, as we will not be able to hire all the relevant and necessary staff.  We will always do our best to continue working on this project. We are fortunate to have like-minded people who share our interests and ideas in our lives. We have been trying so hard on our own and up until now we even pulled through. However, we started this campaign because we need money and people in order to finish this game.

 Even if you are not able to contribute to our cause we hope that you will share this with your friends. And if you like it help us achieve our goal.

 Help make our dream a reality.
story_txt:
Hey there, guys! We are a small team that has set their minds
on making video games. We hope many people will find them entertaining and
interesting. We worked with different teams on different projects in the past
and this helped us gain experience and hone our skills—though there is always
room for further development. However, it made us realize that all the stories
we were coming up with were not up to par with some of their well-known and
successful contemporaries. This is exactly why we would like to do something
innovative and fresh and that is why the four of us came together to make a
horror game that is actually going to be frightening and blood-curdling. We
would like to make something that is not going to be like the thousand others
in the video game industry that has been saturated with a plethora of titles
that are ripping each other off. We believe that a game is like a canvas for
personal expression and this is evident in the way we try to incorporate a
piece of ourselves into it. If this campaign is successful we will be able focus
on this project with all our might and we will give it our best shot.

 “Nox Aeternum” is a first-person horror game that mainly relies on storytelling and unpredictability . This game is for real horror aficionados and everyone who enjoys visually realistic games. The plot reveals itself through various notes found in the game, enemies and environment itself. Multi-layered story unwinds as the player progresses through the game. The game is situated in the 14th century after The Black Death. The protagonist is a liege lord against whom a cabal of shadowy figures conspire. We pride ourselves on the fact that we have not included any jump scares, or cheap scares in the game. Every monster in the game was individually and carefully programmed and is a completely separate A.I. Enemies have their own personalities and mood changes. Based on their mood swings, their actions change accordingly. We are trying to create environment that is ever changing and alive. This game features a non-linear gameplay in which the events are not sequenced in a particular order they completely depend on what the player does. Our main influences include H.P. Lovecraft, and several fantasy games.

1.  You will help us bring this game to life.2.  Those of you who donate 10€ or more will receive a free digital copy of the game as soon as it is finished.
3.  Some of you will be able to participate in the making of the game.


We are trying to raise 10,000 €. Out of those 10,000, 15% will go to Indiegogo
and other fees. Around 15% will go to a video game composer and audio

developers, since our team consists of a programmer, a level designer, a 2D
artist, and a video game writer. 

As for the perks—we will include many in-game perks, and
other gifts of gratitude.



1.  Polishing and debugging of the internal game mechanics .

2.  More digital assets — 3D models.
3.  Possible adaptations for other platforms.
4.  Putting the finishing touches on graphics, testing, debugging.
5.  Composing a soundtrack.

If we do not reach our goal all the funds will still be
utilized in the same manner. However, we cannot guarantee that the end-product
will live up to its expectations, as we will not be able to hire all the
relevant and necessary staff.  We will always
do our best to continue working on this project. We are fortunate to have like-minded
people who share our interests and ideas in our lives. We have been trying so
hard on our own and up until now we even pulled through. However, we started
this campaign because we need money and people in order to finish this game.
 Even if you are not
able to contribute to our cause we hope that you will share this with your
friends. And if you like it help us achieve our goal.
 Help make our dream a
reality.

story:
Any gamer knows that game controllers aren’t the cleanest things in one’s house. In fact, they seem to have 5 TIMES more bacteria than toilet seats. Bleah, right? If, like me, you love long gaming sessions, then you know that things can also get…uhm…stinky. And, let’s face it, cleaning your Xbox or PS4 controller the old-fashioned way is quite an ordeal, not to mention the fact that you risk ruining it with cleaning products.

What if you could clean your controller in 5 minutes and charge it at the same time?

Zap is a product born out of necessity: as a gamer, I truly felt the need to do something about the two things that kept me away from gaming: dirt and stench. So I did: I created Zap, the world’s first UV-enabled box specifically designed to keep your controllers clean as a whistle.

Join our campaign and you can be a part of creating a cleaner world for all us gamers out there and get your own Zap at a special early-bird discount.

How it works

Trust me, cleaning your game controllers has never been easier:

- Place your game controller in the enclosure

- Connect it via USB or microUSB

- Press the button to start the self-cleaning cycle

- Wait 5 minutes

- The magic is complete

Better yet, Zap works for almost any other device in your house:

- Smartphones

- Tablets

- TV remote controllers

- Wireless mice

Thanks to the power of UV light, Zap can kill 99.9% of all bacteria on your game controllers. You can literally eat off them afterwards!

All you need is Zap and a wall socket to connect it to. Then you just sit back and watch it work its magic.

 

Where we are now & what part can you play

- Design & prototyping – done

- First functional prototype – done

Your contribution:

- Testing

- CE/FCC certification

- Mass production

 

Risks and challenges

Most of the work on Zap has already been done. We have already found a reliable manufacturer, so as soon as we reach our goal we can start testing and then go into production. We don’t expect any major challenges, except for a small delay that may be caused by the testing process.

 

Join the (clean) ride!

Select the perk that appeals to you most and you can be one of the first worldwide owners of Zap! Zap away all the bacteria in 5 minutes!

story:
As seen on:

         

Game overview:

In the summer of 2016 Ordinary Entrepreneurs Ltd created Crazy Speed Racing which happens to be more than a mobile game. It is 3D dark Matrix type of roller coaster ride; intense, shiny and scary. You play the role of the street thug, the Vin Diesel type of a rebel who lives by his own code; the street warrior who lives by sword and dies by the sword. In this universe you are your best friend.

Many of us remember the good times they had playing old school PC games like Carmageddon and Need for Speed Hot Pursuit 2. Crazy Speed Racing allows you to experience things you would never consider doing in real life. Going for a walk, meditating or doing yoga helps you loosen up. Nothing compares to wreaking some havoc downtown. Drive as fast as you can, break all laws, blast, wreck and destroy whatever comes your way. The streets of the future expect you.

Through the game you enter a dark futuristic reality controlled by a rouge artificial intelligence. Your biggest challenge is to stay alive for as long as you can in order to progress to the next level. Your arsenal of free weapons includes smart bombs, armors, speed boosters and anti-magnets. These powerful toys will help you battle your way through each level and stay alive until your very last street battle against the synthetic dark matrix and its minions.

Crazy Speed Racing falls into the “free thrills” category. This easy to play game is suitable for all ages. The responsive tap and tilt game controls and user friendly menus deserve your appreciation. The phenomenal 3D graphics accompanied by the rhythmical dub step soundtrack will excite and invigorate you.

This amazing mobile game has been designed for iPhone, iPad and iPod touch. Crazy Speed Racing has so many levels it feels like an infinite dark realm filled to the brim with all kinds of dangers and hidden traps. The variety of free vehicles and exotic weaponry will make you feel like a “Matrix” type of a street fighter on wheels. Be prepared for the most epic racing experience on a handheld device.

Screenshots of the game:

What Do We Need:

Our goal is to keep the game ads free. Currently, the game is launched in the "Free" category on iTunes. It probably makes sense to every potential user that a free game will have ads because that's how we, the developers, make money. The game also offer variety of in-App purchases options.

We want to completely remove the game ads to make YOUR game experience much more fun! To be able to do that, we need your support. The more you donate in our game, the longer there will be absolutely no ads in our game!

Important: Depending on the donations amount, we also plan to launch a version which is absolutely free and not to have any in-Apps so the users will have all possible game upgrades for FREE and will be able to enjoy this awesome endless high speed racing game!

Follow us and share our campaign with the rest of the world:

Official Website: http://www.crazyspeedracing.com

  • Youtube 

  • Dailymotion

  • Vimeo

  • Facebook

  • Twitter

  • Google Plus

  • Pinterest 

  • Tumbrl

  • Foursquare

story:
The App to Change Football

      

We are the first App that delivers Advanced Stats so that Football Games are never the same.

The App includes the following innovative features:

  • Field Positional Heat Maps
  • Gamestlye Classification (Combative, Box-to-box, Positional or Explosive)
  • Action per Zone (Defense, Midfield, Attack)
  • Football Related Physical Stats (Distance, % Running, Sprints, Average and Maximum Speed, Moves)
  • Performance rankings within App users
  • Possibility to challenge any App user
  • Comparison to Official Professional Players (Like Messi and Ronaldo)

The Impact on the Game

Every Player knows that the Top Clubs, Coaches and Players have access to Advanced Analytics in both training and games. Just like the Champions League Heatmaps during TV Broadcasting.

Until now the Friendly or Semi-professional Games experience was completely detached from the Analytics and Profiles although every player aspired to that,

Magicoach completely changes every game by bringing to this level the full TV and Gaming Experience. Finally I can merge my Football Fan, Gamer or Enthusiastic role with my friendly games.

The impact is to do for Football what App+GPS did for Cycling or Running with the additional impact of direct comparison with Official ProPlayers.

Risks & Challenges

The delivery of the systems is expected to take 4 months. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Share our campaign with the maximum persons you can! More backers means acceleration of new features!

story:
Short Summary


  •  Our goal is to open an arcade and gaming cafe focused primarily on hosting tournaments for popular games on various consoles. The local gaming community near Marysville, WA, just an hour north of down town Seattle. Is in need of a safe and friendly space for people of all ages to spectate and play together, both casually and competitively. Yes, I said spectate! There are some people that don't actually play these games, but are a fan of the sport! Simply put, eSport is a video game competition.
  • Esports are the most popular spectator


  • We want to work with local high schools and offer incentives for passing grades and promote teamwork by hosting seasonal tournaments for high school teams. This might inspire those who aren't active in sports to keep passing grades for something they are active in, esports.            
  • Choose a Clan!
  • Dungeon Gaming will have 3 clans that consist of gaming "family" members. You choose which one to be a part of. 
  1. Clan of spirit, determination and courage.
  2. Clan of wisdom, intellect and cunning.
  3. Clan of vitality, ability and confidence.
  • Each clan will accumulate points per members placement 1st-3rd place. The clan with the most points at the end of a season (winter, spring, summer, fall) will earn that season's trophy in the Clans trophy case in house and each winnings clans member will receive a prize!
  • Our startup costs are close to $120k and consist of the following:
  • $18k for 1st months lease and security deposit
  • $75k in software for 24 computers
  • 8 xbox ones, 1 Wii-U and 10 flat screen tv's
  • Arcade machine monthly lease rental/shipping
  • ---1 Dance Dance Revolution machine
  • ---1 two player shooting game
  • ---2 Classic arcade cabinets
  • ---1 Pac Man 4 player Battle Royale
  • Construction/Decor of acquired location

    $15 =


The Impact

  • We imagine we'll help create friendships with those that have common interests.  We foresee the creation of multiple Gaming teams that will consist of soon to be friends that have yet to meet! 

  • Our main challenge is that we are a start up company with no client base..

    • At the on set of the operation our main strength will be the enthusiasm of our staff and guest’s. At that time, most of the staff will be volunteers taking part in a cause they are passionate about.

story:
About Me:

My name is Chad, I'm a  photographer, magazine creator, and digital artist. I live in Washington State.  Over the last year I have delved into computer game creation. Using game engines like Unreal 4 and Unity. 

THE STORY:

My current computer died on me a couple months ago. I'm currently using a old one from around 2009. My independent production on the game Coin Quest: Dark Stakes has halted. I'm not able to run the game engine that I need to create. With your help, I can continue. 

What I Need & What You Get:

I need funding of at least $999

This will cover a development computer and any extras I need. 

This is an example of the computer I can get from NewEgg.

Example Computer

 

  • AMD FX-Series FX-6300 (3.50GHz)
    • 16GB DDR3 1TB HDD
    • Windows 8.1 64-Bit
    • NVIDIA GeForce GT 640 2 GB


    What you will get are some fun perks. Which you can see on the right side. At the lowest level you will receive your name in the credits and other fun perks to come at higher levels. 

    If I don't reach the goal, I will still use what ever I raise to get whatever computer I can that can help with my work.  

    For anonymous help we accept  Crypto Currency. 

    Bitcoin: 1G3NWPaezoUeeuZNJ7ByCnepXSnz8bccoX

    Hyper:  HUps6b9rpBoSY6cnsQRZnxwYkvHf7AwQVd

    GP: GTEfJSwvyR1qC9YEvVTzTkTT3rmt8Vsc5y

    Coin2: CckMYrtNEPZidaqZGxfcwiQuWbgB4TaVqV

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I know for some, money can be a challenge to help back projects. You can still help by sharing, tweeting, and getting the word out through social media, forums, word of mouth and what ever ways you can think of. This is all appreciated so much. 

    Over the next 60 days check in with updates. I will be posting many. I will also be putting up a video soon.

story:
We are grateful :) for your support and your consideration of this project. 

This game was developed over this past year and a prototype has been made. Our goal for this campaign is to raise enough money to hire an artist to make enhanced illustrations for each card in the game, to make our first bulk order, and to launch our game into the market. 

We hope you will give us the opportunity to share our games with you and to help our new business launch to succeed. If you would like to back us click on the  button up and to the right => ^ and see the list of Royal Perks you can choose from down and to the right => v 

You can also support us by posting this page on your social media and encouraging others to back us.  Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools.         Thank you!!

 Why make a pledge to our game?

Imagine playing the popular "war" card game with actual warriors from history, or playing a battlefield strategy game in which you get to organize an army to capture your opponent's castle using the greatest warriors from history all fighting together at the same time and place, or playing the popular "memory" game with pairs of historical warriors. And imagine playing capture the flag outside and giving each player a role to play as a specific warrior from history. You can!, with Royal Combat: Warriors of History.

See our website for the full rules and instructions, videos and more about our other games: http://www.bartlbrothers.com

With Royal Combat: Warriors of History you are essentially getting 4 games in 1.  

"Basic Battle"

This method of play is very similar to the popular "war" card game.  The difference is that you get to choose which card from your hand to put down and you play war with actual warriors from history!

 "Battlefield"

This play method has a combination of calculated strategy play and taking risks and gives the same feel of a board game. Each player has a castle they must defend with a castle guard and a front line they must advance into the battlefield and against opponent's castles. So this game is similar to strategy board games such as chess, checkers, and stratego. And it has the battlefield uncertainties faced in games such as Risk.

"Memory"

The "Memory" play method is exactly the same as the popular memory game. The only difference is that you are playing it with the really cool Royal Combat: Warriors of History cards.

"Capture the Castle"

"Capture the Castle" is very similar to the popular outdoor active game "Capture the Flag". The difference is that you are using the Royal Combat: Warriors of History cards to give players different ranks and allow them to role play different characters in the game. This is one of the funnest games ever :)

The bottom line for each of these games is that they are so fun you will want to keep playing.

 52 cards in each deck

 26 for a red team and 26 for a blue team

There are 4 categories of players: Gold Star, Silver Star, Green Star, and Shadow

 Higher Ranks Capture Lower Ranks

But Higher Ranks have weaknesses from some lower Ranks

PRIMARY GOAL: $1,000 - enhanced artwork for each card, first bulk order of games

Reaching this goal will provide a level of artwork on each card seen in the Spartan/Viking animation that is contained in supplemental videos on this page (not the "basic battle" animation in the main video). They also have a brief presence in the main project video.  The drawings from those animations will be on the Spartan and Viking cards and each of the other warriors will have the same level of artwork completed for them.  Depending on which stretch goal we reach, the artwork will be even better.

Please Help Us Reach our Goal!


STRETCH GOALS:

$2,000: Custom-made box containers for each deck of cards.

$3,000: Royal Gold Cards get top-level artistic makeover with special resemblance to particular royal characters from history or literature.

$4,000: Silver and Shadow cards get top-level artistic makeover. 

$5,000: A completely revamped graphic illustrated edition of Royal Combat: Warriors of History gets funded.  The artwork will be as good as any card game in the market.

$7,500: Castle Wall decorated playing mats for card games. 

$10,000+: more awesome games begin production!  See our website for more info.

TIMELINE:

September 2015: Royal Combat: Warriors of History, will be illustrated, printed, and shipped out to backers. 

Allocation of Funds:

60% Product Creation: Illustration and Design, Printing and Manufacturing, Marketing.

20% Royal Rewards: You get our brand new products before anyone else! 

10% Business Start Up: Legal, Risk Management, Taxes, Filings, Supplies

10% Fees: Indiegogo's cut and transaction processing fees.
story_txt:
We are grateful :) for your support and your consideration of this project. 


This game was developed over this past year and a prototype has been made. Our goal for this campaign is to raise enough money to hire an artist to make enhanced illustrations for each card in the game, to make our first bulk order, and to launch our game into the market. 
We hope you will give us the opportunity to share our games with you and to help our new business launch to succeed. If you would like to back us click on the  button up and to the right => ^ and see the list of Royal Perks you can choose from down and to the right => v 
You can also support us by posting this page on your social media and encouraging others to back us.  Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools.         Thank you!!

 Why make a pledge to our game?
    
Imagine playing the popular "war" card game with actual warriors from history, or playing a battlefield strategy game in which you get to organize an army to capture your opponent's castle using the greatest warriors from history all fighting together at the same time and place, or playing the popular "memory" game with pairs of historical warriors. And imagine playing capture the flag outside and giving each player a role to play as a specific warrior from history. You can!, with Royal Combat: Warriors of History.
See our website for the full rules and instructions, videos and more about our other games: http://www.bartlbrothers.com
With Royal Combat: Warriors of History you are essentially getting 4 games in 1.  
"Basic Battle"
This method of play is very similar to the popular "war" card game.  The difference is that you get to choose which card from your hand to put down and you play war with actual warriors from history!

 "Battlefield"
This play method has a combination of calculated strategy play and taking risks and gives the same feel of a board game. Each player has a castle they must defend with a castle guard and a front line they must advance into the battlefield and against opponent's castles. So this game is similar to strategy board games such as chess, checkers, and stratego. And it has the battlefield uncertainties faced in games such as Risk.

"Memory"
The "Memory" play method is exactly the same as the popular memory game. The only difference is that you are playing it with the really cool Royal Combat: Warriors of History cards.

"Capture the Castle"
"Capture the Castle" is very similar to the popular outdoor active game "Capture the Flag". The difference is that you are using the Royal Combat: Warriors of History cards to give players different ranks and allow them to role play different characters in the game. This is one of the funnest games ever :)

The bottom line for each of these games is that they are so fun you will want to keep playing.

 52 cards in each deck


 26 for a red team and 26 for a blue team


There are 4 categories of players: Gold Star, Silver Star, Green Star, and Shadow

 Higher Ranks Capture Lower Ranks

But Higher Ranks have weaknesses from some lower Ranks


PRIMARY GOAL: $1,000 - enhanced artwork for each card, first bulk order of games
Reaching this goal will provide a level of artwork on each card seen in the Spartan/Viking animation that is contained in supplemental videos on this page (not the "basic battle" animation in the main video). They also have a brief presence in the main project video.  The drawings from those animations will be on the Spartan and Viking cards and each of the other warriors will have the same level of artwork completed for them.  Depending on which stretch goal we reach, the artwork will be even better.
Please Help Us Reach our Goal!

STRETCH GOALS:
$2,000: Custom-made box containers for each deck of cards.
$3,000: Royal Gold Cards get top-level artistic makeover with special resemblance to particular royal characters from history or literature.
$4,000: Silver and Shadow cards get top-level artistic makeover. 
$5,000: A completely revamped graphic illustrated edition of Royal Combat: Warriors of History gets funded.  The artwork will be as good as any card game in the market.
$7,500: Castle Wall decorated playing mats for card games. 
$10,000+: more awesome games begin production!  See our website for more info.
TIMELINE:
September 2015: Royal Combat: Warriors of History, will be illustrated, printed, and shipped out to backers. 
Allocation of Funds:
60% Product Creation: Illustration and Design, Printing and Manufacturing, Marketing.
20% Royal Rewards: You get our brand new products before anyone else! 
10% Business Start Up: Legal, Risk Management, Taxes, Filings, Supplies
10% Fees: Indiegogo's cut and transaction processing fees.

story:
Find Us Here:

  Facebook    Website    Reddit  DriveThruRPG

"This is a world of men no longer"

The lands of Scath, your home, are broken.
Once there were three great kingdoms.
Now only ashes and ruins remain.
Evil rules the nights. The Fomori own the world.
To them, man is just another animal to be hunted,
enslaved or corrupted.
The spirit of men is shattered. They cover behind flimsy walls or roam the wilderness in small, primitive packs.
No one dares to oppose the Fomori.
Until now.

The ancient elemental spirits have simply watched as the dark legions hunted humanity to the brink of extinction. Now the Fomori are threatening the very life of the world itself, and the spirits can watch no longer.
You were born into a world of fear and death, of inhuman powers and terrifying monsters. You have fought starvation, the cold of winter and sinister creatures alike. You have watched friends and family members die or be taken.
Now the time has come to fight back. The spirits have given you strength. They have given you magic. Rise and challenge the rulers of the world!
Destroy the Shadow of the Fomori!

The Setting:

At the very core of this game stands the idea of a dark fantasy world ruled by ancient, mysterious powers.
It is a world where mankind is dying, struggling for survival against both natural dangers and supernatural monsters that roam the wilderness. Travelling is deadly, thus most people live and die within a few miles from the place of their birth.
The player characters are men and women lifted from these harsh, deadly lives by the Eight, ancient elemental spirits. They have taken a small part of such a spirit into themselves and received both physical and magical power.
Armed with this power and the will of the Eight behind them, these warriors, these "Chosen Ones", will lift the broken spirit of humanity, unite the scattered clans and villages under one banner and challenge the dark powers that have ruled Scath for over two hundred years. They are the only ones who can save the world...and maybe rule it?

Classical Origins:

"Shadow of the Fomori" in many ways goes back to the ancient stories of classical heroes that we humans have told each other around the campfires, borrowing heavily from mythological lore, especially the Celtic one. It is a game where players will experience carrying the weight of the world on their shoulders, being the only thing standing between the last remnants of humanity and the cold sleep of death.

The Journey:

During their rise to power the Chosen will battle both natural and supernatural dangers. They will explore a land largely unknown, encountering many terrifying creatures. They will realize that the world of Scath is far older than they have been told, and that the only way to win this war they are fighting in, is to uncover the secrets of that forgotten past, a time long before the rise of humanity.
In their journey the player characters will meet wondrous, ancient beings with their own agendas and will, depending on their choices, turn them into trusted allies or bitter enemies. The Chosen will bring their people the first victories in over two hundred years and will use them to rekindle the spirits of hope and resistance within the heart of mankind.
During all that time the heroes will experience changes within their own bodies and minds. The influence of the Eight is strong, so strong that it might wipe away the humanity within a Chosen himself. Will the player characters be prepared to sever the ties with their friends and family, sacrificing their body and soul and call it a small price to pay? Or will they hold on to what makes them mortal, struggling to unite the spiritual powers with their own humanity?

"Scath – Shadow of the Fomori" uses a D20 based rule system with many elements that will be familiar to experienced roleplayers.
The aim of the system is to provide a core of fairly simple rules while enabling players and GM's alike to add more complicated, in – depth rules to their own liking, thus giving the characters far more options and hopefully making the game more enjoyable.
The combat rules are one of the main focuses of the game, providing five distinct combat styles with over 30 different combat actions. Tied into that – but also very much usable out of combat – are the magic rules, including the eight elemental lores the player characters can use, but also three distinctly different kinds of magic.
The gamemaster section also includes rules for leading armies into battle against each other and resolving such conflicts without having to rely on improvisation or hour – long dice rolling.

For further Information about Setting and Rules see our website.

This is a game for players who enjoy combat, exploration and leadership. The Chosen Ones will have to battle terrible monsters, explore the secrets of a past long forgotten and forge alliances with weird beings. They will also have to unite humanity under one banner and lead them into battle against the evil that has destroyed their forefathers.
At the same time, there is also a lot of roleplaying involved. Scath is a world with a dark, mysterious atmosphere, and this atmosphere is very important for a campaign. The weight of the world lies upon the Chosen Ones, and many men have been destroyed by this weight.
The player characters themselves are changing and might struggle to adapt to their new natures. Lastly the efforts of unification and alliances provides great chances for roleplaying too: do the player characters want to be tyrants, leading by intimidation and fear, or will they be golden heroes in a world of darkness and blood? Will they want to keep all power in their hands, or will they risk giving it away to other, more "human" leaders? And how will they react to all the weird characters and alien beings they might encounter, and who might prove either ally or enemy? Only the players can find the answers to these questions.
Ultimately it is your own decision on which of these elements your RPG group will focus. My belief is that "Scath" can be a very enjoyable experience for both groups who want to focus mostly on combat and exploring old ruins and groups whose main interest is in roleplaying and leading large forces or any other combination of the elements mentioned.

Several unusual elements can be found in this setting. Together they make playing in the world of Scath a unique experience for players and gamemasters alike.

  • Scath is heavily inspired by Celtic mythology, a body of ancient stories and legends that are fairly unknown to most people and are not used as much as they would deserve. Combined with them is a dark fantasy end-times setting, with a whole world on the brink of destruction.

  • Mankind's technology in the lands of Scath is on a very low level. Most Wilder clans and some of the more primitive villages have been cast back into the stone age, relying on tools of bone, wood and stone. Whilst there might be a few artefacts of iron to be found here and there no one has the ability to create or repair it, and the highest standard of technology left is bronze.

  • Most knowledge about the past has been lost in the great war. Even the lands themselves are mostly unknown, roamed by monsters. Very few men dare to venture far from the territory around their villages or camps. The player characters will be able to explore a whole world, never knowing what might wait behind the next hill. The players and their characters will both start with next to no information about Scath, thus making metagaming and mixing in/out of character knowledge nearly impossible. This journey of discovery, of finding information about the world, its history and its inhabitants, is one of the most interesting things about Scath.

  • Scath as a roleplaying game returns to the classical beginnings of heroic tales. The player characters are classical heroes, amongst the very few Chosen Ones that stand between mankind and its utter destruction. The weight of the whole world is on their shoulders.


or: "What you are getting for your money"

With your help the world of Scath will be able to come to life in a book of approximately 250 pages. It will be held almost exclusively in shades of white, grey and black to reflect the bleak, dark atmosphere of the world.

The book itself will be divided into two large sections. Below you will find a list of contents for both of these sections (subject to minor changes).

The first part: Player's Handbook

  • "Dead and alive" is a short story showing an outcast's ascension to power.
  • "Introduction: Welcome to a world of Shadow" will talk about the reasons for creating Scath, the atmosphere and main elements of the setting.
  • "Living in a land of fear" describes what little of history is known to men and talks in detail about the two societies of mankind: Villagers and Wilders.
  • "Ancient powers awaken" gives the players background information about the Eight, powerful elemental spirits that give them their abilities and one of which will become closely connected to each and every player character.
  • "Heroes in a dark land" gives players everything they need to know about character creation and the many paths they can chose to become the hero they truly want to be.
  • "How to be a hero" explains all general rules, giving descriptions of main attributes, skills and feats.
  • "Fields of Blood and Bronze" talks about rules for combat, including the five distinct combat styles two of which each Chosen can learn during his journey.
  • "Forces of the world beyond" explains how magic works in the Scath: Shadow of the Fomori. It also describes in great detail the eight elemental lores which player characters can choose from, including over a hundred different spells and hints on using them both in and out of combat.
  • "Tools of Trade" This final chapter of the player's handbook talks about barter trade and general equipment. It also describes different kinds of weapons and armour both PCs and NPCs can use.
  • Scattered throughout the Player's Handbook are furthermore short stories written from the perspective of beings living in the world of Scath. They should give the players a better understanding of what it feels like to actually live in such a dangerous, dark land.

The second part: Gamemaster's Handbook

DISCLAIMER: a lot of the great atmosphere and suspense in the world of Scath comes from the players and their characters not knowing what lies ahead and what happened in the past. Many of these secrets are unveiled in the Gamemaster's Handbook and players should not take too close a look into its pages.

  • "History of the land", an in – depth look at the creation of the world of Scath and all the things that happened up to this point in history.
  • A detailed "World Map" which includes descriptions of many important settlements and sites.
  • "Creating the world of Scath" GM tips, plot hooks and campaign elements.
  • "Societies of the Pale Ones and the Servants of Fire"
  • "Elemental Powers" including further rules for magic and its use, creation of magical weapons, rules for ascendence (a secondary system of gaining experience) and a deeper look at the Eight and their plans.
  • "Masters to darkness" – the dark machinations of the Fomori, their powers and greatest beings.
  • "Creatures and Warriors"– over 30 opponents/potential allies.
  • "Famous Characters" (ca. 10) for use in the campaign.
  • "Mass Combat rules"will give you rules for fighting large battles, with hundreds or even thousands of warriors on both sides.

No book is written in a vacuum. The world of Scath is a conglomeration of ideas inspired by the works of many great authors and ancient legends alike.
The main influence is, of course, the mythology of the ancient Celts, especially the Irish ones. There are other, more modern books that use the same themes, and that have inspired me in the same way: "The Book Corum" by Michael Moorcock and David Gemmell's four "Rigante" novels.
Other influences from contemporary fantasy are Steven Erikson's "Mazalan books of the Fallen" (my absolute favourite books of all time) and Brandon Sanderson's "Mistborn" trilogy, which inspired some of the atmosphere of Scath.
In addition Josef Campbell's "Hero with a thousand faces" was a great inspiration for writing about the journey of classical, old school heroes.

When it comes to rules I was mostly inspired by two different gaming systems. The first one is the well known D20 rule system used by "Pathfinder" and different versions of "Dungeons & Dragons". The other gaming system is the 2nd Edition of "Warhammer Fantasy Roleplaying", combined with some elements from the fairly similar "Dark Heresy".

1100 € = "Careers for Humans": For those who want to experience the world of Scath from its truly dark side, with no mystical powers to protect them, rules for playing ordinary mortals will be added, including the three human archetypes "Warrior", "Huntsman" and "Seeker of Knowledge". 

1500 € = "The Valley of Tears", a sandbox – setting detailing on approximately thirty to forty pages an area that can be used to start a campaign, including three villages, a larger city and several Overlords and their plans and servants.

3500 € = "Fully illustrated book": The Rulebook will have some illustrations, but to be able to deliver an even higher quality of detailed artworks we need more funding. If this stretchgoal is reached there will be additional "general" artwork scattered throughout the whole rulebook, but more importantly, we will be able to provide illustrations for nearly every single creature in the "Creatures and Warriors" section. 

As I am writing this the Player's Handbook is about 90% done. The Gamemaster's Handbook is about 20% done.
I will continue writing while this campaign is running on Indiegogo. By the end of June the Player's Handbook will be done.
During July and the first two weeks of August I will be able to write most of the Gamemaster's Handbook. The rest of August will be spent tidying up the book and doing the layout.
Approximately in the second or third week of September the PDF version of Scath: Shadow of the Fomori, will be done and distributed amongst all backers.
October will be the month of printing and shipping. Depending on where in the world you live you will most likely receive your softcover or hardcover copy in mid or late October.

Risks

There are not too many risks involved in this project. Most of the illustrations are done and writing is well underway. By the time you are reading this (June 2015) the book will be approximately halfway finished.
If something happens to me the book might be delayed, but it will definitely be finished and shipped to your home by the end of 2015.
Should this campaign not reach its goal of 1000 Euro that would mean further delay until I can find some additional resources on my own. Even in that case all backers will receive their copy of the book not later than Spring 2016.

  • Shipping details

    Shipping will be done by our partners at Drivethrurpg.com. Depending on the part of the world you come from and whether you want a softcover or the (heavier) hardcover version of the book the shipping price will go up and down.

    The average shipping prices for the following regions are:

    USA/Canada: Softcover 5 Euro, Hardcover 10 Euro
    Europe: Softcover 8 Euro, Hardcover 12 Euro
    Australia: Softcover 12 Euro, Hardcover 20 Euro
    Brazil: Softcover 25 Euro, Hardcover 30 Euro

    Please add these prices to your pledge if you are bound to receive an actual book, no matter if softcover or hardcover!

  • Flexible funding and what it means

    "Flexible funding" means that you will get your copy of the book, even if the campaign itself does not reach 1000€. Should this happen, however, Indiegogo itself will be receiving a greater share of the money and I will also have to find additional funding myself, which will lead to a delay of several months. Even in this case every backer should have their book by spring 2016.

  • How does character creation work?

    Character creation is explained in greater detail on our website here.

  • A closer look at combat

    Battles are one of the main challenges the PCs will have to face in "Scath:Shadow of the Fomori". Combat is supposed to be fast – paced and dangerous, but at the same time allowing the players to use different strategies while battling opponents, and specializing their tactics when facing enemies they have already faced before. This is what we have been aspiring to create with the combat rules of Scath.

    The rules themselves are based on Action Points. Every character has a certain amount of Action Points per combat turn (two in the beginning, three or maybe even four at later levels), symbolizing his skill and decisiveness in a battle. He can use these points to do different kinds of combat actions. There are a dozen "Basic Actions" that every character, no matter how unused to battle, can attempt (download a Guide to Basic Combat Actions). In addition to that (and in addition to the different kinds of magic Chosen Ones can wield) there are about twenty "Advanced Actions", that only fighters experienced in one of the five "Combat Styles" can attempt to perform. Thus low level characters will have the opportunity to get to know the basic combat rules and then mix it up with some more complicated, and potentially more devastating attacks/actions.
    With this kind of combat system we have tried to encourage players to try out different kinds of attacks (feint, stunning strikes, disarming attacks, attacks that sacrifice defensive capabilities to deal more damage and vice versa etc.) in combat, instead of simply using the same kind of attack every turn. This should also enable both GMs and players alike to attempt a more narrative style of combat without having to put in too much extra effort, because the combat actions a PC has taken by itself tells most of the story.

  • Magic in the world of Scath

    Magic in the world of Scath is a powerful thing, allowing its wielders to shape the world to their will. At least eleven different kinds of magic, different "lores", if you so will, can be found in the Core Rulebook of Scath.
    The first eight of these lores of magic are the elemental powers, mystical abilities that were gifted to a Chosen One. Some of them are very different from each other, while others might be close regarding the effect the magic causes, if not its origin.
    In addition to that there will be three lores in the Gamemaster part of the Core Rulebook: the mysterious Lore of Stars, used by the nearly disappeared brotherhood of sorcerors and by the so – called "Pale Ones", the sinister, destructive Lore of the Fomori, used by the Overlords and their servants, and the Lore of Nature, primarily used by shamans, druids and some supernatural creatures.

    The rules for magic are fairly simple. Every spell has a "Spirit Level". To cast it successfully, the Chosen One must at least reach that Spirit Level. He can use his "Spirit Dice" to do that. These are simple D6 that are rolled and added together. Chosen Ones can use up to five spirit dice, boosting their chances to reach a spells Spirit Level, but the more dice they roll the more danger they are in to deplete their own spiritual energy, or even lose control of the magic, with unfortunate effects on themselves and their surroundings.
    Thus players can influence the amount of power their characters want to put into a spell, carefully choosing between potential risk and potential reward.

  • Who I am

    I am Alex, a fantasy fan, general geek when it comes to all types of board games, computer games and roleplaying games, and martial arts enthusiast from Austria. I have about fifteen years of experience when it comes to RPGs and have spent the last ten of them creating detailed homebrew rule systems and worlds for my own gaming groups. This is my first project to be "properly" published. I have gamemastered a very successful campaign of "Scath: Shadow of the Fomori" for over three years and I am really excited about the chance to share my gaming experience with the rest if the world!

    Feel free to contact me with any questions or suggestions you might have!

  • What is DriveThruRPG?

    DriveThruRPG is a website specializing on printing and shipping RPG books, with the ability to print books in both England and the US. This enables us to save us (and you!) a lot of shipping costs, because we do not have to send books across the Atlantic.

    You can check out their website at www.drivethrurpg.com.

			"Ancient powers awaken" gives the players background information about the Eight, powerful elemental spirits that give them their abilities and one of which will become closely connected to each and every player character.
		

			"Heroes in a dark land" gives players everything they need to know about character creation and the many paths they can chose to become the hero they truly want to be.
		

			"How to be a hero" explains all general rules, giving descriptions of main attributes, skills and feats.
		

			"Fields of Blood and Bronze" talks about rules for combat, including the five distinct combat styles two of which each Chosen can learn during his journey.
		

			"Forces of the world beyond" explains how magic works in the Scath: Shadow of the Fomori. It also describes in great detail the eight elemental lores which player characters can choose from, including over a hundred different spells and hints on using them both in and out of combat.
		

			"Tools of Trade" This final chapter of the player's handbook talks about barter trade and general equipment. It also describes different kinds of weapons and armour both PCs and NPCs can use.
		

			Scattered throughout the Player's Handbook are furthermore short stories written from the perspective of beings living in the world of Scath. They should give the players a better understanding of what it feels like to actually live in such a dangerous, dark land.
		


The second part: Gamemaster's Handbook

	DISCLAIMER: a lot of the great atmosphere and suspense in the world of Scath comes from the players and their characters not knowing what lies ahead and what happened in the past. Many of these secrets are unveiled in the Gamemaster's Handbook and players should not take too close a look into its pages.




			"History of the land", an in – depth look at the creation of the world of Scath and all the things that happened up to this point in history.
		

			A detailed "World Map" which includes descriptions of many important settlements and sites.
		

			"Creating the world of Scath" GM tips, plot hooks and campaign elements.
		

			"Societies of the Pale Ones and the Servants of Fire"
		

			"Elemental Powers" including further rules for magic and its use, creation of magical weapons, rules for ascendence (a secondary system of gaining experience) and a deeper look at the Eight and their plans.
		

			"Masters to darkness" – the dark machinations of the Fomori, their powers and greatest beings.
		

"Creatures and Warriors"– over 30 opponents/potential allies.
		

			"Famous Characters" (ca. 10) for use in the campaign.
		

			"Mass Combat rules"will give you rules for fighting large battles, with hundreds or even thousands of warriors on both sides.







	No book is written in a vacuum. The world of Scath is a conglomeration of ideas inspired by the works of many great authors and ancient legends alike.
	The main influence is, of course, the mythology of the ancient Celts, especially the Irish ones. There are other, more modern books that use the same themes, and that have inspired me in the same way: "The Book Corum" by Michael Moorcock and David Gemmell's four "Rigante" novels.
	Other influences from contemporary fantasy are Steven Erikson's "Mazalan books of the Fallen" (my absolute favourite books of all time) and Brandon Sanderson's "Mistborn" trilogy, which inspired some of the atmosphere of Scath.
	In addition Josef Campbell's "Hero with a thousand faces" was a great inspiration for writing about the journey of classical, old school heroes.
	
	When it comes to rules I was mostly inspired by two different gaming systems. The first one is the well known D20 rule system used by "Pathfinder" and different versions of "Dungeons & Dragons". The other gaming system is the 2nd Edition of "Warhammer Fantasy Roleplaying", combined with some elements from the fairly similar "Dark Heresy".





	1100 € = "Careers for Humans": For those who want to experience the world of Scath from its truly dark side, with no mystical powers to protect them, rules for playing ordinary mortals will be added, including the three human archetypes "Warrior", "Huntsman" and "Seeker of Knowledge". 


	1500 € = "The Valley of Tears", a sandbox – setting detailing on approximately thirty to forty pages an area that can be used to start a campaign, including three villages, a larger city and several Overlords and their plans and servants.


	3500 € = "Fully illustrated book": The Rulebook will have some illustrations, but to be able to deliver an even higher quality of detailed artworks we need more funding. If this stretchgoal is reached there will be additional "general" artwork scattered throughout the whole rulebook, but more importantly, we will be able to provide illustrations for nearly every single creature in the "Creatures and Warriors" section. 





	As I am writing this the Player's Handbook is about 90% done. The Gamemaster's Handbook is about 20% done.
	I will continue writing while this campaign is running on Indiegogo. By the end of June the Player's Handbook will be done.
	During July and the first two weeks of August I will be able to write most of the Gamemaster's Handbook. The rest of August will be spent tidying up the book and doing the layout.
	Approximately in the second or third week of September the PDF version of Scath: Shadow of the Fomori, will be done and distributed amongst all backers.
	October will be the month of printing and shipping. Depending on where in the world you live you will most likely receive your softcover or hardcover copy in mid or late October.

Risks

	There are not too many risks involved in this project. Most of the illustrations are done and writing is well underway. By the time you are reading this (June 2015) the book will be approximately halfway finished.If something happens to me the book might be delayed, but it will definitely be
	finished and shipped to your home by the end of 2015.
	Should this campaign not reach its goal of 1000 Euro that would mean further delay until I can find some additional resources on my own. Even in that case all backers will receive their copy of the book not later than Spring 2016.






Shipping details

			Shipping will be done by our partners at Drivethrurpg.com. Depending on the part of the world you come from and whether you want a softcover or the (heavier) hardcover version of the book the shipping price will go up and down.The average shipping prices for the following regions are:


			USA/Canada: Softcover 5 Euro, Hardcover 10 Euro
			Europe: Softcover 8 Euro, Hardcover 12 Euro
			Australia: Softcover 12 Euro, Hardcover 20 Euro
			Brazil: Softcover 25 Euro, Hardcover 30 Euro
Please add these prices to your pledge if you are bound to receive an actual book, no matter if softcover or hardcover!



Flexible funding and what it means

			"Flexible funding" means that you will get your copy of the book, even if the campaign itself does not reach 1000€. Should this happen, however, Indiegogo itself will be receiving a greater share of the money and I will also have to find additional funding myself, which will lead to a delay of several months. Even in this case every backer should have their book by spring 2016.



How does character creation work?

			Character creation is explained in greater detail on our website here.



A closer look at combat

			Battles are one of the main challenges the PCs will have to face in "Scath:Shadow of the Fomori". Combat is supposed to be fast – paced and dangerous, but at the same time allowing the players to use different strategies while battling opponents, and specializing their tactics when facing enemies they have already faced before. This is what we have been aspiring to create with the combat rules of Scath.
			The rules themselves are based on Action Points. Every character has a certain amount of Action Points per combat turn (two in the beginning, three or maybe even four at later levels), symbolizing his skill and decisiveness in a battle. He can use these points to do different kinds of combat actions. There are a dozen "Basic Actions" that every character, no matter how unused to battle, can attempt (download a Guide to Basic Combat Actions). In addition to that (and in addition to the different kinds of magic Chosen Ones can wield) there are about twenty "Advanced Actions", that only fighters experienced in one of the five "Combat Styles"  can attempt to perform. Thus low level characters will have the opportunity to get to know the basic combat rules and then mix it up with some more complicated, and potentially more devastating attacks/actions.With this kind of combat system we have tried to encourage players to try out different kinds of attacks (feint, stunning strikes, disarming attacks, attacks that sacrifice defensive capabilities to deal more damage and vice versa etc.) in combat, instead of simply using the same kind of attack every turn. This should also enable both GMs and players alike to attempt a more narrative style of combat without having to put in too much extra effort, because the combat actions a PC has taken by itself tells most of the story. 
		


Magic in the world of Scath

			Magic in the world of Scath is a powerful thing, allowing its wielders to shape the world to their will. At least eleven different kinds of magic, different "lores", if you so will, can be found in the Core Rulebook of Scath.
			The first eight of these lores of magic are the elemental powers, mystical abilities that were gifted to a Chosen One. Some of them are very different from each other, while others might be close regarding the effect the magic causes, if not its origin.
			In addition to that there will be three lores in the Gamemaster part of the Core Rulebook: the mysterious Lore of Stars, used by the nearly disappeared brotherhood of sorcerors and by the so – called "Pale Ones", the sinister, destructive Lore of the Fomori, used by the Overlords and their servants, and the Lore of Nature, primarily used by shamans, druids and some supernatural creatures. 
			The rules for magic are fairly simple. Every spell has a "Spirit Level". To cast it successfully, the Chosen One must at least reach that Spirit Level. He can use his "Spirit Dice" to do that. These are simple D6 that are rolled and added together. Chosen Ones can use up to five spirit dice, boosting their chances to reach a spells Spirit Level, but the more dice they roll the more danger they are in to deplete their own spiritual energy, or even lose control of the magic, with unfortunate effects on themselves and their surroundings.
			Thus players can influence the amount of power their characters want to put into a spell, carefully choosing between potential risk and potential reward.
		


Who I am

				I am Alex, a fantasy fan, general geek when it comes to all types of board games, computer games and roleplaying games, and martial arts enthusiast from Austria. I have about fifteen years of experience when it comes to RPGs and have spent the last ten of them creating detailed homebrew rule systems and worlds for my own gaming groups. This is my first project to be "properly" published. I have gamemastered a very successful campaign of "Scath: Shadow of the Fomori" for over three years and I am really excited about the chance to share my gaming experience with the rest if the world! 
				Feel free to contact me with any questions or suggestions you might have!



What is DriveThruRPG?

			DriveThruRPG is a website specializing on printing and shipping RPG books, with the ability to print books in both England and the US. This enables us to save us (and you!) a lot of shipping costs, because we do not have to send books across the Atlantic. 
			You can check out their website at www.drivethrurpg.com.

story:
It's an online first person RPG shooter, that is PLAYED in a REAL LIFE world by remotely controlling REAL VEHICLES, on a REAL life battlefield. An experience that was only possible in military research and in real live combat situations before this project. We have devoted hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars to create demo version of the unique and exciting miniature apocalyptic battleground world, located inside our «top secret» warehouse.

  'MURICA 2050: REMOTE is a revolutionary PC/MAC/MOBILE GAME where you remotely control miniature vehicles equipped with cameras and weapons on a REAL interactive maps.

  • Each map actually exists in real life inside a «top secret» location
  • Remotely control vehicles in first person view on our battlefield with your PC (Windows and Linux)/MAC/TABLET/IPHONE/ANDROID
  • Play either as a Comrade Commie or a Freedom Fighter with your friends, set up ambushes, destroy parts of the map, eliminate the opposing team YOUR WAY
  • Accumulate freedom fries, burgers, and buckets of oil as Freedom Fighters or borsh, vodka, and balalaika as Comrade Commies
[Due to political instability in the region, currencies are subject to change]


   Now historians, keepers of the past, can not give a definite answer to what happened then. This is what we know. The arms race between super power nations reached its peak. New weapons became more dreadful and horrifying than ever before. Large, powerful countries began to dictate their will to small nation-states; forcing them into military alliance or testing its latest weaponry achievements on their territory. Deadly fighting for territory and its resources reached a tipping point. Two major nuclear superpowers had pushed each other to the brink of assured mutual annihilation. The gnawing pressure and utter insanity slowly deteriorated the minds of the upper echelon of the military establishment and a preemptive nuclear strike was launched. This event caused a chain reaction. Nuclear lunches were spotted all over the world, there were no telling who is attacking whom.

   Humanity hid in underground shelters, bunkers and tunnels, while quiet nuclear winter descended on Earth for decades. In the middle of the twenty-first century, as the radioactive dust settled, first reconnaissance mission was send up top. Recovered samples have shown that it will be extremely difficult for humans to survive on the surface. Nuclear blasts altered composition of the atmosphere and planets orbit, so there would be only few habitable zones for people on the face of the Earth now...
  Warring tribes began their last stand fighting along century’s old ideological battles. Ruthless warlords quickly seized an opportunity to rebuild and reshape new society according to their dogmas.

  As a player of ‘MURICA 2050: REMOTE and a citizen of one of the habitable regions, you will have an opportunity to visit following buildings:

  • BANK - building where you can rent a safety deposit box to store your extra items and hard earned currency
  • RECYCLE CENTER - specialized facility that recycles all junk parts found by players. [Access by permit only]
  • FACTORY - main production building of the game. Manufactures  weapons and armor, equipment and special tools from resources using blueprints. [Also accepts found parts from players for small commission]
  • MECHANIC SHOP - building where you can purchase and mount new modifications on your vehicle

  • AUCTION HALL - trading grounds, where players can buy and sell different items
  • CITY HALL - main quest hub, where players can participate in salvage missions
  • ACADEMY - an institution that allows players to learn new profession and upgrade skills

  • LABORATORY - gain access to top secret patents and alien technology blueprints, also participate in exciting exploration missions
  • MILITARY HQ - building where you can get started on some of the combat missions
  • MERCENARY CAMP - recruit mercenaries into your crew
  Plant your banner and forge your empire in the world, by controlling everything in the region. From auction prices, bank interests rates and city hall taxes to mechanic modifications, recycling research and factory production. Command your army. Conquer neighboring regions and dominate in clan wars!!!

  Humanity left their refuge and came out of the bunker on the contaminated, but habitable land. In a situation where it was necessary to help each other, people once again engaged in the desperate war for resources and territory. All scrap metal has been utilized for the war efforts. Now, any piece of iron that is able to move becomes a "war machine".
Players are in control of an "armed" vehicle, equipped for search and rescue (PvE) or combat missions (PvP).

  Players, that are familiar with 3D modelling, will have an opportunity to customize "car body” of their vehicle to the last little detail. And also sell their models to others.

To prevent any miss understandings and ensure that both parties are satisfied, our team will act as a facilitator in every transaction.

  Weapons and ammunition of the world of 'MURICA are extremely diverse and plentiful. However, there are couple of main categories:

 All weapons require different types of ammunition. Most came before the war, others were invented after, using latest technology available. Now military funding and research is the only way to survive!!!

 At first, you will be required to complete military boot-camp campaign to familiarize yourself with game mechanics and unique combat settings. Then, you decide which direction your character will take. To survive players can learn and perfect their skills in four major professions. All of them packed with their own unique abilities, weapons and daily missions.


 Every map is a complicated maze with integrated hidden and reviled points of interest, for example: abandon warehouses for looting useful technology, supplies, weapons and ammunition; repair stations to restore some of that damaged armor; lookout towers that give you a broader view of the map; crossing bridges that you can destroy and trap your enemy; stationary defensive turret structures for extra armor and damage; land mines that can immobilize enemy vehicle; booby traps and other distractions that are perfect for setting up an ambush. Constructed by putting together combinations of 3D printed blocks.

Maps are grouped into three categories: Combat, Exploration, Championship.

Join the fight at random, or pick your teammates and play as one squad.

  • Gladiator match. Twenty players, last one to survive wins.
  • Team death match. Ten verses ten. Eliminate enemy team. 
  • Hunting game. Search and destroy enemy vehicles in set time.

  • Gathering objective. Factory work orders.
  • Farming quests. Delivery quests. Reach destination in set time. 
  • Race track missions with its own ranks and competitions.

  • Recreation of famous World War 2 tank battles. 
  • Alien invasion. Players group to destroy aliens which will be controlled by 'MURICA development team. 
  • Tournament. Champions mountain. Hundreds players, winner takes sizable cash prize.

Each category contains three different types of terrain: urban, mountains and rivers, radioactive woods.

 Combat conducted in urban areas such as towns and cities. Urban combat is very different from combat in the open at both operational and tactical level. The characteristics of an average city include tall buildings, narrow alleys, sewage tunnels and possibly a subway system. Defenders may have the advantage of detailed local knowledge of the area, moving from one part of the city to another undetected using underground tunnels, setting up ambushes and planting booby traps. Meanwhile, the attackers tend to become more exposed as they are unfamiliar with the defenders hidden routes and must use open streets more often. 

 Mountain warfare is one of the most dangerous types of combat as it involves surviving not only combat with the enemy but also the extreme weather and dangerous terrain. Mountain ranges are of strategic importance since they often act as a natural border between regions, and may also be the origin of valuable resources. Attacking a prepared enemy position in mountain terrain requires a greater ratio of attacking to defending forces. 

 Radioactive woods have a variety of effects on any operation. Dense contaminated vegetation can limit lines of sight and line of fire, but can also provide great opportunity for camouflage. Fire support is difficult to observe and adjust. Momentum and speed are difficult to build up, making it difficult to react to an enemy threat. Forest terrain, often without good roads and full of swamps can be inaccessible for basic vehicles. Also disruption of enemy movement make ambushes frequent and effective tactical operation in the wild.This terrain is perfect to gain new skills and experience.


 Our team consists of talented, innovative artists who live and breathe 'MURICA. Artists, composing beautiful music, visual and sound effects, enriching overall gaming experience. Artists who utilize latest 3D modeling and printing technology, hardware and software programers, bringing to life vision of 'MURICA 2050: REMOTE. Our goal is to bring forward completely new revolutionary game play type for our friends and supporters.

Serguei Pertsev: Founder and creator / Programer

  Serguei is the vision behind this project. Having fully committed to bring this idea to life, Serguei has worked tirelessly to assembly a team of professionals who share his passion for video games.

Serge Gamalyev: Project manager / Graphic design

 An indispensable asset of this team, Serge has helped develop benchmarks and execute an established action plan in regards to the overall project development and direction. Spending all his free time, outside of his daily management duties, he has proven once again as a reliable, dedicated and professional team member.

Anthony Yorsæjørn: Creative consultant / Resource management

  Anthony's endless support and creative inputs have helped establish the distinctive feel of 'MURICA. This freedom-loving, always grinning Ruski ensured the project's dangerously offensive humor stereotypes played an integral role in the development of this game. Anthony has also effectively helped to allocate limited resources during this strenuous, but gratifying venture.

Tim Klimov: Head of engineering team / Electronic expert

 Tim is a remote control car hobbyist and has built the mechanical parts for our vehicles. Everything from the motors, chassis, and transmissions. Tim has modified vehicles to obtain highest degrees of versatility and efficiency. Also was able to develop and implement laser targeting. 

Our project caught interest of many other software and animation developers, programers, electronics experts that are eager to aid us on this mission.

Risks and challenges

 One of our main strengths is also our weakness: perfectionism. We'll keep working on maps and and game play until they're perfect. This could mean delays in the expected release date for some missions or other features. We will post regular updates through out social media.

At the end of the day, we want this game to be fun for all of us. And we value your ideas as much, as we value your contribution.

Now we will be introducing a broadcast channel for championships.

All these features are coming from our supporters...

And what would you like to see in this game?

We are confident that by working together, this game will see the light of the day.

Thank you for reading and you support!!!
