story:
We're going oldschool: a » free demo on Steam for everyone. Here you'll get an Alpha Build of RUMP! with a small tutorial and some bigger maps for you to freely jump around and test our game.

We're also going to update the demo regularly, so that even after the final release people can actually test our game and don't have to buy it as blind as you have to with most games today. If you stumble upon weird things feel free to use the ingame bugreport feature within the game options. » Click here to download the free demo on Steam and have fun jumping and rumping!


Within only 6 days thousands of people pushed this game through » STEAM Greenlight - but what is it exactly? It's a crazy and challenging 3D jump and run game with a high focus on speedrunning, competition, sick moves and ultimate multiplayer-mayhem!

You think the good old Mario Kart was the challenge for you and your friends? Now RUMP! is going to be busting your mind. There are no classic green, red or blue shells - but several other gadgets, that will make your friends rage when you fire them off.

Compete with your steam friends, dare them to defy you and beat their best times! Be rewarded with different skins, characters and even some nice powerups. If you want to, you can climb the ladder and score the best times of the worldwide ranking!

The singleplayer offers over 50 different maps with some serious jumping, collecting and raging action! Get all Coins to proceed to the next level, be fast to make sure to beat your friends' highscores! Achieve the Bronze, Silver and Gold times to receive cool awards, skins and other stuff.

In the multiplayer modes you can challenge up to three of your friends in a fight to the death! Multiple modes are planned - but the most important thing, as usual, will be: first to arrive wins. Use your body and your gadgets to get rid of your foes and proceed to unbelievable greatness! Missiles, Boosters, Hooks and other grim utilities can be used to make your way to the top. Compete with other players all over the world!



  • Up to four people multiplayer mayhem to beat your friends via STEAM!
  • Online Matchmaking with Quickjoin options or premade Lobbys/Groups!
  • Sleek singleplayer with a high amount of different maps, gadgets, mechanics, competition and story!
  • High amount of various Skins, Accessories, Chars and Maps!
  • Awesome multiplayer gadgets like hooks, missiles and other fun stuff!
  • Cool new things at least twice a month! Weapons, Gadgets, Levels!
  • Global & local rankings with leaderboards and statistics!
  • Observer Mode for viewing and casting multiplayer runs!
  • eSport functionality for live competition!
  • Speedrun functionality for all time contest records!
  • Many humorous and funny elements, including dark ones!
  • Competition, rage and success!
  • Different supported plattforms! (tba, see Goals)
  • Unique Soundtrack and ambience!
  • Tons of uniquely designed levels! Created with love!
  • Lots of achievements and unlockables!
  • No arms and legs - but there's a cape!


Being individual means at lot to us - because customizing your character adds a lot of variance and fun to the game. To achieve this we're putting in a couple of characters right away, plus according skins and accessories.

So we're already into creating additional playable characters and skins for them - and you can add more! Check our stretch goals for the added chars. And also settings - let us tell you more about these!

You could call these sceneries, environments, surroundings and the like. We call them settings internally. And we're starting with the cities' rooftops of rumptown - but we have a lot of possible other settings ready in our ideas.

How about rumping in space? Or in a cave? Or in a jungle? Each new setting will come with a lot of new graphics and mechanics. A cave surely has different traps than cities' rooftops - and so will every new setting.

Each new setting added, by your contributions in our stretch goals and by ourselves after the release, contains at least 30 new maps to go along with the new scenery. This is where you can lure your friends into new awesome traps and score better times on each map than anyone else ever did!


We want to thank our backers by giving them some unique and rare perks. It is only $20 to get the game itself - but you can back us more. Each new tier comes with one or two new goodies for you. This goes up to a real 333 Gold Coin and a day off with our team at the "Heide Park" theme park here in Germany.

For an easier overview of which contribution tier gets you which perks, please take a look at our Perk Matrix here:

Check out some of our actual perks on the graphics below. Additionally we have some shipping information (for international shipment of physical perks) and more details on certain perks like the ingame character creation and the FounderCity image rules. Please see » this PDF file.



If you missed the link above: check out our » Perk Matrix to get an easy overview which contribution tier gets you which perks / goodies.


Like our name already says: We are dedicated to games in all its beauty. We play them, we talk about them, we make videos and now we are creating our own dream game.

We are a rather small team of 11 people in our company located in Hamburg, Germany, and there is no one who does not love games with their heart and soul. The big part of us have been working together for over the last 5 years. We know each other very well and that is one of the main reasons why we decided to create a standalone game.

We proudly show off a big and long experience in gaming entertainment. We've been host on several shows at the yearly GamesCom fair in Cologne, including lots of daily shows on the Blizzard booth (especially StarCraft II) - entertaining the huge crowd that was present on each GamesCom fair. Five years and still counting - we'll be there this year as well.

We've been broadcasting innumerable shows on our Live-Stream, we've been producing countless VODs on many, many different games. We also organized and hosted an indescribable Live-Event with more than 700 people at the location - plus the hundreds of thousands of people watching the live stream of that event.

It is our chance to be part of the games industry, working on our dreams and leaving a small footprint on "Planet Gaming". Entertaining our friends and fans pushes us every day for quite a long time now. Seeing people play games and having fun while doing so is a real pleasure to us. That's why we want to create a game of our own. But we have to stay realistic. And that is the reason to ask for your support.

With your contribution, no matter how big or small it is, you are showing us that you believe in us. You say to us that you would like to have fun and see this game come to life. We really appreciate that and every Dollar gives us the chance to do something good, keep our company running and create the game we love - for ourselves, and especially, for you!


No doubt you've noticed that the sum we're looking for on our initial target - and especially the stretch goals - looks quite high. Believe it or not, this is actually cheap for a 3D jump and run game at this scope - and the only reason it's this cheap is because we're already deep into the development of the base physics and mechanics of this game.

More than half of your support is being used for the salaries of our team - to keep working in our office and making progress every day. The second chunk of all your payments sadly is going off in taxes and fees. Since we're a registered corporation, we'll have to pay 19% VAT (Value Added Tax) on any of your contributions, since they count as a straight income. Plus some fees for Indiegogo, PayPal and currency conversion (eventuall we'll need those USD in EUR), we're close to 30% for these dues in total. With the remaining money we're paying the monthly fees on software licenses and the like, which are pretty much only required to create assets and things for the actual game development.

This is a flexible funding campaign, meaning that all your contributions are going right to our accounts and helping us in making this game even more awesome. As soon as the initial campaigns target is met, the fees on Indiegogo are being lowered – so we get even more time out of your support if we meet the first and main goal.


While we started creating "RUMP!" out of a quick idea we soon realised that this game has great potential to bring fun to the people. We came up with some really cool ideas, features and settings - but there was one thing we didn't have: Time!

As a small company, we people try to live from what we are doing. So we could either bring a very early version of RUMP! on the market and sell it on Steam as an "Early Access Game" - which would be clearly the wrong decision for our understanding and vision - or we could go the hard way and say: We need money - to buy us more time!

It ain't easy for us to go and ask you people for a funding for a game that ain't finished yet. But since the game is already in a playable state we could easily launch an early access program and sell the current state of the game.

But we don't want to do that. We want a really publishable state of RUMP! and so we need some more time to get things finished and polished.

We would like to invest more work into developing RUMP! and creating the environment, bring features and gameplay to perfection and making our job good. For this we need licenses for different kinds of software, funds for hardware and equipment, and even more menpower (like an animation specialist, which could speed up things a bit). We need to pay our bills for rent and our people working on the game.

We're all working hard to achieve the things we would like to - but at some point, after a 20 hour day, you need some money to live and get your head free. Having panics like "Where will I be next month" is a feeling we REALLY don't need and none of our teammates deserve. And here you come into play by contributing to this awesome game and our vision.


In case we're going over the top of our initial target, we do have a plan for the future development and more features in the game.

On a sidenote: we're also thinking about an ingame level editor, so everyone can create their own maps and circuits. This is not planned for the final release, but maybe at a later point. We're just pointing out that we do think about such things and we believe that community created maps would be really awesome to play!


We really do have a good starting position. One of our main fears was to not get Steam's Greenlight in a decent time. Some parts of our development rely on Steams "SteamWorks API" and we only would get access to it if we were able to get "the green light". But we were wrong: within only 6 days you, our fans and friends, pushed our game through greenlight! That was amazing and a very big step for us.

Aside of these we're really solid:


Can we get a shippable state of the game (and not pulling a DayZ)?

Yes, since we are actually playing it every day in our office while testing changes. The core game itself is pretty much complete - but not to the extent and range we are wishing it to be. More levels, more skins, more gadgets. Basic functions are implemented quickly - but it's the fine tuning that gets them to feel right and create the fun in the game. We need some more time to get this to where we're looking to go for.


Are your development basics safe and stable?

Yes, as we currently are not using (or depending on) any trial or unstable software. Our assets are being created in solid applications like Photoshop and 3ds Max - and for the game we're really happy with the Unreal Engine 4, as it fields awesome performance and usability. The EPIC team is pushing out updates and improvements regularly, but we can also launch specific parts in a previous engine versions.


Is there a platform to distribute our game?

Yes, since that honorable swarm of users already got us Greenlight on Steam. But we're looking beyond PC-gaming and Steam. We'd really like to release a port for any Unix / Linux Platform, a port for any Apple / Mac user and finally also a version for PlayStation and XBOX users.


Do we have the needed skillset to build our game?

Yes, since we are already building and updating it every day as of now. The game is already in a playable state - but we want it to be better. More humourous and sinuous animations of our characters are asking for an animation specialist. So this is more of a bonus. Our characters work and they are already hilarous - but when an animation specialist comes into play, that may become even more entertaining.


Will this game really be fun?

That is up to you! Play the public demo (tutorial + 1-2 levels, will be released soon), look at our videos or check out the screenshots! Fun is up to each individual - but since our setting, of playing a character with no arms and legs, is already quite humorous, we think that pretty much everyone will have lots of it. Especially once you got hooked by the multiplayer. Play it with your friends and you'll probably spend a decent amount of time jumping and rumping around.


We're currently planning to release the final version of RUMP! around October / November 2015.

We think we do have it all. But it's you to decide!


Are you a modern company and can relate yourself to gaming and games in general? Are you looking for creative advertising space? Then you should read up on our ingame Billboards!

Saying "Billboards" we do not only mean the big billboards themselves, but also ad spaces, decals, banners, flags and several other spots, where smaller variations of a big billboard or even just the according logo might be placed on a flag.

We want them to look like they've been fully made for this game and chime along with the environment. They shall not disturb or distract the players - but be fun to look at. Please ask for our samples and we'll also be happy to help you on finding the right style, if you'd like to participate but haven't been into ingame ads yet.

Please contact us for more information: » info@dedicationlabs.com - thanks!


Yes there are other and free ways to support our cause! Every additional beings voice (including dogs, so our office dog Loki ain't  alone!) is very valuable to us. So if you like to help us - with no money at all - try to use your contacts and tell them about our game. Your friends at work or in class, a post on your Facebook-Page, a tweet on your Twitter or whatever Social Media network you prefer.

Follow us on our channels (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube) to recieve regular updates and spread them as well. All the information will be posted below! Every bit of reach counts! Thank you for helping us reach out!


This is a question where myths are told and even the ancient greek were asking this question. Some say Rumper lost his arms and legs while sneezing. Some say them idiots are unable to animate limbs properly... and even other say: You know, because things and stuff. For reasons!

Maybe you will get to know more in the singleplayer campaign by reading the ancient Rump-Hieroglyphics that can be found here and there.
story_txt:
We're going oldschool: a » free demo on Steam for everyone. Here you'll get an Alpha Build of RUMP! with a small tutorial and some bigger maps for you to freely jump around and test our game.
We're also going to update the demo regularly, so that even after the final release people can actually test our game and don't have to buy it as blind as you have to with most games today. story:
You can now play the pre-alpha version of the game! Keep in mind that the game is currently in PRE-ALPHA. It is not representative of the final product! Daily updates here!

:http://www.indiedb.com/games/a-demons-game


You will explore a variety of areas, each one vast and full of its own secrets.Each enemy you encounter is unique in its traits and tendencies. You will be forced to be quick on your feet to outsmart and defeat the scourge separating you and your love.
"A Demon's Game" puts an emphasis on the importance of exploration in an atmospheric game. Players will be rewarded for taking time to venture off the beaten path, slowly uncovering the details of your wife's fate.


Sometimes in life, you have to commit yourself to saving the ones you love. You need to sacrifice yourself for the greater good, and triumph over all barriers between you and that goal. My name is Daniel. I used to live a normal life... I had a decent job, a beautiful wife... But everything has changed, and now I have to get her back. I'm ready to go to the deepest corners of hell if I have to, if it means I get to see her again.

The game's plot may seem to be simple and somewhat cliché, however we ensure you that there will be a level of depth beyond the generic indie horror game story. For fans of games with deep, well thought out stories, you will not be disappointed.


"A Demon's Game" is a very unique title, but keeps true to it's horror roots. Unlike the mass of amateur indie "horror" titles which have appeared recently, we want to move away from the trend of incessant jump scares and low production quality. "A Demon's Game" focuses on creating a terrifying atmosphere, rewarding exploration, and engrossing players in the rich lore of its world.


 Each demon you face in game behaves differently, having its own strengths and weaknesses to consider in fighting it. You will need to discover the intricacies of each in order to progress further through the story.

Soul Eater


Known for its unyielding appetite for human flesh, it will not hesistate to devour you in a heartbeat. Having to hunt without eyes, the Soul Eater relies on echolocation to hunt down its prey.


Lucifer



Everyone knows who he is, but no one knows what's he's truly capable of. Lucifer is said to be the most powerful Demon in Hell, this mixed with a sadistic nature for torture and suffering make him one of the most terrifying foes to ever stumble upon.


What will the money be used for?

Steam Greenlight-110$

3D models and animations- 250$

Custom soundtrack and sfx- 70$

Ultimate Unwrap 3D-60$

Be mindful that the minimum campaign goal for indiegogo is 500$.


Why Indiegogo?

Simple, I want to do more, and at the same time I want to prove that anyone can make a high-quality game if they have what it takes. I'm still in highschool, and I have taken no classes on how to make games or how to program in this engine. I'm appealing to you, the gaming community for help because my resources are limited and I want to make something more than a game, I want to make an experience. By contributing any amount to the production of the game, you are helping it to become something bigger, better, and more epic.

stories, you will not be disappointed.




"A Demon's Game" is a very unique title, but keeps true to it's 
horror roots. Unlike the mass of amateur indie "horror" titles which 
have appeared recently, we want to move away from the trend of incessant
 jump scares and low production quality. "A Demon's Game" focuses on 
creating a terrifying atmosphere, rewarding exploration, and engrossing 
players in the rich lore of its world.





Note: These are not the only demons in the game! These are just the one I feel should be revealed right now.


 Each demon you face in game behaves differently, having its own 
strengths and weaknesses to consider in fighting it. You will need to 
discover the intricacies of each in order to progress further through 
the story.
Soul Eater



Known for its unyielding appetite for human flesh, it will not 
hesistate to devour you in a heartbeat. Having to hunt without eyes, the
 Soul Eater relies on echolocation to hunt down its prey.

Lucifer




Everyone knows who he is, but no one knows what's he's truly capable of.
 Lucifer is said to be the most powerful Demon in Hell, this mixed with
 a sadistic nature for torture and suffering make him one of the most 
terrifying foes to ever stumble upon.

What will the money be used for?
Steam Greenlight-110$
3D models and animations- 250$
Custom soundtrack and sfx- 70$
Ultimate Unwrap 3D-60$
Be mindful that the minimum campaign goal for indiegogo is 500$.


Why Indiegogo?

Simple, I want to do more, and at the same time I want to prove that 
anyone can make a high-quality game if they have what it takes. I'm 
still in highschool, and I have taken no classes on how to make games or
 how to program in this engine. I'm appealing to you, the gaming 
community for help because my resources are limited and I want to make 
something more than a game, I want to make an experience. By 
contributing any amount to the production of the game, you are helping 
it to become something bigger, better, and more epic.

story:
"Lie, cheat, steal and backstab your way to victory, on your quest to becoming the next President of the Unites States!"

Mudslinger consists of 6 candidate cards, 112 Mudslinger cards, 50 state cards and rules cards. Also, this is shown with the accessories of money chits and dice (we couldn't fit it all in the box!).

What is Mudslinger?

Mudslinger is a highly competitive card-and-dice game where players will do whatever it take to become President.

Hilariously mean-spirited, Mudslinger is great fun for beginners and experienced players alike, but the more cut-throat one's strategy, the better the odds of winning. Prepare to wage war!


Mudslinger will bring out the best of the worst in people, as no deed is too low when it comes to running for President!

Almost every turn, players will be fighting for states, spending campaign dollars to influence elections or mudslinging opponents and playing action cards against others at the most inopportune times.

Not to mention, all players can negotiate with other players at any time. This is important when folks want to gang up on others or swing devious deals to set the advantage in their corner... and just like politicians, no player is bound to fulfill any promises they make. You're playing against real people though. Burn too many bridges, and it may be your last.

Unlike many other card and board games, any player can actively engage with others during anyone's turn. Whether it's to help someone, sling mud or negotiate with others at the table, there isn't any "waiting for someone to finish" to keep things moving. Mudslinger can be fast-paced and brutal at times. Abandon your generous nature at the door. This is politics. Things are going to get messy.


Here's a quick snapshot of the new card design. Sorry about the glare!


But Politics is Boring!

Believe us when we say you DO NOT have to like politics to love this game. Of course, if you are a political junkie, more power to you - it's definitely up your alley, but if you just love competitive games that require cunning wit, solid strategy and some downright evil actions dropped on opponents every now and then, this is a must-have game for the collection.



History

Mudslinger was actually developed over a decade ago! What began as a pet project snowballed into something much bigger when we realized we actually developed a very fun game. Check out our story at mudslingerthegame.com for more info, but in a nutshell we sold a couple hundred copies, almost got picked up by a publisher and even won a cute little award, before ending the party.

At the insistence of new and old friends alike, we decided to update the game a bit and let others experience Mudslinger again, too. We hastily threw together a Kickstarter, with ambitions of fancy packaging and much larger goals.

Though the Kickstarter flopped, we did discover new ways we could bring Mudslinger to market without it costing us a fortune. (Thanks for all the tips, kind internet strangers!)

So here it is... the awesome news is Mudslinger is finished and ready to ship! We reworked all the art, redesigned the cards (updated some of them for more current events) and went forward with a test run. Following that, we tweaked a few things and now have over 200 copies in hand and can pull the trigger for more if needed.

Whether we sell only one copy or thousands, if you support this campaign, you'll get the product in your hands.

With the crazy political season just heating up, there's no better time to hop and board and have some fun mudslinging your friends into the ground!

Share this IndieGoGo and get the word out! Thank you so much for your support!


UPDATES

Mudslinger has been updated to "fit" on even the smallest of tables now, printed on high quality, durable glossy cards with rounded edges. These are "mini cards," about 60% of the size of a traditional card. We've added a political spectrum guide to all the group cards, making card placement a snap, even for beginners.

Most importantly, brand new art has been provided by the incomparable Matt Feazell, creator of Cynical-Man and a host of other awesome titles. Matt Feazell has been syndicated, worked for a Disney magazine and made a career of producing some of the sharpest and most hilarious titles in the mini-comics universe.  The man brings stick art to life.


A Word of Warning

This game is recommended for adults, as play can get very nasty (we really do mean that). Mudslinger allows players to openly backstab others, lie straight to their faces, and genuinely do some mean, hurtful things. It's hilarious, but grown-up hilarious.

On the surface, Mudslinger may seem a bit complex, but it is actually quite easy to learn, with each turn consisting of three very quick phases, and then passing to the next player. After a few rounds you'll have it down and will quickly begin developing strategies. After one game, you'll likely be developing long-term strategies for future games. The best players know when to be aggressive, defensive and cunning - and it's those people who win the most games.

story:
WE ARE INVITING BRAVE YOUNG GAME CHANGERS TO PARTICIPATE IN OUR INAUGURAL GAME CHANGER MOVEMENT RETREAT

When you join the Game Changer Movement as a member with a contribution of at least $10; you will be building a community of conscious parents who are courageously Changing OUR Game together!  We are creating collaborative processes that allow parents and youth to come together to create the next wave of meaningful and exciting gaming.  We are creating a platform that Realifies the Game World and Gamifies the Real World!  We look forward to building this community together!

For every $10 you contribute, we promise to inspire one child to trade in at least one violent video game that we will transform into art, furniture, signs and maybe even dresses!


Our Kids Won't Care How Much we Know, Until They Know How Much We Care!

What is the Game Changer Movement you ask, and how is this all going to work?

  1. We will inspire 1,000,000 youth to trade in at least one violent video game.
  2. We have launched a Virtual Living Room with the Game Changer Movement where at least once a week, we initiate a conversation with fellow Game Changers, parents and youth.  This is currently hosted in Google Hangouts.  We are aiming towards Mondays at 3:30 p.m. EST as the definite weekly time.  We will have a topic for the week and people can feel free to post and add to the discussion on the Game Changer Movement page on Facebook at www.facebook.com/gamechangersexperience. 
  3. We will deploy robots 

    whose sole mission is to collect violent video games all across the country at schools, YMCAs, movie theatres, sports arenas, and other venues where children are likely to frequent.  We are also engaging in conversations with potential strategic partners who might be willing to contribute their “excess capacity” to help us gather the games nationwide.  It will cost approximately $2500 for us to deploy a robot to a community near you!  If you are interested in this opportunity, please reach out and let us know by posting a comment and selecting the $2500 perk on the side!  It would be great to create a custom sponsorship experience for your family, business, school or organization.
  4. Each youth who trades in a violent video game will receive gifts from our supporters and sponsors and they will be given VIP access to the “Game Changer Game Platform”  We are developing a mission suitable for the courageous youth who are willing to change their game!  This platform will Gamify the Real World and Realify the Game or Virtual World.  This will be a values driven platform and we are going to co-create it with the stakeholders including the first youth who courageously trade in a game.  This is going to be a work in progress as the Game Changer Movement unfolds.                                                            
  5. The first 100 youth who courageously trade in at least one violent video game, will be invited into a special creation session, so they can have direct input in the game platform we create for them.
  6. Once 1 million youth are pre-registered by trading in a violent video game, we will announce details about the surprise we have for in store for them.  The Game Changer Game Platform is in early stage development.  This will be a values driven Platform there will be a cap on both hours per day and hours per week that the game can be played in the virtual world.  There will be no cap on the hours in the carbon based world!  We also know that the Platform will only permit pro-social games to be played within the system.
  7. We are asking parents to record and post themselves taking, what we call, the Game Changer Pledge.  This is a promise to spend at least 2 more hours each week with their children.  We have created a starter list of 20 recommendations for how parents might spend that time.  We would love for people to post stories about how they “Spent their 2 Hours” on the Game Changer Movement Facebook page (www.facebook.com/gamechangersexperience)                              
  8. We are going to develop a strategic vision for the rePURPOSEing of the 1,000,000 games that are turned in.  We will exhibit or sell the pieces that we are calling Conversation PEACES.  We will be creating the Conversation PEACES as part of a nationwide tour, where we invite parents and youth into our mobile living room so that we might create art and have conversations about how to bring the unit back to the family and transform the connection that is possible.
  9. We will collaborate with schools, community centers, athletic and entertainment venues as we curate events across the country.  We are setting out with more questions than answers, and we will share what we learn along the way as we transform violence into art.                                                                           

  10. We are going to help our emotional landscape by rePURPOSEing violent content and media into art, and we will help our physical landscape as we eventually redirect the CDs and DVDs from the landfills of our nations to the walls and living rooms of our houses and boardrooms.  We are going to lift up youth facing homelessness as we create the Conversation PEACEs in youth shelters along the way.  We hope to create a business model that will allow youth facing homelessness to franchise the Game Changer Movement brand as we take social entrepreneurship to the next level!

What is this summer looking like for you and your family?

Were you looking forward to a connection with your kids as the last day of school came and went?

Were the hours spent at school replaced by hours spent playing video games?

Do you find yourself rolling your eyes and saying things like, "When I was your age, I went outside right after breakfast and I didn't come back in, until dinner time...."

Are you concerned about the content that many of the games contain?

Do you know what games are being played when your kids visit their friends?

Do you know who the voices are in the headphones when kids play live games?


What is the history of the Game Changer Movement?

On November 15th, 2013 the Game Changer Movement was born!  We are here to rePURPOSE our HEARTdrives with each other.  About 2 months after the shootings at Sandy Hook Elementary School, Erik Lehmann, father of three, had a powerful vision.  He wanted to let kids know just how much they matter right now!  Upon looking around, he saw that our youth are often told all the ways that they don’t matter.  They can’t work until age 14, drive until age 16, can’t vote until 18, and can’t drink alcohol until age 21.  Much of a child’s school day is spent passively consuming the information and taking the tests that adults believe they should take!  The Game Changer Movement is here to encourage children to know that they have a choice to be significant right now!  Tony Robbins, a human behavior expert, considers significance; one of the six main drivers of human behavior.  This is true at any age!

What does it mean to rePURPOSE our HEARTdrives?

We are inspiring 1,000,000 youth to trade in at least one violent video game.  We have developed a low tech robot whose sole mission is to collect the violent video games in a community near you.  We are going to transform and rePURPOSE the games that are collected from the robots into art, furniture, signs, and other transformational expressions.  We will decommission the violent content and create a new PURPOSE for the CDs, DVDs, and their cases.

We will travel the country,curating events and programs with youth and their caregivers.  We are designing a mobile living room that will be launched so that we can have real conversations about how to bring the unit back to the family.  The family looks very different now than it has looked in the past, and with this new look; comes new challenges and opportunities! We will create what we call Conversation PEACES as we talk WITH each other and create art, signs or rePURPOSE furniture in each community on the national tour.  We are going to share perspectives with families all across the country and eventually the world.  Our collective HEARTdrive will be rePURPOSEd from a fear and scarcity based world to a love and abundance based world.

Why are we focusing on violent video games in this phase of the Game Changer Movement?

There is data indicating that both boys and girls will play at least 10,000 hours of video games before they become 21 year old men and women.  Currently 90% of the popular video games contain violence at varying degrees…even games rated E10+.  This is the challenge and opportunity!  Malcolm Gladwell wrote about the magic of spending 10,000 hours in pursuit of mastery in his book, Outliers.  If someone invested 10,000 hours into something, they would likely come out a master at it!  With 90% of the games our kids play containing violence, our kids are becoming masters at hurting and killing instead of learning, growing, and loving.  We, as parents, have an opportunity and perhaps even a responsibility to help guide our kids towards applying more of those hours towards the common good.  It is time for us all to change our game, together!

Gaming is not going away any time soon.  In fact, gaming is actually becoming a major educational modality, because of the active learning and sense of significance that is embedded in the game or the mission.  There are many ways to create a sense of significance, and violence is one of the easiest in a way.  In a first person shooter game, the first person becomes immediately significant when they have a gun in their hand and they control whether or not someone else lives or dies.  Combine the sense of significance that violence creates with true to life graphics, and we are reinforcing a sense of significance that has no real-life corollary.  This might be ok, if, after our kids played the games, we sat down with them and had a conversation with them.  The challenge with this is, we think we are too busy already, so we don’t take the time to connect with our kids and have the crucial conversations necessary to let our kids know how significant they truly are already.  We, as parents know that the best way to reach our kids is to actually meet them where they are, and see them eye to eye, on their level!  

This may mean that we actually play video games with our kids and perhaps we can meet them in a virtual world that has room for all members of the family, instead of having us roll our eyes as the chasm between parents and their children widens by the hour.

Tony Robbins speaks about 6 key drivers of human behavior and they are: Certainty, Variety, Significance, Connection, Growth, and Contribution.  When we look at the virtual video gaming world it is very interesting that the gaming world might be getting progressively better at offering these drivers as compared to our real lives.  In her book, Reality is Broken, by Jane McGonigal, she points out that the gaming world allows gamers to achieve a sense of accomplishment, community, significance, and maybe even contribution! 

Is it possible to redirect the 10,000 hours of gaming time towards solving real world challenges?  Can we create challenges that inspire 1,000,000 youth to trade in violent video games in the first place?  What will inspire today’s youth to change their game?

In her book “Peers Inc”, Robin Chase discusses the concept of excess capacity as an exponential opportunity in the world of business and social change.  Imagine what the world will look like when kids and adults alike apply the excess capacity of their entertainment hours and gaming hours?  What if the first million youth who traded in a violent video game were given a challenge to solve in the game or virtual world that had immediate real world application?  How significant would those kids feel?  How happy would their parents be?  What if there were a gaming platform that parents wanted their kids to play, because it taught them all the things they needed to learn in an environment that reached them where they were already looking?  Would there be as much ADD and ADHD?  What would an educational system  look like if it were augmented in a symbiotic relationship with gaming platforms that complemented and reinforced the subjects that were discussed during the school day? 

I am inspired about redirecting a good portion of the 10,000 hours that youth spend playing video games towards games that matter in the real world!  In 2007, I read the book “The Power of Focus” by Jack Canfield, Mark Victor Hansen, and Les Hewitt.  In that book there was a recommendation to take an hour a day from unproductive time and invest it into a new pursuit.  When I read this, I decided to take an hour from TV and start running for at least an hour a day.  By July of 2008, I crossed the finish line of a 15K, or 9.3 mile road race called the Boiler Maker Race in Utica, NY.  By November 2010, I crossed the finish line of the New York City Marathon, and I have run the Honolulu Marathon twice since then.  I share this because I learned what becomes possible when time is redirected from something unproductive and invested in something growth oriented.  All this happened by redirecting just one hour a day.  What would the world look like if 1,000,000 youth redirected their gaming hours from non-productive and violent gaming and reinvested them into pro-social games that addressed real-life community or societal challenges? 

Elan Musk, who co-founded Paypal, founded Space X and Tesla, was in a conversation with Sal Khan, founder of the Khan Academy about education and Elan recommended that he gamify education as much as possible.  This is a great opportunity for collaboration with schools, organizations, municipalities, and corporations.  One way to create a sense of significance is to search out real world challenges that can be brought into the classroom environment.  Gamifying also provides for an opportunity to learn how to fail gracefully and hopefully faster.  Failure is what Elan Musk was willing to do three times while developing Space X and his first three launches failed before the forth succeeded and then Space X was granted an almost $2 Billion contract. Failure comprises 70% of the gaming world, and many successful entrepreneurs attribute their largest successes to learning how to get up after failure.  On the flip side of failure, games allow for learning towards mastery with failure as a necessary part of the process.

To make the story way more personal, I feel compelled to share about some memories from the time I spent about 50 days living in a homeless shelter for youth as a high school senior.  I was really lucky because the shelter was located in the same school district where I was enrolled, so I did not miss any school on account of my temporary homelessness.  That said, all the other youth at the shelter were not as fortunate.  The shelter offered tutoring to the other youth; however, the tutors were not very consistent and then the video games that were available were very violent in nature, and there were no conversations about making such choices of how to spend our time.  I have visited youth shelters over the past few years and the video game options in shelters are getting progressively more violent.  Imagine if there was an alternative available to these kids!  These kids are some of the most resourceful people I have ever known in my entire life!  I am so looking forward to helping these youth to redirect their time allocation choices.  These kids, who have been invisible, to so many, may, in fact make a huge contribution to this planet.  I believe in these kids, because I was one of them!

video games in a community near you.  We
are going to transform and rePURPOSE the games that are collected from the
robots into art, furniture, signs, and other transformational expressions.  We will decommission the violent content and
create a new PURPOSE for the CDs, DVDs, and their cases.

We will travel the country,curating events and programs with
youth and their caregivers.  We are
designing a mobile living room that will be launched so that we can have real
conversations about how to bring the
unit back to the family.  The family
looks very different now than it has looked in the past, and with this new
look; comes new challenges and opportunities! We will create what we call Conversation PEACES as we talk WITH each other and create art, signs or
rePURPOSE furniture in each community on the national tour.  We are going to share perspectives with
families all across the country and eventually the world.  Our collective HEARTdrive will be rePURPOSEd
from a fear and scarcity based world to a love and abundance based world.

Why are we focusing on violent video games in
this phase of the Game Changer Movement?
There is data indicating that both boys and
girls will play at least 10,000 hours of video games before they become 21 year
old men and women.  Currently 90% of the
popular video games contain violence at varying degrees…even games rated E10+.  This is the challenge and opportunity!  Malcolm Gladwell wrote about the magic of
spending 10,000 hours in pursuit of mastery in his book, Outliers.  If someone invested 10,000 hours into
something, they would likely come out a master at it!  With 90% of the games our kids play
containing violence, our kids are becoming masters at hurting and killing
instead of learning, growing, and loving. 
We, as parents, have an opportunity and perhaps even a responsibility to
help guide our kids towards applying more of those hours towards the common
good.  It is time for us all to change
our game, together! 
Gaming is not going away any time
soon.  In fact, gaming is actually
becoming a major educational modality, because of the active learning and sense
of significance that is embedded in
the game or the mission.  There are many
ways to create a sense of significance, and violence is one of the easiest in a
way.  In a first person shooter game, the
first person becomes immediately significant when they have a gun in their hand
and they control whether or not someone else lives or dies.  Combine the sense of significance that
violence creates with true to life graphics, and we are reinforcing a sense of
significance that has no real-life corollary. 
This might be ok, if, after our kids played the games, we sat down with
them and had a conversation with them. 
The challenge with this is, we think we are too busy already, so we
don’t take the time to connect with our kids and have the crucial conversations
necessary to let our kids know how significant they truly are already.  We, as parents know that the best way to
reach our kids is to actually meet them where they are, and see them eye to
eye, on their level!  This may mean that
we actually play video games with our kids and perhaps we can meet them in a
virtual world that has room for all members of the family, instead of having us
roll our eyes as the chasm between parents and their children widens by the
hour.

Tony Robbins speaks about 6 key drivers of
human behavior and they are: Certainty, Variety, Significance, Connection,
Growth, and Contribution.  When we look
at the virtual video gaming world it is very interesting that the gaming world
might be getting progressively better at offering these drivers as compared to
our real lives.  In her book, Reality is
Broken, by Jane McGonigal, she points out that the gaming world allows gamers
to achieve a sense of accomplishment, community, significance, and maybe even
contribution!  
Is
it possible to redirect the 10,000 hours of gaming time towards solving real
world challenges?  Can we create
challenges that inspire 1,000,000 youth to trade in violent video games in the
first place?  What will inspire today’s
youth to change their game?
In her book “Peers Inc”, Robin Chase
discusses the concept of excess capacity as an exponential opportunity in the
world of business and social change. 
Imagine what the world will look like when kids and adults alike apply
the excess capacity of their entertainment hours and gaming hours?  What if the first million youth who traded in
a violent video game were given a challenge to solve in the game or virtual
world that had immediate real world application?  How significant would those kids feel?  How happy would their parents be?  What if there were a gaming platform that
parents wanted their kids to play, because it taught them all the things they
needed to learn in an environment that reached them where they were already
looking?  Would there be as much ADD and
ADHD?  What would an educational
system  look like if it were augmented in
a symbiotic relationship with gaming platforms that complemented and reinforced
the subjects that were discussed during the school day?  
I am inspired about redirecting a good
portion of the 10,000 hours that youth spend playing video games towards games
that matter in the real world!  In 2007,
I read the book “The Power of Focus” by Jack Canfield, Mark Victor Hansen, and
Les Hewitt.  In that book there was a
recommendation to take an hour a day from unproductive time and invest it into
a new pursuit.  When I read this, I
decided to take an hour from TV and start running for at least an hour a day.  By July of 2008, I crossed the finish line of
a 15K, or 9.3 mile road race called the Boiler Maker Race in Utica, NY.  By November 2010, I crossed the finish line
of the New York City Marathon, and I have run the Honolulu Marathon twice since
then.  I share this because I learned
what becomes possible when time is redirected from something unproductive and
invested in something growth oriented. 
All this happened by redirecting just one hour a day.  What would the world look like if 1,000,000
youth redirected their gaming hours from non-productive and violent gaming and
reinvested them into pro-social games that addressed real-life community or
societal challenges?  
Elan Musk, who co-founded Paypal, founded
Space X and Tesla, was in a conversation with Sal Khan, founder of the Khan
Academy about education and Elan recommended that he gamify education as much
as possible.  This is a great opportunity
for collaboration with schools, organizations, municipalities, and
corporations.  One way to create a sense
of significance is to search out real world challenges that can be brought into
the classroom environment.  Gamifying
also provides for an opportunity to learn how to fail gracefully and hopefully
faster.  Failure is what Elan Musk was
willing to do three times while developing Space X and his first three launches
failed before the forth succeeded and then Space X was granted an almost $2
Billion contract. Failure comprises 70% of the gaming world, and many
successful entrepreneurs attribute their largest successes to learning how to
get up after failure.  On the flip side
of failure, games allow for learning towards mastery with failure as a
necessary part of the process.
To make the story way more personal, I feel
compelled to share about some memories from the time I spent about 50 days
living in a homeless shelter for youth as a high school senior.  I was really lucky because the shelter was
located in the same school district where I was enrolled, so I did not miss any
school on account of my temporary homelessness. 
That said, all the other youth at the shelter were not as
fortunate.  The shelter offered tutoring
to the other youth; however, the tutors were not very consistent and then the
video games that were available were very violent in nature, and there were no
conversations about making such choices of how to spend our time.  I have visited youth shelters over the past
few years and the video game options in shelters are getting progressively more
violent.  Imagine if there was an
alternative available to these kids! 
These kids are some of the most resourceful people I have ever known in
my entire life!  I am so looking forward
to helping these youth to redirect their time allocation choices.  These kids, who have been invisible, to so
many, may, in fact make a huge contribution to this planet.  I believe in these kids, because I was one of
them!

story:
UPDATE (2016-03-11): You can now find Holodance on Steam - it's going into Early Access on April 5th. If you have preordered an HTC Vive, you might want to get it :-)

narayana games is a Virtual Reality game development studio founded in 2011 by Jashan Chittesh, author of "Das Unity-Buch" (the #1 selling German book on Amazon in category Games Programming). Holodance is not just one but many dreams coming true and you can help us get there in due time:

Building a collaborative multiplayer Virtual Reality gaming experience that makes you dance in joy! Enter a new dimension of reality and tune into the rhythms of the virtual to bring back the harmony to the real! All music is composed and produced specifically for this VR experience using binaural audio and the levels are designed to perfectly match the sound to give you:

A spatial, rhythmic, audio-visual experience of pure ecstatic joy!


Think of Holodance as a music video that you can enter and play with. But it's not just a 2D video - it's an actual reality that touches hearing and seeing and hopefully your heart!

Holodance is designed for these official target platforms:

  1. SteamVR / HTC Vive (to be released still in 2015)
  2. Oculus Rift with Touch Controllers (to be released first half of 2016)
  3. Sony Project Morpheus with Motion Move Controllers (to be released 2016)

We target a 90+ framerate when using the Oculus minimum hardware requirements (GeForce 970 or faster, i5 or faster). At the moment, unfortunately, Virtual Reality is only fully supported on Windows. But as soon as SteamVR becomes available for Mac and Linux (which is already announced), we will also support those two operating systems.


What We Need & What You Get

What We Need

Development of Holodance has already started and come a long ways, so we only need $15,000 more to complete the first version of the game to release it together with the release of the HTC Vive at the end of this year. We have one developer (Jashan Chittesh) working full-time on the project already:

  • $6,000 for three more months of development
  • $3,000 for three more months of renting the office space
  • $2,000 for additional hardware
  • $1,500 for IndieGoGo and processing fees
  • $1,500 for taxes

There are a few stretch goals we're considering, like: porting Holodance to AR (target platforms: Hololens and Magic Leap), building an in-game editor and community-features so you can use your own MP3s, built-in support for sharing your sessions, and if you want us to really go wild, we might even port Holodance to mobile with a tap-based interface.

Let us know which ones you are interested in via the comments!

Any of these will only be started once the initial game is complete and released. More details will be announced in due time.

We may also add additional target platforms like OSVR, FOVE (with eye-tracking), Leap Motion (use your plain hands), STEM Controllers (kick dem notes wit your feet), motion capturing suits like PrioVR and Perception Neuron for full body-immersion and whatever else actually works and is requested by ... you! ;-)


What You Get

You can contribute in various tiers according to your desired level of commitment:

  1. Supporter: You just want to support this project by giving as little or much as you like without asking for much in return. As a Callout Supporter, you are mentioned with a tweet, optionally with a link to your Website.
  2. Gamer: You get the game, either on release or a month earlier. No risks involved, no questions asked.
  3. Beta-Player: You get the betas - immediately or after the early beta people already tested them for two weeks. Early beta access includes a private forum to discuss issues (this forum is public for viewing but only people with early beta access are allowed to post). There's also an Unlimited Version that will later include any upcoming addons (those are music packages created by narayana games or third parties after the game was released).
  4. Sponsors: You pay more and get the credits ... and unlimited beta-access, of course. As a sponsor, you'll also be able to show off your level of sponsorship in the game and you'll be mentioned on Twitter, like a Callout Supporter but with your level of sponsorship included in the Tweet. We appreciate every level of participation - but we really need you Sponsors, Silver Sponsors and Gold Sponsors. Thank you!
  5. Collaborator: This one is really special and only available three times: We have reserved three spots for people who want to work with me one-on-one to build three unique levels as part of the standard game. Each Collaborator can have a say on one level: You decide the name and theme of the level and we'll provide music and art as needed (if you want to provide your own - that's also fine, of course). Those three levels will always be included in the game, in addition to the 12 main levels but as extra levels that don't have to be unlocked and are always available to everyone. So if we find three collaborators, we will have 15 levels altogether. This is your opportunity to not only help make this happen but also shape how it happens! There's one limitation to keep in mind: Your level will have to fit the "sustainable" theme of the game (see below), so if you are considering having me add a Zombie-level where you blow things up: No, sorry, won't happen!
  6. Addon Creator: If you want to build addon packages with your own music (that you own all rights to) and level design yourself, contact us directly. That will be handled through a profit sharing model. This is not something that you can buy into, you have to qualify for it - but it might very well end up being something paying you well.
  7. Awesome people spreading the message: No matter on which level you contribute: Please spread the word and let other people know about Holodance!

The more people start holodancing,
the more friends you'll have to play with!


The Impact: Sustainable Games for VR/AR

narayana games is all about sustainable games. What does that mean? We believe games are an incredibly powerful means of communication: When you build a game, you say something, and you say it loud. So the question is: Are we, as game developers, aware of what we're actually saying? And are we saying something that the world really needs? Or are we pushing out a message against flourishing life? Are we part of the problem by encouraging competition - or are we part of solution by inspiring creativity and respect for life?

Holodance is a perfect example of a sustainable game: It's all about creativity, music and dancing, collaborating and joy: When you enter a multiplayer session in Holodance, it's not you against the other(s) - it's about mastering the level together and sharing a good time. You can do it alone, on your own, that's fine - but it will naturally take longer. Just like in real life. And playing this game should even be something that your body likes because you've got to move! We believe VR should not be a couch-potatoe experience but a dynamic, joyful experience that involves as many senses as possible.

narayana games has already worked on several other sustainable games:

  • Traces of Illumination, while based on Snake / Lightcycles turned the us against them mechanics of boxing the enemy to make them crash into being considerate to not have players of your own team or other teams into the walls. While this game still starts kind of competitive, the last level can only be completed when all players of all teams work together. Development on Traces of Illumination is currently on hold and will be resumed after we've released a few smaller titles like Holodance ;-)
  • Resurrect is a short combat / magic / VR demo initially built as a demo project for ScoreFlash (a Unity Addon we're selling on the Asset Store), which allows you to either heal or destroy two skeletons and later a golem. It's up to you to decide - but your decision has consequences that you'll have to live with ... until you try again. The idea is to take the fun that strategic combat can be and put it into a context of non-harming.
  • Save the Bots is a free demo project for ScoreFlash available on the Unity Asset Store that took the Angry Bots demo provided by Unity Technologies and turned the mechanics from "kill the robots" to "save the robots" - with a funny ending when you succeeded.


Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk we're facing right now is when we'll be getting the HTC Vive and Sony Project Morpheus development kits. Until we get this hardware, a setup of Oculus DK2 + Razor Hydra + (optional) Microsoft Kinect One is used, which comes with limitations for an experience designed for room-scale VR (but don't worry - Holodance can scale down to a "standing experience" if you don't have more space available ... you could even play it sitting, if you have a good reason to do so).

We have already tested the current version with an HTC Vive Development kit and confirmed that it works (and quite well, in fact) - and will keep sending builds to friends with those HTC Vive DevKits until we have our own to assure things don't break. Here's an actual gameplay video that was recorded using the HTC Vive development kit:


Eventually, the HTC Vive will be available to consumers and if all else fails, we'll do the final testing of the completed game on a consumer version. Hopefully we will get the DevKit still during this summer - and the more people are excited and supportive of Holodance, the more likely Valve / HTC will join into that excitement and send us a kit. We don't know how exactly they select the developers that receive the DevKits but one thing that might help, and that you can help with, is by Greenlighting Holodance (direct link into Steam).

With Sony Project Morpheus, it all depends on Sony: narayana games is currently in the queue to become a PS4 partner and once that's through we'll order the development kits - and then it's up to Sony decide whether we will get one. But we're positive that they will like Holodance as much as we do and then it's in their best interest to get their development kits into our office. Porting itself is fairly easy, just like with the Oculus Rift with Touch Controllers (we already have an abstraction layer in place for these kinds of things which works very well).

Another challenge is networked multiplayer in a fast-paced music game. The problem is that it might look very weird when there's even a little delay due to network latency. Most likely this won't really be a problem because players are too busy handling their own notes so they won't have much time to check if the other players are perfectly in sync. However, if this does become an actual problem, we have a few ideas for solutions. This is something we will put a lot of attention on once we deliver the first betas.


Other Ways You Can Help

Once again: Even if you can't contribute with money right now, you can still help this get funded by spreading the message. Keep in mind: This is not just about having yet another music game built, it's about establishing sustainable games for VR: We want Virtual Reality to be as much as possible a positive medium that is healthy for the body and fun for the generations to come.

Indiegogo also provides share tools to make spreading the word easy - but sometimes a personal invitation email can have much more impact. And keep in mind: If the flap of a butterfly could cause a storm on the other side of the world, your word could change the world!

Earlier gameplay video


Pledge now!!!

story:
COLOR: Strategy Board Game is the result of passion about gaming. This campaign will bring the game to basic production.

Your contribution is extremely important in helping the COLOR to come to life. By contributing to this campaign you will also get a copy of the game at special price, available only through this campaign.






COLOR: Strategy Board Game is a turn-by-turn multi-player game where players are colonizing territories, collecting resources, building connections and mines, discovering hidden lands and passing through positive or negative events.

It can be played by two, up to four players aged ten years and up. The playing time is around 30 to 60 minutes. The game can be easily played even at the very first time without being an experienced player.


GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW


RULES OVERVIEW

Complete rulebook will be available soon.


GAMEPLAY

There are several types of resources with different rarity and value. These are used for building, upgrading and various actions. 


Resources can be gathered from lands. There are also unknown lands that can be discovered.


At the beginning the entire world is hidden and players must pick a land to build the first base.

The first base discovers the bordering lands and is gathering resources from the surroundings. 


For additional income, you can build connections from base, and then build mines.


You can scout the hidden lands and find new resources. 


Multiple players can have buildings on the same land. You may build on specific slots to avoid opponent’s intrusion. Each land has a limited number of slots that can be used, and once it is full, nothing else can be built on that land.


Sometimes you may not have all the necessary resources for a building or action, but you can trade with the bank at a higher rate or trade with other players.


Events are positive or negative. These may randomly occur at every turn.


To win the game, you must collect a certain number of victory points. These are achieved by building and expanding own territory...  









TURN-BY-TURN

At each turn one player is throwing two dice with colored faces. First die represent the event called for the current turn – it can be none, often or rare event. 

The events can be positive or negative and can affect one or multiple players. 

The second die represents the resource generated at current turn. Current player is gathering resources in dependence of buildings owned on specific lands.

The second part of the turn is building, trading or taking an action (like SCOUTING a hidden land).  

At the end of the turn, the current player must make sure to not have more resources in hand than the supply capacity. To do so, the player can spend the resources, trade or discard.




INSIDE THE BOX

4 land boards (250 x 260 mm)

32 resource tokens (30 mm)

12 info cards (67 x 100 mm)

2mm high density mounted
cardboard

64 resource cards (44.5 x 60.3 mm)

32 event cards (44.5 x 60.3 mm)

300gsm greycore paper

40 buildings (25 x 25 x 25 mm)

32 connections (15 x 50 x 15 mm)

2 color d6 dice (16 mm)

Plastic

1 rulebook (148 x 210 mm)

4 summary sheets (148 x 210 mm)

128gsm gloss paper

GOAL:  $20K

  • Design
  • Prototype production
  • Testing
  • Basic production

The game already passed through first steps of development and the next step is to start the basic production. With your help contributing to this campaign, the game will move to the next step and it will be manufactured at one of the largest board game manufacturer in China.

Even if the main goal isn’t reached, the game will be manufactured in small amounts at local stores in Eastern Europe and delivered to the contributors within this campaign! 


PERKS

$51 – EARLY COLOR #1 – First contributors can get a copy of the game with additional 15% discount from the campaign game price.

$60 – EARLY COLOR #2 – First contributors can get a copy of the game at special price, available only through this campaign + FREE COLOR themed T-Shirt.

$60 – COLOR – Get a copy of the game at special price, available only through this campaign.


Production and Shipping

If the main goal is reached, the production will start directly after the campaign is closed, otherwise it may be a little delay to get additional funds, but the production will start anyway.

The shipping is estimated to be on January 2016, but I’ll make everything possible for you to have it delivered on December 2015, so you will have a nice gift for Christmas.


Stretch Goals

$25k – Finishing the development of the game expansion (ECONOMIC & MILITARY)

$30k – Deluxe Edition (larger size, wooden boards and tokens, ceramic pieces and plastic cards)

$45k – Multiplayer Massive Online Game development (+mobile development)


Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute with funds, it doesn't mean you can't help.

Spread the word and make some noise about COLOR!

Please use the Indiegogo share tools.

You can also get a FREE COLOR copy, by becoming a referrer and bringing three contributors. 

To count as a referrer, you must use Indiegogo’s share tools while logged into your Indiegogo account. This is important because otherwise, your unique ID won’t be attached to any resulting contributions or visits.


THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT
story_txt:
COLOR: Strategy Board Game is the result of passion about gaming. This campaign will bring the game to basic production.
Your contribution is extremely important in helping the COLOR to come to life. By contributing to this campaign you will also get a copy of the game at special price, available only through this campaign.









  
COLOR: Strategy Board Game is a
turn-by-turn multi-player game where players are colonizing territories, collecting
resources, building connections and mines, discovering hidden lands and passing
through positive or negative events.
It can be played by two, up to
four players aged ten years and up. The playing time is around 30 to 60
minutes. The game can be easily played even at the very first time without being an experienced player.

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW

RULES OVERVIEW




Complete rulebook will be available soon.

GAMEPLAY


There are several types of
resources with different rarity and value. These are used for building,
upgrading and various actions. 



Resources can be gathered from lands. There are
also unknown lands that can be discovered.



At the beginning the entire world
is hidden and players must pick a land to build the first base.


The first base discovers
the bordering lands and is gathering resources from the surroundings. 



For additional income, you
can build connections from base, and then build mines. 



You can scout the hidden lands and find new
resources. 



Multiple players can have
buildings on the same land. You may build on specific slots to avoid opponent’s
intrusion. Each land has a limited number of slots that can be used, and once it is full, nothing else can be built on that land. 



Sometimes you may not have all the necessary resources for a
building or action, but you can trade with the bank at a higher rate or trade with
other players.



Events are positive or negative. These may
randomly occur at every turn.



To win the game, you must collect a certain number
of victory points. These are achieved by building and expanding own
territory...  









TURN-BY-TURN


At each turn one player is
throwing two dice with colored faces. First die represent the event called for
the current turn – it can be none, often or rare event. 


The events can be
positive or negative and can affect one or multiple players. 


The second die represents the resource generated at
current turn. Current player is gathering resources in dependence of buildings
owned on specific lands.


The second part of the turn is
building, trading or taking an action (like SCOUTING a hidden land).  


At the end of the turn, the
current player must make sure to not have more resources in hand than the
supply capacity. To do so, the player can spend the resources, trade or
discard.








INSIDE THE BOX






4 land boards (250 x 260 mm)
32 resource tokens (30 mm)
12 info cards (67 x 100 mm)
2mm high density mounted cardboard



64 resource cards (44.5 x 60.3 mm)
32 event cards (44.5 x 60.3 mm)
300gsm greycore paper




40 buildings (25 x 25 x 25 mm)
32 connections (15 x 50 x 15 mm)
2 color d6 dice (16 mm)
Plastic


1 rulebook (148 x 210 mm)
4 summary sheets (148 x 210 mm)
128gsm gloss paper
