Super Mixtape is being developed using Agile software development processes and is currently on track, and is being developed in Unity 5.
        

Any additional stretch goals could potentially add a small delay to product development, but it would be a shame not to include a wanted feature. As for the product being released, Super Mixtape has already completed the Steam Greenlight Process and is Planned to be released on Xbox One and Windows 10 Store shortly afterwards.
        

All updates will be communicated between the Polygrammatic website, Steam page, and Crowdfunding campaign as well as the created backer forums.
        

Thank you for taking the time to look at my campaign for Super Mixtape, and if you have any future questions, get in touch!

story:
The OSC Global All-stars tournament is run by the OSC team and aims to increase the interaction and competition between the North American, European, SEA and Chinese scenes. The tournament is open to all SEA, EU, NA and China citizens and gives a chance for many of these regions best and up-and-coming players to test themselves against pros they may not usually play against.

Additionally we want to see how the regions match up, and who will take out the trophy and title of best foreigner!

Help us support those players who need it the most! These guys might not have the support of a Kespa team, the glory/opportunities of a GSL, or the overall culture and acceptance of their craft that their Korean adversaries receive.

You can help us support these players by tuning in to the streams over the 5 group stages and finals, spreading the word, following all these players on social media, or if you can spare any $, help us boost the events prizepool.

Players:
Bunny, Snute, HuK, Petraeus, Lilbow, Kane, MaSa, PiG, MaNa, Bly, Kelazhur, PtitDrogo, Xenocider, TargA, iaguz, Zanster, Blysk, Tefel, DemiLove, PiLiPiLi, EnDerr, ZhuGeLiang, PSiArc, GAMETIME, TeebuL, Mistake

All money rasied goes straight to the prizepool/players!

Brackets/Results/Participants can be viewed here

In addition to the $ prizepool, this tournament also gives out OSC rankings points towards the $5000+ yearly finals!

Brackets/Results for the first Global All Stars event can be viewed here

story:
How It All Started

Yoooooooooo whaddup this is Nicholas Prindle aka BlueWind. I woke up from a dream on New Years Day of 2018 with a vision that I could make a solid 3D video game. I've focused on achieving this goal ever since, and with the amazing help & talents from friends and family the idea has finally blossomed into something worth sharing.



Plot Summary

Thousands of years ago the planet Nova was a mystical place only inhabited by its magical caretakers, the Zen Guardians, and animal companions known as Novetians. Nova's two neighboring planets, Romulus and Eros, were densely populated by multiple species of sentient beings. Things had been good on Romulus and Eros for a time, but their societies began to crumble due to the strain from a harsh class system. 

There was a great war initiated by the bureaucrats of each planet's societies that involved both planets attacking each other for land and resources they wanted on Nova. Since Romulus and Eros were within spitting distance of each other while Nova was relatively far away in comparison, they resorted to attacking and sabotaging each other before either could manage to land on Nova. And thus the Great War for Nova ensued...

However, in a victory for the working class, a massive migration event took place when the Zen Guardians intervened and rescued those not involved with the war using their magic powers by teleporting them back to Nova. After this miraculous event, the Zen Guardians were drained from using so much power to transport everyone. Seeing this, the only hyper-intelligent species from Romulus known as the Clow Clow enacted a huge technological feat that employed a barrier around all of Nova preventing any spacecraft from entering its atmosphere. All species joined in to build the machine and protect the planet.

 After that, there was peace. 

All the species that made it to Nova have lived in harmony and unison with the planet and the Zen Guardians for generations. They've been very appreciative of the world they live in and all the splendor, sustenance and comfort it naturally provides them. Each species has respectively gravitated to regions and adapted to those that suit them best, but some folks like to wonder and see Nova in all of its glory, too. Huge cities and technological feats have been achieved, as well as the dawn of artistic pursuits like music and painting. Things are thriving, and renewable energy sources are abundant and powering the way new Novans live. 


Fast forward to the present day. 

*Cue Conflict*

But now something's amiss on the once peaceful planet Nova! The Zen Guardians are being slowly wiped out by an unknown force. You fill in the shoes of Aura, a young Lon Lon, who in a rare twist of fate, is given the ability to use magic. With this power in your hands you must choose how you will go about responding to the newfound chaos that is rocking your once calm planet. 

 

Mechanics

A Brief Summary

This game is a puzzlebox. It's meant to be replayed several times to see and find all the endings and branching paths. The game world and NPCs are visually effected by your actions and things can turn bad quick if you're not careful. There's also beaucoup Easter Eggs and other hidden content so have fun experimenting!

The Day System

You can only perform so many actions in each game day on Nova, and you have so many days to complete story missions you are sent on. After a certain amount of in-game days have passed, you'll encounter one of the many endings the game has to offer and see the weight of your actions. Seize the day! 

Emotions

Every situation you encounter effects an emotional meter for your character . If you don't find time to meditate or make art, you may have an emotional spike during any stressful situation that happens in the game. You can lose the ability to make choices and watch in horror as your character reacts on their own. Don't lose your cool! 

Classes

There are three player types or classes you can choose from. This helps you navigate obstacles differently with every playthrough. Overcome & adapt! 

Novetian Companions

Over 20 choices of Novetian companions are available, each with their own unique abilities that help you both in general gameplay and in conflict resolution. *pats*

Farming & Cooking

Find fertile pieces of soil throughout the game world to farm with various types of plants and make batches of different recipes to feed yourself and your animal companion, or gift a meal to NPCs you've befriended. Yummy! 

Battling
Using all the aforementioned systems and being inspired by JRPGs, battling just involves having better numbers than the bad guys. Or so you thought?  ;D 

Music

Over 200 songs totaling at 7 hours of music has already been written for the game. While the official soundtrack is only gonna be 4-5 hours, there is also hidden music throughout the game world in the form of collectable vinyl records. You can play the records you find in the game world at the end of each day at your house. 

Games That Inspired Us
The gameplay itself was influenced by many different games like Persona, Harvest Moon, Pokemon, and Majora's Mask with some fresh new takes on the RPG genre as a whole. 

Current Team Members
 

  • Sunshine Abaddon -  Lead Voice Actor / Creative Consultant / Storywriter
  • Charles Benfield - Art Direction / Sprite Animation / 3D Modeling and Architecture 
  • Luke Stasica - Logo Creator / Visual Consultant / Vector Design Specialist
  • Nicholas Prindle (BlueWind) - Creator / Director / Composer / Storywriter / Programmer / Level Designer / Crust Punk / 





--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Where The Money Goes

Even though we are a super small team, we've got a lot of the bases for game design covered and we know we can accomplish what we set out to do. But we still desperately need your help with funding to commission work with outside artists.

Here's some of the things we need to pay to have commissioned: 

  • 3D Models for characters and enemies
  • Anime styled character portraits for NPCs you can befriend
  • HUD design elements that make menu and dialogue navigation smooth and stylistic
  • 2D animations and emotes that add charm 


Any additional funding also helps make sure we can focus on this project being released in a timely manner and at a larger scale than we anticipated. We will also use money for marketing and promotion upon the game's initial release on Steam. 

THE GAME WILL BE RELEASED ON STEAM
IF THINGS GO REALLY WELL WE WILL PORT IT TO THE SWITCH

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

These are tough times and we know money is tight, so please if you can't contribute financially  share this page and spread the word about Sea of Choices.  We truly believe this will be a game people can enjoy for a long time when its complete. 

    Special Special Thanks:

    I wanna thank some folks who have been key to improving this project at various points over the past 3 years and it wouldn't of taken shape without their guidance, talents, and support:

    Daniel Sage / Joanne Cannon /  David Tarcza / Austin Willis / Alexis Interiano / Paul Edwards / Ryan Miller / Hanna Betz / Richard Dubus / Jason Glaudi /  Blake Reimmuth / Jenn Laiche Stevie Gallagher / Antoine Jones /  Anas Maerouf / Andrew Rauch  / Tyler O'brien / Andrew Burnette / Alex Cino / Melissa DeMoura / 


    And anyone else I may not have mentioned. Shouts out to good people! 

    Closing Statements

    Thanks so much for making it to the bottom of this page lol.
    We wanna be completely transparent and say that most of the content in the trailer isn't anything final, it will be improved upon. Even the main character is going to see a lot of changes. We wanted to showcase that we can design and program great areas and concepts.  Now that we know our concept is obtainable, we've decided to enlist help so we can truly flesh what we've built out and make a unique game world. 

    If you have any questions feel free to contact us and we will respond as soon as possible.

story:
Aeternum Vale is an atmospheric pixel-art adventure game for PC & Mac.

 

It was originally funded through Kickstarter on September 14th 2020.

 

Check out the Kickstarter page that started it all ! 

 

Interested in game development? Pixel art? Level design? Want to know more about the project, see more of the game? Join me on Twitch for some relaxed game dev streams and let's have a chat! twitch.tv/boriscerdan

 

 

Why Indiegogo InDemand ?

The idea originated from late backers who found out about the Kickstarter campaign after the deadline, and wanted to still be able to get the game at a discounted price, be part of the community and help the project reach higher stretch goals.

Indeed, while the game surpassed its initial goal of 4500€, only the 5000€ stretch goal unlocking an additional secret boss was reached.

This InDemand post-campaign is the occasion for the game to keep working towards the Nintendo Switch port stretch goal of 6500€, which is really dear to a lot of the backers, and me. Additional funds would also allow a proper release campaign, and ensure that development can still continue, even in case of eventual delays.

 Moreover, this post-campaign page is a new opportunity for me to keep spreading the word about the game until it releases, communicate on development's progress and share with all of you awsome updates related to the project! :)     

 

What is Aeternum Vale ?

Aeternum Vale is a melodic & atmospheric 2D pixel-art adventure through a strange and uncharted world, full of riddles and mysteries, set somewhere between a puzzle platformer and a Metroidvania.
 

You will have to roam this huge handcrafted world, uncovering secret paths and new abilities enabling you to keep exploring further and further these strange unexplored lands, while facing a wide array of enemies and deadly bosses. But the soul of the project resides in its evocative storytelling, told through the world itself and an endearing cast of wacky characters.

 

Through this unwordly mist,

YOU are the main character.

This is YOUR story.

YOU are lost. 

 

But everybody gets lost. 

And it's time to find the way back. 

 

Inspirations

Gameplay-wise, the game finds its roots in retro titles like Castlevania or Metroid, and in more modern takes on the Metroidvania genre in games like Hollow Knight. But aside from the pad-in-hands feel, the overall experience also draws from funny old school point'n'click adventure games like Monkey Island and takes inspiration in indie titles with a different way of storytelling, like Undertale and its crazy characters or Gris and its vivid world and organic manner of delivering an emotionally driven story. All of The Legend of Zelda series was also a huge influence on me, being a life long fan.  

 

The Project

Aeternum Vale is almost entirely a solo project.

Apart from the soundtrack, composed by the very talented Wesley Coleman, and the punctual participation of some graphic designers (most of them being backers of the project and part of our discord community), the game is written, developed, and designed solely by myself.  

 

Telling stories through interactive media with complete creative freedom turned out to be an extremely rewarding experience. Being the programmer, loremaster, and designer of a whole living, breathing world allows me to tell a very personal and, I hope, engaging story, populated by unique characters and full of memorable places players will want to return to.

 

But this freedom comes at a great cost in time.

The game turned out to be a colossal enterprise to be taken alone, and even though I'm able to make considerable progress daily, it's at the expense of almost the entirety of my days, evenings, and often weekends.

 

It's time that I'm more than willing to sacrifice on a project that I'm so passionate about from its very start, and which motivates me as nothing did before in my life. Even if I still find it very hard to compose with the different other aspects of the project (marketing, financing, community management, etc), I do my best to keep the community updated on the game's progress, and put a lot of value in total transparency regarding the whole project.


Being the lone father of this beautiful child of pixels makes me the only person accountable, and I intend to rigorously follow my rules of ethics throughout the all process, from development to release, for the sake of the people involved, the players, and my own. :)

 

                             

 

All of the backer's names will appear in the game's credits !

 

15€ - Digital Copy

Get yourself a digital copy of the game before everyone else!

 

25€ - Founder's

Get yourself a digital copy of the game AND the official digital soundtrack, and a "Founder' role on the community discord!

 

50€ -  VIP Beta Tester's Pack

Want to get further involved in the project ? With the VIP Beta Tester's Pack, you will get the digital copy of the game and the official digital soundtrack, a VIP Role on the community discord, Exclusive Beta access, along with a digital postcard signed by yours truly! 

 

195€ - Designer's Pack

You have an eye for graphic or game design and would like to truly be a part of development ? With the Designer's Pack, you'll get to design an in-game character together with me through discord, along with all of the above perks and a special role on the community discord!

 

 

! MORE INFOS !

Check out the Kickstarter page that started it all ! 

! MORE INFOS !

JOIN US ON DISCORD, IT'S REALLY FUN !

story:
Who are you and why are you running this fundraising campaign.

Hello everyone, my name is Darryl Isaac, but in my online content, I will assume the Pen/Stage Name “Ohgun”. When I was just in High School, I began to experiment with various programs to help make my dream of becoming video game designer a reality. Such programs include:

DAZ Studio
GameMaker
M.U.G.E.N.
Blender
Poser
MakeHuman
VisualBasic
BlueJ
Python
Photoshop

I've had experiences with 3D graphics and game engines back in High School, but now I want to use my experiences to start off my very own animation studio and entertain my potential audience with CGI films, gaming streams and vlogs. Another reason why I'm running this campaign is because in March 19th, my mother had suffered a heart attack and had to be taken to St. Francis Hospital in Bartlet. The next day, she had to undergo bypass surgery within St. Francis Hospital in Park Avenue. She had a very successful operation and has undergone a full recovery. It was that experience that taught me a very vital life lesson: I can't live off of someone else forever and I would have to start fending for myself. Hence this is why I am intending to start up my very own business for the first time. But prior to my mother’s medical issues, I was beginning to question whether or not I can actually make my dream a reality. I was scared that if I give up on my journey now, I could end up having to work several dead end and stressful jobs for the rest of my life. So even though it was rather stubborn, I decided to keep on pursuing my dream and even changing course towards a field in Graphic Design that focuses on making CGI graphics and art. I even considered starting my own CGI animation studio last year. Since the day I came up with O-152 Studios, decided to put my own survival on the line to turn my idea into an effective startup that will continue to grow even after I pass away.

What is this campaign and why is this campaign important to you?
This campaign is mainly to raise funds to not only officially open up my online 3D animation/live action film company O-152 Studios, but to offer financial support to St. Francis Hospital in Memphis, TN for the care they gave my mother and so many other patients for 40 years. The main reason for raising funds is because I do not have the resources I need to create the entirety of the content I desire to produce and release on my own platform. The importance of this campaign to me is to change the lives of people all other the world including my own for the greater good and promote enjoyment and satisfaction from my audience in the process.

What magnitude am I going to help you achieve with this campaign?
When I first make 3D Animation Videos online, I’ll mainly target the gamers and 3D Animation fans within the Memphis area. After gathering that audience, I will eventually cater towards people from around the world all while providing a mixture of entertainment and addressing social issues within American communities. All while bring forth said issues with the intention of having conversations amongst the audience and any opposition towards my beliefs and opinions.

How much do you need for this campaign and where are the funds going?

For this special fundraiser, I will a maximum of $300,000 and a minimum of $3000. The funds will be dedicated towards purchasing the hardware, software, materials, and equipment as well as staffing, advertising, insurance, and utilities such as food, water, and electricity. The goals of this campaign will come in 3 Phases, and each Phase will be comprised of four stages.

Phase 1: Early Development

This phase mainly takes care of the basic necessities for my content such as hardware, software, materials, and equipment that will be used to create vlogs and videos. However, each stage’s maximum funding is $3,000 making this Phase’s goal to be $12,000.

Stage 1: This stage is mainly to acquire the hardware powerful enough to create CGI graphics using 3D models. Begins at Campaign Launch | Stage Goal: $3,000

Stage 2: Now this particular stage’s main purpose is to obtain web development, media editing, and 3D construction software as well as materials needed for my productions. Begins at $3,000 | Stage Goal: $6,000

Stage 3: The semi-final stage of funding for Phase 1 will cover the expenses for filming equipment, software, and more materials needed for my productions. Begins at $6,000 | Stage Goal: $9,000

Stage 4: Any funds contributed in this last stage of Phase 1, will cover the costs of streaming and 3D modeling and animation software along with any accompanying materials. Triggers at $9,000 | Stage Goal: $12,000

Phase 2: Central Development

This phase mainly takes care of the more intermediate necessities such as relocation, storage, props, sound containment and various studio equipment meant to create higher quality vlogs, 3D animations, live action videos and streams. Each stage’s maximum funding for this phase has increased to $12,000 raising the overall campaign goal to a total of $60,000.

Stage 5: This stage’s funds will cover the costs for relocation for 6 months, storage, camera, and studio equipment. Triggers at $12,000 | Stage Goal: $24,000

Stage 6: The second funding stage of Phase 2 will cover an additional 6 months’ worth of rent for relocation, props, luggage for equipment, camera, and additional materials. Triggers at $24,000 | Stage Goal: $36,000

Stage 7: This stage of funding will cover the wiring, sound containment, lighting, motion capture and streaming equipment for “Ohgun’s Friday Night Gaming” Streams. Triggers at $36,000 | Stage Goal: $48,000

Stage 8: The last stage of Phase 2’s funding will cover the costs for additional computer hardware needed for live steams, office furniture, and radio equipment for “Ohgun’s Tuesday Night Conversation” Streams. Triggers at $48,000 | Stage Goal: $60,000

Phase 3: Late Development

This phase mainly takes care of the advanced expenses such as streaming equipment, game development software, staffing, utilities, marketing, insurance and utilities to create the best quality productions available along with a donation to St. Francis Hospital for the care they have given my mother between March 19th and March 26th. Each stage’s maximum funding in this final phase will be capped at $60,000 maxing out the final goal of $300,000.

Stage 9: This stage is mainly reserved for rent for the next year’s location, storage, advanced streaming equipment, game development software, streaming services, and staffing expenses. Triggers at $60,000 | Stage Goal: $120,000

Stage 10: This stage will split any expenses between staffing, utilities, marketing and insurance expenses for the entire studio. Triggers at $120,000 | Stage Goal: $180,000

Stage 11: The semi-final stage of funding will cover the additional expenses for utilities, marketing, insurance, and staffing for the studio. Triggers at $180,000 | Stage Goal: $240,000

Final Stage: Any funds contributed in this last stage will be donated to St. Francis Hospital as well as any fees that will be deducted from the total by both Indiegogo and PayPal. Triggers at $240,000 | Stage Goal: $300,000

Fees, Excess Fund, and Outstanding Expenses Distribution
The factor that decides the amount of funding will actually go to O-152 Studios will be determined by the fees collected by Indiegogo (9% if Stage 1 is incomplete, or 4% if Stage 1 is completed) and PayPal (2.7%). Any funding after the fees that falls short of a certain stage’s goal will be donated St. Francis Hospital’s Park Ave. branch. And any excess funds will be focused on preparing Phase 2 and 3 perks for distribution. The Products purchased using the funds will be the items listed in my acquisition books and all outstanding expenses will on my personal expense. Here is the chart that will show exactly how the funds will be spent:

What are some perks that are offered with this campaign?

The perks for this campaign vary between a simple “Thank You” message sent directly to you by me personally, or your name being listed as one of my Executive Producers in my videos bundled with all the perks in that particular Phase. However, more perks will be unlocked based on which Phase the fundraiser is currently on. Some perks however, are extremely limited, so claim them while they last.

For starters, the Perks available for launch include:
Thank You Messages
Free VIP Memberships
Render Requests (Only 20 Available individually)
Little Shortie Request (Only 10 Available individually)
Shortie Request (Only 10 Available individually)
Quartie Request (Only 5 Available individually)
Associate Producer’s Combo (Only 10 Available, Can select any two Perks currently unlocked)
Phase 1 Completionist (Only 4 Available, includes Thank You Message, Lifetime VIP Membership, and Render, Little Shortie, Shortie, and Quartie Requests)

How will this campaign impact us?

With this campaign, I intend to change the lives of my audiences and my own with the Vlogs, and PSAs I intend to make for my website. I also intend to entertain my audience with my videos, films, game streams, and eventually video games. But overall, I want this campaign to impact the audience by opening their eyes to what’s really happening in America using representations of events that are occurring within not only my current hometown of Memphis, Tennessee, but around the United States and eventually the world.

What are some of the risks and challenges for the O-152 Studios Campaign?
The main challenge I have to take in order to do this campaign is to ensure that I can actually accomplish this task is my inexperience with the software I intend to use in order to produce videos and movies. To overcome that challenge, I will use my determination to work and desire to learn the ropes of the software's structure and systems to develop exemplary quality content.

Now the major risk of this campaign is there will be critics that will pop up from out of the woodworks and instantly assume that this campaign is a fraud.

It’s understandable that I may have some people come out and make such an accusation, but in response to this, I have thoroughly documented what I intend to do with the money you’ve contributed to my campaign via the Acquisition Books I have made. All three books will be solid proof that their contributions are going towards the right places and spent wisely.

I can’t afford to make a contribution to the campaign!

Can’t afford to make a contribution? Well don’t worry about it. Simply sharing the campaign’s page with your family and friends in real life and on social media sites such as facebook and Twitter using the hashtag #O152Campaign, Tumblr, Google+, LinkedIn, Pinterest and StumbleUpon can spread the word about this campaign and helping the campaign reach its overall goal even faster. Even take a picture of yourself with my campaign and post it on Instagram with the hashtag #O152Campaign, or simply send them an email containing the link to my campaign so they can be able to contribute to my cause. While you’re at it, go ahead and spread the word to the streets about my campaign, even print out one of my flyers for the campaign and post them all over your office, your establishment, your house, or even the neighborhood telephone poles (with the owner's/supervisor's/neighborhood’s consent of course). You can even give some to your family and friends so that they can help spread the word about this campaign.

Attachments
Acquisition Book 1: Download Here
Acquisition Book 2: Download Here
Acquisition Book 3: Download Here
Flyer: Download Here

Who are you and why are you running this fundraising campaign.
Hello everyone, my name is Darryl
Isaac, but in my online content, I will assume the Pen/Stage Name “Ohgun”. When
I was just in High School, I began to experiment with various programs
to help make my dream of becoming video game designer a reality. Such programs
include:
DAZ Studio
GameMaker
M.U.G.E.N.
Blender
Poser
MakeHuman
VisualBasic
BlueJ
Python
Photoshop
I've had experiences with 3D
graphics and game engines back in High School, but now I want to use my
experiences to start off my very own animation studio and entertain my
potential audience with CGI films, gaming streams and vlogs. Another reason
why I'm running this campaign is because in March 19th, my mother had suffered
a heart attack and had to be taken to St. Francis Hospital in Bartlet. The next
day, she had to undergo bypass surgery within St. Francis Hospital in Park
Avenue. She had a very successful operation and has undergone a full recovery.
It was that experience that taught me a very vital life lesson: I can't live
off of someone else forever and I would have to start fending for myself. Hence
this is why I am intending to start up my very own business for the first time.
But prior to my mother’s medical issues, I was beginning to question whether or
not I can actually make my dream a reality. I was scared that if I give up on
my journey now, I could end up having to work several dead end and stressful
jobs for the rest of my life. So even though it was rather stubborn, I decided
to keep on pursuing my dream and even changing course towards a field in

story:
Who I am?

I'm indie game developer, my old projects can be found on my youtube channels http://youtube.com/dorumonstr http://www.youtube.com/user/friuns2
I've done a lot of work on this game, but I've reached the point where I need help to finish it. I am raising money to get that help. 


The Game

TrackRacing Pursuit is a car combat game developed by me. Game currently have 3 game modes Street Race, DeathMatch, Survival (escape cops)
★Deathmatch: the level of scattered ammunition, missiles, and nitro kits, for killing a player gets 3 points. 
★Street Race: All players start as racers, if someone dies he becomes a cop, racers get points for pass checkpoints, police receive points for the capture racers.

Game currently in development and public alpha version can try here
PC web version: http://tmrace.net/tm/web2/beta.html

Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.dm.racefree
There is also new private version for testing.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to collect 2,000 US Dollars in order to:

  • Design and create the game artwork (new Cars and Levels). 

  • Support game server that is 90€/mo (cost may increase as game grows)

  • Buy new sounds and music

  • Create game site.

Goals

100$

  • update this page add more goals and more info and description.

300$

  • update physics engine

  • update game to new unity3d 5 game engine

500$

  • Complete new level and make it public for everybody

  • add new car

  • improve car destruction physics

Unable to donate, but still want to help us?

Spread the word! Share/like this page on Facebook or any social media you prefer :)

story:
Featured In

Read about ZoZbot in Mashable, Tom's Guide and Gizmag!

ZoZbot won "Best Robot" in the Tom's Guide CES 2016 Awards! 

Designed to inspire creativity and promote fun for users of all ages, ZoZbot is a revolutionary, customizable gaming experience that can transform into something new each time you show up to play. If you can dream it, you can make it a part of your ZoZbot experience!

Watch our story here:



Created by a team of seasoned inventors, engineers and gamers providing automation and design services to the high-tech world of Silicon Valley, ZoZbot is the first consumer robot that enables Robo-Gaming, a continuously evolving platform for a gaming experience that blends the creativity and excitement of robotics with a combination of pool, pinball, mini-golf, soccer and many other games for players of all ages.  

ZoZbot is a smartphone controlled modular robot that plays a game called ZoZball in a modular stadium known as the ZoZadium. Players will be able to personalize their ZoZbot with additional modules and features such as cameras, sounds, lights, actuators, weapons, avatars and more to adapt it to different games, appearances and functionality. As new modules and software for ZoZbot and its companion ZoZadium become available, players will be able to create new and exciting games in the ever-expanding ZoZmos.
ZoZbots are not limited to one game or function at a time.  Modules can be stacked through our ingenious patent pending interface.  With a sense of adventure and a little ingenuity, the possibilities are endless.

Designed to inspire creativity and promote fun for users of all ages, ZoZbot is a customizable gaming experience that can transform into something new each time you show up to play. If you can dream it, you can make it a part of your ZoZbot experience!  


The ZoZbot platform is designed to be modular and expandable.  Above is a rendering of our planned Claw Module.  The extendable design and stackable platform is perfect for people who want to make their own crazy fun.  

Add a Camera Module for first person interactive gaming.

Our Projectile Module adds a new dimension to target practice. 

ZoZbots run on rechargeable batteries.  You can expect a full hour or more of fun play on one charge. We will also offer a battery booster module to give you extended play time.

ZoZbot at CES 2016 Las Vegas

At the massive consumer electronics show in Las Vegas, Nevada.
ZoZbot is in the middle of the action with a booth in the Eureka Park area of the Sands Convention Center Hall G.  Booth 80035

The show ran for 4 days but 3 days before we started with a big crate and a small space

Our team spent two days putting the booth together.

On the first day we demonstrated ZoZbots to 1,000's of interested consumers.

Thanks to our ZoZbot team for all the hard work.

Our Journey

Two pre-prototype ZoZbots dueling it out.  These are our 3D Printed ZoZbots prior to our prototypes arriving.

An exciting time for the ZoZbot team as our first two ZoZbots arrive from our factory

Our developers at work assembling the first pre-production prototypes. Your ZoZbot will come ready to play out of the box.  No assembly required.

Shown above is our prototype ZoZadium which is a customizable play area.  While the ZoZadium is not required for play it provides an awesome arena for playing solo and competitive multi-player games.  

What We Need & What You Get

Here are our details:

  • As you can see the ZoZbot team is well on it's way to producing a finished product
  • We are seeking $100,000 in funding to take this great idea from prototypes to production. 
  • Our backer levels range from a simple investment all the way up to a full partnership with us.

The Impact

  • This is the dawn of Robo-Gaming.
  • ZoZbot was created to inspire creativity and promote fun for players of all ages with a customizable gaming experience that can transform into something new each time you show up to play.
  • If you can dream it, you can make it a part of your ZoZbot experience

About us

Incorporated in 2015, CutThroatRobotics is a team of seasoned inventors, engineers and gamers providing automation and design services to the high-tech world of Silicon Valley.

Risks & Challenges

We are a small group of entrepreneurs who have created a new genre of gaming. Our designers and engineering team have many years of experience in robotics. Despite being a startup, we strongly feel that our combined experience minimizes your risk in backing us. Furthermore, our business team has been in the consumer electronics field for many years and knows what it takes to run a successful company.

Other Ways You Can Help

We look forward to producing and shipping a wonderful new gaming experience. In order to make ZoZbot a household name around the world, we are seeking dealers and distributors and licensee  to work with us.

The fine print

  • Multiple World-Wide Patents and Trademarks pending.
  • Final shipping products may differ slightly from some of the pictures and renderings shown here

Our Journey



Two pre-prototype ZoZbots dueling it out.  These are our 3D Printed ZoZbots prior to our prototypes arriving.

An exciting time for the ZoZbot team as our first two ZoZbots arrive from our factory


Our developers at work assembling the first pre-production prototypes. Your ZoZbot will come ready to play out of the box.  No assembly required.


Shown above is our prototype ZoZadium which is a customizable play area.  While the ZoZadium is not required for play it provides an awesome arena for playing solo and competitive multi-player games.  
What We Need & What You Get

 Here are our details:  As you can see the ZoZbot team is well on it's way to producing a finished product
We are seeking $100,000 in funding to take this great idea from prototypes to production.  Our backer levels range from a simple investment all the way up to a full partnership with us.    The Impact  This is the dawn of Robo-Gaming. ZoZbot was created to inspire creativity and promote
fun for players of all ages with a customizable gaming experience that can
transform into something new each time you show up to play. 
If you can dream it, you can
make it a part of your ZoZbot experience 
About us




Incorporated in 2015, CutThroatRobotics is a team of seasoned inventors, engineers and
gamers providing automation and design services to the high-tech world of
Silicon Valley.

Risks & Challenges 

We
are a small group of entrepreneurs who have created a new genre of gaming. Our designers and engineering team have many years
of experience in robotics. Despite being a startup, we strongly feel that our
combined experience minimizes your risk in backing us. Furthermore, our
business team has been in the consumer electronics field for many years and
knows what it takes to run a successful company.   Other Ways You Can Help 

We
look forward to producing and shipping a wonderful new gaming experience. In
order to make ZoZbot a household name around the world, we are seeking dealers
and distributors and licensee  to work with us.
The fine print

Multiple World-Wide Patents and Trademarks pending.

Final shipping products may differ slightly from some of the pictures and renderings shown here

story:
Official Site

Game Streams Can Be Better...

And more meaningful. I enjoy watching people play. Game Design is my passion. Hm...I wonder what happens if I stick these two together. *click*

Viola! Like two interlockable Lego Bricks, Dstream is born!


Well if you're not fond of Lego's 

it doesn't matter. This is about videogames. Many streams I see have little lasting value. There's the community, that's good. Yet even a design stream I watched recently seemed a bit...boring. With Dstream things get more exciting:

  • Series Breakdown 
     I take one franchise, say the Legend Of Zelda or Need for Speed, and play a variety of their games.

  • One Question
    For each franchise, a series of episodes debuts with one specific question we aim to answer about the games as a whole (e.g. why so successful?)

  • Trivia and "You Had No Ideas"

    About real games you enjoy! Things you never knew (or maybe you did)!

  • Do's and Don't

    And I'll track what's good and bad in the games...see what you can apply to your projects. Practical stuff here.

  • Team contest, giveaways, and series related fun!
    May even have a mock presidential election. I'm not taking  candidates yet! (Diddy Kong is automatically disqualified) 

 And also...

I want to give a voice to the Indie Game World. I plan to play new Indie titles with their devs as special guests on the show. This will be a regular event once I start it (that's a later feature). I'll explore good game design just as always--no mercy for the Indies. ;^)

 How You Are Helping

Here's a breakdown of the costs.

~$150 for an Elgato HD Capture Card. That's how I record the game and show it to you.

~$50 for a headset

$9.95 for the first month of Vimeo Plus

~$50 for overlay images/software (if I choose to buy that)

~$50 for other expenses

$500 is much more than I need, yet that is the smallest goal that one can set. I will use the extra funds for advertising, giveaway stuff, or other things that will benefit the stream. With a Vimeo Plus subscription, I will be able to upload all episodes to Vimeo where you can watch them ad free as many times as you'd like.

This is a flexible funded campaign. That means even if I don't raise all $500, I receive what I've earned.

Check out the official site for more details! You can help me out on Patreon anytime, or support me here. I really appreciate it! When it comes time to air, Twitch will be the site I use.

__________________________________________________


The first franchise I'll explore is Ape Escape. Give $10 to receive an my Ape Escape 2  gameplay diary (I already started playing alone) and get a taste of what you'll see in the stream. I'll even draw a monkey for you! :D See an excerpt from the diary here.


For a gift of any amount $1 or more, I give you my thanks, both personally and publicly on the live stream. And I'll keep you updated!

I want to let you know, the trivia and "You Didn't Know" feature may not be implemented immediately. The contests and social games will have to wait for sure until we've done a few episodes. Thank you for your patience.


The goal is to start the first stream by June. If that changes, I will let you know!


ABOUT ME: I'm a young entrepreneur with a deep interest in videogames. I've been creating them ever since I was 12 and have extensive computer knowledge. This is my second Indiegogo campaign (the first wasn't funded; I ended it early). With the income from this stream, I'd like to pay for some of my expenses, and who knows, perhaps it will pay for all of them! :P

story:
What is it?

www.TheRepublicGame.com
This is a GAME.
An elaborately designed maze in a 18,000 sq ft warehouse in downtown Orlando. 
30 Players. - YOU
12 Actors. 
80 Minutes.
Interweaving story lines.  
Sound effects. Lighting effects. Strobe lights. Projections. Special effects.
Puzzles.
Multiple endings based on how YOU play the game. 
OPENING BETA TEST MAY 2015 with Orlando Fringe Festival. 

This giant maze delves deep into an alternate society, one of archaic hierarchies, confusion, and deceit. Drawing on elements from Greek mythology, Plato’s Republic, and Metropolis, you, a player in this society, will plunge directly into the middle of conflict and unrest.

Every decision you make causes a reaction that affects not only your own story line, but the story of the players around you. You are creating a story web that is constantly in flux and shifting. Non Player Character (NPC) actors will help guide you through your experience, but you may not be aware of who is a player and who is an actor. You will be deceived. You will be manipulated. You will be watched. The more you challenge and engage in the world around you, the stronger your journey will be.

Experience

There are three different factions inside the world we are creating: The Republic, The Office, The Labyrinth. Each faction has a unique design and will feel completely different than the others. Guests will be immediately thrown into one of these areas. Depending on which faction you are placed into, you will interact more heavily with those characters and that story line. However, each story line interweaves with the others, so you will experience each environment. I'm going to remain vague about the design and story specifics as I don't want to spoil the exploratory nature of the project and the sense of discovery the players should feel. We will slowly release a few story and design teasers, but you must come and explore/experience for yourself. Just know, the sets are going to be elaborate, overwhelming at times, and there are going to be moving elements, special effects, and elements that warp your sense of reality. The space design alone will immediately draw you into this new world. The other players and actors will then heighten the space and guide you into your own story where you have to make decisions that will change your game and the games of those around you. You may be kidnapped, you will be touched, you will feel uncomfortable, you will be watched, so this is not for the faint of heart. However, this is not a horror genre, this experience is not meant to frighten you, although you may experience elements of fear. We are pushing you out of your comfort zone through interactions with the actors and spaces. If at any moment you feel too uncomfortable or challenged, we do have a safe word in place: Pineapple.

The TEAM

We are comprised of 9 core team members consisting of writers, designers, and engineers.  We spend most of our day designing theme parks. Design is in our blood. Designing engaging experiences is what we excel at in our day jobs. We can take this expertise and create something that has never been done and do it creativily, successfully, and feasibly.

What your donation is going towards

Warehouse space
Lumber
Special Effects
Lighting
Sound
Moving elements
Actors
Costumes
Prosthetic Make Up Pieces
Media elements

Why I am creating The Republic

I've always been interested in pushing the arts into a new realm, into something innovative and inspiring. I've always seen myself as an artist yet felt stuck inside the various categories of art: dancer, sculptor, painter. I never wanted to be any of these singularly, but instead want to mush them all together into something messy, some new medium. Going to graduate school and studying architecture really heightened this desire to combine my passions. The more I was designing architectural spaces, the more I wanted to also express my love for dance and sculpture. This sense of entrapment inside architecture led me to flee to the theater department where the first of these interactive/architectural/theatrical productions emerged. I felt alive in the first production, The Labyrinth Experiment. I found an amazing group of students to play and brainstorm these ideas with me. We were blindly trying to find a way to create an experience that pushed people to think and took the audience out of their seats and into the action of a production. I want the audience to feel like they are the stars in their own play and get to make decisions that affect their play. This is where gaming elements emerged. I realized all the hours I spent playing World of Warcraft were paying off. Bring in gaming was natural. People now had a reason to participate in the experience and drive the story. The Republic is about the audience, the players, and empowering them to push themselves in a risk free environment that is out of the computer and in reality.

FAQ


What ages are appropriate?

The show is Mature (18+) and may contain nudity, violent moments, suggestive themes, strong language, and graphic images. We might open a Teen (13+) show and will post more information at a later date.


How long is this experience?

You should expect to spend about 80 minutes in the experience.


Will there be any physical contact?

The actors may engage in physical contact with you. You may be kidnapped, blindfolded, picked up, in a safe manner (you will not actually be harmed). If at any time you feel too uncomfortable the safe word of PINEAPPLE is in place. If you decide you must use the safe word, the actor will immediately release you/stop actions and a member of staff will escort you from the game. You will not be able to return to the game.


What is the level of interactivity?

Each player is expected to act as an individual. You will be fully engaged in the production, running, walking through the maze. You will be required to move props, speak with other players and Non Player Characters, solve puzzles.


Is this experience scary?

This is NOT a horror genre. It is not meant to be scary. However, you will feel uncomfortable and depending on how you test yourself, you may experience elements of fear. You will be safe the entire experience.


Are there special effects?

Yes. There is fog, strobe lights, other lighting effects, steam, other various effects.


Do I really control the story?

Yes. We are constantly watching you throughout the experience and in constant communication with the NPCs. The story and situations will constantly change based on how you make decisions and how you react. There are multiple endings and which outcome you get depends entirely on you and the other players.


Are there group ticket discounts?

Yes. Please contact us at: info@pseudonymproductions.org


What do I do if I don't feel safe?

There is a safe word in place: PINEAPPLE. If you don't feel safe at any moment, yell out this safe word and the situation you are in will immeditally halt. A member of our staff will collect you and escort you off site. There is surveillance throughout the maze and we can see you at all times. You will not be able to return to the game.


What will I learn?

A purpose of this experience is to take the idea of a risk free video game environment into a more ‘real’ setting. You are given the opportunity to test yourself and push yourself in uncomfortable environments. You may do something in this game that you never thought you were capable of before. You are meant to learn more about yourself. The more you challenge yourself, the more you will gain from this experience.


What kind of shoes should I wear?

It is recommended you wear comfortable footwear as you will be running/walking most of the experience. However, if you can nail it in heels, go for it.


Is this a good group activity?

This is mostly an individual experience. You will be pulled apart from the people who accompanied you. You may encounter and interact with those people, but you cannot go around together. However, after the experience is over, you can share and exchange information about your different experiences.


Will I have to sign a waiver and why?

Each player will need to sign a waiver before entering experience. This waiver is for your safety as well as our NPCs and other players.


Can I play this game more than once?

Sure, come as much as you would like. We will make sure you are not the same role twice, so please let us know when you arrive.


Is the outcome the same every time?

No, there are multiple endings and no two experiences are exactly alike.

story:
(Para la informacion en Español, ve al final de la página)


We are ARCHANICA, a new RPG initiative, and we want to publish the MECANOTECHNICS HANDBOOK, a product that we've been working on for nearly 12 years.

This is a sourcebook for D&D 3.5 and Pathfinder; it introduces Mecanotechnics, a new power source based on science and technology. Just like the Psionics Handbook, this book contains new races, character classes, skills, feats, accessories, and features to expand your campaign world.

However, we need your support to publish it. We started designing this book as teenagers and didn't have the means to publish it professionally, but we worked a lot on it during all these years, with the goal of releasing it someday.

And now the day has come.

Fortunately, the book is already written! But as we hail from Mexico, we wrote everything in Spanish, and translating so much content is not a piece of cake. So, the main goal of this funding campaign is to collect the money to translate it to English so the whole world can enjoy it, as well as to cover more resources to pay for professional design and artwork.


The book contains all this:

·  A complete system of CREATION AND USAGE OF MECANOTECH weapons and accessories.

·  5 brand new PLAYABLE RACES (plus 4 ADVANCED RACES) that define the flavor of a scientific campaign setting.

·  4 never seen before CHARACTER CLASSES (and 6 SUB-CLASSES) based on the mecanotechnics power source, plus 3 OBSCURANTIST CLASSES specially designed to fit in medieval and proto-scientific settings.

·  Around 150 MACHINES, SUBSTANCES, and scientific weapons, with more than 500 optional UPGRADES available to improve them and expand their functions.

·  More than 70 TECHNOLOGIES with different uses, and more than 600 UPGRADES to customize them.

·  About 30 NEW FEATS to improve the scientific prowess of mecanotech character classes and 40 GENERAL FEATS to grant non-scientific character classes expertise in the usage of machines and technologies.

·  More than 50 detailed ACCESSORIES, including consumables, machine components, improved materials, gadgets and various items useful in mecanotech adventures.

·  A full-fledged ALTERNATE SYSTEM OF MECANOTECHNICS, featuring almost 60 IMPLEMENTS and ADD-ONS, for a different approach to the power of science.

·  SPECIAL ADVANCE OPTIONS for scientific characters to study more than one science area and balancing different disciplines.

·  An entire chapter dedicated to DESIGNING THE ROLE OF SCIENCE IN YOUR WORLD, featuring rule sets, examples and suggestions on how to build a world of mecanotechnics based on your preferences as a game director.


Our project is modest: We aim for a digital release with only a few illustrations so you may have a taste of the world of mecanotechnics. But if you want more, you can get more. The resources would be expended as following:
  • Translation to English. The book's around 500 pages long, between rules and descriptions of our world. As English is the standard language out there, we think it's the best way to reach people from any country.
  • Digital Design. We want to present a dignified book, so we want to pay a designer. The book includes important design elements like charts, stat blocks and special log sheets that players can use to keep track of their technologies.

  • Artwork. We wish to include at least illustrations for the new races and classes, and we have a badass artist, Luis Ruíz. But if we exceed our primary goal, we'd love to give you more of our world: Machine designs, technologies, civilizations... everything you can imagine!
  • Website. We want to stay in touch with our readers so a forum is the perfect way to receive feedback from you and give you updates about the book, both pre- and post-launch.
  • Administrative Costs. Registering a trademark, getting the copyrights and creating contracts for international artists to work with us can be expensive. We're also spending money on promotional material and exposure in media.

Whether we reach our goal or not, we'll do our best to bring you the book, but without your help, the wait could be way longer...


If you want to take a look at what we offer, you can download a sample pack with some of the rules of the handbook.

The sample pack contains:
  • 4 new playable character races: Atlantean, Kyri, Erron and Fril.
  • 5 playable character classes: Mechanic, Chemist, Mech Knight, Gunslinger and Musketeer.
  • New skills and feats.
  • Complete lists of machines and technologies for all classes.
  • 27 machine samples (Level 1-2) with their upgrades.
  • 4 technology samples (Level 1) with their upgrades.
  • Guide of accessories and consumables.

CLICK HERE TO DOWNLOAD.


As you can see, our scope is ambitious and we want to offer the most complete experience possible. Unfortunately, the more content we include, the higher the translation and digital design costs become, and right now we can't confirm how much support we'll get from our potential audience.

This is why we decided to create a pared down edition that reduces the book to what we consider its "essentials", without compromising the balance of the system at all.

This "Essential Edition" would include fewer races, character classes (as well as their related content, such as feats) and fewer technologies. This will make the book more affordable, and leaving everything that makes the game balanced and enjoyable completely untouched.  The only things left out would be a few options for the player.

Thus, we will manage the "ESSENTIAL EDITION" as our main goal in order to make sure the book will be published, while an "EXPANDED EDITION" with the whole content would be our first stretch goal, if our audience demands the most complete experience available.

You can check the differences between the Essential and Expanded editions here:

We want to make clear the Expanded Edition is not a perk but a stretch goal. That means, everyone supporting the book with any contribution will get the Expanded Edition if the stretch goal is reached, but it's up to you to help us to make it happen.

Our dream with this book is creating a new secondary staple for fantasy products based in the d20 system, and we think we have what it takes.

While this is our first release, we believe our system is a logical, flexible, and exciting way to manage scientific heroes in RPG games, so it could change the world of fantasy gaming and become a useful resource for any new RPG player.  


The main risks for this project are the possible eventualities in the game system, but we've been very attentive to detail and we want to keep this way in case something else fails.
We'll go into an extended game testing period before releasing the game, so players can tell us about any adjustments we can make to the final version. Likewise, we want to keep working in the book after release using the forums as a means of contact and feedback.

That way, we'll be able to provide readers with revisions for any flaw, and if it becomes necessary, a fully revisited edition of the book will be free for our backers. 

Even if you're not familiar with role-playing games, you can help us to fulfill our dream. Do you know anyone who could be interested? Please tell them about our project, we'll be very grateful!









(For English information, go the top of the page)

Somos ARCHANICA, una nueva iniciativa de RPG, y queremos publicar el MANUAL DE MECANOTECNIA, un producto en el que llevamos trabajando por casi 12 años.

Esta nueva fuente de poder para D&D 3.5 y Pathfinder introduce la Mecanotecnia, una nueva fuente de poder basada en ciencia y tecnología. Al igual que el Manual de Psiónica, este libro incluye nuevas razas, clases de personaje, habilidades, dotes, accesorios y demás reglas para expandir tu mundo de campaña.

Sin embargo, necesitamos de tu apoyo para publicarlo. Empezamos a diseñar este libro en nuestra adolescencia y no teníamos los medios para publicarlo profesionalmente, pero hemos trabajado mucho estos años con la meta de publicarlo algún día. Y ahora ese día ha llegado.

Por fortuna, ¡el libro ya está escrito! Pero ya que somos mexicanos, escribimos todo en español, y traducir tanto contenido no es sencillo. Así que la principal meta es traducirlo al inglés para que todo el mundo pueda disfrutarlo, y también buscamos recaudar recursos para pagar diseño y arte profesionales.

El libro contiene todo esto:

•  Un sistema completo de creación y uso de armas y accesorios mecanotécnicos.

•  5 nuevas RAZAS JUGABLES de personaje (así como 4 RAZAS AVANZADAS más) que definen el sabor de una ambientación de campaña científica.

•  4 CLASES DE PERSONAJE nunca antes vistas (y 6 SUBCLASES) basadas en la fuente de poder mecanotécnica, además de 3 CLASES OSCURANTISTAS especialmente diseñadas para funcionar en entornos medievales y proto-científicos.

•  Cerca de 150 MÁQUINAS, SUSTANCIAS y armas científicas, con más de 500 MEJORAS opcionales para aumentarlas y expandir sus funciones.

•  Más de 70 TECNOLOGÍAS con distintos usos, y más de 600 MEJORAS para personalizarlas.

•  Alrededor de 50 NUEVAS DOTES para mejorar las aptitudes científicas de clases mecanotécnicas, y 30 DOTES GENERALES para aumentar la pericia de clases no científicas en el uso de máquinas y tecnologías.

•  Más de 50 ACCESORIOS detallados, incluyendo consumibles, componentes de máquinas, materiales mejorados, artilugios y objetos diversos útiles en aventuras mecanotécnicas.

•  Un SISTEMA ALTERNO DE MECANOTECNIA totalmente desarrollado, con casi 60 IMPLEMENTOS y ADITAMENTOS, para un acercamiento diferente a la práctica de la ciencia.

•  OPCIONES DE AVANCE especiales para personajes científicos que estudien más de un área de la ciencia y deseen balancear diferentes disciplinas.

•  Un capítulo completo dedicado a DISEÑAR EL PAPEL DE LA CIENCIA EN TU MUNDO, incluyendo conjuntos de reglas, ejemplos y sugerencias de cómo construir un mundo de la mecanotecnia a tu gusto como director de juego.


Nuestro proyecto es modesto: Buscamos publicar el libro digitalmente y con sólo unas cuantas ilustraciones para que puedas tener una probada del mundo de la mecanotecnia. Pero si quieres más, podemos hacerlo. Los recursos se destinarán a lo siguiente:

  • Traducción al inglés. El libro es de casi 500 páginas, entre reglas y descripciones de nuestro mundo. Ya que el inglés es el lenguaje estándar de los RPG, creemos que es la mejor meta de llevar nuestro libro a cualquier audiencia.

  • Diseño digital. Queremos presentar el libro de forma digna, así que necesitamos pagar a un diseñador. El libro incluye elementos de diseño importantes como tablas, fichas de estadísticas y bitácoras especiales que los jugadores pueden usar para llevar un registro de sus máquinas y tecnologías.

  • Ilustraciones. Queremos incluir al menos ilustraciones para las nuevas razas y clases, y tenemos un genial artista, Luis Ruíz. Pero si rebasamos nuestra meta principal, nos encantaría mostrarte más de nuestro mundo: Diseños de máquinas, tecnologías, civilizaciones... ¡Todo lo que puedas imaginar!

  • Sitio web. Queremos estar en contacto con nuestros lectores así que un foro es la forma perfecta de recibir retroalimentación de tu parte y darte actualizaciones del libro, tanto antes como después del lanzamiento.

  • Costos administrativos. Registrar una marca registrada, obtener derechos de autor y crear contratos para trabajar con artistas internacionales tiene un precio. También invertiremos en material promocional y publicidad.

Alcancemos o no nuestras metas, haremos todo lo posible para traerte el libro, pero sin tu ayuda, la espera puede ser mucho más larga...


Si quieres echar un vistazo a lo que ofrecemos, puedes descargar el paquete de muestra oficial con algunas reglas del manual:

El paquete de muestra contiene:
  • 4 nuevas razas de personaje: Atlante, Cairi, Erro y Fril.
  • 5 clases de personaje: Mecánico, Químico, Caballero Iniciado, Pistolero y Mosquetero.
  • Nuevas habilidades y dotes.
  • Listas completas de máquinas y tecnologías para todas las clases.
  • 27 máquinas de muestra (Niveles 1-2) con sus mejoras.
  • 4 technologías de muestra (Nivel 1) con sus mejoras.
  • Guía de accesorios y consumibles.
CLIC AQUÍ PARA DESCARGAR.


Como puedes ver, nuestro proyecto es ambicioso y queremos ofrecer la experiencia más completa posible. Por desgracia, entre más contenido, los costos de traducción y diseño digital se elevan, y de momento no podemos confirmar cuánto apoyo obtendríamos de nuestro público potencial.
Es por eso que decidimos crear una versión depurada que reduce el libro a lo que consideramos lo "esencial" pero sin compometer el balance del sistema de ninguna forma.

Esta "Edición Esencial" contendría menos razas, clases de personaje (así como menos contenido derivado de éstas) y unas pocas menos de tecnologías. Y por tanto, costaría menos. Pero todo lo que mantiene el juego balanceado y disfrutable quedaría completamente intacto. Lo único que quedaría fuera serían unas pocasopciones para el jugador.

Por tanto, manejaremos la "ESSENTIAL EDITION" como nuestra meta principal para asegurar la publicación del libro, mientras que una "EXPANDED EDITION" con el contenido completo sería nuestra primera meta adicional, si nuestro público demanda la experiencia más completa posible.

Puedes ver las diferencias entre la Edición Esencial y la Expandida aquí:

Queremos dejar claro que la Edición Expandida no es una recompensa sino una meta adicional. Eso quiere decir que todos los que hagan la mínima contribución al proyecto recibirían la Edición Expandida si la meta adicional es alcanzada. Pero está en tus manos ayudarnos a que se logre.

Nuestro sueño con este libro es crear un nuevo libro de cabecera para productos de fantasía basados en el sistema d20, y creemos tener lo que se necesita. Aunque este es nuestro primer proyecto, creemos que nuestro sistema es lógico, flexible y una forma emocionante de manejar a héroes científicos en juegos RPG, para cambiar el mundo de los juegos de fantasía y ser un recurso útil para cualquier nuevo jugador.

Los principales riesgos para este proyecto son posibles eventualidades en el sistema de juego, pero hemos puesto mucha atención al detalle y quieremos seguir así en caso de que algo cause problemas.
Sostendremos un periodo de prueba extendido antes de lanzar el libro, y así los jugadores podrán decirnos qué ajustes podemos hacer en la versión final. De igual forma, queremos seguir trabajando en el libro después de la publicación usando los foros como medio de contacto y retroalimentación.

De ese modo podremos proveer a los lectores con revisiones de cualquier fallo, y si se vuelve necesario, una edición corregida del libro de forma gratuita para nuestros donantes.


Al ser nuestra lengua nativa, la versión en español del libro ya está escrita, sin embargo para lanzar el proyecto queremos enfocarnos primero en nuestra audiencia internacional.

El diseño digital de versiones en ambos idiomas duplicaría los costos y comprometería el éxito del proyecto, por lo que dejamos la perspectiva de una edición en español para un futuro.

Aun así, si eres de nuestra audiencia hispana agradeceremos mucho tu apoyo, ya que nos ayudará a hacer realidad una edición en español en un futuro próximo. Además, si apoyas el proyecto, compartiremos contigo todo el contenido del libro en español (aunque solamente en texto, sin diseño digital) cuando llegue la fecha de entrega de este proyecto.



Aún si no estás familiarizado con los juegos de rol, puedes ayudarnos a cumplir nuestro sueño. ¿Conoces a alguien que podría estar interesado? Por favor, diles sobre nuestro proyecto, ¡Estaremos agradecidos!


(For English information, go the top of the page)
story_txt:
(Para la informacion en Español, ve al final de la página)We are ARCHANICA, a new RPG initiative, and we want to publish
the MECANOTECHNICS HANDBOOK, a product that we've been working on for nearly
12 years. 


This is a sourcebook for D&D 3.5 and Pathfinder; it introduces Mecanotechnics,
a new power source based on science and technology. Just like the Psionics
Handbook, this book contains new races, character classes, skills, feats,
accessories, and features to expand your campaign world.

However, we need your support to publish it. We started
designing this book as teenagers and didn't have the means to publish it
professionally, but we worked a lot on it during all these years, with the goal
of releasing it someday. 

And now the day has come.
Fortunately, the book is already written! But as we hail from
Mexico, we wrote everything in Spanish, and translating so much content is not
a piece of cake. So, the main goal of this funding campaign is to collect the
money to translate it to English so the whole world can enjoy it, as well as to
cover more resources to pay for professional design and artwork.




The book contains all this:


 
· 
A complete
system of CREATION AND USAGE OF MECANOTECH weapons and accessories.
· 
5 brand new PLAYABLE RACES (plus 4 ADVANCED RACES) that define the
flavor of a scientific campaign setting.
· 
4 never seen
before CHARACTER CLASSES (and 6 SUB-CLASSES)
based on the mecanotechnics power source, plus 3 OBSCURANTIST CLASSES
specially designed to fit in medieval and proto-scientific settings.
· 
Around 150 MACHINES, SUBSTANCES,
and scientific weapons, with more than 500
optional UPGRADES available to
improve them and expand their functions.
· 
More than 70 TECHNOLOGIES with different uses,
and more than 600 UPGRADES to customize them.
· 
About 30 NEW FEATS to improve the scientific
prowess of mecanotech character classes and 40 GENERAL FEATS to grant non-scientific character classes
expertise in the usage of machines and technologies.
· 
More than 50 detailed ACCESSORIES, including consumables, machine components, improved
materials, gadgets and various items useful in mecanotech adventures.
· 
A full-fledged ALTERNATE SYSTEM OF MECANOTECHNICS,
featuring almost 60 IMPLEMENTS and ADD-ONS, for a different approach to
the power of science.
· 
SPECIAL ADVANCE OPTIONS for scientific characters to study more than one science area and
balancing different disciplines.
· 
An entire
chapter dedicated to DESIGNING THE ROLE
OF SCIENCE IN YOUR WORLD, featuring rule sets, examples and suggestions on
how to build a world of mecanotechnics based on your preferences as a game
director.


Our project is modest: We aim for a digital release with only a few
illustrations so you may have a taste of the world of mecanotechnics. But if
you want more, you can get more. The resources would be expended as following:


Translation to English. The book's around 500 pages long, between
     rules and descriptions of our world. As English is the standard language
     out there, we think it's the best way to reach people from any country.

Digital Design. We
     want to present a dignified book, so we want to pay a designer. The book
     includes important design elements like charts, stat blocks and special
     log sheets that players can use to keep track of their technologies.


Artwork. We
wish to include at least illustrations for the new races and classes, and
     we have a badass artist, Luis Ruíz. But if we exceed our primary
     goal, we'd love to give you more of our world: Machine designs,
     technologies, civilizations... everything you can imagine!

Website. We
     want to stay in touch with our readers so a forum is the perfect way to
     receive feedback from you and give you updates about the book, both pre-
     and post-launch.

Administrative Costs. Registering a trademark, getting the
     copyrights and creating contracts for international artists to work with
     us can be expensive. We're also spending money on promotional material and
     exposure in media.
Whether we reach our goal or not, we'll do our best to bring you the book,
but without your help, the wait could be way longer...



 
If you want to take a look at what we offer, you can download a sample pack with some of the rules of the handbook.

The sample pack contains:

4 new playable character races: Atlantean, Kyri, Erron and Fril.

5 playable character classes: Mechanic, Chemist, Mech Knight, Gunslinger and Musketeer.
New skills and feats.
Complete lists of machines and technologies for all classes.

27 machine samples (Level 1-2) with their upgrades.

4 technology samples (Level 1) with their upgrades.

Guide of accessories and consumables.

CLICK HERE TO DOWNLOAD.



As you
can see, our scope is ambitious and we want to offer the most complete
experience possible. Unfortunately, the more content we include, the higher the
translation and digital design costs become, and right now we can't confirm how
much support we'll get from our potential audience.
This is why we decided to create a pared down edition that reduces the book to
what we consider its "essentials", without compromising the
balance of the system at all.
This "Essential Edition" would include fewer races, character
classes (as well as their related content, such as feats) and fewer
technologies. This will make the book more affordable, and leaving everything
that makes the game balanced and enjoyable completely untouched.  The only
things left out would be a few options for the player.Thus, we will manage the "ESSENTIAL EDITION" as our main goal
in order to make sure the book will be published, while an "EXPANDED
EDITION" with the whole content would be our first stretch goal, if
our audience demands the most complete experience available.

You can check the differences between the Essential and Expanded editions here:We want to make clear the Expanded Edition is not a perk but a stretch goal.
That means, everyone supporting the book with any contribution will get the
Expanded Edition if the stretch goal is reached, but it's up to you to help us to make it happen.




Our dream with this book is creating a new secondary staple for fantasy
products based in the d20 system, and we think we have what it takes.


While this is our first release, we believe our system is a logical,
flexible, and exciting way to manage scientific heroes in RPG games, so it
could change the world of fantasy gaming and become a useful resource for any
new RPG player.  


The main risks for this project are the possible eventualities in the game
system, but we've been very attentive to detail and we want to keep this way in
case something else fails.
We'll go into an extended game testing period before releasing the game, so
players can tell us about any adjustments we can make to the final version. Likewise,
we want to keep working in the book after release using the forums as a means of
contact and feedback.That way, we'll be able to provide readers with revisions for any flaw, and if it
becomes necessary, a fully revisited edition of the book will be free for our
backers. 


Even if you're not familiar with role-playing games, you can help us to
fulfill our dream. Do you know anyone who could be interested? Please tell them
about our project, we'll be very grateful!










(For English information, go the top of the page)

story:
With a shared love of the wizarding community, we have created a brand new party game called "Wizard's Duel".

Most full contact games land in the realm of sportsball, live action roleplay (LARP), or other such entertainments.

We at Broken Iron Productions have brought tabletop gaming to life with the fun and interactivity of live duels.  Combining the strategy of card and tabletop gaming with the theatrics of LARPing is now our signature play theme.

While it can be played as a tabletop match, our favorite method is in the manner of a true duel.  The Duelist facing the Opponent, with or without Seconds at the ready, in case of sudden death or disqualification.

We have the idea, and it's already got a great following all across the US.  With your help, we can make this dream a reality for people all over the world to enjoy...together.  There's nothing quite like the joy of play, and we invite you to join our circle.  Even the smallest donation will get us closer to realizing this dream, and posting this link on your social media, tagging your wizarding friends and Pages will help bring this game worldwide!

All wands are handcrafted and decorated, as are the wand cases, quills and other wizarding supplies.  The spellcards are all our inventions, with all-original artwork.  The cards are professionally printed with deck boxes and instructions.  T-shirts, decals and tabletop mats are professionally printed by our friends at AardvarkTees.com.  Everything is made in the USA.

Wands, quills and other wizarding supplies can be custom-ordered at Broken Iron Anvil Smithy, our Etsy shop.
