story:
About This Campaign

Hello! My name is Daniel Williams and I’m a husband, father, and app developer. I’ve been in the mobile space for a few years and along the way, I’ve made a few games for Android and iOS. When I started my mobile adventure, I noticed there was a lack of good quality game assets that were freely available. While this didn’t stop me from pursuing the mobile space, this was a hindrance because I didn’t have the graphical assets to take my games from being ugly pieces of art to something awesome.

With your help, I want to create a tool that will provide a one-stop shop resource for game developers everywhere. This one-stop shop will provide royalty free graphics that include backgrounds, UI interfaces, buttons, coins, powerups, and other common game elements. Additionally, I will create a way for you to create 2d sprite sheets. Imagine being able to select a character skin, such as an orc or dwarf, a costume, and a weapon and then being able to download a walking, running, attacking, dying 2d sprite sheet.

I want to create this tool because I believe it will change the lives of game developers everywhere. Your funding will go towards the creation of this one-stop shop resource. 


What I Need & What Everyone Gets

This tool is broken down into two major parts – Game Graphics and an Online Sprite Sheet Creator.

Part 1 – Download Common Game Elements

In part 1, this online tool will offer the option to download and use royalty free common game elements such as user interface graphics, game backgrounds, icons, and other common in-game elements. Some example of these assets would include buttons, backgrounds, coins, crates, barrels, and treasure chests.

Below are two examples of user interface kits that you would be able to download and use. Every interface kit would come as separated .jpg and .png files so all you'll need to do is drop them in your game.

UI Kit Examples

Part 2 – An Online Sprite Sheet Creator

In addition to getting access to common game elements, you’ll have access to an exclusive online sprite sheet creation tool. This tool will allow anyone to easily create a sprite sheet for his or her next game.

The online tool will ask you to choose a character skin, a costume, and a weapon to generate a unique sprite sheet. Once you're done, you'll get a fully loaded sprite sheet that will come with walking, running, attacking, blocking, jumping, dying, and a few more animations. A tool like this is a game changer for the game development industry.

Sprite Creation Process

To give you an idea of the possibilities, if I created 10 skins, 10 costumes, and 10 weapons, game developers around the globe would have access to 10,000 possible character combinations. Imagine the games that could be created with these graphics!

The online sprite sheet creator will not require the use of Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, or another graphics editing program. You’ll just need to point, click and download.

Character Design Examples


The Impact

This campaign is for fully fledged user interface designs, game backgrounds, parallax backgrounds, user interface elements, and a whole lot of sprite sheet choices. These great looking and quality graphic assets will have a positive effect on the game industry because more people will be able to create more games at a lower cost. Instead of worrying about the cost of graphics, developers can shift their focus to the game play mechanics to make their game more fun and even innovate with new game genres.

Parallax Background Example


Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges for this project is purely time based. I’ll be handling the development of the website and the online interface for creating sprite sheets.

While this is being developed, the real challenge will be preparing the graphics for the online tool. Creating individual GUI elements and other standard items won’t be a problem. The real issue will be making sure that I get enough skins, costumes, and weapons designed for the online tool.

If there are any setbacks during this project, I am committing myself to keeping every backer updated on progress, good or bad, for the duration of this project.

Potential stretch goals for this project would include even more character designs and even royalty free music.


Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes, people want to help, but they cannot commit to monetary contribution. We’ve all been there, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! You can help change the face of game development by getting the word out to people you know that may be able to help.

Or, if you would like to graphics in this new one-stop shop, please let me know! I would love to have as many assets on here as possible. This will not take away from my commitment to this campaign if funded. If anything, this will the tool even better.

Thank you for taking the time to take a look at my campaign. I sincerely hope you decide to support it any way you can! I look forward to changing the face of the game development industry with you!


tl;dr

This campaign if for an online tool that will allow game developers to download and use royalty free graphics.


Sprite Sheet Example

story:
Start with a stare down!

Don't peep! Okay?


Be prepared for a surprise!


Good job son! Give praises!


Bring a quiet family member out of their shell!


See a side of them you’ve never seen before!


Oh, don't look away!


Together we are the BEST FAMILY FOREVER!


Full video below


                                                     







                                       


We wanted to put this project on Indiegogo, because it’s the quickest way for us to get the game into your hands, make improvements as a community, and spread the love and the importance of family bonding around the globe. We are keeping the perks as simple as possible to minimize wait time. More perks will be added as we progress. We think this game is great, but we need more people to join us in making it better. Take this chance—join us in our achievements and start posting sweet moments with your loved ones. 

                                     


                                                              



Development of the game is simple: it’s just a card game with added physical actions. We gathered the foremost scientifically proven beneficial actions that would create positive connections between people. But we have a bigger dream. We intend to create the ultimate universal family card game! How? We want all of you SUPPORTERS from around the world to provide us with the kind of actions that YOU would do to bond with your family. Let’s work together to make this dream come true!


  

Why are there superhero characters?

BFF is a superhero themed family card game. We infused the daily happenings of family life with superheroic abilities and comical artwork. 

Who is printing the card game?

We have already contacted Admagic for the best fulfillment and card quality. 

Does shipping includes VAT, Handling, ETC?

Yep. The shipping price is all inclusive. We don’t want any surprise costs to show up with your package. 

I noticed only four roles, what if i'm a family of five?

You could simply combine two decks and play! Team up battle royal style and fight for victory to become King or Queen! Pretty sure it will be awesome. 

                                                           OR

Four new roles, each with a different set of abilities are unlockable through our achievement section!

                                                           OR

Role cards can be used for added strategy, but the game is playable with or without roles.

What does it mean to becoming King/Queen when you win?

The winner should get special treatment for winning! It’s entirely up to you to decide what this entails. You could make up new rules, or you could ask your mom to cook your favorite meal (and she could flatly refuse)!

PS: Winner status ends when a new round begins. 

Why is it HAIRloom instead of HEIRloom?

A little perspective, like a little humor, goes a long way!

What are “Brutal,” “Romance,” and “Pure Evil”?

They are stretch goals for the friends deck! You guys can help us by suggesting physical actions that you want to see in the friends deck and together we will create make it the best it can be!

What if i got other question?

We would love to hear your feedback!




For more information about the game: www.bestfamilyforever.net (Please bear with us as we put our heart and soul into this campaign)

story:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

"I’m genuinely excited at the idea of trying this" - Gamezebo

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


ARE YOU MAKING CATS EAT POOP???

No. (They do that all on their own.)

Eat Poop You Cat is a mobile game, inspired by the parlour games of the French Surrealist movement, that involves bizarre drawings, word play, and perhaps more insight into your friends' heads than you bargained for! And with so many of today's games focusing on competition and high scores, Eat Poop You Cat instead focuses on fun, creativity, and collaboration.


The Game

Eat Poop You Cat originated as a party game played with pencil and paper. We want to make it into a mobile game, so you can play wherever you want, whenever you want, with whomever you want!

Here's how it'll work:

  • You sign into the app with your Facebook account, and then pick a handful of Facebook friends that you want to play with.
  • When the game begins, everyone starts by writing a sentence or phrase for the next player to try to draw. This phrase can be anything you think up! 

  • Once you've done that, the text you wrote will be sent to another player in the game, and someone else's text will be sent to you! When this happens, it'll be your turn to draw something that describes what they wrote!

  • When you send your drawing off, it's then the next player's turn to write something that describes your drawing, but without knowing what the text was that inspired it!

  • Then the next player has to make a drawing based on that text, and so on and so on. Write, draw, write, draw, etc. At each stage, the initial sentence gets more and more confused, and the drawings get more and more ridiculous!

  • Once your initial phrase has gone through 10 iterations of this, the game ends, and everyone gets to see the entire sequence of phrases and pictures from start to finish! At that point, you can share your favorite drawings on social media!

And that's the whole game! There are no winners or losers, just surreal drawings and funny phrases!


The History

The history of Eat Poop You Cat is shrouded myths and legends, but Eat Poop You Cat, LLC's resident amateur historian (myself), believes that it probably has its roots in the surrealist parlour games of the early 20th century, such as Consequences and Exquisite Corpse. And like "Exquisite Corpse", the name "Eat Poop You Cat" probably arose from the game itself. Exquisite Corpse got its name from the first time the game was played, in Paris, c. 1925, wherefrom arose the phrase, "Le cadavre exquis boira le vin nouveau." ("The exquisite corpse shall drink the new wine.") Simone Collinet described the scene in 1968:

It was during one of those idle and tedious evenings, frequent at that time - contrary to subsequent descriptions which benefit from hindsight - that the Exquisite Corpse was invented.

Someone said: 'How about playing Consequences? That's entertaining.' So we played the traditional game of Consequences. Monsieur meets Madame, he says to her, and so on. But not for long. The game rapidly became something else. 'Just write down anything at all', Prévert suggested.

In the next round, the Exquisite Corpse was born. From Prévert's pen, as a matter of fact, for he wrote the first words, so perfectly complemented by those following; one wrote: 'shall drink the new'; the next: 'wine'.

Once their imagination was let loose, it couldn't be stopped. André exclaimed with delight and immediately saw in it one of those wellsprings or natural outpourings of inspiration he so loved to discover. A torrent was unleashed.

Even more reliably than with automatic writing, one was sure of jarring amalgams. Violent surprises prompted admiration, laughter, and stirred an unquenchable craving for new images - images inconceivable to one brain alone - born from the involuntary, unconscious and unpredictable mixing of three or four heterogeneous minds. Some sentences took on an aggressively subversive existence. Others veered into an excessive absurdity. The wastepaper basket played its part. One tends to forget that.

The fact remains that the suggestive power of these arbitrary juxtapositions of words was so startling and dazzling and validated Surrealist theories and inclinations in such a striking way that the game became a system, a method of research, a means of exaltation and stimulus, a mine, a treasure-trove and finally, perhaps, a drug.

[From Surrealist Games, Alastair Brotchie, 1995]

The exquisite corpses of Simone Collinet, André Breton, and Jacques Prévert have declined our request for comments, but we believe they would favor what we undertake here: to bring that craving for inconceivable images and subversive juxtapositions of words to new, even more heterogeneous minds.


The Money

Perhaps the most important questions in crowdfunding are, "why are you asking for our money?" and, "what will you do with it?" Here're my answers. I'm asking for your money because, while I happen to be an experienced programmer, I'm not qualified to make a robust, polished mobile app.

I initially attempted to create this game all on my own. I spent a few weeks coding a prototype backend in Scala and ran it on Heroku. But then I got stuck. I'm a pretty competent backend engineer, but user interfaces and graphic design are complete mysteries to me, as the months I spent banging my head on the wall trying to create a serviceable android frontend can attest.

Now, with more time and effort, I might have been able to eek out something functional. But in the marketplace for mobile games, functional just doesn't cut it. If I want anyone to actually give this game a second glance, it has to work great, and look spiffy. And the best way for me to make that happen, is to pay some real professionals with proven track records.

That's where Zapporoo comes in. I contacted a few freelancers and several companies who were in the business of building mobile apps, and Zappooroo is the company I settled on. Their services include programming the full application stack, for iOS and Android, and covering the costs and responsibilities of hosting the app's backend for the first full year.

Having never built something quite like this before, I felt it was important to get this high level of professional help. If I overestimate my abilities, if I bite off more than I can chew, and the app turns into an unreliable mess, it will never take off. I've seen too many apps fail that way.

So I talked with the people at Zaporoo about my idea, and they loved it! I spent a few thousand dollars of my own money on the initial design phase, and everything they've shown me looks great, and has convinced me that they understand the game itself, and how best to bring it to market.

Now it's time to move forward with actually building the app, but the $20,000 price tag is out of reach for me to fund personally.  So that's why I'm turning to the crowdfunding community for help!

I've been a fan of crowdfunding for years, and I've personally pledged more than $8,500 to hundreds of different projects. I've seen the power crowdfunding has to build communities, to help creators connect to their patrons, to and bring fabulous new ideas to life. I can't tell you how excited I am to see that magic happen with a project of my very own!

Cheers, friends! And thank you so much for your help!


Risks and challenges

The first and most obvious risk is that we fail to raise enough money.  I might be able to bring the price down by cutting corners or scrapping features, but I don't want to do that.  I want to bring you the best possible version of the game.  So any money I can't raise here will have to be raised either from my personal savings or through loans.  I'm pretty relentless and I have no intention of abandoning this project before it's even had the chance to thrive, so I plan to make the money happen one way or another. But depending on how much money remains to be raised after the campaign, it may cause delays to my expected delivery dates.

Another risk for this project is that, once the game is complete, it will fail to find a significant audience. If we raise the money, Zapporoo will cover the cost of server time, disk space, and bandwidth for the first year. After that, the hope is that the costs can be covered with advertisements and in-app purchases. However, if the game doesn't acquire a large enough audience, and loses money at a rate greater than what I can personally cover, I will have to shut it down. I truly believe that Eat Poop You Cat has the potential to become wildly popular, and I'm willing to put my money on the line for that.  I plan to promote the game with ads on Google and Facebook, through social media such as Twitter and Instagram, and on any gaming blogs or reviews sites that will listen to me. However, because of the social nature of the game itself, I'm hoping that our biggest source of promotion will be word-of-mouth: friends inviting their friends to play!

The other potential risk is that Zapporoo will fail to produce a satisfactory game. Since I'm not producing the game myself, I don't have complete control over the outcome. However, Zapporoo has a strong portfolio of successful past projects. (https://zapporoo.com/portfolio.html) And working with them on the initial design phase has me convinced that they share my vision for the game, and are capable to take direction when necessary. So I don't believe there is a significant risk of them producing an unacceptable product.

Having never built something quite like this before, I felt it was important to get this high level of professional help. If I overestimate my abilities, if I bite off more than I can chew, and the app turns into an unreliable mess, it will never take off. I've seen too many apps fail that way.
So I talked with the people at Zaporoo about my idea, and they loved it! I spent a few thousand dollars of my own money on the initial design phase, and everything they've shown me looks great, and has convinced me that they understand the game itself, and how best to bring it to market.

Eat Poop You Cat - Blueprint Diagram
Now it's time to move forward with actually building the app, but the $20,000 price tag is out of reach for me to fund personally.  So that's why I'm turning to the crowdfunding community for help!
I've been a fan of crowdfunding for years, and I've personally pledged more than $8,500 to hundreds of different projects. I've seen the power crowdfunding has to build communities, to help creators connect to their patrons, to and bring fabulous new ideas to life. I can't tell you how excited I am to see that magic happen with a project of my very own!
Cheers, friends! And thank you so much for your help!

Risks and challengesThe first and most obvious risk is that we fail to raise enough money.  I might be able to bring the price down by cutting corners or scrapping features, but I don't want to do that.  I want to bring you the best possible version of the game.  So any money I can't raise here will have to be raised either from my personal savings or through loans.  I'm pretty relentless and I have no intention of abandoning this project before it's even had the chance to thrive, so I plan to make the money happen one way or another. But depending on how much money remains to be raised after the campaign, it may cause delays to my expected delivery dates.Another risk for this project is that, once the game is complete, it will fail to find a significant audience. If we raise the money, Zapporoo will cover the cost of server time, disk space, and bandwidth for the first year. After that, the hope is that the costs can be covered with advertisements and in-app purchases. However, if the game doesn't acquire a large enough audience, and loses money at a rate greater than what I can personally cover, I will have to shut it down. I truly believe that Eat Poop You Cat has the potential to become wildly popular, and I'm willing to put my money on the line for that.  I plan to promote the game with ads on Google and Facebook, through social media such as Twitter and Instagram, and on any gaming blogs or reviews sites that will listen to me. However, because of the social nature of the game itself, I'm hoping that our biggest source of promotion will be word-of-mouth: friends inviting their friends to play!The other potential risk is that Zapporoo will fail to produce a satisfactory game. Since I'm not producing the game myself, I don't have complete control over the outcome. However, Zapporoo has a strong portfolio of successful past projects. (https://zapporoo.com/portfolio.html) And working with them on the initial design phase has me convinced that they share my vision for the game, and are capable to take direction when necessary. So I don't believe there is a significant risk of them producing an unacceptable product.

story:
Aderyn’s Cradle ("Cradle" for short) is the next step in fantasy first-person RPG gameplay. You are the Oracle, the last link to a long-lost god. Your adventure through the Cradle will force you to grapple the polarizing forces of the Holy Trifecta:  humanity, nature and the gods. Throughout your journey, you will uncover the history of Aderyn’s Cradle piece by piece through completing quests and puzzles, fighting anomalies, and exploring the natural world and intricate ruins of the Aderian civilization. To complete your mission, you must harness the power of the five forces through Mana, the lifeblood of Anora, in order to perform powerful magic. Along the way, you will fight the corrupted creatures who would use these same forces against you. Together with the Guides, you will ultimately bring Aderyn’s Cradle back to Anora and restore balance to the lost land.

Cradle will immerse you in smooth, realistic, intuitive combat, so that progression through our intellectually rich and emotionally resonant narrative campaign is as exciting as can be. We don’t just want you to buy our game; we want you enjoy it enough to play from start to finish, and again, and again, until you’ve experienced every piece of the lore, the environment, and their rewards.

This project is an ambitious one for an independent studio with no large backers, which can only offer royalty checks and company shares as compensation for the hard work of creating this game. In order to meet the goal of a 2017 release, we must succeed through crowdfunding alone at this early stage of production. Nonetheless, production will not halt even if our crowdfunders do not meet their bottom line. Thanks to the dedication of the core team of Mojo's leaders, and their determination to see this project through, production will continue on the face of financial setbacks. Without proper funding, however, the pace of production will be slow, and the 2017 release surely pushed back.

We won’t cut any corners, nor settle for a minimum viable product. Our goal,  In short, is to bring you the very best of everything, from visuals and mechanics to story and sound. We are a company made for gamers, by gamers. With Cradle, we aim not just to create something fun, but to drive the medium of videogames forward as an art form. We hope you’ll share our vision!

Basics:

  • Planned platforms: PC
  • Release date: Fall 2017 on all platforms 
  • Approximate campaign runthrough time: 15-25 hours (speed run), 30-60 hours (average run)
  • Available modes: Single-player campaign, two-player co-op campaign, multiplayer arena


Aderyn’s Cradle is a first-person action/adventure role playing game (RPG) with a unique combat system. There will be six weapons available for each of the five character classes, and each weapon has a unique set of attacks. This grants each class a well-rounded strategic toolbox to set up a multitude of combos and fighting styles suited for the player’s chosen character class. A large variety of possible battlefield scenarios exist in Cradle. An intuitive, yet intricate aiming/blocking/parrying system prevents fighting from becoming monotonous and repetitive, even allowing the player to throw fakes like a true duelist. 


On top of all of this, Aderyn’s Cradle features a groundbreaking, fast-paced system for melee combat called RealFight Combat™. The system uses deterministic animations, which execute different animation sequences depending on where the player aims on an opponent, and what type of opponent is being faced. The amount of damage dealt is dependent on the location of a successful strike rather than randomly generated values. The system is easy to pick up, but challenging to master. 

Combat in Cradle requires the use of strategically applied augments (weapon and armor upgrades), weapon choices, attacks, and movements. Augments will be unlocked as the player progresses through the game. Weapon and armor customization through augmentation keeps fighting visually stunning and makes it a magical experience. 

This is going to be a lot of fun!


Weapon augments are an essential part of both progression and combat in Aderyn’s Cradle. They link together the powers of humanity, nature and the gods to increase a weapon’s strength. Weapon augments may be acquired through the discovery of secrets, puzzle-solving, or defeating powerful enemies. The different types of augments are representative of the five forces of Anora. Up to five augments can be applied to each weapon. Effects of augments are permanent. Augments have three different levels which determine their strengths and grant special abilities.

A sample Fire Augment sequence for the Druid’s Healing Staff. Level 1 increases hit damage with the weapon. Level 2 increases hit damage further, and adds a damage over time effect to attacks. Level 3 increases all weapon damage, and causes single target attacks to include an area of effect burn on every second attack.


The premise is simple: each character has a base level of armor to defend against physical and magical damage. In Aderyn’s Cradle, all armor consists of five different attributes that contribute to the abilities of the player’s character. These attributes are:

  • Physical Resistance: The player’s immunity to physical harm.

  • Magic Resistance: The player’s immunity to magic and poison.

  • Swiftness: The amount of energy consumed by the player’s movement.

  • Stability: The ability of the player to withstand knockback, stun, and staggering blows.

  • Stealth: The ability of the player to go unnoticed and undetected.

These attributes can be strengthened through the use of Armor Augments, which are materials acquired by the player and applied to a set or portion of armor, causing it to increase in stats. Armor changes in appearance depending on what stats the player chooses to upgrade. All characters start with different base levels of each attribute depending on the player’s chosen class.


Medica is the alchemy system of Cradle. Our aim in making it an intuitive, easy-to-use system is to add extra incentive to exploring our rich open world. Ingredients are found throughout the four open worlds in a variety of physical forms. When picked up, they’re stored in an ingredients pouch alongside bandages. They come in the many forms of useful stones, liquids, species of plants, fungi, and creatures which can all be harvested and stored in inventory. Solvents are liquids only, and are gathered in a waterskin; up to three can be carried at a time. To create a salve, the player combines the ingredient(s) and the solvent in a mortar and pestle, and then heats the mixture over a flame. Discovering effective combinations of ingredients and finding the right recipes is key to taking advantage of the Medica system's full potential.

Medica allows for the crafting of two types of salves. The ingredient list determines the type of salve and its effects, while the solvent used determines its power level. Regeneration (regen) salves are consumed in-combat to restore depleted resources such as health or stamina. Stat salves are consumed to provide permanent boons to player attributes, such as health regeneration or fall damage reduction.

Regen salves can serve to restore either health or stamina. They are prepared in advance, applied to bandages, and made available for the player to consume at any time, even in the midst of combat. When crafting Regen Salves, only one ingredient and one solvent will be used for each. The ingredient determines which type of salve is being crafted and the base potency of the salve. The solvent acts to multiply the base potency as determined by the ingredient. The overall level of the salve is calculated by multiplying the base potency of the ingredient by the multiplicative potency of the solvent.


Stat salves yield permanent buffs to the player, and are best used as soon as they’re made.  Their ingredients are very rare, and far greater in variety than regen salves. Some grant special abilities, like underwater breathing. Ingredients do not help determine potency as with regen salves; instead, they determine type. Some will be swallowed, others rubbed on, and yet others will be consumed by other methods of ingestion. The recipes for these stat salves will be imparted via scrolls, Guides, and other sources of information in-game.


The Oracle is the only human in the world capable of hearing Aderyn’s voice in a clear, real way. Aderyn (aka The Maker, aka Deity of Hands, aka One Who Moves the Heavens, aka Master of Craft and Light) is only able to communicate abstractly with every one of his other followers. No matter how devout or willing they are, they can never understand Aderyn and be as intimately connected with them as you are; even though when the campaign begins, you don’t even know Their name. This is why They are able to guide you so readily through the steps you must take. When They speak, it is like a voice coming from somewhere deep within yourself you cannot reach or control. The Voice of Aderyn comes when you need it; it’s silent when you don't.

In the ages before the Soulfire Crisis, the Oracle was the supreme spiritual leader of the land; a person revered as the direct voice of Aderyn on Earth. She or he acted as ambassador between humanity and the gods for the Aderian people and was, as a result, the single most powerful individual in the Cradle. Once identified and anointed into their sacred, sovereign role, oracles served until their death. Each  oracle was said to be a craftsman who embodies the traits of Aderyn most: free will, creativity, and perfected skill. The Oracle wears a sacred textile, said to be spun by the Maker Them-self. The player uses this cloth as a medium through which the energies of the Holy Trifecta (gods/humanity/nature) can be channelled to make weapon upgrades. 

Through the game’s highly responsive movement and combat system, the player will be able to truly feel like a relentless Swordsman, nimble Ranger, daunting Paladin, dynamic Druid, or devastating Arcanist. Players may choose to play as either a male or a female character, no matter which class is picked. Each class has a unique movement pace, designed to compliment their various combat styles. Each class also has their own unique type of armor, and each armor type can be customized and augmented by the player to enhance their stats.


The Druid seeks balance and communion with nature, preferring the company of the rugged wilds to “civilized” society. As the Druid, your finely toned muscles and self awareness give you the capability to render powerful strikes, while your unique understanding of the living world allows you to use nature to your advantage. Using vines to ensnare, drag, throw and travel, the Druid can manipulate the battlefield by summoning forth life-giving energies to self-heal, and growth to cause plants to grow and retaliate against the corrupted foes of humanity and nature. The Druid can also call upon the spirits of the local wildlife, allowing them to see through the eyes of a chosen beast and use it as a conduit for destroying the desecrators of the wilds. Not only can the Druid call upon animals to fight, they can even become one. 


Arsenal:

  • Walking Staff of Healing (ThirdStaff, as seen in video)
  • Life Vine & Rock Fist
  • Lute of Life 
  • Bear Fang (Gauntlets)
  • Spirit Talisman 
  • Soothsayer's Truncheon (Quarterstaff)

The Walking Staff of Healing with Fire Augment

At home in the shadows, the Ranger is inspired by ninjas and marksmen. Wielding a combination of bows, glaives, small daggers and other unique projectiles, the Ranger takes down enemies from afar before even being spotted. Once assaulted, the Ranger quickly switches to use dual daggers, and goes about dispatching enemies in close range with ease, darting across the battlefield. As the Ranger, you will possess quick reflexes and unparalleled speed, enabling you to run circles around enemies, spreading death wherever you step. The tradeoff is that you won't take damage very well.

Always being one for speed and agility over strength, the Ranger thrives in the fast pace and adrenaline of combat. As they dodge more attacks, and score hit after hit at fast pace, the Ranger becomes increasingly focused. Eventually, they fall into a deadly cadence, allowing them to ignore both pain and fatigue, and experience infinite stamina.


Arsenal:

  • Luna & Corona (Twin Dirks, as seen in video)
  • The Astral Bow(Composite Bow)
  • The Hornets Needles (Throwing Knives) 
  • Tufaan Arsenal (Spore Bombs)
  • The Dancing Blades (Bouncing Glaives)
  • Perfect Thunder (Crystal Long Bow, as seen in video)

Perfect Thunder

Luna & Corona

The Paladin is an indomitable force on the battlefield. With strength unparalleled, they move slowly, conviction in every ground-shaking step. As the Paladin, you will down foes with heavy strikes using large one- and two-handed weapons. Being a defender of the weak, it is only fitting that you wield large shields in addition to heavy weapons, and focus on repelling enemy attacks before launching your own devastating blows. With such large weapons and shields, overwhelming to the average obstacle, the Paladin’s strikes send enemies flying, or leave them stunned and vulnerable.

Wading straight into the midst of battles others might evade, the Paladin thrives off of the ability to prevent and block enemy attacks. With every attack blocked, the Paladin gains confidence, building up to become an unstoppable force (for a time).


Arsenal:

  • Mother's Benediction (Axe & Shield)
  • Gauntlets of Conviction
  • Spirit of the Serpent (Halberd)
  • The Heart of Gold (Two Handed Shield)
  • Undying Faith (Heavy Hammer, Light Shield)
  • Fist of the Maker (2- Handed Hammer)

Thriving in close quarters combat, the Swordsman dual wields slicing, piercing weapons and uses maneuverable two handers to slay foes with abandon. With a powerful shout, the swordsman will rush even the most dangerous of foes with a powerful battle charge.

As a Swordsman, you ignore pain, thriving on every hit an enemy throws at you, especially when you take only light damage. With every hit scored, the Swordsman’s rage increases, making their hits increasingly damaging, and eventually entering an enraged bloodlust. When in this state, the Swordsman gains health with every enemy slain.


Arsenal:

  • The Frozen Two-Hander (Two-Handed Sword)
  • The Sword & Shield of Rolling Hill (Light Shield, Medium Sword, as seen in video)
  • Kiha's Blades (Double Axes)
  • The River's Claws (Light Saber, Dirk)
  • The Convert's Resolve (Hand Glaives)
  • The Maker's Fangs (Double Spears, can combine)

The Sword & Shield of Rolling Hill

Master of the magical arts, the Arcanist uses superior intellect and the power of their weapons to bend the five forces of the world to their will. With terrifying displays of power, the Arcanist strikes fear into the hearts of foes great and little. The Arcanist thrives on this fear which serves to fuel her determination to win, turning her into a catalyst for destruction. If you’re looking for a class able to defeat several enemies in a single, well-placed blow, the Arcanist is for you!

The Arcanist is righteous and cold, using calculated strategies to manipulate the battlefield. Causing confusion and chaos enables the Arcanist to move in and finish foes with quick slashes of a sword, or to create space if they get too close. The Arcanist is not only a living artillery, able to down targets from a distance, they are also a stealthy assassin. Both of these characteristics are integral parts to the Arcanist's prowess in battle.


Arsenal:

  • Sword & Staff of Light (Medium Sword, Staff)
  • Frost Fingers & Typhoon Stick
  • Emberstone & Glacial Core
  • Hand of Life & Dagger of Decay
  • Meteorite Codex
  • ???

In ages past, the world of Anora was home to five Cradles. Each of the five deities ruled their own Cradle.

Aderyn is the deity of hands, craft and Light Force.

Nitima is the deity of heart, passion, and Fire Force.

Ostia is the deity of mouth, hunger, and Life Force.

Ryphae is the deity of brain, intellect, and Stone Force.

Acie is the deity of eyes, perception, and Fluid Force.

The Five Gods shaped their lands, their respective Cradles, in unique ways. They fashioned their followers’ societies in ways that satisfied their own selfish pleasures. They cared little for the quality of the lives that their human followers led, only that they remained great in number; for a God’s power is drawn from the number of its followers. The one exception to this divine selfishness was Aderyn. Aderyn took pleasure in watching the humans build, and was proud of their creations and artwork. He discovered that the individual will of the humans was stronger than that imparted to them by external pressure and decided to nurture it, not challenge it. With his Force of Light, he lit the soulfires, divinely-imbued lanterns in his temples which housed the energy of ancestors' souls, giving humans free will, intuition, and inspiration to create. Aderians became renowned as master craftsmen. With the soulfires’ light gleaming like beacons over Anora, many foreigners began to flock to Aderyn’s Cradle and turn away from their original gods. Their influence gaining, Aderyn’s followers began to carry his charm, a round and bright jewel that signified their god’s will guiding their path.

Aderyn’s siblings seethed with jealousy as they watched his followers swell in number. Hastily, they decided to join forces and overthrow their sibling. Thus began the Soulfire Crisis, an event which changed Anora forever.

A massive battle ensued between the followers of Aderyn and those of the other four deities. As the blood of the faithful Aderians soaked the soil of their Cradle, the Jealous Four sensed Aderyn's power wane. Their divine smiting decimated the Aderian population. Their plan was working. Soon, Aderyn would be weak enough to defeat.

Those of Aderyn’s loyal people who did not perish outright suffered an even crueler fate: they were twisted and corrupted, painfully separated from their own humanity, so that only their altered bodies remained as the rest of their humanity was consumed.

Showing no mercy, the Jealous Four divided Aderyn’s Cradle, one piece for each, warping and twisting it into an aberration of its former beauty, altering the creatures into monsters, destroying countless wonders of craftsmanship built by Aderians. Finally, they extinguished the hated soulfires, destroying Aderyn’s last link with Their beloved people. To ensure Aderyn’s permanent defeat, the Four trapped him in a great citadel, located at the heart of his land, and together banished Aderyn’s Cradle to another plane of existence. All that remains to commemorate Aderyn’s lost land is a great gaping crater in the face of Anora, an example of what happens should anyone defy the will of the gods. 



The serene and grandiose Cathedral of Aderyn acts as the hub level and home base of the player’s journey. It contains a workshop for armor augments, a library for accessing discovered lore, a crafting station for medica, and portals to each of the four open worlds. As beautiful as it is mysterious, the Cathedral also contains special areas of its own, waiting to be explored.


The Titanwood lines the border between Ostia’s Cradle and where Aderyn’s Cradle once lay in the world before being banished to the Metaspace. Ostia’s Life Force has caused the trees here to grow abnormally tall, and the forest to overflow with organisms. Once you depart your village, you must flee through this land to reach Aderyn’s shrine, so that Aderyn can transport you to the ruined Cradle.  


The Icelands are one of the four open worlds of Aderyn’s Cradle. In the northernmost reaches of the Cradle lay the Icelands, home to glacial caverns, snow-capped peaks, active volcanoes and hot springs. The Aderians who lived here studied the advantages of geothermal technology, and made themselves expert engineers. They were famous for crafting ways to use the natural heat of volcanoes to power their formidable forges in the pursuit of craft to honor Aderyn. Even before the Crisis, this unforgiving environment proved challenging for all but the most rugged lifeforms. 


Now, the land is razed by Nitima’s Fire Force. Areas of extreme heat and chill tear the countryside apart with abyssal rifts, constructing a myriad of natural obstacles to surmount. Gargantuan fields of lava and active volcanoes now dominate the scenic expanses of mountain tundra, where the highest peaks in the Cradle contrast with abyssal moulins cut deep in the permafrost. The player must beat back Nitima’s corruption in this hazardous environment of ice and fire!


The Bayou is one of the four open worlds of Aderyn’s Cradle. Before the Soulfire Crisis, the Bayou was a dense fungal forest and a thriving ecosystem, populated by enormous mushrooms, strange plants and large, exotic insects. It was home to bustling centers of trade, and the wilderness overflowed with precious materials ripe for collection. Among the most valuable were the unusual woods which come from the trunks of fungal trees.  Diverse groups of merchants, craftsmen, and tradesmen from all over Anora gathered in its bustling towns to peddle their wares. During the Crisis, the land was smote by Ostia’s Life force. 

The Bayou in ruins has been twisted by overgrowth, with every creature, fungus, and fungal plant competing for survival. Human ruins have been totally reclaimed by natural forces, and fungus covers every available surface. Once-docile creatures have been transformed into formidable monstrosities, like the Swamp Stalker. Though foreboding, the Bayou is sure to awaken a fervent wanderlust in you, just as for the Aderian adventurers of old who first ventured into its depths in the name of freedom and craft.



The Quarry is one of the four open worlds of Aderyn’s Cradle. The lush and expansive forest of the Quarry once contained a variety of plants, wildlife, and some of the most prosperous industrial regions known to Anora. Following the Soulfire Crisis, the deity Acie transmuted and flooded the land, corrupting it with their force of Fluid. Tropical forests shrouded in mist, waterfalls, hidden caves, flooded settlements and mines can all be explored in this environment. 

Remnants of broken-down machinery, pools of water tinted orange with rust, and small mining hamlets populate the mountains and valleys. Eroding gear and pulley systems that were once used for hoisting large rocks and minerals out of the ground will serve as tools for environment-based puzzles, and can be exploited creatively in combat.


The Desert is one of the four open worlds of Aderyn’s Cradle. To the far west of the Cradle lie its scorched sands, and badlands, inhabited by a mix of aquatically-influenced plants and animals. During the Soulfire crisis, the land was smote by Ryphae’s force of Stone, causing enormous crevasses to rend the land and desiccating its already-scant water sources. The arid landscape of the Desert contains sky-high cliffs and formidable mesas with cities built through their windswept caves. Majestic Vika, pictured above, is one such city. Its citizens became famously fascinated with sound and how it bounced off rock; how it echoed deep in the caverns they called ‘home’. They carved and hung special instruments in the caverns of their city that hummed with air currents and harnessed the sounds for record keeping, entertainment, and even magic. 

Much of the sound was distorted following the Crisis, by Ryphae’s corrupting stones altering the perfectly-sculpted shapes of caves and cliffs. The player will seek clues from the past as echoes of ancient music float on howling wind.



You traverse the emptied lands of Aderyn. Having beaten your latest enemies, you rest in your sleeping sack and gaze at the stars. In this odd world, victim of divine smiting, you cannot help but wonder… Did anyone else survive?

You don’t have long to wonder. A face has appeared out of nowhere, and you are nose-to-nose with another human, the first you’ve seen in many days of fighting monsters. The seasoned survivalist crept up on you easily! “Who are you?!” You sputter, caught off-guard to find another living soul in this eerie, ethereal place.

Charon, one of the four guides you will meet in Aderyn's Cradle.


The person smiles, unable to suppress a chuckle at the look on your face. “Be at ease, Oracle, I am a priest of Aderyn. You’ve heard from Them, right?” You nod… Aderyn… Yes, that was how the voice introduced itself, the voice that’s been speaking from somewhere inside your own spirit, guiding you through the journey. “Well, They hinted that you’d be coming along. I’m to be your guide for a bit.”

“How did you live?” Until this moment, you’d been certain that you were the only human alive in all the Cradle. The wilds had long since grown over and through all the settlements you’d found, each one completely empty. At every turn, there’ve been only twisted creatures, corrupted humanoids, or harsh wilderness to greet you.

The person’s face falls, remembering all the others lost in the Soulfire Crisis.

“Well, the Maker worked wonders to keep just a handful of us alive…”

The priest recounts Aderyn’s final moments of power. Knowing that time was running out, and his siblings’ wrath would soon descend, Aderyn acted swiftly to split Their remaining essence into pieces. Four faithful followers were chosen to carry these essences, a sliver of Aderyn's power entrusted to each. They were tasked with the burden of carrying on his culture, and were the last hope that Aderyn would one day return to Anora. Anointed by Aderyn's Light, they have been made immune to the horrid magic he knew the other deities would use to twist and destroy the others, and the land itself. Aderyn promised them a savior; a new Oracle who would bring the Cradle out of darkness. Since the Soulfire Crisis, the four priests have been living in the desolate Cradle, patiently and faithfully awaiting the player’s arrival.

These chosen priests, known to the player as the Guides, are the only four humans the player will meet in the entire game. The Guides are sources of quests, weapons, and an immense wealth of knowledge concerning the past and present of the Cradle. From them you’ll receive an abundance of informative lore, important resources, witty quips and good cooking!

Anora is the world in which Aderyn’s Cradle is set. The Five main types of mana correlate to the Five main forces; the energetic signatures that make up all matter in Anora. These forces are harnessed by the player to produce special effects on the player's weapons, and power magic-based attacks. These five forces are the energies that make up the world of Anora and provide the energy of its existence.

  • Life: The lifeforce of all living things in the land. It is the pulse of Anora.

 In the absence of Life is Decay.

  • Fire: The force of heat and flame. It is the radiant energy of Anora.

 In the absence of Fire is Chill.

  • Light: The force of pure energy that fills the void. It is the spiritual strength of Anora.

 In the absence of Light is Darkness.

  • Fluid: The force of liquids and gases. It is the ebbing and flowing energy of Anora.

 In the absence of Fluid is Stillness.

  • Stone: The force of all the land. It is the material strength of Anora.

 In the absence of Stone is Disintegration, or space.

The Mana carrier, also functions as a torch.

Here are just a few examples of imbalanced conditions in the land where mana can be found:

A large forest fire ravaged a partition of the Bayou causing much death and destruction of living organisms. Because of the sudden imbalance, Life Mana begins to seep from the land.The corruption of Nitima spawned a fissure of lava to form in the Icelands. Because of now-extreme heat of the area, Fire mana continuously bleeds from the opening, around the steady lava flow.

A devastating mudslide caused deforestation in a segment of the Quarry. The massive release of energy exerted in the disaster, Stone Mana accumulates in the central area of impact.


There are various types and forms of Kami in Aderyn’s Cradle. In essence, they are the physical manifestations of any one of the Five Forces. They are created from the collective consciousness of either a single species or an entire biome. The species (or biome) must come into contact with mana in order to spawn a kami. The kami will be a kami of whichever Force spawned the mana, giving it not only unique abilities arising from the Force, but also a nearly indestructible physical form, both stronger and wiser than any individual of its species (or biome). Once created, they do not die or disintegrate on their own, and can exist for thousands of years. 

Aderyn's people believed the kami to be eternal, and their attitudes towards the beings ranged from reverent to superstitious to disbelieving. Druidic legends tell of kami possessing the powers of the Gods, and speculate that the human Gods, Acie, Nitima, Ostia, Ryphae and Aderyn, were born from the same forces which create kami. 


In certain areas of perpetual violent or dynamic geology/ecology, there is constantly mana bleeding in the area; this is how elementals, sometimes called "land kami" are born, some occupying Anora perpetually. A certain number of kami will always exist in areas of localized imbalance, whether from environmental phenomena, mana bleeding, or an imbalance in a population of living creatures. Some kami in-game will be enemies, while others might aid the player or remain neutral.


Anomalies are physically altered versions of natural animals and plants. They spawn when individuals are exposed to mana. Mostly, they are isolated cases. Their exposure to mana in the environment, whether sustained or instantaneous, alters their developmental patterns, causing them to develop into altered forms which can better coexist with and exploit the mutating Force. Post-Soulfire Crisis, their numbers dramatically increased in the ruined Cradle, correlating with the sudden jump in mana spawn. They are the corrupted creatures of Aderyn’s land, and most become enemies for the player to fight as they journey.

Various creatures compared to the five player classes.

The Swamp Stalker

Born of Light, God of Creation

Born of Light energy, Aderyn embodies both the momentary inspirations that drive creativity from perception, as well as the long-simmering intuitions that come to creative fruition over time. They represent both intuition and free will. Aderyn possesses and alights Their followers’ intuition; to enable this, They have buit a society that unconditionally protects free will and craft above all else. Aderyn is the deity of Creation, who creates soulfires for which humans create material containers. To inspire creativity in Aderian followers, Aderyn lit the soulfires, lights in his temples, giving men freedom and will to innovate.

A mere sliver of his essence is what had the power to teleport you all the way from your home in the real, physical realm of Ostia’s Cradle to the ethereal, cursed lands of Aderyn’s Cradle. Aderyn did this because you are the Oracle, the savior he has promised his faithful surviving followers. The Oracle is the one who will restore Aderyn's land to the world and allow Their followers and culture to one day grace Anora again.

Use of Funds

We are coming to Indiegogo to ask for funding to build a proper vertical slice of Aderyn’s Cradle which will give a more accurate view of gameplay. What will this “vertical slice” look like? It’ll be a section of our Icelands open world environment, complete with demonstrations of all main in-game elements. Through it, we will showcase our combat, weapon augment application, lore, an environment-based movement puzzle, and more!  Once this vertical slice is done, we will be expanding our crowdfunding to encompass all remaining funds needed to finish the game.

Specifically, we will be using the funds received from the current IndieGoGo campaign to create in-game assets and to compensate freelance artists for the work we need to finish the vertical slice.  Additionally, these funds will be used to cover the costs of software, technology and other enterprise applications that are needed to get the job done. 

Our plan is simple: to use the funds bestowed by all of you who are already part of the vision of Cradle to create a clear and full showing of it so as to share its vision with the rest of the gaming community and with potential investors. If we have clear communication of the game's vision alongside this key vertical slice, we are confident that we'll be able to secure the rest of the funds needed to finish Aderyn's Cradle.

Frequently Asked Questions:

1. Will Aderyn’s Cradle be released on consoles?

Due to the ease of porting Unreal 4 onto next gen consoles, we hope to release Aderyn’s Cradle on console! Most likely this will be the first stretch goal during our Kickstarter campaign or we will include it from the beginning of said campaign.


2. Will Aderyn’s Cradle be released on Mac and Linux?

Currently, we do not plan on supporting Mac or Linux.


3. What Specs will I need to run Aderyn’s Cradle?

TBA; unfortunately, it is too early in development for us to know.


4. Is there magic in Aderyn’s Cradle?

Yes, mana represents the physical manifestations of this magic, the lifeblood of Aderyn’s Cradle and the world of Anora.  The Arcanist wields the 5 forces to devastating effects, with the druid imploring nature magic.


5. Will Aderyn’s Cradle have multiplayer?

Yes.  Initially an add-on which we intended to release after the campaign, multiplayer will come with Aderyn’s Cradle, containing four game modes, CTF, Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, and King of the Hill, with two modes to play in, Ranked mode, where each class has all 6 weapons, un-augmented for serious competitive play, and an unranked mode, featuring all 6 weapons, augmentable as you choose for some fun practice or with friends.


6. Anora is a new fantasy universe of your own creation? Cool! This isn’t going to be another needlessly whitewashed world steeped in gender stereotypes, is it?

Aderyn’s Cradle is committed to avoiding whitewashing and gender stereotypes as we create Anora! We have artistic and narrative guidelines in place so that the balance of complexions, body types, ages and other physical features stays heterogenous, similar to the population of the United States, as we bring the Aderian population to life. The same goes for our characters’ other attributes. No matter how they express their sexual orientations or gender identities, we strive to both be aware of stereotypes and transcend them. All in all, our Story and Art Teams take the goals of creating a rich culture and diverse populace for Aderyn’s beloved followers seriously. This is just another measure in our goal to bring you a fantasy experience that is relatable, robust, immersive and inspiring.  


7. Will There be Occulus Rift support?

Yes!


8. When will Aderyn’s Cradle be released?

If all goes according to plan, we will release Aderyn’s Cradle about 2 years from now in Fall 2017!


9. I’ve emailed or sent a message to Mojo to see if I can work with them... But I haven’t gotten a response. :(
We appreciate your interest and support of Mojo and Aderyn’s Cradle during this crucial time! Since we are running this campaign while still working on development, please be patient as we work through this campaign. We will respond to everyone as quickly as we can. This may  not happen until the campaign is complete, but rest assured that we haven’t forgotten you!

10. I’ve noticed that after your $60 dollar reward, you don’t mention multiplayer - will it be included with the physical addition of Aderyn’s Cradle?

Yes, all those who back us here on the $60 and above will receive the multiplayer alpha when it is released and will have that updated to the full multiplayer once that is released as well via download.


 11. Can I donate to Aderyn’s Cradle via Paypal and still receive Indiegogo rewards?

Yep! Click here!
story_txt:
Aderyn’s Cradle ("Cradle" for short) is the next step in fantasy first-person RPG gameplay. You are the Oracle, the last link to a long-lost god. Your adventure through the Cradle will force you to grapple the polarizing forces of the Holy Trifecta:  humanity, nature and the gods. Throughout your journey, you will uncover the history of Aderyn’s Cradle piece by piece through completing quests and puzzles, fighting anomalies, and exploring the natural world and intricate ruins of the Aderian civilization. To complete your mission, you must harness the power of the five forces through Mana, the lifeblood of Anora, in order to perform powerful magic. Along the way, you will fight the corrupted creatures who would use these same forces against you. Together with the Guides, you will ultimately bring Aderyn’s Cradle back to Anora and restore balance to the lost land.Cradle will immerse you in smooth, realistic, intuitive combat, so that progression through our intellectually rich and emotionally resonant narrative campaign is as exciting as can be. We don’t just want you to buy our game; we want you enjoy it enough to play from start to finish, and again, and again, until you’ve experienced every piece of the lore, the environment, and their rewards. This project is an ambitious one for an independent studio with no large backers, which can only offer royalty checks and company shares as compensation for the hard work of creating this game. In order to meet the goal of a 2017 release, we must succeed through crowdfunding alone at this early stage of production. Nonetheless, production will not halt even if our crowdfunders do not meet their bottom line. Thanks to the dedication of the core team of Mojo's leaders, and their determination to see this project through, production will continue on the face of financial setbacks. Without proper funding, however, the pace of production will be slow, and the 2017 release surely pushed back.We won’t cut any corners, nor settle for a minimum viable product. Our goal,  In short, is to bring you the very best of everything, from visuals and mechanics to story and sound. We are a company made for gamers, by gamers. With Cradle, we aim not just to create something fun, but to drive the medium of videogames forward as an art form. We hope you’ll share our vision!Basics:

Planned platforms: PC


Release date: Fall 2017 on all platforms 

Approximate campaign runthrough time: 15-25 hours (speed run), 30-60 hours (average run)


Available modes: Single-player campaign, two-player co-op campaign, multiplayer arena

Aderyn’s Cradle is a first-person action/adventure role playing game (RPG) with a unique combat system. There will be six weapons available for each of the five character classes, and each weapon has a unique set of attacks. This grants each class a well-rounded strategic toolbox to set up a multitude of combos and fighting styles suited for the player’s chosen character class. A large variety of possible battlefield scenarios exist in Cradle. An intuitive, yet intricate aiming/blocking/parrying system prevents fighting from becoming monotonous and repetitive, even allowing the player to throw fakes like a true duelist. On top of all of this, Aderyn’s Cradle features a groundbreaking, fast-paced system for melee combat called RealFight Combat™. The system uses deterministic animations, which execute different animation sequences depending on where the player aims on an opponent, and what type of opponent is being faced. The amount of damage dealt is dependent on the location of a successful strike rather than randomly generated values. The system is easy to pick up, but challenging to master. Combat in Cradle requires the use of strategically applied augments (weapon and armor upgrades), weapon choices, attacks, and movements. Augments will be unlocked as the player progresses through the game. Weapon and armor customization through augmentation keeps fighting visually stunning and makes it a magical experience. This is going to be a lot of fun!Weapon augments are an essential part of both progression and combat in Aderyn’s Cradle. They link together the powers of humanity, nature and the gods to increase a weapon’s strength. Weapon augments may be acquired through the discovery of secrets, puzzle-solving, or defeating powerful enemies. The different types of augments are representative of the five forces of Anora. Up to five augments can be applied to each weapon. Effects of augments are permanent. Augments have three different levels which determine their strengths and grant special abilities.A sample Fire Augment sequence for the Druid’s Healing Staff. Level 1 increases hit damage with the weapon. Level 2 increases hit damage further, and adds a damage over time effect to attacks. Level 3 increases all weapon damage, and causes single target attacks to include an area of effect burn on every second attack.The premise is simple: each character has a base level of armor to defend against physical and magical damage. In Aderyn’s Cradle, all armor consists of five different attributes that contribute to the abilities of the player’s character. These attributes are:
Physical Resistance: The player’s immunity to physical harm.
Magic Resistance: The player’s immunity to magic and poison.

Swiftness: The amount of energy consumed by the player’s movement.
Stability: The ability of the player to withstand knockback, stun, and staggering blows.
Stealth: The ability of the player to go unnoticed and undetected.
These attributes can be strengthened through the use of Armor Augments, which are materials acquired by the player and applied to a set or portion of armor, causing it to increase in stats. Armor changes in appearance depending on what stats the player chooses to upgrade. All characters start with different base levels of each attribute depending on the player’s chosen class.

Medica is the alchemy system of Cradle. Our aim in making it an intuitive, easy-to-use system is to add extra incentive to exploring our rich open world. Ingredients are found throughout the four open worlds in a variety of physical forms. When picked up, they’re stored in an ingredients pouch alongside bandages. They come in the many forms of useful stones, liquids, species of plants, fungi, and creatures which can all be harvested and stored in inventory. Solvents are liquids only, and are gathered in a waterskin; up to three can be carried at a time. To create a salve, the player combines the ingredient(s) and the solvent in a mortar and pestle, and then heats the mixture over a flame. Discovering effective combinations of ingredients and finding the right recipes is key to taking advantage of the Medica system's full potential.



Medica allows for the crafting of two types of salves. The ingredient list determines the type of salve and its effects, while the solvent used determines its power level. Regeneration (regen) salves are consumed in-combat to restore depleted resources such as health or stamina. Stat salves are consumed to provide permanent boons to player attributes, such as health regeneration or fall damage reduction. Regen salves can serve to restore either health or stamina. They are prepared in advance, applied to bandages, and made available for the player to consume at any time, even in the midst of combat. When crafting Regen Salves, only one ingredient and one solvent will be used for each. The ingredient determines which type of salve is being crafted and the base potency of the salve. The solvent acts to multiply the base potency as determined by the ingredient. The overall level of the salve is calculated by multiplying the base potency of the ingredient by the multiplicative potency of the solvent.Stat salves yield permanent buffs to the player, and are best used as soon as they’re made.  Their ingredients are very rare, and far greater in variety than regen salves. Some grant special abilities, like underwater breathing. Ingredients do not help determine potency as with regen salves; instead, they determine type. Some will be swallowed, others rubbed on, and yet others will be consumed by other methods of ingestion. The recipes for these stat salves will be imparted via scrolls, Guides, and other sources of information in-game.



The Oracle is the only human in the world capable of hearing Aderyn’s voice in a clear, real way. Aderyn (aka The Maker, aka Deity of Hands, aka One Who Moves the Heavens, aka Master of Craft and Light) is only able to communicate abstractly with every one of his other followers. No matter how devout or willing they are, they can never understand Aderyn and be as intimately connected with them as you are; even though when the campaign begins, you don’t even know Their name. This is why They are able to guide you so readily through the steps you must take. When They speak, it is like a voice coming from somewhere deep within yourself you cannot reach or control. The Voice of Aderyn comes when you need it; it’s silent when you don't.





In the ages before the Soulfire Crisis, the Oracle was the supreme spiritual leader of the land; a person revered as the direct voice of Aderyn on Earth. She or he acted as ambassador between humanity and the gods for the Aderian people and was, as a result, the single most powerful individual in the Cradle. Once identified and anointed into their sacred, sovereign role, oracles served until their death. Each  oracle was said to be a craftsman who embodies the traits of Aderyn most: free will, creativity, and perfected skill. The Oracle wears a sacred textile, said to be spun by the Maker Them-self. The player uses this cloth as a medium through which the energies of the Holy Trifecta (gods/humanity/nature) can be channelled to make weapon upgrades. 



Through the game’s highly responsive movement and combat system, the player will be able to truly feel like a relentless Swordsman, nimble Ranger, daunting Paladin, dynamic Druid, or devastating Arcanist. Players may choose to play as either a male or a female character, no matter which class is picked. Each class has a unique movement pace, designed to compliment their various combat styles. Each class also has their own unique type of armor, and each armor type can be customized and augmented by the player to enhance their stats.



The Druid seeks balance and communion with nature, preferring the company of the rugged wilds to “civilized” society. As the Druid, your finely toned muscles and self awareness give you the capability to render powerful strikes, while your unique understanding of the living world allows you to use nature to your advantage. Using vines to ensnare, drag, throw and travel, the Druid can manipulate the battlefield by summoning forth life-giving energies to self-heal, and growth to cause plants to grow and retaliate against the corrupted foes of humanity and nature. The Druid can also call upon the spirits of the local wildlife, allowing them to see through the eyes of a chosen beast and use it as a conduit for destroying the desecrators of the wilds. Not only can the Druid call upon animals to fight, they can even become one. 


Arsenal:



Walking Staff of Healing (ThirdStaff, as seen in video)


Life Vine & Rock Fist


Lute of Life 


Bear Fang (Gauntlets)


Spirit Talisman 


Soothsayer's Truncheon (Quarterstaff)




The Walking Staff of Healing with Fire Augment





At home in the shadows, the Ranger is inspired by ninjas and marksmen. Wielding a combination of bows, glaives, small daggers and other unique projectiles, the Ranger takes down enemies from afar before even being spotted. Once assaulted, the Ranger quickly switches to use dual daggers, and goes about dispatching enemies in close range with ease, darting across the battlefield. As the Ranger, you will possess quick reflexes and unparalleled speed, enabling you to run circles around enemies, spreading death wherever you step. The tradeoff is that you won't take damage very well.Always being one for speed and agility over strength, the Ranger thrives in the fast pace and adrenaline of combat. As they dodge more attacks, and score hit after hit at fast pace, the Ranger becomes increasingly focused. Eventually, they fall into a deadly cadence, allowing them to ignore both pain and fatigue, and experience infinite stamina.

Arsenal:


Luna & Corona (Twin Dirks, as seen in video)


The Astral Bow(Composite Bow)


The Hornets Needles (Throwing Knives) 


Tufaan Arsenal (Spore Bombs)


The Dancing Blades (Bouncing Glaives)


Perfect Thunder (Crystal Long Bow, as seen in video)




Perfect Thunder



Luna & Corona





The Paladin is an indomitable force on the battlefield. With strength unparalleled, they move slowly, conviction in every ground-shaking step. As the Paladin, you will down foes with heavy strikes using large one- and two-handed weapons. Being a defender of the weak, it is only fitting that you wield large shields in addition to heavy weapons, and focus on repelling enemy attacks before launching your own devastating blows. With such large weapons and shields, overwhelming to the average obstacle, the Paladin’s strikes send enemies flying, or leave them stunned and vulnerable. Wading straight into the midst of battles others might evade, the Paladin thrives off of the ability to prevent and block enemy attacks. With every attack blocked, the Paladin gains confidence, building up to become an unstoppable force (for a time).

Arsenal:


Mother's Benediction (Axe & Shield)

Gauntlets of Conviction
Spirit of the Serpent (Halberd)

The Heart of Gold (Two Handed Shield)


Undying Faith (Heavy Hammer, Light Shield)


Fist of the Maker (2- Handed Hammer)







Thriving in close quarters combat, the Swordsman dual wields slicing, piercing weapons and uses maneuverable two handers to slay foes with abandon. With a powerful shout, the swordsman will rush even the most dangerous of foes with a powerful battle charge. As a Swordsman, you ignore pain, thriving on every hit an enemy throws at you, especially when you take only light damage. With every hit scored, the Swordsman’s rage increases, making their hits increasingly damaging, and eventually entering an enraged bloodlust. When in this state, the Swordsman gains health with every enemy slain.

Arsenal:


The Frozen Two-Hander (Two-Handed Sword)


The Sword & Shield of Rolling Hill (Light Shield, Medium Sword, as seen in video)


Kiha's Blades (Double Axes)


The River's Claws (Light Saber, Dirk)


The Convert's Resolve (Hand Glaives)


The Maker's Fangs (Double Spears, can combine)




The Sword & Shield of Rolling Hill



Master of the magical arts, the Arcanist uses superior intellect and the power of their weapons to bend the five forces of the world to their will. With terrifying displays of power, the Arcanist strikes fear into the hearts of foes great and little. The Arcanist thrives on this fear which serves to fuel her determination to win, turning her into a catalyst for destruction. If you’re looking for a class able to defeat several enemies in a single, well-placed blow, the Arcanist is for you! 
The Arcanist is righteous and cold, using calculated strategies to manipulate the battlefield. Causing confusion and chaos enables the Arcanist to move in and finish foes with quick slashes of a sword, or to create space if they get too close. The Arcanist is not only a living artillery, able to down targets from a distance, they are also a stealthy assassin. Both of these characteristics are integral parts to the Arcanist's prowess in battle.

Arsenal:

Sword & Staff of Light (Medium Sword, Staff)
Frost Fingers & Typhoon Stick
Emberstone & Glacial Core
Hand of Life & Dagger of Decay
Meteorite Codex

???





In ages past, the world of Anora was home to five Cradles. Each of the five deities ruled their own Cradle.
Aderyn is the deity of hands, craft and Light Force.

Nitima is the deity of heart, passion, and Fire
Force.


Ostia is the deity of mouth, hunger, and Life Force.


Ryphae is the deity of brain, intellect, and Stone Force.


Acie is the deity of eyes, perception, and Fluid Force.


The Five Gods shaped their lands, their respective Cradles, in unique ways. They fashioned their followers’ societies in ways that satisfied their own selfish pleasures. They cared little for the quality of the lives that their human followers led, only that they remained great in number; for a God’s power is drawn from the number of its followers. The one exception to this divine selfishness was Aderyn. Aderyn took pleasure in watching the humans build, and was proud of their creations and artwork. He discovered that the individual will of the humans was stronger than that imparted to them by external pressure and decided to nurture it, not challenge it. With his Force of Light, he lit the soulfires, divinely-imbued lanterns in his temples which housed the energy of ancestors' souls, giving humans free will, intuition, and inspiration to create. Aderians became renowned as master craftsmen. With the soulfires’ light gleaming like beacons over Anora, many foreigners began to flock to Aderyn’s Cradle and turn away from their original gods. Their influence gaining, Aderyn’s followers began to carry his charm, a round and bright jewel that signified their god’s will guiding their path.

Aderyn’s siblings seethed with jealousy as they watched his followers swell in number. Hastily, they decided to join forces and overthrow their sibling. Thus began the Soulfire Crisis, an event which changed Anora forever.



A massive battle ensued between the followers of Aderyn and those of the other four deities. As the blood of the faithful Aderians soaked the soil of their Cradle, the Jealous Four sensed Aderyn's power wane. Their divine smiting decimated the Aderian population. Their plan was working. Soon, Aderyn would be weak enough to defeat.

Those of Aderyn’s loyal people who did not perish outright suffered an even crueler fate: they were twisted and corrupted, painfully separated from their own humanity, so that only their altered bodies remained as the rest of their humanity was consumed.


Showing no mercy, the Jealous Four divided Aderyn’s Cradle, one piece for each, warping and twisting it into an aberration of its former beauty, altering the creatures into monsters, destroying countless wonders of craftsmanship built by Aderians. Finally, they extinguished the hated soulfires, destroying Aderyn’s last link with Their beloved people. To ensure Aderyn’s permanent defeat, the Four trapped him in a great citadel, located at the heart of his land, and together banished Aderyn’s Cradle to another plane of existence. All that remains to commemorate Aderyn’s lost land is a great gaping crater in the face of Anora, an example of what happens should anyone defy the will of the gods. 













The serene and grandiose Cathedral of Aderyn acts as the hub level and home base of the player’s journey. It contains a workshop for armor augments, a library for accessing discovered lore, a crafting station for medica, and portals to each of the four open worlds. As beautiful as it is mysterious, the Cathedral also contains special areas of its own, waiting to be explored.





The Titanwood lines the border between Ostia’s Cradle and where Aderyn’s Cradle once lay in the world before being banished to the Metaspace. Ostia’s Life Force has caused the trees here to grow abnormally tall, and the forest to overflow with organisms. Once you depart your village, you must flee through this land to reach Aderyn’s shrine, so that Aderyn can transport you to the ruined Cradle.  



The Icelands are one of the four open worlds of Aderyn’s Cradle. In the northernmost reaches of the Cradle lay the Icelands, home to glacial caverns, snow-capped peaks, active volcanoes and hot springs. The Aderians who lived here studied the advantages of geothermal technology, and made themselves expert engineers. They were famous for crafting ways to use the natural heat of volcanoes to power their formidable forges in the pursuit of craft to honor Aderyn. Even before the Crisis, this unforgiving environment proved challenging for all but the most rugged lifeforms. 




Now, the land is razed by Nitima’s Fire Force. Areas of extreme heat and chill tear the countryside apart with abyssal rifts, constructing a myriad of natural obstacles to surmount. Gargantuan fields of lava and active volcanoes now dominate the scenic expanses of mountain tundra, where the highest peaks in the Cradle contrast with abyssal moulins cut deep in the permafrost. The player must beat back Nitima’s corruption in this hazardous environment of ice and fire!




The Bayou is one of the four open worlds of Aderyn’s Cradle. Before the Soulfire Crisis, the Bayou was a dense fungal forest and a thriving ecosystem, populated by enormous mushrooms, strange plants and large, exotic insects. It was home to bustling centers of trade, and the wilderness overflowed with precious materials ripe for collection. Among the most valuable were the unusual woods which come from the trunks of fungal trees.  Diverse groups of merchants, craftsmen, and tradesmen from all over Anora gathered in its bustling towns to peddle their wares. During the Crisis, the land was smote by Ostia’s Life force. 





The Bayou in ruins has been twisted by overgrowth, with every creature, fungus, and fungal plant competing for survival. Human ruins have been totally reclaimed by natural forces, and fungus covers every available surface. Once-docile creatures have been transformed into formidable monstrosities, like the Swamp Stalker. Though foreboding, the Bayou is sure to awaken a fervent wanderlust in you, just as for the Aderian adventurers of old who first ventured into its depths in the name of freedom and craft.






The Quarry is one of the four open worlds of Aderyn’s Cradle.
