The lush and expansive forest of the Quarry once contained a variety of plants, wildlife, and some of the most prosperous industrial regions known to Anora. Following the Soulfire Crisis, the deity Acie transmuted and flooded the land, corrupting it with their force of Fluid. Tropical forests shrouded in mist, waterfalls, hidden caves, flooded settlements and mines can all be explored in this environment. 





Remnants of broken-down machinery, pools of water tinted orange with rust, and small mining hamlets populate the mountains and valleys. Eroding gear and pulley systems that were once used for hoisting large rocks and minerals out of the ground will serve as tools for environment-based puzzles, and can be exploited creatively in combat.




The Desert is one of the four open worlds of Aderyn’s Cradle. To the far west of the Cradle lie its scorched sands, and badlands, inhabited by a mix of aquatically-influenced plants and animals. During the Soulfire crisis, the land was smote by Ryphae’s force of Stone, causing enormous crevasses to rend the land and desiccating its already-scant water sources. The arid landscape of the Desert contains sky-high cliffs and formidable mesas with cities built through their windswept caves. Majestic Vika, pictured above, is one such city. Its citizens became famously fascinated with sound and how it bounced off rock; how it echoed deep in the caverns they called ‘home’. They carved and hung special instruments in the caverns of their city that hummed with air currents and harnessed the sounds for record keeping, entertainment, and even magic. 



Much of the sound was distorted following the Crisis, by Ryphae’s corrupting stones altering the perfectly-sculpted shapes of caves and cliffs. The player will seek clues from the past as echoes of ancient music float on howling wind.







You traverse the emptied lands of Aderyn. Having beaten your latest enemies, you rest in your sleeping sack and gaze at the stars. In this odd world, victim of divine smiting, you cannot help but wonder… Did anyone else survive?
You don’t have long to wonder. A face has appeared out of nowhere, and you are nose-to-nose with another human, the first you’ve seen in many days of fighting monsters. The seasoned survivalist crept up on you easily! “Who are you?!” You sputter, caught off-guard to find another living soul in this eerie, ethereal place. 



Charon, one of the four guides you will meet in Aderyn's Cradle.

The person smiles, unable to suppress a chuckle at the look on your face. “Be at ease, Oracle, I am a priest of Aderyn. You’ve heard from Them, right?” You nod… Aderyn… Yes, that was how the voice introduced itself, the voice that’s been speaking from somewhere inside your own spirit, guiding you through the journey. “Well, They hinted that you’d be coming along. I’m to be your guide for a bit.”
“How did you live?” Until this moment, you’d been certain that you were the only human alive in all the Cradle. The wilds had long since grown over and through all the settlements you’d found, each one completely empty. At every turn, there’ve been only twisted creatures, corrupted humanoids, or harsh wilderness to greet you.
The person’s face falls, remembering all the others lost in the Soulfire Crisis.



“Well, the Maker worked wonders to keep just a handful of us alive…”
The priest recounts Aderyn’s final moments of power. Knowing that time was running out, and his siblings’ wrath would soon descend, Aderyn acted swiftly to split Their remaining essence into pieces. Four faithful followers were chosen to carry these essences, a sliver of Aderyn's power entrusted to each. They were tasked with the burden of carrying on his culture, and were the last hope that Aderyn would one day return to Anora. Anointed by Aderyn's Light, they have been made immune to the horrid magic he knew the other deities would use to twist and destroy the others, and the land itself. Aderyn promised them a savior; a new Oracle who would bring the Cradle out of darkness. Since the Soulfire Crisis, the four priests have been living in the desolate Cradle, patiently and faithfully awaiting the player’s arrival. These chosen priests, known to the player as the Guides, are the only four humans the player will meet in the entire game. The Guides are sources of quests, weapons, and an immense wealth of knowledge concerning the past and present of the Cradle. From them you’ll receive an abundance of informative lore, important resources, witty quips and good cooking!





Anora is the world in which Aderyn’s Cradle is set. The Five main types of mana correlate to the Five main forces; the energetic signatures that make up all matter in Anora. These forces are harnessed by the player to produce special effects on the player's weapons, and power magic-based attacks. These five forces are the energies that make up the world of Anora and provide the energy of its existence.

Life: The lifeforce of all living things in the land. It is the pulse of Anora. 
  In the absence of Life is Decay.
Fire: The force of heat and flame. It is the radiant energy of Anora.
  In the absence of Fire is Chill.
Light: The force of pure energy that fills the void. It is the spiritual strength of Anora.
  In the absence of Light is Darkness.
Fluid: The force of liquids and gases. It is the ebbing and flowing energy of Anora.
  In the absence of Fluid is Stillness.
Stone: The force of all the land. It is the material strength of Anora.
 In the absence of Stone is Disintegration, or space.





The Mana carrier, also functions as a torch.
Here are just a few examples of imbalanced conditions in the land where mana can be found:
A large forest fire ravaged a partition of the Bayou causing much death and destruction of living organisms. Because of the sudden imbalance, Life Mana begins to seep from the land.The corruption of Nitima spawned a fissure of lava to form in the Icelands. Because of now-extreme heat of the area, Fire mana continuously bleeds from the opening, around the steady lava flow.
A devastating mudslide caused deforestation in a segment of the Quarry. The massive release of energy exerted in the disaster, Stone Mana accumulates in the central area of impact.




There are various types and forms of Kami in Aderyn’s Cradle. In essence, they are the physical manifestations of any one of the Five Forces. They are created from the collective consciousness of either a single species or an entire biome. The species (or biome) must come into contact with mana in order to spawn a kami. The kami will be a kami of whichever Force spawned the mana, giving it not only unique abilities arising from the Force, but also a nearly indestructible physical form, both stronger and wiser than any individual of its species (or biome). Once created, they do not die or disintegrate on their own, and can exist for thousands of years. 
Aderyn's people believed the kami to be eternal, and their attitudes towards the beings ranged from reverent to superstitious to disbelieving. Druidic legends tell of kami possessing the powers of the Gods, and speculate that the human Gods, Acie, Nitima, Ostia, Ryphae and Aderyn, were born from the same forces which create kami. 







In certain areas of perpetual violent or dynamic geology/ecology, there is constantly mana bleeding in the area; this is how elementals, sometimes called "land kami" are born, some occupying Anora perpetually. A certain number of kami will always exist in areas of localized imbalance, whether from environmental phenomena, mana bleeding, or an imbalance in a population of living creatures. Some kami in-game will be enemies, while others might aid the player or remain neutral.






Anomalies are physically altered versions of natural animals and plants. They spawn when individuals are exposed to mana. Mostly, they are isolated cases. Their exposure to mana in the environment, whether sustained or instantaneous, alters their developmental patterns, causing them to develop into altered forms which can better coexist with and exploit the mutating Force. Post-Soulfire Crisis, their numbers dramatically increased in the ruined Cradle, correlating with the sudden jump in mana spawn. They are the corrupted creatures of Aderyn’s land, and most become enemies for the player to fight as they journey.




Various creatures compared to the five player classes.


The Swamp Stalker


Born of Light, God of Creation
Born of Light energy, Aderyn embodies both the momentary inspirations that drive creativity from perception, as well as the long-simmering intuitions that come to creative fruition over time. They represent both intuition and free will. Aderyn possesses and alights Their followers’ intuition; to enable this, They have buit a society that unconditionally protects free will and craft above all else. Aderyn is the deity of Creation, who creates soulfires for which humans create material containers. To inspire creativity in Aderian followers, Aderyn lit the soulfires, lights in his temples, giving men freedom and will to innovate.




A mere sliver of his essence is what had the power to teleport you all the way from your home in the real, physical realm of Ostia’s Cradle to the ethereal, cursed lands of Aderyn’s Cradle. Aderyn did this because you are the Oracle, the savior he has promised his faithful surviving followers. The Oracle is the one who will restore Aderyn's land to the world and allow Their followers and culture to one day grace Anora again.







Use of Funds

We are coming to Indiegogo to ask for funding to build a proper vertical slice of Aderyn’s Cradle which will give a more accurate view of gameplay. What will this “vertical slice” look like? It’ll be a section of our Icelands open world environment, complete with demonstrations of all main in-game elements. Through it, we will showcase our combat, weapon augment application, lore, an environment-based movement puzzle, and more!  Once this vertical slice is done, we will be expanding our crowdfunding to encompass all remaining funds needed to finish the game.Specifically, we will be using the funds received from the current IndieGoGo campaign to create in-game assets and to compensate freelance artists for the work we need to finish the vertical slice.  Additionally, these funds will be used to cover the costs of software, technology and other enterprise applications that are needed to get the job done. 

Our plan is simple: to use the funds bestowed by all of you who are already part of the vision of Cradle to create a clear and full showing of it so as to share its vision with the rest of the gaming community and with potential investors. If we have clear communication of the game's vision alongside this key vertical slice, we are confident that we'll be able to secure the rest of the funds needed to finish Aderyn's Cradle.

Frequently Asked Questions:

1. Will Aderyn’s Cradle be released on consoles?
Due to the ease of porting Unreal 4 onto next gen consoles, we hope to release Aderyn’s Cradle on console! Most likely this will be the first stretch goal during our Kickstarter campaign or we will include it from the beginning of said campaign.

2. Will Aderyn’s Cradle be released on Mac and Linux?
Currently, we do not plan on supporting Mac or Linux.

3. What Specs will I need to run Aderyn’s Cradle?
TBA; unfortunately, it is too early in development for us to know.

4. Is there magic in Aderyn’s Cradle?
Yes, mana represents the physical manifestations of this magic, the lifeblood of Aderyn’s Cradle and the world of Anora.  The Arcanist wields the 5 forces to devastating effects, with the druid imploring nature magic.

5. Will Aderyn’s Cradle have multiplayer?
Yes.  Initially an add-on which we intended to release after the campaign, multiplayer will come with Aderyn’s Cradle, containing four game modes, CTF, Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, and King of the Hill, with two modes to play in, Ranked mode, where each class has all 6 weapons, un-augmented for serious competitive play, and an unranked mode, featuring all 6 weapons, augmentable as you choose for some fun practice or with friends.

6. Anora is a new fantasy universe of your own creation? Cool! This isn’t going to be another needlessly whitewashed world steeped in gender stereotypes, is it? 
Aderyn’s Cradle is committed to avoiding whitewashing and gender stereotypes as we create Anora! We have artistic and narrative guidelines in place so that the balance of complexions, body types, ages and other physical features stays heterogenous, similar to the population of the United States, as we bring the Aderian population to life. The same goes for our characters’ other attributes. No matter how they express their sexual orientations or gender identities, we strive to both be aware of stereotypes and transcend them. All in all, our Story and Art Teams take the goals of creating a rich culture and diverse populace for Aderyn’s beloved followers seriously. This is just another measure in our goal to bring you a fantasy experience that is relatable, robust, immersive and inspiring.  

7. Will There be Occulus Rift support?
Yes!

8. When will Aderyn’s Cradle be released?
If all goes according to plan, we will release Aderyn’s Cradle about 2 years from now in Fall 2017!
9. I’ve emailed or sent a message to Mojo to see if I can work with them... But I haven’t gotten a response. :(


We appreciate your interest and support of Mojo and Aderyn’s Cradle during this crucial time! Since we are running this campaign while still working on development, please be patient as we work through this campaign. We will respond to everyone as quickly as we can. This may  not happen until the campaign is complete, but rest assured that we haven’t forgotten you!



10. I’ve noticed that after your $60 dollar reward, you don’t mention multiplayer - will it be included with the physical addition of Aderyn’s Cradle?
Yes, all those who back us here on the $60 and above will receive the multiplayer alpha when it is released and will have that updated to the full multiplayer once that is released as well via download.

 11. Can I donate to Aderyn’s Cradle via Paypal and still receive Indiegogo rewards?
Yep! Click here!

story:
Hi there, we are Startale Games, an indie studio based out of Salt Lake City, Utah. Our team is made up of two programmers/game designers, and we have been working on creating video games for quite a while now. Our current project "Claim" is our first dive into producing a finished product that we feel comfortable showing off to the world.

We have been in development for just around 2 months now and have already made amazing progress. Check out the video to see just how far we have gotten! The core game play is already coded in, so the finishing touches we need to implement are player progression (achievements, rankings, etc) and visual updates. The game will be released for PC, IOS, Andriod, and Switch (Early Access is PC only!).

Your money will go towards purchasing better art for the game as well as marketing. We can do all the coding and game design on our own, but we need you guys to help us make the game both beautiful and popular. All donations lead to a better experience, and more people involved with a project we hope you can get as passionate about as we are.

Claim is a 1v1 turn based strategy game that is played on a 5x11 grid. Each player starts with 2 columns of tiles on opposite ends of the board under their control. They place a castle on one of the tiles they own, and the opponent cannot see where they placed it, much like battleship. Your goal is to place units on your own tiles, move them across the board to claim more tiles, then claim your opponent's tiles, and finally your opponent's castle in order to win the game.

Tiles are claimed by units when a player ends their turn. There are many different nations, each with their own unique units that will claim different patterns in the board. For example, the Pawn unit will only claim the tile he ends his turn on, but the Monarch unit will claim the tile he is on, the tiles to his sides, and the tile in front of him when the turn ends. An additional element to the game is that you cannot see enemy unless they are claiming tiles, or are on the tiles you control. Because of this, you must pay close attention to how the board is changing, and predict where enemy units are placed.

Before the match starts, each player chooses one of our available nations to play as. Each nation has a completely different theme, and has a unique unit that is only available to them. For example, Green Team gets a catapult unit, while blue team gets a magical druid unit. Each team has a different play-style with strengths and weaknesses. After the player plays enough matches, they will gain access to custom team builder which allows for building a team made up of the units you like the best.

With the individual units, you are able to buy skins for them with the gold you have accumulated inside the game. With our 10$ game price, we are making skins fairly easy to obtain. They will feel like a nice reward after a few matches, not an endless grind. Our goal is not to money off skins, just let people work towards looking cool.

Additionally, players will be able to spend their gold on custom banners, different emotes, and different voice lines. We are trying to let the player customize their experience, and add as much of their personal flair to their games as possible.

Finally, we will have a custom castle builder, where you can spend your gold to get parts. You will be able to drag and place any castle parts you want onto a unique tile that will then be available for use in the game. 

Your contribution will take the game from a small scale indie, to a large scale multiplayer title. We have the code all in place to scale the game exponentially, we just need the money to grab our player base. If we get enough funding, we will be running tournaments, creating more armies for people to play with, and better matchmaking for everyone. If you enjoy good strategy games and proving you are the best, help us gather more opponents for you to crush.

We are requesting $2,000 total, 500$ of which will go towards artwork and graphics, and the remaining $1,500 being used to get us rolling with the advertising. Hopefully with your contribution, and the sales we make from marketing, we will be able to push the game into the hands of many many players. Any extra money we get will simply be funneled back into the marketing of the game.

The game will be released mid-August, funding or no funding. The difference will be in how good it will look and how many people we can get to play it. There is no risk involved with backing us, since the money you spend will only go towards improving it, not creating it from scratch. The heavy lifting of the project has already been done, we just need to polish it up.

Follow us on Twitter to spread the word: https://twitter.com/Claim_STG

Sign up for our newsletter: https://www.startalegames.com/claim

Share this project with your friends! You can just use the Indiegogo sharing tools to help us get some more views, and some more traction.

If you are a content creator, we can send you keys, just send an email to support@startalegames.com

story:
Quick Dash is a fast paced arcade style game. It has simple mechanics where you don't hit the thing in front of you (pretty simple right!). However as you progress, the quicker you go, and the more challenging the obstacles become.

By donating, you'll help with continual development of the game and receive a copy of it on release! I want to make 'Quick Dash' challenging yet fun, I feel the quick pace is important to the feel of the game and hope to share it with you!

story:
As many of you may know, it can be difficult to make it in the world of esports. It can be even harder to make this your full time job. Freshca has been fortunate enough to become a recognized name in the Hearthstone community, getting invites to several tournaments in the scene, and popularizing several decks.

Tools like Twitch.tv have helped gamers connect directly with their fans in ways that have never been possible before. Unfortunately, life can throw a curve ball that can be difficult to overcome. A little over a month ago, Freshca's computer starting having issues, and has caused him to be unable to stream. He even had to drop out from the Challengestone 2 tournament because his computer kept crashing while recording.

After exhausting all other options, Freshca needs our help to get back to what he does best, playing Hearthstone, entertaining his fans, and maybe some murloc action as well. Let's help give back to one of the games great players, and enjoy more great Freshca moments!

If we reach the goal, Freshca has commited to trying a 24 hour stream to help thank everyone!

Check out: http://twitch.tv/freshca

story:
Play in the Most Immersive Community-Based Web Browser

Medieval Strategy Wargame

And this isn't just pie-in-the-sky … you can play the Beta Version of the game right now!

http://kingdomsoftheworld.co

By joining your City State into a Kingdom with other online players, you create a community to chat with, strategize with and conquer other players with.  You’ll build unique land holdings on in your City State to maximize different aspects of game play; Brute, Tank, Bank or Brain-Trust.  You’ll fill your coffers with gold, timber, iron and water and in the end, you’ll make your own power to the highest of heights to become Ruler of the World.

Our team is a group of four people, Sandie, Dan, Matt and JD, who have been eagerly playing web-based community strategy wargames for years, and right now, there's nothing else out there we've found … so we're making it ourselves!  The key to community-centered play is in this idea of "The Kingdom".  Each player has their own Duchy or Barony, a piece of land where they build their castle and train their troops and secure resources.  But in order to ascend The Throne of the World, each player needs to also join together in a Kingdom.  It can be a group of friends you already know, or brand new players you've never met.  Together you plan and strategize to overcome other Kingdoms, marching toward the top, until at last you place one of your team members on The Throne!  Our team members collectively possess all of the skillsets required to develop this game, including programming experience, game design expertise,  web-design and social media marketing.  This same core team took over and redeveloped a highly successful previously developed web-based strategy wargame, and they take these talents and skills forward into Kingdoms of the World.

What We're Looking For and How it will Help:

In order to bring this game to life, we're looking to the Indiegogo community to help us!  Right now, the interior web-pages are pretty basic, and there are a variety of specialty game aspects that need to be expanded.  The core of the game is working well, and it's been tested for months in live Beta play. 

Here's a list of features currently live:

  • Join a Kingdom with other players
  • Defend other players in your Kingdom
  • Invade members of other Kingdoms
  • Invade Mines (gather resources)
  • Rank up to become Ruler of the World
  • Help Rank your Kingdom up by winning battles
  • Train soldiers
  • Build Castle Defenses
  • Acquire and use Sigils and Potions to buff your soldiers
  • Acquire and use Ancient Relics that give special powers or create special events
  • View and use an Inventory of your items
  • View all battles across the world
  • View all Epic Battle statistics
  • View all Kingdom Statistics
  • Chat with other players live
  • Log results of all actions display on your Profile Page

We're looking for $10,000 from the community, and the money we get from this campaign will allow us to improve the User Interface dramatically as well as expand into some of the more detailed aspects of managing your own duchy and your kingdom, including custom tailoring the buildings on your land to suit your style of play (to favor combat, gold or learning).  Advanced game features will include freely moving from Kingdom to Kingdom, Solo Play,  Spying, Long-Distance Attacks and more.  A portion of the money will also be used to market the game to a wider audience, as bringing in more players increases the activity (and the fun!) in the game.  And if we don't reach our goal, any money earned will be applied to improving the game, one priority at a time.

Rewards

We've got a huge and great set of rewards for your participation!  Look at what we have for you:

KEY: 

Sovereigns are the In-Game currency, used to buy any of the In-Game items. 

Berserker Tokens are single-use (1 battle) tokens that make your troops stronger

Building Upgrades increase the power of your Castle, your Blacksmith, you University, etc.

Contributor Badges are both ornamental AND useful.  They are displayed on your Profile, but also, from time to time, the game will "Activate" Badges to cause different events and effects to happen.

Relics are semi-unique single-use items in your inventory, that when you choose to Activate them,  they have various effects and powers on battles and on the game, with rarer powers having greater effects.

  • $5 Pledge
    • 150 Sovereigns, 10 Berserker Tokens, Bronze Contributor Badge
  • $10 Pledge
    • 350 Sovereigns, 20 Berserker Tokens, 1 Free Building Upgrade, Silver Contributor Badge
  • $15 Pledge
    • 600 Sovereigns, 30 Berserker Tokens, 3 Free Building Upgrades, 1 Common Relic, Silver Contributor Badge
  • $20 Pledge
    • 800 Sovereigns, 40 Berserker Tokens, 5 Free Building Upgrades, 1 Uncommon Relic, Gold Contributor Badge
  • $30 Pledge
    • 1200 Sovereigns, 75 Berserker Tokens, 10 Free Building Upgrades, 2 Common Relics, 2 Uncommon Relics, 1 Rare Relic, Gold Contributor Badge
  • $50 Pledge
    • 2200 Sovereigns, 125 Berserker Tokens, 20 Free Building Upgrades, 5 Common Relics, 3 Uncommon Relics, 2 Rare Relics, Platinum Contributor Badge
  • $75 Pledge
    • 3500 Sovereigns, 200 Berserker Tokens, 30 Free Building Upgrades, 5 Common Relics, 5 Uncommon Relics, 3 Rare Relics, Platinum Contributor Badge
  • $100 Pledge
    • 5000 Sovereigns, 300 Berserker Tokens, 40 Free Building Upgrades, 8 Common Relics, 8 Uncommon Relics, 5 Rare Relics, Vanadium Contributor Badge
  • $250 Pledge
    • 15000 Sovereigns, 900 Berserker Tokens, 80 Free Buildings Upgrades, 8 Uncommon Relics, 15 Rare Relics, Osmium Contributor Badge
  • $500 Pledge
    • 30000 Sovereigns, 2000 Berserker Tokens, 180 Free Buildings Upgrades, 32 Uncommon Relics, 40 Rare Relics, Palladium  Contributor Badge
  • $1000 Pledge
    • 75000 Sovereigns, 4000 Berserker Tokens, 360 Free Buildings Upgrades, 100 Uncommon Relics, 150 Rare Relics, Iridium  Contributor Badge

Risks & Challenges

The game is already up and running, so, there's no issues there.  As always, in the end, the main risk is that sufficient numbers of people play the game for sufficient periods of time to make it fun and enjoyable.  The mitigation of this risk is that the current Beta has already been played continuously for many months, and the previous game that we were developers on lasted for more than 5 years and had thousands of players

If you can't contribute ... please share this with your friends!

Any help you can give is much appreciated!!!

Relics are semi-unique single-use items in your inventory, that when you choose to Activate them,  they have various effects and powers on battles and on the game, with rarer powers having greater effects.

$5 Pledge150 Sovereigns, 10 Berserker Tokens, Bronze Contributor Badge

$10 Pledge350 Sovereigns, 20 Berserker Tokens, 1 Free Building Upgrade, Silver Contributor Badge

$15 Pledge600 Sovereigns, 30 Berserker Tokens, 3 Free Building Upgrades, 1 Common Relic, Silver Contributor Badge

$20 Pledge800 Sovereigns, 40 Berserker Tokens, 5 Free Building Upgrades, 1 Uncommon Relic, Gold Contributor Badge

$30 Pledge1200 Sovereigns, 75 Berserker Tokens, 10 Free Building Upgrades, 2 Common Relics, 2 Uncommon Relics, 1 Rare Relic, Gold Contributor Badge

$50 Pledge2200 Sovereigns, 125 Berserker Tokens, 20 Free Building Upgrades, 5 Common Relics, 3 Uncommon Relics, 2 Rare Relics, Platinum Contributor Badge

$75 Pledge3500 Sovereigns, 200 Berserker Tokens, 30 Free Building Upgrades, 5 Common Relics, 5 Uncommon Relics, 3 Rare Relics, Platinum Contributor Badge

$100 Pledge5000 Sovereigns, 300 Berserker Tokens, 40 Free Building Upgrades, 8 Common Relics, 8 Uncommon Relics, 5 Rare Relics, Vanadium Contributor Badge


$250 Pledge15000 Sovereigns, 900 Berserker Tokens, 80 Free Buildings Upgrades, 8 Uncommon Relics, 15 Rare Relics, Osmium Contributor Badge

$500 Pledge30000 Sovereigns, 2000 Berserker Tokens, 180 Free Buildings Upgrades, 32 Uncommon Relics, 40 Rare Relics, Palladium  Contributor Badge

$1000 Pledge75000 Sovereigns, 4000 Berserker Tokens, 360 Free Buildings Upgrades, 100 Uncommon Relics, 150 Rare Relics, Iridium  Contributor Badge


Risks & Challenges
The game is already up and running, so, there's no issues there.  As always, in the end, the main risk is that sufficient numbers of people play the game for sufficient periods of time to make it fun and enjoyable.  The mitigation of this risk is that the current Beta has already been played continuously for many months, and the previous game that we were developers on lasted for more than 5 years and had thousands of players

If you can't contribute ... please share this with your friends!
Any help you can give is much appreciated!!!

story:
Try out our free demo (Web or Windows)

 

 

 

Have you ever played one of these AAA games about the Caribbean and pirates and felt that the world around you isn’t really alive? That there are only beautiful graphics serving decorations without any real dynamic behaviour behind them? Well, that’s what we felt and what pushed us to develop a Maritime Law. We want to do a few things different and more exciting, which will change the complete feel of the game about the Caribbean and pirates. Let’s discuss this with more details!

 

 


Have you ever felt the desire to put yourself in the shoes of a captain, standing in your cabin, looking at your desk where lies the nautical map and planning the route for your journey? In our game, we will offer you this opportunity.

 

 

This is an exciting strategical process where you decide what path to take, with complete freedom of drawing any course you want, while taking into account multiple risks and opportunities, such as:

  • The cyclons and winds, which develop and evolve from a state of complete calm to treacherous storms
  • The underwater currents, serving one-directional roads of the sea
  • Various ocean regions with different properties, like stormy regions, pirate-infested waters, coastal regions, reefs and many more.

 

 

 

Now, how about adding more roleplaying flavour to the naval game? We love RPGs and we always wanted to have different personalities, traits, backgrounds which lead to interesting choices, conflict and decision that you make. The game begins with you designing your character by choosing the look and the background story for him. This background story will determine your starting positions, social status and traits. During the game, you will get more traits, based on your decisions and actions, which will determine your playstyle and assist you in a role you want to play. Let’s say that you have betrayed the people around you a couple of times and received a Deceitful trait. This trait will invoke more events and opportunities for you to abuse other people around you in your favour. Or if you don’t like it, by behaving the opposite way you may lose this trait and recover your credibility.

 

Another vital part of the RPG model for us is the character progression and improvement. When you do certain actions in Maritime Law - you can the experience related to this area. Currently, we have four types of Expertise:

  • Sailing is your skill in nautical navigation and controlling your ship
  • Tactics represent your expertise in combat, naval and melee
  • Leadership is affiliated to your ability to lead people, boost their morale and retaining control over your crew.
  • Diplomacy will help you to interact with other captains, negotiate in towns and improve your reputation and credibility around the world.

In each of these categories, you will progress to new levels, which will unlock new abilities in a wide tree of options for you to pick (coming soon).

 

 

 

Have you ever realized how vital were some occupations on the ship compared to others and that by that time standards studying them was a big effort for many people? Many sailors started from the ground bottom, knowing nothing and most of the time were mopping the deck. Only after earning the trust among the crew after few trips, they would start learning how to do the riggings and sails, how to operate cannons or even being tutored for management roles.

We intend to provide a deep but clear and easy tool for you to experience that journey of a sailor. Many times you will prefer to hire swabbies in a local tavern because they are cheaper and loyal. Then you will assign them as assistants to more experienced carpenters, sailing masters and gunners, so they could become something more than just powder monkeys. After a few months of training, you will see ‘a boy become a man’, with this person becoming a valuable asset on your ship.

 

So you might ask: “Why bother with all this training, why can’t I just sail with swabbies?” Well, nothing will stop you, really, it’s up to you. But imagine piloting a spaceship without knowing what any button on control panel does, this feeling would be quite close. Anything can go wrong, all the time! For example, your ship can go in a wrong direction or run aground, your cannons will explode on your ship, sails tear apart.

We will provide you with a nice view inside your ship where you can learn what your crew is doing at any given time as well as manage your ship giving executive orders. This view incorporates the current state of your supplies, cargo and spare parts (like masts, rigs and sails) with you can interact at any given time.

The last point about your crew is its social dynamic. When you sail for weeks and months in close terms with other people on a small ship, the fights and deaths are not rare. But this is not as scary as a risk of mutiny on your ship when your crew is dissatisfied with your actions. You want them to like you, especially if your captaincy is not supported by the government, but by the vote of the crew. In this case, you begin to play a little political campaign, by killing the agitators, bribing the undecided and holding to your loyal friends and officers.

 

 

 

Let’s be honest, when you think of the Caribbean in the 17th century, two words pop up in your mind faster than others: pirates and adventures! These adventures are not just the fetch quests or “here is the treasure map of Captain X”, they are about daring heroes who stand against the world in their attempt to build their own destiny and exploit various opportunities. We want to bring this feeling in Maritime Law. Any legendary story you might think of you will find in our game: treasure galleons wrecked by the storm, ghost ships, towns short on supply, pirate stashes, unprotected fleets that are easy to capture and many, many more.

 

 

You will encounter these adventures in the shape of a tavern rumour. You meet a person, talk to him, try to sway him to tell the secret he knows, while at the same time testing is he truthful or not. In the end, you may end up with a unique piece of information about an event that took place in the world, which you can investigate. Usually, this involves sailing into unexplored regions while having incomplete information about the potential threats and yields of this expedition. Combine this with the fact that sometimes you may decide not to share this information with the crew (like in Black Flags TV show) and you get a very intriguing journey, in which if you won’t be precise and lucky you may end up with ambush or even worse - nothing, which may lead to mutiny on your ship.

The last adventure, is your own, personal one. It involves the conflict, driven by your background, usually something you want to achieve in life and your role in the major world conflict: The Golden Age of Piracy. By building your reputation with colonial powers and/or pirates by doing quests for them you develop new powers and grow your might. You are free to pick not only the side in the upcoming conflict but also the role. If you prefer a peaceful approach, then you may play a role of the investor in the major colonial powers and focus on trading, colonizing, exploring and escorting government officials. If your heart lies with pirates and their ambitions, you might work on building a pirate state by uniting them under one banner, building their military power and wealth (as the Old World will not give up their colonies so easily) and make your ay into the governments of the respective countries by bribing and threatening official to recognize your state and customs. At last, if you prefer a more straightforward approach then you are free to just fight the opposing side and banish them from your world.

 

 

 

We are a small team of friends, united by the passion for games, creativity and ambition. Our mission is to make high-quality games for players and we do believe that this is near to impossible without dialogue with the audience.

This campaign is very important for us as it creates a direct channel between the community and our team. We believe that the best game is the one made for the players and with their feedback.

You can find more information about us on our website: https://www.tiamatgamestudio.com/

We need your support because we are going to make a brilliant game, not just the ordinary one. And for this, we need to work really hard during the next year or so. With enough pledges, there won’t be any delays in the game development process. All funding which we are collecting will be invested in the game: more in-depth mechanics, better graphics, more diverse character personalities and ship customization. Also, we want to bring an atmosphere of the 17th century, so we have to spend resources for historical surveys, to provide you with accurate captain’s biographies, wars and events.

 

 

We need nearly 10 000€ for minimum development when we are able to work on the project. These funds will go mostly on salaries for programmers and artists, equipment and office rent. As we have set the flexible goal for this campaign, even if we won’t reach our goal we will still be working on this game, but with much tighter budgeting and slower pace of development.

We have some optimistic goals planned if we raise more than our initial mark, which we will be revealing to you when we get close to each of these numbers. The first one is 25 000€, which will allow us to hire an extra artist and programmer in order to make a 3D sailing mode with manual control over the ship.

 

 

Anyway, this all is just the price of a job of an independent game developer, which we happily embrace. One of the biggest reasons for doing this campaign was to create a communicational bridge between the people who are really interested in this game and want to share their feedback and us, the developers.

Why is it so important? In our opinion, when you try to go for a new idea which involves a lot of experimenting (and not just copying other products), you have to 'keep one foot on the ground', which in our case mean to make sure that the actual game, based on these ideas will provide the desired effect and is well received. Because in the end, we are not making this game just for ourselves or the money, but mainly because we want for this game to exist on the market, be really good and beloved.

We humbly thank everyone of you who believed in us and supported our project. Get in touch, follow for through updates and write to us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or Steam.

story:
Hi, we're ABXY.  It's nice to meet you.

We're 2 content creators (Mari & Peter), 1 bag designer (Mark), and 1 supply chain expert (Pat). We've made The ABXY Switch Bag because we love the Switch and wanted to give it a prettier, more thoughtful, and more deserving home to lay its bones.  After all, the Switch has given us happiness, so we wanted to keep the Switch happy.  After 2 years of prototyping different ways to carry a Switch, we are proud to present you, The ABXY Switch Bag.

 

Strikin' a pose for the Gram

 

Fits the necessities.  

Fits your Dock, 2 Nintendo Switches (Standard or Lite), 2 controllers, your Switch cables and your plus-sized smartphone.

Fully Locked & Loaded

Here're some loosely explained features in a bird's eye view

Get protected.  

Our removable divider holds your dock & Switch upright and in place.  

Hold me

mmmm...time to Nintendo Switch & chill

For added protection, you can put the Switch in the bottom compartment which has an EVA padded chamber to keep your console protected.  Use the game cartridge panel to protect the screen and keep it clean.

Snug as a Switch in a fitted compartment

In the car, on the plane, wherever you want.  

Use Theater Mode by putting your Switch screen in the bottom compartment loops and remove the controllers to use the controller.  The Switch screen will naturally angle upwards to you and you can use your controller or your two hand-held Switch controllers.

I'm in love with my Switch in my car

No Wetness in here.  

We use a 600D Polyester with Carbonate Coating and a DWR finish to ensure safety against rain and incidental spills.

DWR coating says NOT UP IN HERE

Doctor's bag opening 

The most functional bags are the ones that give you the most visibility into what you're carrying, with quick access and good protection.  Our opening solution gives you a birds-eye view to easily see all of the contents in your bag.  It's quick to open, securely kept closed, and is magnetically fastened up with our custom hardware.

Play in place

Play games while your Switch sits cozily in its new home - Pull the cable through the side holes and plug it into your Dock.  Voila!

Play in place in action:

 

Colorways

Last month, we made some media samples in 3 different colors: Bullet Black, Navy & Gray.  Unfortunately, we didn't love the Navy & Gray as much as we wanted to.  In this campaign, you will have seen some images of the Gray & Navy colorways, but instead of offering these colorways which we didn't love, we will be offering the Switch Bag in that Bullet Black & Kirby White.  Here are the two colorways we've using to send to our factory.  

TLDR, we have 2 colorways:

Bullet Black (as seen all over the campaign) & Kirby White (as seen below):

 

The ABXY Switch Bag Walkthrough

 We just wanted to show you how everything fits and works.

 

Design & Development

It's been a methodical 2 years of market research, development, and sampling to bring this to market. We took our time to get here, but now that we're here, we're ready to press START.

 

Fits your Plus-sized phone!

Market Study

Current Switch bags on the market are really Switch boxes or cheap and flimsy bags, and there aren't many of them.  There's been zero effort to make these look good. They're also giant and take up way too much space when you travel.  The ABXY Switch Bag takes up a smaller footprint, and still keeps your Switch, Dock & Controllers protected.

Dimensions & Specs

Bag Weight: 19.7oz / 0.56kg

Bag+Switch+Dock Weight: 46.15oz / 1.31kg

Total Volume of the Main Compartment: ~5 Liters

Min to Max Shoulder Strap Length: 25" to 48"

Kickstarter

We just completed our Kickstarter campaign! 

 

Timeline, Production, Supply Chain

We've placed our initial Purchase Order for The ABXY Switch Bag on April 20.  Why did we start then?  Well, we've got an internet-famous gamer, a bag designer, and a supply chain management company behind ABXY, and we've got a kickass product for the Switch community.  So we wanted to put our money where our hearts are and we paid the deposit then.  We are on track for product to arrive at our warehouse in early September, where we'll turn it around and ship it to our supportive backers as soon as product's received.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.  Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.    The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:  Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world. Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one). Make it real for people and build trust.    Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. Describe your plan for solving these challenges.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Project.

I have been a tabletop role play gamer since 1989 and my first tabletop role play game was "HeroQuest". When my friends forced me to become a "Dungeon/Game Master" using d20 system, i didn't know where to start! Months later I realized that I need a world tool that instantly provides useful information. At that period I was studying to get my bachelor degree "Surveying and G.I.S. Engineering" so I made a desktop G.I.S. application for my campaigns. After I took my bachelor degree, i worked at a G.I.S. company on many projects in many positions. I developed an Online Web-G.I.S., worked with databases from start to end, created traffic and urban planning G.I.S. maps and much more. When I lost my job during the economic crisis I decided to merge my love for tabletop-RPGs with my profession, so I developed a Fantasy Online World using G.I.S. (Geographic Information Systems)

Experimentally I uploaded W.O.A.L.M. on a server and I made a web-site as professional as I could. I made this campaign to cover these expenses and to keep the project running with upgrades-updates for the next two years!

Our Current Project and Our Next Moves.

W.O.A.L.M. has a general map (almost 10 times bigger than Texas) with:

  • 48 Realms
  • 504 Cities
  • 2800 Mountains and Hills
  • 980 Forests
  • 128 Sea names, bays, coast names and gulf names
  • 6 Large Deserts
  • 43.000 Kilometers of Rivers Network
  • 12.500 Kilometers of Road and Path Network
  • 850 Caves, Dungeons, Mines and Tunnels
  • 230 Lakes
  • 65 Types of Ores and Gems (Info about their color, opacity, prices per gram etc.)
  • 1300 Points of Interest (Monuments, Temples, Towers, Castles etc. with a short description)

Information based on climatic environment:

  • 183 Types of trees, Bushes, Herbs (extra info type of wood, wood usage and price per Kg)
  • 473 Types of Insects, Predator Animals, Prays and Sea Animals
  • Area Temperatures by day and night

44 completed City Maps (18 uploaded on the server)

Each city map contains:

  • Commoners buildings description (Each building has a description)
  • Lords buildings description (Each building has a description)
  • Owner information (Each building has an Owner)
  • Districts description
  • Organisations description
  • Churches description (How many followers etc.)
  • Theaters description (Capacity etc.)
  • Barracks description (How many guards etc.)
  • Prisons description (How many prisoners and guards etc.)
  • Libraries (How many books and scrolls etc.)
  • Shops (Each shop sells specific products with suggested information) for example: You click on a building shop which is a “Tailor” and sells "disguise kit" for 48 gold

Extra Tools:
  • Npc Suggested character sheets
  • Encounter Tool
  • Spells Tables
  • Pantheon
  • Points of Interest (Search tool)

Currently I have a "Dedicated Server" running with "Server O.S." and "Administrator Internet Panel" in Europe, an E-mail server, a domain name, SSL Certificates for user's sensitive data protection. Ticket module for the web-site, web-site forum, G.I.S. map-server and for all these payments a small company business to be a legal citizen.

If this campaign will not reach its goal, my first priority is to keep W.O.A.L.M. online as much time as possible.

If this campaign reaches its goal 

I will set up W.O.A.L.M. on a Canadian or U.S. Dedicated Server so it will be faster and easier for use by everyone (Worldwide). That means i will have to maintain and update 2 servers.

Next 2 years plans are to:

  • Create 442 extra cities maps (44 city maps are completed 18 are on the map)
  • Merge cities maps with the General Map (City maps currently redirecting user into a new map)
  • Create dungeons maps for every "Cave-Tunnel-Dungeon" 
  • Create small objects maps such as Bridges, Temples, monuments etc.
  • Create an Under-LandMap (Tunnels & Caves network) 
  • Write new history information for all the Realms
  • Update History to the Cities Description
  • Update Building footprints for different types of Buildings

My contributors.

As a G.I.S. world tool, W.O.A.L.M. can provide any information users might need!

Along with the "Subscribers Plan", a month , six months, a year or two years of access into W.O.A.L.M. I can use your name (or your character's name or your nickname) in Lore of W.O.A.L.M. as:

  • Lord
  • Knight
  • Evil Character
  • Demi-god

 I can create a Tower or a Castle where you are going to be the owner with a short description of your choice

I can create a city "2500 Buildings" Named by your (Nickname) with a story of your choice (If you don't have any, I will create a story just for your character). Every citizen will worship you like a God!

Online Web-Geographic Information Systems.

Creating an Online Web-G.I.S. world tool is a very difficult task. You know already that W.O.A.L.M. is a fantasy "Google Maps".  "Google Maps" has more than 10.000 employees. W.O.A.L.M. is almost 10 times bigger than Texas, which means it's nearly as big as Canada and United States together. 

All the knowledge someone needs to create a web-server, a map-server, a web-site and to set them all up to work correctly requires 0time. I worked almost 31.000 hours for the last 5 years setting everything up correctly for my users. That means i have already passed through many difficulties, all of you know that, every time you try to do something  (even the same task) on a computer, a new problem might pop-up, but that’s what  life is all about. A great problem to be solved. 

I love what i do but I created this tool for you! I would like you to participate in my project and help me make it bigger!

I will appreciate any kind of help, so If you would like to help in any way (write a story about a Realm or a City, draw a dungeon map etc.), feel free to contact me through my web-site, e-mail or message me on social.


Thank you very much for your time! Please remember to share!

story:
THE TEAM:

My name is Nick, and I'm an independent video game programmer. My dream is to, like the dreams of many, become an influential and creative game designer to the best of my abilities. 

My current work towards that goal is this project: Post-Spatial Studios.

We currently consist of about 7 or 8 members (total count not final as of yet), including:

*Myself, the creator and aspiring CEO, having some experience in game programming and am currently pursuing a Computer Science degree through a university*

*My sister Antonia, and her roommate Caroline, who are both Digital Art/Graphic Design majors in SUNY Potsdam, a state college in Northern New York, and both of them are fantastic designers in every sense of the word*

*My associates: Cody, the lead writer and designer for storyboard, then there's Mike, also a writer/designer, and Jack, an assistant programmer*

*And also, a few friends who also work in art, design, or programming*

THE GOAL:

We need the above goal met in order to:

  • Acquire tools for game development
  • Acquire hardware and software relating to the tools
  • Establish ourselves as an official business
  • Start the hypothetical "engine" and the fuel that will drive us towards making GREAT games!

THE REWARDS:

Every dollar counts towards development, and we are thankful for any donation we may receive! In return, we will offer benefits such as:

  • Our thanks
  • Access to special news, notifications, and early access
  • Betas and Alphas for private testing
  • Eventually, limited edition physical copies of any games we produce.

NOTE: The reward depends on the amount donated.

HOW WE USE THE MONEY:

All the money donated will be stored in a central deposit account which, upon the official establishing of the LLC, will become part of the company's funds.

If we meet our goal, then the community that supports us will be gratefully thanked!

If we don't, then it's not the end of the world for us; We will use what we've got and still see if we can make our grand ideas for great games.

WHAT IT TAKES:

Game development, especially when it comes to making a company, is hard. We acknowledge that. However, despite our lack of mass amounts of experience in the industry, Post-Spatial Studios is comprised of personable, morale-driven employees who will stop at nothing to create the games you and I both want. In addition, they will devote most, if not all, of their free time to developing the games the world desires for the better.

CAN'T DONATE, BUT WANT TO HELP ANYWAYS?

We would love it if you told your friends/family/acquaintances/co-workers about this campaign and, in general, spread the word about our movement!

Facebook, Google+, E-mail, etc. All of that can be used to spread the word that Post-Spatial Studios might be the next big thing in gaming.

story:
What Is Heart2D ?
- Heart2D is interesting software. It will be the world's first software that truly allows anyone to create amazing games regardless of technical skill. Due to it's unique user interface, making games becomes a fluid process that doesn't require any scripting, programming or software design experience.

We will release Heart2D in this systems : Windows, Mac, Linux

Export your Heart2D projects to different platforms : Android, iOS, Windows Desktop, Windows Store, Amazon

Heart2D don't need third-party software to get your game in any kind of platform

Heart2D support this Ads : AdMob, HeyZap, Facebook, Chartboost, AppLovin, RevMob​


Who Is It For ?
- By design, Heart2D is intuitive. Anyone can use it. Unlike any other game maker, you don’t need to be a tech genius to use it. Simply put, Heart2D It will be popular with anyone who loves games. We have many great artists, makers, indie gamers, entrepreneurs and thinkers want use our software. The two things they have in common are: They love video games and creating new things.


What is the Goal of Heart2D ?
- The goal of the software was simple: to design the ultimate video game maker that allows anyone to make a video game. There is no coding or programming required. All the tools you need to complete your game is inside the software.


How Does It Work ?
- Creating games in our drag & drop software is as easy as making a PowerPoint presentation. It only takes a second to add a new character, enemy, object, platform, decoration, effect or background into your game, simply drag and drop the image into the level editor. You can also easily edit their properties if needed and test out the game throughout the entire process.

Platform behavior

The Platform behavior implements a side-view "jump and run" style movement. It supports slopes, moving platforms, "jump-thru" platforms, and arbitrary angles of gravity.

Jump-thru behavior

The Jump-thru behavior allows the Platform behavior to stand on the object, and jump on to it from underneath. This differs from the Solid behavior, which the Platform behavior can stand on, but not jump on to from underneath. The image below illustrates the difference.

8 Direction behavior

The 8 Direction behavior allows an object to be moved up, down, left, right and on diagonals, controlled by the arrow keys by default. It is often useful for controlling the player in a top-down view game. It can also be set to 4 directions or simple up/down or left/right movement which is useful for paddles or sliders.

Bullet behavior

The Bullet behavior simply moves an object forwards at an angle. However, it provides extra options like gravity and bouncing that allow it to also be used like a bouncing ball. Like the name suggests it is ideal for projectiles like bullets, but it is also useful for automatically controlling other types of objects like enemies which move forwards continuously.

Solid behavior

The Solid behavior makes other behaviors react to the object as if it were an impassable obstacle. Objects with this behavior are referred to as Solids. It affects the following behaviors:

  • 8 Direction,which is blocked by Solids
  • Bullet, which can optionally bounce off Solids
  • Platform, which can land on Solids. Platform cannot jump on to solids from underneath - for this, use the Jump-thru behavior.
  • Pathfinding, which by default uses solids as path obstacles.

Enemy behavior

The Enemy behavior this is an object that will kill the character on contact, and can be killed by attacking it.

Rotate behavior

The Rotate behavior simply makes an object spin.

Shadow caster

The Shadow caster behavior marks an object as casting a shadow from a Shadow light object.

******

Why we need funding ?

Financial support will help us to establish the program in an orderly manner, where the program's budget will be divided into several milestones to developers.

Our Team : 3 Developers with +25 years experience in building softwares.

We are evaluated from https://www.embarcadero.com/fr/mvp-directory

Our Gaols

Goal 1 : 60.000 $ - release Heart2D in this systems : Windows
Goal 2 : 85.000 $ - release Heart2D in this systems : Windows, Mac
Goal 3 : 120.000 $ - release Heart2D in this systems : Windows, Mac, Linux

Development schedule

Heart2D will take from the start to the end about 12 - 15 months development. 

Risks and challenges

We have been able to build a working prototype with basic functionality but it may require small changes for full software release. We will face more challenges and unforeseen product issues as we get closer to the release date. Every step in our development will be carefully selected to make this product even more special for our users.

We may need to make a few changes into the software design so the product can become more user friendly. This can cause the final product to be slightly different from our original prototype.

All of these factors can have an effect on release dates. We will work our hardest to achieve our set dates and deliver a product that both we and our investors are satisfied with.

We are looking forward with your great support  because Heart2D is different

We thank you from the deep of my heart because your support innovation and development. We promise and confidently provide the best and make available any person establishing distinctive game and shared with all of his friends and family.

Email : fushion2d@gmail.com​

Twitter : http://www.twitter.com/Heart2D_Games

story:
For years I have been waiting for a good star wars game to come out, I'm already 37 years old and still waiting, one could say I have given up on waiting and decided to make it myself, however this is just a modification on a suitable platform where one could Explore, Trade, and Build in the Star Wars universe.
My aim is maximum immersion, very high quality models and scenery, in line with the original trilogy.

Unfortunately my job does not leave me with much free time, and barely pays the bills, a few small donations can help me free up some time to work on this.

I'm in no way trying to make money on this, it is just a dream i want to see come true!


After a year of working on this we are at version 0.9.9 (99% complete)
Downloadable from MODDB, you guys can check out how its going.
I have spent almost every free minute I get on this, and in desperate need of more time for this.
I'm sure you are a eager as I am to dive into the star wars universe and build your own empire or defeat one.

many thanks :)

For years I have been waiting for a good star wars game to come out, I'm already 37 years old and still waiting, one could say I have given up on waiting and decided to make it myself, however this is just a modification on a suitable platform where one could Explore, Trade, and Build in the Star Wars universe.My aim is maximum immersion, very high quality models and scenery, in line with the original trilogy.Unfortunately my job does not leave me with much free time, and barely pays the bills, a few small donations can help me free up some time to work on this.
I'm in no way trying to make money on this, it is just a dream i want to see come true!
After a year of working on this we are at version 0.9.9 (99% complete)Downloadable from MODDB, you guys can check out how its going.I have spent almost every free minute I get on this, and in desperate need of more time for this.I'm sure you are a eager as I am to dive into the star wars universe and build your own empire or defeat one.many thanks :)

story:
Es geht, ging schon immer, und wird auch weiterhin auschließlich, um ETO, gehen!

ETO, das sind 62 Karten oder 124...oder 248...usw. naja, eben so viele, wie du ETO-Spiele miteinander kombinierst... und alle mit Begriffen zu denen passende Antworten gefunden werden müssen um Punkte zu erzielen. Ein Teil der Karten erfordert dabei besondere Leistungen deines humanoiden subdermalen Arbeitsspeichers und bietet einige rasante Überraschungen.

An die Karten und los!

Lade dir einfach eine kostenlose Testversion von ETO + Regeln auf unserer Webseite herunter und teste es selbst:

>>ETO-DOWNLOAD<<

 

 

Alles fing in einem kleinen Haus nahe am Waldrand an...

Wir, Wolfram, seines Zeichens Rattologe und auch sonst gebildeter Typ und Kai, väterlicher Alleinherrscher und theoretisch Physiker, begeistern uns schon seit frühester Jugend für Spiele aller Art. Daher und in Ermangelung wirklich nützlicher Fähigkeiten haben wir uns entschlossen gemeinsam eigene Spiele zu entwerfen. Eine erste Frucht unseres Genius darfst du hier nun bewundern. Wir präsentieren voller stolz und kein bisschen demütig: ETO, das beste Spiel diesseits des Orion!

 

Idee, Regeln und Design sind in trockenen Tüchern. Getestet wurde auch schon ausgiebig. Jetzt muss ETO es nur noch in die Regale und auf eure Tische schaffen!

Hier kommst du ins Spiel, also in die Kampagne... bzw. zu ETO... zu uns... also.....naja, du weißt schon. Jetzt brauchen wir dich und deine sauerverdiente Kohle! ;)

Mit dem Geld das durch die Kampagne aufgebracht wird, startet die Produktion der 1. Auflage von ETO. Schnapp dir also ein Paket und bringe ETO schon bald zum Spieleabend mit!

 

 

 

Individuelles ETO-Exemplar: Du darfst dir für eine Symbolreihe eigene Begriffe (8 Stück) ausdenken und ein Symbol aus einer extra Symbolreihe aussuchen welches es nur für das individuelle Exemplar gibt!

Gekaufte Freundschaft: Nach gemeinsamer Absprache bringen wir bei diesem Perk deinen Namen/Logo/etc. auf der Spielverpackung bzw. Anleitung der 1. Auflage von ETO an.

Nennung auf Webseite: Dein Name (Nickname) wird in einer Unterstützerliste auf der ETO-Webseite verewigt.

The voice of ETO: Unsere Sprecherin Julia spricht einen kurzen Text für dich ein, welchen wir dir als Audiodatei zur Verfügung stellen. Was gesagt werden soll, in welchem Tonfall und wofür die Aufnahme verwendet werden soll darfst du bestimmen! (Wir behalten uns das Recht vor bestimmte Texte/Themen und Verwendungszwecke abzulehnen.)

story:
Here's a sample PDF of the first two chapters of our setting The Faerie Ring. (The "Prelude" chapter explains how we're reaching far and wide for myths and folklore from around the world, not just from European origins. And the "Red Jack" chapter goes into depth on the kitsune and pipe foxes and murder stone and more.)  

Here's the quick description of what you'll get:

CAMPAIGN GUIDE: This book has 300+ pages. It contains details on ten fey lords, including their stats and their history and motivations and intrigues. There are new locations (demesnes, cities, planes) detailed for each of the fey lords, plus 40+ statted fey monsters. As stretch goals are unlocked, additional content will be added.  

PLAYER'S GUIDE: This book has 128+ pages. It contains eleven new fey player races. You'll learn the details of each race, what makes them different, and options for playing them. You'll get new archetypes, feats, racial traits, and more, including supernatural abilities unique to each race. (Pathfinder and 5E are being separately, so each will have content specific to that system.) As stretch goals are unlocked, additional content will be added.

MAGIC GUIDE: This book has 64+ pages, and it is a PDF included in the "ALL PDF" reward tiers. It will detail the Seelie and Unseelie Courts, providing magical options for players to take part in them and defend themselves from them. There will be new incantations/rituals, spells, strange and unique magic items, and interesting new magical systems, such as the moonshadow (which details how to incorporate the moon's influence on your fey). As stretch goals are unlocked, additional content will be added.

TWO EDITIONS: The books will be created for both Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and for 5E. Material will be converted if applicable, but otherwise, content will be created new for each to match each system's specific mechanics. Backers at a tier that includes "ALL PDF" will get the PDFs for both editions. For other PDF tiers and print editions, backers will be able to choose their edition.

STRETCH GOALS: "New Chapter" stretch goals will add digital content to each of the three core books. "Module" stretch goals will be available in "ALL PDF" tiers.

"ALL PDF" TIERS: If you select one of the tiers that says "ALL PDF", you will automatically receive (though depending on the tier, possibly more)... 

  • PDFs of the Campaign, Player's, and Magic Guides 
  • 12 fey adventures in 2016 (and any other PDF we publish for The Faerie Ring in 2016)

You will receive PDFs of both editions, Pathfinder and 5E. In addition, you will also receive any additional chapters or modules unlocked through stretch goals.

The Faerie Ring expands the fey options for both players and GMs using either Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or 5E and creates new opportunities for meddling where you probably shouldn't. It introduces new fey monsters, playable fey races and other character options, fey big bads or patrons (or both!), fey cities and planes and other locales, and more.

This project aims to highlight the fey: to build their mythos with the strong personalities of powerful fey lords, to build their mystery with extraplanar fey locales and adventures, and to build their influence with fey character options.

We're updating and remastering the two existing PDF releases ("Prelude" and "Red Jack") and incorporating them along with nine additional chapters of brand new content as The Faerie Ring: Along the Twisting Way in two printed volumes: a Campaign Guide and a Player's Guide. Plus, a third book in PDF, the Magic Guide.

The Faerie Ring began over 5 years ago and launched Zombie Sky Press. And though the project's been silent for a while, we've been quietly designing the whole time, and now, we're ready to unveil our plans. The original "Prelude" is linked in the Update section for everyone to check out. 

There's a plethora of amazing people designing and developing in our Fey Processing Plant, including Steven Helt (and the Horsemen), Monica Marlowe, Ben McFarland, Sarah Madsen, Mike Welham, Todd Stewart, Liz Courts, David Schwartz, John Bennett, Shawn Merwin, Dan Dillon, Chris Harris, Clinton Boomer, Wolfgang Baur, and Scott Gable. And visually, Julie Dillon, Carolina Eade, Domenico Neziti, and others are providing luscious fey creatures and landscapes. We'll be showcasing illustrations in our updates.

The first seven chapters are nearly complete and are going through final edits and layout. And the last three chapters are being designed now. We'll unveil each chapter to backers as they're finished. 

The Faerie Ring gives you everything you need to play with fey characters and in fey locales. It's not a setting but, instead, a toolbox--a series of mini-settings!--to add more fey to your favorite settings. (Not unlike our previous It Came From The Stars: Campaign Guide did for space.)

It contains 10 powerful fey lords and their servitors and demesnes. Each lord comes with an associated player race and extraplanar locales to add mystery, adventure, and whimsy to your campaign.  

There are three separate books. The Campaign Guide contains our constantly expanding fey mythos, including the details of 10 fey lords (including their stats), more than 30 fey monsters, exotic extraplanar locales, and more. The Player's Guide contains at least 11 playable fey races and all the fey-themed character options (archetypes, feats, items, and more) to make them and other non-fey characters spring to life in any campaign. The Magic Guide contains the magic of the fey, detailing the Seelie and Unseelie Courts, incantations, the moonshadow, and more.

The 10 fey lords:

  • Red Jack: A ghostly kitsune psychopath and avatar of death. He takes his love of death to a new level.
  • Hob: Silent and mysterious, eldest of the mogwoi lords. As different as they come. 
  • Jasmine: The Painted Lady. The Cannibal Queen. Driven by her hatred of Mab.
  • Manitou: Ancient trickster and horned god of the deep wood. Always looking to the horizon, wondering what’s on the other side. His own greatest foe.
  • Korapira: Mistress of the trees; terror in the leaves. Few can match her intensity and drive to get what she wants. She longs to bring her children—the entire plant kingdom—crashing down on the world.
  • Wild Hunt: The spirit of nature knows nothing of moderation. It cares nothing for mercy. It feels nothing for civilization. Its goal is survival, and for Slaine and the fir bolg, it is salvation. 
  • Mab: Queen Mab now speaks always of death, gloom, and the slow passing away of the fey worlds. She has become consumed by her regrets.
  • Moaro: A horrific and literal shadow of her former self, this darking is delusional and unpredictable, ever wandering.
  • Nemesis: Product of a tragic love story, she is now an uncaring engine of vengeance.
  • Flibbertigibbet: Clown prince of the mogwoi! Master of gremlins! Unintentional destroyer of worlds!

The 11 playable races:

  • Kitsune: Foxes. There's more to them than you think.
  • Matabiri: Aquatic and amoral scientists.
  • Black Hats & Far Darrig: Don't dare laugh at their magic hats.
  • Twilight Children (Changelings): Stolen and mixed-breed children. Always at the borders.
  • Putti: Psychic flower babies. Not as evil as their mother would like.
  • Fir Bolg: Nomadic dog warriors. Mortal enemies of the sidhe.  
  • Goodfellows: Winged sprites, hiding right behind you. 
  • Darklings: Militant crusaders from the plane of shadow.
  • Wyrd: Blind and prescient and not believing all your lies.
  • Bitterclaws: A more sophisticated brand of gremlin!

There will be two versions of The Faerie Ring: Along the Twisting Way. One for Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and one for 5E. The reward tiers are the same for both. You'll have a chance to choose your version during your backer survey after the campaign ends. 

If we exceed our funding? There are more fey lords awaiting their own spotlight. Maybe you can help us decide which to do next. Modo, the lord of murder, in his subterranean city of Agartha? Decade, mad psychic with dominion over time and space? Mahu, the lord of stealing, collecting all your stuff in Nowhere since the beginning of civilization? Wanamangura, the Rainbow Serpent, ever the dreamer? The mysterious Cicada? Obidicut, the lord of lust, in his city of Cockayne? Tane, fallen winged prince? Whiro, lord of the underworld? The dirty Mud Hermit? Rahab, the Chaosbringer? Or the terrible Morrigan and her sidhe city Tír na nÓg? (Who doesn't want to play as a sidhe!) Each unlocked lord will be developed as a new chapter, along with new player races and monsters and locations. And if we unlock 10 new ones, the second volume, Under a Poison Moon, will become available in print, as well. 

We also want to create modules, each with a fey-themed adventure and source material, such as the extraplanar deep-sea fey adventure Sea of Rahab by Todd Stewart (building from Hob's chapter in The Faerie Ring: Along the Twisting Way) and The Thousand Eyes by Richard Pett (building from Manitou's chapter).

When a "New Chapter" is unlocked below, we'll create a new fey lord and their monsters (for the Campaign Guide), a new player race and options (for the Player's Guide), and additional magic (for the Magic Guide). Each fey lord will be determined by the backers: want Modo next, or maybe Decade, or someone else?
