story:
THERE'S A DEMO AVAILABLE, A FREE DEMO YOU HEAR? NONE OF THAT EARLY ACCESS NONSENSE! CLICK HERE!

Speaking of which, DID WE ALSO MENTION WE ARE CURRENTLY ON STEAM GREENLIGHT FIGHTING HORDES OF INDIE GAMES TO BECOME AN OFFICIAL STEAM GAME!?!

STEAM CLIENT USERS, CLICK HERE!

Sorry, no more yelling. But seriously, we could really use your votes guys, we'll love you forever, even if you don't vote <3



Underhero is a 2D side-scroller RPG adventure with timing-based combat. It's a mysterious yet funny story, full of silly characters and quirky dialogue.

A love letter to Paper Mario games and RPGs in general, it tells the story of a world where the chosen one is gone, and a minion takes his place as the new "hero".

The game is still under development, but we have prepared a lengthy demo just to show you what we've got. Let us now what you think!



For Underhero we are using the Unity 3D engine, that lets us use real-time lighting, awesome-looking particle effects and a smooth 60 frames per second for gameplay. This game is not a 16 or 32 bit game specifically, but we are using a retro-inspired pixel art aesthetic combined with modern elements.

It looks pretty good, according to us. 



We have a very talented composer for the Underhero soundtrack, his name is Stijn van Wakeren and he's making a seamless blend of chiptune with modern instruments and sounds to create a peculiar style that fits very well with the game aesthetics. 

A fusion of retro and modern videogame music, super tasty.

If you want to know more about Stijn and his music, you can follow him right here!



As you may or may not know, making a game is quite expensive, time consuming and hard, especially for us since we live in Venezuela, a country full of complications and economic hardships.

Not to worry, though! We are not so easily stopped. We've been working hard and the game is currently 50% finished. We've managed on our own so far, but we still need your help for a few things:

- Software licences (Unity Pro, mostly.)

- Music (Stijn is a great guy, but even great guys deserve something for their hard work!)

- Sound effects

- Legal expenses

And that's about it! As you can see, we've managed ourselves so far with a very small budget, but we do need your help to make Underhero the game it deserves to be!



You heard that right! One of the rewards for helping fund Underhero's development is to join the army of the big baddie of the game, Mr. Stitches!

How does it work? We'll contact you and ask for your name, last name or nickname via email. When the game ships, you will eventually find a minion or enemy NPC with your name! Immortalize your handsome name inside the world of Underhero!

"Look son, that's me" that could be you in the future, immediately proceeded by insults of how awful old people games looked like.



$1 We <3 you forever.

As soon as the campaign ends, we will send you an email with sprinkles and kisses. We will also thank you for trusting AND believing in us with your hard earned money! We love your guts. *Winks*

$5 Digital copy of Underhero!

That's right! We'll give you a Steam key for Underhero!

Plus, your name in the credits, because you deserve it.

(Don't worry, you'll still get your "we love you" email <3 )

$10 Become a Minion!

We'll name an NPC/Enemy Minion with your gorgeous name and you will be part of Stitches' Army!

Just imagine the moment you find yourself. So deep.

-Plus all previous tiers!-

$15 Underhero Soundtrack!

You will receive a digital download of the Underhero OST!

Composed by our talented music man, Stijn van Wakeren.

-Plus all previous tiers!-

$25  Underhero Artbook!

You'll get a beautifully illustrated PDF digital book containing all promotional and concept art of the game! Plus, we'll throw in a nice digital poster just for you.

-Plus all previous tiers!-

"WHERE ARE MY PHYSICAL REWARDS YOU SCAMMERS!?!" I hear you ask.

Well, I'm afraid that due to our location, making and shipping physical rewards is extremely hard if not impossible.

That doesn't mean we're ruling out making cool merchandise in the future!                   But we'll just have to wait and see how things go.



We are Paper Castle Games, a small indie game studio based in Venezuela.

Lead Artist:

I'm Alvaro Dominguez, a.k.a Kay, ok? And I am drawing all the pretty stuff you see in the game! I also work on everything else that is not related to scary code.

Lead Programmer:

I'm Rafael Cabrera and I'm in charge of making the game fun and functional. I also work on everything else that is not related to combining pixels in such a manner that is pleasant to the eyes.

2 guys vs. the world, corniness is our strength.

This is our full time job by the way, this our only chance of making something worthwhile out of the situation we currently live in our country.

We believe in this game, and we believe in you! (I wasn't kidding with the corniness)

   



The only real risk is delaying Underhero until we find funds any other way to finalize development, if this campaign is unsuccessful, of course. (We might consider will do pole dancing for money).

Underhero is getting made, no matter what, baby!
story_txt:
THERE'S A DEMO AVAILABLE, A FREE DEMO YOU HEAR? NONE OF THAT EARLY ACCESS NONSENSE! CLICK HERE!Speaking of which, DID WE ALSO MENTION WE ARE CURRENTLY ON STEAM GREENLIGHT FIGHTING HORDES OF INDIE GAMES TO BECOME AN OFFICIAL STEAM GAME!?!STEAM CLIENT USERS, CLICK HERE!Sorry, no more yelling. But seriously, we could really use your votes guys, we'll love you forever, even if you don't vote <3Underhero is a 2D side-scroller RPG adventure with timing-based combat. It's a mysterious yet funny story, full of silly characters and quirky dialogue.A love letter to Paper Mario games and RPGs in general, it tells the story of a world where the chosen one is gone, and a minion takes his place as the new "hero".The game is still under development, but we have prepared a lengthy demo just to show you what we've got. Let us now what you think!
For Underhero we are using the Unity 3D engine, that lets us use real-time lighting, awesome-looking particle effects and a smooth 60 frames per second for gameplay. This game is not a 16 or 32 bit game specifically, but we are using a retro-inspired pixel art aesthetic combined with modern elements.It looks pretty good, according to us. 
We have a very talented composer for the Underhero soundtrack, his name is Stijn van Wakeren and he's making a seamless blend of chiptune with modern instruments and sounds to create a peculiar style that fits very well with the game aesthetics. A fusion of retro and modern videogame music, super tasty.If you want to know more about Stijn and his music, you can follow him right here!
As you may or may not know, making a game is quite expensive, time consuming and hard, especially for us since we live in Venezuela, a country full of complications and economic hardships.Not to worry, though! We are not so easily stopped. We've been working hard and the game is currently 50% finished. We've managed on our own so far, but we still need your help for a few things:- Software licences (Unity Pro, mostly.)- Music (Stijn is a great guy, but even great guys deserve something for their hard work!)- Sound effects- Legal expensesAnd that's about it! As you can see, we've managed ourselves so far with a very small budget, but we do need your help to make Underhero the game it deserves to be!
You heard that right! One of the rewards for helping fund Underhero's development is to join the army of the big baddie of the game, Mr. Stitches!How does it work? We'll contact you and ask for your name, last name or nickname via email. When the game ships, you will eventually find a minion or enemy NPC with your name! Immortalize your handsome name inside the world of Underhero!"Look son, that's me" that could be you in the future, immediately proceeded by insults of how awful old people games looked like.
$1 We <3 you forever.As soon as the campaign ends, we will send you an email with sprinkles and kisses. We will also thank you for trusting AND believing in us with your hard earned money! We love your guts. *Winks*$5 Digital copy of Underhero!That's right! We'll give you a Steam key for Underhero!Plus, your name in the credits, because you deserve it.(Don't worry, you'll still get your "we love you" email <3 )$10 Become a Minion!We'll name an NPC/Enemy Minion with your gorgeous name and you will be part of Stitches' Army!Just imagine the moment you find yourself. So deep.-Plus all previous tiers!-$15 Underhero Soundtrack!You will receive a digital download of the Underhero OST!Composed by our talented music man, Stijn van Wakeren.-Plus all previous tiers!-$25  Underhero Artbook!You'll get a beautifully illustrated PDF digital book containing all promotional and concept art of the game! Plus, we'll throw in a nice digital poster just for you.-Plus all previous tiers!-"WHERE ARE MY PHYSICAL REWARDS YOU SCAMMERS!?!" I hear you ask.Well, I'm afraid that due to our location, making and shipping physical rewards is extremely hard if not impossible.That doesn't mean we're ruling out making cool merchandise in the future!                   But we'll just have to wait and see how things go.
We are Paper Castle Games, a small indie game studio based in Venezuela.Lead Artist:I'm Alvaro Dominguez, a.k.a Kay, ok? And I am drawing all the pretty stuff you see in the game! I also work on everything else that is not related to scary code.Lead Programmer:I'm Rafael Cabrera and I'm in charge of making the game fun and functional. I also work on everything else that is not related to combining pixels in such a manner that is pleasant to the eyes.2 guys vs. the world, corniness is our strength.This is our full time job by the way, this our only chance of making something worthwhile out of the situation we currently live in our country.We believe in this game, and we believe in you! (I wasn't kidding with the corniness)
    

The only real risk is delaying Underhero until we find funds any other way to finalize development, if this campaign is unsuccessful, of course. (We might consider will do pole dancing for money).Underhero is getting made, no matter what, baby!

story:
Please note:
Finnish law doesn't allow us to accept donations without compensation. If you wish to contribute, please select a perk. Thank you!


Download our alpha demo and test the game for yourself!
(Versions for Windows, Mac and Linux available. Note that Mac and Linux versions have received little to no testing and are mostly provided as proof that those versions are also in the works. )

Help us get on Steam and vote for us on Steam Greenlight!

You are the Boy. You wake up in a prison cell. As you get your bearings, you are suddenly released. Where are you? Who are you?  Explore dungeons, woods, mines and more to figure out (or indeed remember) the truth. The answers are out there, though they might not be what you expect.

So what's the gameplay like? People like comparisons, so I'll give it a go: think of it as a top-down Zelda game, with the mouse-driven movement from Warcraft 3 and various MOBA titles,  mixed with a little bit of Diablo and The Binding of Isaac for good measure. And Bastion. Definitely some Bastion.

You can also find a post about the game's inspirations on my blog.

The main features of the game include:

  • Mouse-driven gameplay inspired by old-school RPGs and RTSs.
  • Randomly generated levels, each with more to explore than the previous one.
  • You get one life to tackle the challenge (a.k.a. permanent death).
  • Familiar combat with a twist: the more damage you take, the less damage you can inflict.
  • Alter the way you play: Make deals so magic orbs give you stamina instead, inflict and take double damage, or pay the price of magic with your stamina...
  • Piece together the lore throughout the game. You might not get all of it on the first run, but you’ll want to play again to get the whole story.
  • Voice-acted narration that doesn't interrupt gameplay
  • Good old secret areas that are... well, secret.
  • Oh yeah, and epic boss fights:

The combat is pretty cool. Here is what we think makes it so:

  • Stamina - Stamina Points (SP) are both the player's health and attack power: the more damage you take, the less damage you deal.
  • Magic - All magic spells are equal and cost 1 Magic Point (MP) to use. Choose which spell to use depending on the situation.
  • Deals - You can make deals to drastically change your playstyle: what if both you  and your enemies take double damage? How about using your Magic Points as a lifesource, but not being able to cast spells?



Here's what the money we make will be used for:

  • Rent (and maybe a little bit of food)
  • Voice talent
  • Testing devices

Exceeding our goal will also make our lives a lot easier and it would greatly helps us with things that we would otherwise pay from our own pocket, such as:

  • Web hosting
  • Software licenses
  • Marketing



You can try our public demo build of the game right now!

The game is currently in what we consider an alpha. Alphas, betas and other Greek alphabet don't really mean much these days, but to give you and idea of where we are at, our current estimate is to release the full game in fall 2015.

Of course, we will also post regular updates on development to keep you up to date.



We would like to stay independent, to stay true to our vision and to develop the game in close contact with people who are interested in it (that's you guys!). Working with traditional publishers doesn't give us this kind of freedom.

We love making games and if funded, this campaign would allow us to focus all our energy on just that! For us, this would be a dream come true; and you get a better game too.


Thinking about getting the soundtrack? Here are some samples, have a listen:


Thinking about getting the poster, t-shirt or both? Here's how they will look:

     


  • Janne Markkula - Formidable 3d artist, game designer and animator. Every model, texture and particle effect in the game is made by this guy. Programming? Janne does that too.

  • Trevor Gast -  Composer extraordinaire who also does sound effects. Every sound in the game is Trevor's doing.


And So It Was is currently developed with Windows PC as the main platform. Right now we have limited devices to test the game on, which is why we have this focus.

The game is made with the Unity game engine, which offers platform options for Mac and Linux as well, so if we get funded, we'll be looking at those next. The current alpha build runs on both of those operating systems, so getting the final game to Mac and Linux in addition to Windows is very likely.

System requirements are not set in stone at this point, but we will do our best to optimize the game to run on pretty much all modern computers and hopefully older ones as well.


  • From a gameplay standpoint, we want to make sure the game feels challenging but balanced. In a randomly generated environment, perfecting this will take time, but we believe we can do it.

  • This is our most ambitious project to date, so we expect to encounter some challenges in development, but with a fully-funded project we can face these head-on. Our commitment to this game has already produced fun and interesting results and we believe that once you get your hands on the game, you will agree.


  • Vote for us on Steam Greenlight!
  • Follow us on Twitter! (Janne Markkula)
  • Like us on Facebook!
  • Subscribe to us on Youtube!
  • Check out our website, the game's website and our presskit!
  • Share this campaign on any and all social media!
  • Tell your friends!


If the goal is not met, will the game still be made?
Yes. We are determined to make this game, funded or not. This is why we have chosen flexible funding.
However, we won't be able to cover all development expenses on our own, which means that if we don't get funded, we will need to have regular jobs to pay the bills. Not being able to work on the game full time will significantly reduce effective development time, which pushes the release date back.

Which platforms will the game be available on?
We're currently looking at Windows only for release. We are very interested in Mac and Linux as well, but we have too limited time and equipment to promise anything on that front. That said, both Mac and Linux versions are very likely to happen at some point. 
As for consoles, they are currently pretty much out of our reach. 

Can I influence the game's development/make suggestions?

Absolutely! You can reach out on Twitter or comment on our Greenlight page. All feedback is greatly appreciated and taken into account.
If you would like to be more directly involved, you can take a look at our Assistant Game Designer and Game Designer perks.

Controller support?
The game has been developed from the start as  a PC game with mouse control, so... probably not. Sorry.

Will the game be on Steam?
That is our hope, yes. You can help us get there by voting for us on Steam Greenlight.

story:
You want to get your hands on one of these characters and enter the adventure world of railroad builders from the 19th century. Help us make this game world a reality.

Your navvy goal is to build the railroad, while fighting to survive all the dangers the desert could offer. 


Gameplay 

In Navvy you carefully place pieces of the rail track. You are highly advised to avoid all obstacles along the way, such as shovels, TNT, abandoned mining cars, crates, rocks and cacti, because if you hit one of these it is Game Over! Not only that, but you are running against the clock, which starts ticking faster with each level. Obviously, the railroad company is exploiting human labor. 

But wait, what is that... Right there, on the ground... A flask? A flask of water? Praise the Lord as this will slow the clock a bit, so you could rest! 

If only there was a way to jump over some obstacles, or even destroy them... However, this task would require springs or a gun...

Character animations


What What We Need & What You Get

We need to collect 2,000 US Dollars in order to: 

  • Design and create the game artwork (sprites, characters, backgrounds, etc). 
  • Develop the code for iOS, Android and Windows mobile.
  • Generate the sounds and music. 
  • Anything left will be invested in an AdWords advertisement campaign.
Although words cannot describe our gratitude, we humbly offer to include your name/nickname in the game's credits. 
Any donation is welcomed or you can choose one of our special perks, that can get you a t-shirt, instant beta access, own character creation or being listed as an official sponsor in the game credits section. 
In case we fail to reach our goal of 2,000 USD, everything we collect will be spent for the creation of the game.  
Gameplay screenshots


The bigger picture

In case we exceed our target amount, we will develop various game features and add-ons as follows:

  • Design new obstacles; Time extension bonuses; Destroying obstacles feature and bonus points for each destroyed obstacle; Shields and lives feature; 
  • Initiate Navvy Friends (new standalone application): Facebook integrated multiplayer; multiple levels; player challenges; new characters; character specific bonuses and add-ons;  Navvy store; Facebook integrated level leader-boards; Facebook web application.



What is Navvy, after all?

As per Wikipedia: "Navvy, a shorter form of navigator (UK) or navigational engineer (US), is particularly applied to describe the manual labourers working on major civil engineering projects (canals, railroads, etc) and occasionally (in North America) to refer to mechanical shovels and earth moving machinery"

Unable to donate, but still want to help us?


Spread the word! Share/like this page on Facebook or any social media you prefer :)

story:
Space Mode Tech Demo
Many people have been asking where the game play video is. We have have working prototypes on display in the gallery however they do not express the full vision. We could show you guys pieces of technology however it is your backing that will help us achieve our goals. we are primarily an art team and programmers cost quite a lot. With your help, we can get this project in to a playable state.
If every person who has visited up to this point had contributed a single dollar to our campaign, we would already have a playable game to show. 

NanoCore is a Multi-Player Online 4X game. It presents a Top Down Space Action Shooter with Customizable Collectable Card Game. It'll have many different modes such as: solo mission based mechanics and tournament mechanics. 
 One of our goals are to introduce a monetary system that goes away from the pay to Win mechanic and more towards pay to enrich our client base. The goal is to have a system where people can make money by selling gold to other players. 
As the game becomes more demanding and popular, we have been estimated to make a large amount of income. Which is a mechanic has been tried and failed by many game companies. With our system, both the player and the company will be rewarded, and giving us the ability to hire more and grow our idea, bigger! There will be will have a free to play web player client available by fall 2015 with commercials in the mission system. These commercials are all internal and are not associated with third party organizations.
Purchasing a full version of the game will remove all commercials from the web player as well as unlocking downloadable client on all available platforms.

Technology

all music and sound effects will be provided by:

East Coast Audio
Mason Fisher from East Coast Game Audio is the Audio Engineer from the world renowned AAA title Galactic Civilizations!


The following assets are already in our possession and do not need to be purchased.

  1. Shader Forge - link
  2. Grid Framework - link
  3. Bolt Network Engine - link
  4. Space Graphics Toolkit - link - demo
  5. SpaceShips Constructor Vol. 1 - link
  6. SpaceShips Constructor Vol. 2 - link
  7. SpaceShips Constructor Vol. 3 - link
  8. Ultimate Starship Collection - link
Platforms:

World Wide server using Amazon EC2 Cloud Services with Amazon Beanstalk for reliability.

Space Mode

As you build a ship you can venture into space. This is needed as you explore out to meet new users, discover players planets to unlock the ability to trade with those users, build friends and enemies and run in to hostile AI Aliens. The space mode is presented as a 3D top down faction action space shooter with thousands of ship combinations available. 
  1. Solar Systems
  2. Star Lanes
  3. Orbital Structures
  4. Newtonian Physics

City Mode

As you build and upgrade your city, assets that you are producing like ships and cards will produce faster.
  1. Housing
  2. Food Production
  3. Factory
  4. Refinery
  5. Mines
  6. Foundry
  7. Ship Yard
  8. Mission Control
  9. Bank / vault
  10. Space Port / Ship Yard

CCG Mode

NanoCore CCG mechanics are a supplemental feature in order to do artefact hunting in the game.  Combat in the missions is relative to the type of planet your city is on. Expedition missions are done by visiting someone's planet and delivering an expedition team. You can then access expeditions on that planet until the planet owner discovers the team.
  1. Infantry Cards
  2. Mechanized Ground Cards
  3. Mechanized Air Cards
  4. Instant Cards
  5. NanoCore Cards


Providing we reach our goal, we can achieve alpha access in roughly 3 months. A large majority of the artwork for this stage, is already complete. We have primarily been an art team from the beginning. Programming hasn't been an easy hurdle, as we only have 1 programmer experienced in this. The project is overwhelming for one person, and thus hiring additional help would relieve much of the strain. We would like for this project to eventually make it the point, that it can sustain a team of developers, full time. With stretch goals, the dream and finished game, can become more of a reality to everyone.

With your help, this campaign will allow us to bring this game to life. It will give us the resources needed to hire out-sourcing, in order to get our product live. The contributions will also allow us to pay existing outsourcing bills that we have already accumulated. We have a strong art team, however we need to reinforce the 3d section of our team. This includes, but is not limited to texture and 3d asset creation. We need to hire specialty Programmers, with experience in Unity3d. On my income, I don't make enough to subsidize an individuals income. Everything up til now has been done under volunteered time. Below is a projection chart, of our estimate to the initial goal of $20,000, and how we would distribute funds.


We understand this game is flex funded however this game will be getting completed, even if no one contrinutes. However this would cause development take take conciderably longer then we are all hoping so if you have read this all and like our game idea, be sure to get yourself a perk on the right and make this game happen faster.



Carbon GameStudio is a Start-UP Independent Game Developer located in Calgary Alberta. Our game team is made up of Numerous developers locations around the world.

NanoCore Cards




Providing we reach our goal, we can achieve alpha access in roughly 3 months. A large majority of the artwork for this stage, is already complete. We have primarily been an art team from the beginning. Programming hasn't been an easy hurdle, as we only have 1 programmer experienced in this. The project is overwhelming for one person, and thus hiring additional help would relieve much of the strain. We would like for this project to eventually make it the point, that it can sustain a team of developers, full time. With stretch goals, the dream and finished game, can become more of a reality to everyone.


    


With your help, this campaign will allow us to bring this game to life. It will give us the resources needed to hire out-sourcing, in order to get our product live. The contributions will also allow us to pay existing outsourcing bills that we have already accumulated. We have a strong art team, however we need to reinforce the 3d section of our team. This includes, but is not limited to texture and 3d asset creation. We need to hire specialty Programmers, with experience in Unity3d. On my income, I don't make enough to subsidize an individuals income. Everything up til now has been done under volunteered time. Below is a projection chart, of our estimate to the initial goal of $20,000, and how we would distribute funds.



We understand this game is flex funded however this game will be getting completed, even if no one contrinutes. However this would cause development take take conciderably longer then we are all hoping so if you have read this all and like our game idea, be sure to get yourself a perk on the right and make this game happen faster.










Carbon GameStudio is a Start-UP Independent Game Developer located in Calgary Alberta. Our game team is made up of Numerous developers locations around the world.

story:
Who is Plummet Free Fall

I am a very lucky man.

 Seven years ago while in Beijng I had a freak accident. With no warning, I tumbled down a construction shaft and fractured my spine. My sole memory of the accident was the free falling plummet I had before hitting my head on the side. I woke  to find myself at the bottom of a construction shaft with a sore head, tight chest and the broken pieces of a wooden plank which I had crashed through during my plummet. If that plank hadn’t been there, I believe I would be a lot worse off then. I was there for an hour before firemen were called in to pull me out of this enclosed space. It was easily the most terrifying experience of my life and has caused me considerable consistent pain for the last seven years.

In 2014, I was free-falling again – I had been made redundant. Suddenly I had lots of spare time. I decided to create something special to mark the anniversary of my accident in Beijing. What I created was Plummet Free Fall,  a endless falling game where you guide a game version of me. The designer captured me well (however I didn't believe I was that ginger).



Even before launching the internet grabbed hold of my story and Plummet Free Fall started appearing in Business Insider, Tech in Asia and Boy Genius Report. Then once launched amazingly it became national and then international news. 


 One of my personal highlights though, was when the Tim Ferriss who started me on this journey when I read Four Hour Work Week,  tweeted my story.


So now two weeks after launch, can happily say the app as preformed beyond my wildest estimates. I was thinking 10,000 downloads and preform well in New Zealand and I will be happy. 
As of today Plummet Free Fall has 200,000 downloads and has been a #1 app in two countries (Russia & Belarus) and the #1 game in three countries (Russia, Belarus and Ukraine).

I never thought my simple game built in my home office in Evans Bay in Wellington, would go around the world. Thank you all who downloaded. You can check out gameplay video below (thank you Appgame | CONNECT for putting this together). I hope you enjoy the free fall.....


The Campaign

I had grand plans for a animated pitch video, however got told tonight that BBC are interested in my story and it is going live to 200 countries tomorrow. I thought it would be unentrepreneurial of me not to have something ready for my biggest news platform yet.

I would love to bring an Android version to all the people who ask me daily "When are you making the Android version"

However the one person in particular I would love to make an  Android version for is  my Grandma. She is one of the biggest supporters of Plummet, however she only has an Android phone. 

Here we are (the two in the middle) celebrating my cousin's fantastic wedding in New Plymouth.


What We Need & What You Get

Converting an iPhone app to Android is harder task then expect with significant amount of work required and  a completely different skill set needed. 

We are after $4000 USD to be used entirely for development of the Android version. This would include approximately

-  $2500 porting

- $500 on tweaking some game design issues 

- $1000 testing for all those Android devices 

As Plummet Free Fall is a free game and I don't want to waste the money my backers shipping tshirts.  I came up with some cool perks which use my time. If you think of any fantastic perks I could add (and they aren't weird or anything) let me know and I will add it to the list.

If we don't reach the goal, the focus will still be on getting the Android version complete and I will just need to raise the funds else where.

Risks & Challenges

Key risk is there are always unknown with development. Since we have done this once before with the iPhone version, I believe we can overcome these obstacles.

Other Ways You Can Help

Download the iPhone game if you are a iPhone user, tell all your other iPhone friends about it and play the game  constantly

Share the story and like/ follow us on Facebook and Twitter

A Special Thanks!

Would like to say a special thanks to my extremely supportive fiancée who has to hear me talk about Plummet every 30 minutes. Love you!!

story:
Download on Steam (As a demo to Faceless), or IndieDB.
(The Sorrowvirus will also be available on Itch.io and GameJolt shortly.)

When we first decided to create a crowdfunding campaign, we knew that we needed to have something playable for you all to experience. We felt that an idea alone was simply not enough to secure your hard-earned funds, and more importantly, your trust.

The Sorrowvirus is just one of the short single-player stories that will be featured within Faceless. The Sorrowvirus explores Wyatt Heyll's penultimate visit to Purgatory as he fights to end his suffering at the hands of his parents once and for all. The Sorrowvirus allows the player to explore a twisted amalgamation of abandoned areas from Wakeland City as Wyatt is overwhelmed by guilt for ignoring the Dolls of Wakeland City. As you venture through The Sorrowvirus again after completing it in search of the True Ending, the threat level will increase and you will struggle even further to keep track of time in a timeless place. Be on the lookout for a secret within The Sorrowvirus to be eligible for a secret, limited and discounted backer perk here on IndieGoGo!

Many of you may know Faceless as the Slender-Man game that was being developed on the Source Engine from 2013-2014. After receiving a Cease & Desist from the Slender-Man's option holders, we rebooted the project with a new and improved monster, as well as a new and improved story. It was originally designed to be a multi-player remake of The Eight Pages. But it now focuses around its multi-player gamemode, Dolls of Wakeland.

Dolls of Wakeland is our main multiplayer (and singleplayer) gamemode that allows for up to four players to explore eight possible locations in Wakeland City that are known to have Ritual Zones located within them. Ritual Zones allow for any Dolls you find to have the souls trapped within them set free. Setting all of the souls free from each location brings you closer from freeing Wakeland City from its nauseating effects, which is the sole reason why no life wanders there.

However, the game's wounded antagonist, the Soulrender, is lurking around the corner. With souls as its only food source, it won't let you go easily. Encountering the Soulrender will cause you to either pass out from overwhelming nausea if you stay too close for it for too long or be knocked out from a violent hit. The Soulrender will never kill you, allowing your friends to revive you when they are able to. The Soulrender's appearance is currently being kept a secret, and will be revealed at a later date!

The secondary antagonists are Anomalies, charred and firey figures seen in the trailer and screenshots above. These dormant threats will appear around the map when you and your friends begin collecting and freeing souls. This particular kind of Anomaly has skin that is lethal to the touch, so be careful when sprinting around corners, because you never know where they'll appear.

The Dolls have at least two-hundred potential spawn points in each map, meaning that in every game, it is exceptionally rare, if not nearly impossible that there will ever be the same pattern of Dolls twice.

Aside from The Sorrowvirus, which is available now, Faceless will also have additional Short Stories, some which will explore different genres of gameplay, including a sidescroller horror and a PSX-era prequel story.

Whispers of Wakeland is a single player Prologue to Faceless, which follows Elijah Grey (Sam A. Mowry (Amnesia: The Dark Descent)) as he makes his way towards the Fallen Grace Church in order to search for Daniel North. He must find out if the Sorrowvirus was successful in destroying the Soulrender and survive the Anomalies that gather at the Asylum underneath the church. When signs begin to appear that something inexplicable happened here, Elijah must work his way carefully around the Anomalies that lurk through the Asylum and try to escape.

The Perishing of Daniel North is a single player Epilogue to Faceless, as you take control of the signature character of Faceless; Daniel North. You must guide Daniel through Purgatory as he remembers the pivotal moments that occurred before his downfall and find your way out from the ever-changing, timeless place. Anomalies return in TPoDN as Daniel roams through a warped version of his childhood home, and other important places in his life.

Watchmaker consists of six members, not including the incredible voice talent and volunteers who have helped along the way.

Adam Sklar, Project Lead, Level Designer and Writer: I'm Adam Sklar, and I'm the Project Lead for Faceless.  I joined the team back when it was another game entirely, and I'm exceptionally proud of everybody who has contributed their incredible skills towards this Short Story. We look forward to bringing more of Faceless to you!

Ángel C. Rodríguez, 3D Artist & Texture Designer: My name is Angel. I'm a Spanish 3D modeller currently based in Gijon. I've been working on Faceless for more than 5 years, bringing to life our monsters, dolls and other sick things Adam has told me. I really hope you like all the things we have done.

David Denyer, Music Composer: My name is David Denyer. I'm an English-German-Armenian, multi-award-winning composer, violinist, and sound artist, currently based in London. I'm very prolific within the experimental and fringe theatre scenes in London. I also work frequently in film, video-games, and am a founding member and performer in the Echoshed Collective, I'm a co-founder of the newly-established Quiet Tyrant record label and I generally take any opportunity to fill dark rooms with unbearably loud and deeply unsettling noises.

Vinícius Rodrigues dos Santos, Programmer: My name is Vinícius, I'm a Computer Scientist/Game Developer for the last 6 years, currently working on indie games and VR applications. I'm doing Gameplay, UI and Network programming for Faceless, learning a lot in the process.

Natacha Rollin Abastado, Animator: I'm Natacha R.A., a 3D Animator/Layout Artist from France. As a kid, I've always loved drawing and watching animated stuff. I started animating around 9 with dough, in stop motion. Years later, at 12, I knew I wanted to make career in the animation field, and never stopped to pursue this dream. I'm working professionally in animation since 2013 and worked on different projects, from Feature Lenghts to Animated Series, as a Layout Artist, Animator and Illustrator. During my spare time, I make Machinimas on Source Filmmaker. On Faceless, I'm taking care of giving emotions and motions to our creatures, dolls and survivors.

John Pata, Technical Sound Designer: I'm John Pata, a Technical Sound Designer based in Australia. For over three years now, I've been designing and implementing Audio for Faceless. Thanks to the collaborative efforts of the team, we've made something that looks (and sounds) very special.

As is always the case, based on the reception and success of the game, we'd love nothing more than to add further content to it, such as an additional multi-player gamemode and some new maps. Right now, however, Faceless will come with one multiplayer gamemode and eight maps. (Four small, four large based on the intended length of gameplay players would like.) Our current plans are to launch the game with one multiplayer gamemode and four maps, and release the remaining four maps throughout the first year of release.

The other multiplayer gamemode that we would like to make would be Doll Hunt, a gamemode that can be played in any of the existing maps where up to 8 people are split into two teams. Dolls, and Hunters. The Dolls are given a set amount of time to find a space to hide from the Hunters, while the Hunters must find the Dolls and deliver them to the Ritual Zones.

 

The most important thing for us is ensuring that your kind contributions to our project do not go unnoticed, every single one of your donations is crucial to ensuring that we are able to get the resources we need to complete our game.

  • Our funding will be going towards ensuring that we can complete this game without facing the various hurdles that we've continuously faced with little to no funding. Development hell and periods of limbo will be a thing of the past as your funding will allow us to continue working on this project every day.
     
  • Your donations will go towards allowing us as a team to devote more of our time to Faceless, allowing for us to work on it for longer durations of time rather than the amount of time we were limited to while developing The Sorrowvirus.
     
  • Donating to this project allows for you to access the Backers Exclusive room on our Discord channel, further tiers will warrant in higher rewards!
     
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will ensure that we make the most of our funding to complete the game as soon as possible through the help of additional programmers, which your funding will go towards.
     
  • If we exceed our goal, all of the extra funding will be used to secure more programming help for longer, manifesting additional planned multiplayer gamemodes and maps. 

Your support will be extremely crucial in allowing us to bring Faceless to life in ways we couldn't imagine previously.

  • With your support, Faceless will develop quicker with access to funds that will support its creation. The Sorrowvirus took a long time to make due to lack of time and funds. We want to make sure that isn't the case from now on!
  • With those supports in our Backer Chat in Discord, we'll be able to receive feedback and suggestions from valuable members of the community for them to help shape and craft the future of Faceless along with us.

As always, there are risks and challenges that come with every project and every idea, but we hope that providing The Sorrowvirus entirely for free can be seen as a gesture of kindness as well as a proof of determination, we absolutely want Faceless to be completed in its entirety and we want to do that alongside you.

  • Delays are commonplace in many areas of creative development and video game development is no exception. Should there ever be any delays in development, we will be 100% transparent with you and explain how we plan to tackle these delays.
  • As this is a flexible campaign, the estimated release date for the project will depend on how successful the campaign is, but as always, we'll be transparent with you in regards to this.

Our Discord is open to the public! Join us. There are exclusive backer rooms for those who support the project, and these amazing backers will also receive early access to news, promotional content and more, as well as behind-the-scenes content that will not be shown to the public.

If you really, really want to support Faceless, or have already supported Faceless and want to know what else you can kindly do to help, please feel free to any and/or all of the following!

  • Share the campaign with your social media and with your friends! This way, your friends may be able to help support the project further by donating, or recommending it to friends of friends!
  • Like our Facebook Page and follow our Twitter to share/retweet our posts!
  • Suggest your favourite YouTuber to play The Sorrowvirus on their channel, it'll help raise awareness for our project so that those who are interested may be able to either donate or further spread awareness!

If you have any questions that you would like to ask about the project, the team, our crowdfunding page or anything else, feel free to send me a question above by clicking "Ask A Question." I'll be sure to answer as many as I can, and compile the most frequent questions into a FAQ update below! You can also ask questions on our Discord Server, which is open to all!

 

-

story:
Every child learns differently. Some can follow instructions and others simply cannot grasp the concept, no matter how basic it might seem to an adult. It's easy for a barrier to build up between a frustrated child and their parent or teacher. Learning is a challenge!

To remove this barrier, we are designing, developing, and publishing a set of applications for all kids - no matter their needs. Our apps will be available on iOS, Android and Kindle, based around game-like learning, to give children an entertaining way to learn. It will feature more than four hundred universal good manners, including proper etiquette and routine tasks, problem-solving, and decision-making via moral-based stories and activities. Each will be broken down into an easy to understand, productive exercise.


Every child has the right to learn new things, to feel included and to participate in social activities.  This is harder for some kids than others, but it doesn't mean a space should be left between them. Children deserve to have equal footing in this world, a start that's dependable and productive, especially for those who need extra encouragement. 

We are focusing on the concepts of sharing, playing well with other children, being productive in school, and taking care of health. Each lesson will lead into an interactive moral-based story, followed by kid-friendly, productive exercises that will help the lesson be happily remembered and easily applied.


These apps could be used as a tool at school and at home, beginning at an early stage.

Children will have the chance to build up independence, confidence, and ease of making friends and setting goals and keeping both. The role-play moral-based stories and related multi-sensory activities will help motivate them to use the lessons learned in their physical lives.

With our apps, children learn in a fun and rewarding way, which reduces pressure and lessens frustrations that traditional teaching methods tend to promote. An example of taking care of one's self: most children, when asked to explain how to brush their teeth, will simply say to put toothpaste on the toothbrush and then brush the teeth. Our app provides a clearer explanation and demonstration for your child - running through the motions of selecting the proper toothbrush, wetting it, placing only a small amount of toothpaste on it, adjusting the angle of the brush with the gums, how to brush properly, rinse the mouth, rinse the brush, and rinse the sink. Mom will love that last part.

We are breaking down these tasks into simple steps, so that they are easier to understand and remember.

The lessons that these amazing and interactive apps will include, for example:

•  Wash hands

•  Brush teeth

•  Sharing is caring

•  Meeting and greeting

These apps are fully interactive, complete with animation. Users are encouraged to practice a task until mastered and offered positive feedback when a task is done correctly. Audio reinforcements, such as clapping, help keep the user motivated. 

Children can play with the screens by tapping different parts of it. For example - a lesson on sharing, may be accompanied by a drag and drop screen, to give the user a chance to share their virtual object.

This tool isn't just for school but for the home as well. Kids enjoy playing these apps on smartphones or tablets–so whether they’re home or traveling on a bus, plane or train, they’ll be able to play and learn. The travel time will just fly by!

Never before has a learning series like this been launched on mobile devices or tablets. It's a fresh and entertaining way to teach children social skills, fine motor skills, visual perception, visual scanning, and other skills that lead to a happier, more successful life.


Give your children the start they deserve.


Children’s use of parents’ mobile devices and tablets at home is a common “every day” occurrence. The bright colors and entertaining sound effects featured in mobile apps are like magnets, drawing children in and holding their attention tightly. 

There's no child that would turn down the chance to play with a tablet. There are, however, concerns from the parents: what if this app isn't really child-friendly? Are they just wasting their time? Couldn't they be doing something more productive, something more engaging?

Our apps eliminate those concerns: we have your children in mind, from start to finish. We want to entertain and educate children everywhere in a fun and creative way. Your child will soon be lost in the colorful background and role-play style of moral-based stories. They won't even realize that they're learning!

Your worries will be gone...and your children will get a strong boost in learning.


We have worked passionately for three years on "Helping Children Learn." We are an eclectic group from the East and West who share the same goal. 

We realize that children in every nation need a strong start in life - that's something that we can all agree on. We, as adults, are responsible for providing that start. 

Our team is composed of experts from graphic designers to developers, educational professionals to medical professionals! We use our joint knowledge to create the content for the apps and ensure that the education provided is top-notch.

Mirza Zaim Baig began his professional career in the technology industry in 2000. By 2003, he was able to obtain a Masters’ degree in Information Technology. Software Development is his passion, and it’s also what he has been involved in for the past fifteen years, including analysis, technical sales, software development, and management positions.

Suzanne Bowen taught English to children ages 10 - 13 for eleven years, co-founded a 1999 dot-com Super Technologies, Inc., and runs a copy editing business. She has traveled throughout Pakistan, Germany, Mexico, the Middle East, UK and North America, was once homeless, and is an avid marathon runner. 

Collins Lai all kinds of beautiful things! Appreciate graphics, illustration, architectures, etc., but prefers to specialize in digital, magazine, editorial and illustration. 


Development of quality graphics isn't cheap. It isn't something that can be done quickly, either. We are in some of the final stages of production for the series of mobile apps. Test runs are in process now to ensure that everything runs smoothly and most, if not all, of the content has already been written. 

After three years of hard work, all of our available resources have become sparse. The goal of our product is to offer a helping hand to children. Now, we need your helping hands to keep going.

The goal is to raise enough funds to turn the series of apps into a reality. Financial support is needed to kick-start this program. Everyone who backs this product will be able to see the progress of the design and development team first-hand –they will know exactly how their funds are being put to use!


After three years of hard work and countless hours of research, we have almost made it. The project is almost complete. Almost...but not quite!

To complete this project, we need to bring more hands on board. 

The final designs for the app will be made once the game has been played through by a variety of beta testers. Once our required funds have been met, we will start rolling out the first apps that will be ready in three to four months from that moment.


The funds that we raise here will be spent on the design, development, testing and publication of these apps, as well as the perks for the campaign. Our backers are allowed to request an audit at any time, to serve as a proof that their donations are being used as promised.

We cannot stress how important it is to meet our required funds! The entire work can be completed in eighteen months, once we have the resources to begin. During this tenure, we will make sure that everyone who contributes is kept up-to-date on where we are with the program. 

It's not an easy goal, but it's very much worth it. Children everywhere will benefit from this product. The apps will be made available on iOS, Android, and Kindle platforms. The original product will be written in English only.

We would love to produce other versions of this app, in multiple languages. If we surpass the goal, we will be able to release the series in more languages and on other platforms. The more children we reach, the more of our goal we have achieved. If we raise over 360k, we will be able to bring these resources where digital education is not even available right now. Our vision for the future? We want to donate tablets to schools with the apps installed, to mentor and volunteer at schools and other community venues, and to encourage others to do the same. See our budget chart (above) please.


Become our ambassador and spread the word in your community. Tell people about this campaign and convince them to join us. Mom will love it!

Be our social media guru and spread the word about #HelpingChildrenLearn @Indiegogo on Facebook  or Twitter.

Click here to tweet

Click here to post on Facebook


You have questions? We have answers. :) Have a new question? Please contact us and we will do our best to help.

Q: How are these apps are going to aid in the education of children?

A: Our team has been carefully selected from across the world and from extremely relative industries. Though we come from varied lives, we all share the same dream of creating a better and brighter future for children. Each member of this team was selected for the expertise that they have in their chosen profession, be it branches of education, writing, or design.

From the start of the design process to the day that these apps are published, your children are the only priority. The entire team is deeply involved in this project, to ensure that every aspect is dealt with perfectly.

Q: When will you start designing and developing this series?

A: As soon as the campaign ends.

Q: How do I follow the progress of the project?

A: Our backers will be kept up to date via a progress report that we will periodically send out. We will also add a Progress Section to our website, which every backer will have access to. Backers will be able to see what the team has already completed, what we are currently working on, and what will be started next. Updates will be frequently posted on our social media pages as well.

Q: When will I receive my perks?

A: There is always a chance that schedules will change. However, if we raise enough funds with this campaign, our work will begin on August of 2015. Once we begin production, we will start sending out your perks.

Soft copies will be sent within the first month. Over the next three to four months, we will send out the rest of the items. You will receive them all by or before January of 2016.

Some of the perks take more time. This includes testing out the apps. As soon as the campaign ends, we will begin putting out updates on the availability of the perks.

Q: What if I want more than one perk package? Am I able to get more than one stand-alone perk?

A: Multiple pledges can be made on Indiegogo by the same account. So long as the same email address and login have been used, we will know that all of the perks are meant to go to the same person.

Q: What will happen if I make a contribution for this series and it ends up not being made?

A: It's very unlikely that this series will not be published. However, if something does come up and the series isn't published, you will still receive any of the perks that we're able to produce. They will be genuine collectibles!

For perks that can't be created without completing the series, we will issue a partial refund for your contribution. We want to ensure that all of the help we receive is accounted for.

Q: If I name a character, am I able to name it anything that I want?

A: For the most part, yes. All names will be reviewed by our content writers and the other professionals on our team. As these apps are meant for children, we need to make sure that every part of them is appropriate.


––––

Photo credits: Brad Flickinger

story:
In 1993, Thomas Zighem wrote the first chapter of a game that is still close to the heart of many turn-based strategy games fans.
In 2011, Genesia: Ultimate Domain was reborn and released on iPad.

Get ready for 2015!

The year of Genesia Legacy!

  • Turn-based strategy and management game in a beautiful living world!
  • Start a new life: send your troops explore unknown territories.
  • Expand your territory: train your settlers to survive harsh seasons and weather.
  • Build! Have your architects build fields, barracks, taverns, workshops... They have dozens of construction plans.
  • Keep a balanced ecosystem: Will you protect or damage the environment? Your actions have an impact on the world.
  • Combat epidemics: Find remedies, brew potions. Achieve scientific progress!
  • Meet historical figures: William Walace, Richard Lionheart, Leonardo Da Vinci, Galileo, Blaise Pascal, Jane Shore, Marco Polo and many others...
  • Will you be a tyrant? Will you plunge your people into war, spread terror, practice slavery and develop weapons of destruction in order to accomplish your quest?
  • Or... Will you be kind and wise?
  • Procedural world generation: You will never play the same game twice. High replay value!
  • An elaborate and detailed game with a coherent ecosystem.
  • Retro graphics: undeniably charming.
  • Up to 3 players in hotseat mode.

The game is in both French and English

  • Steam Early Access (alpha) Q3 2015.
  • Final release of a digital version of the game (Windows, Mac OS X & Linux) via Steam or DRM-Free will be scheduled end of 2015.

About the project owner

My name is Thomas ZIGHEM, I'm 44 years old and I've had a passion for programming and video games since I was only 15. Back then, having a computer at home was unusual, and we didn't really know what we could do with it.

During my career as a developer, I have held various positions such as game designer, programmer, graphic designer, animator and Technical Director, where I could express my attention to detail and my creativity.

For more than two years now, Evelyne and I have been working on "Genesia Legacy", which is scheduled to be released for Windows, Mac OS X and Linux in 2015, and later for iOS and Android tablets.

Honey, we're on TV!

In october 2014, when Twitch launched the Game Development category, I jumped at the opportunity to be a pioneer and to share my work and my experience during "live streams". There I can answer your questions live and show you the progression of the development of "Genesia Legacy".

  • Sir Thomas on Twitch

Why a crowdfunding campaign?

Since 21 january 2013, the development of Genesia Legacy has been solely financed by our own savings. Your contribution will not only allow us to keep on developing the game, but will also help us ease our daily expenses. By making this gesture, you're supporting the work of two independant developers.

Please share on your social network

Word of mouth is the key to success, don't forget to share this page on social medias & forums, that will help us a lot!

It's time to vote!

Back to top

En 1993, Thomas Zighem écrivait le 1er chapitre d’un jeu qui allait « marquer » le coeur des fans de jeux de stratégie au tour par tour.
L'année 2011 marqua la renaissance de Genesia sur iPad.

Soyez prêts pour 2015 !

L’année de Genesia Legacy !

  • Gestion & Stratégie au tour par tour dans un monde vivant !
  • Démarrez une nouvelle vie. Envoyez vos militaires explorer des territoires inconnus.
  • Développez votre territoire. Formez vos colons pour survivre aux saisons, et aux intempéries.
  • Bâtissez ! Ordonnez la construction de champs, jardins, casernes, tavernes, ateliers... Vos architectes possèdent les plans de dizaines de constructions.
  • Veillez à l’équilibre naturel. Allez vous détruire ou protéger l’environnement ? Vos actions ont un impact sur le monde.
  • Luttez contre les épidémies. Découvrez des remèdes, des potions. Faites progresser les sciences !
  • Rencontrez des personnages illustres William Wallace, Richard Coeur de Lion, Leonard De Vinci, Galilée, Blaise Pascal, Jane Shore, Marco Polo et bien d’autres...
  • Agirez vous comme un tyran ? Allez-vous plonger votre peuple dans la guerre, semer la terreur, pratiquer l'esclavage et développer des engins de destruction pour accomplir votre quête ?
  • Ou ferez-vous preuve... De sagesse et de bonté ?
  • Un univers procédural. 2 parties ne se ressemblent jamais. Une durée de vie colossale !
  • Un jeu complet. D’une grande profondeur, qui possède un écosystème cohérent.
  • Des graphismes rétro au charme indéniable.
  • Jusqu'à 3 joueurs. En mode « Hotseat ».

Le jeu sera disponible en français et en anglais

  • En accès anticipé sur Steam (alpha) au 3e trimestre 2015.
  • La version finale au format digital (Windows, Mac OS X & Linux) via Steam ou sans DRM est prévue pour la fin de l’année 2015.

Les porteurs du projet

Je m'appelle Thomas ZIGHEM, j'ai 44 ans et je suis passionné par l'informatique et l'univers vidéo ludique.  Cette passion est née lorsque j'étais enfant, vers l'âge de 15 ans. À cette époque, posséder un ordinateur chez soi était considéré comme « curieux » et l'on ne savait pas vraiment à quoi ces machines pouvaient servir.

Au cours de ma carrière de développeur, j'ai occupé de nombreux postes dans lesquels j'ai pu exprimer mon sens de la rigueur et de la créativité : game designer, programmeur, graphiste, animateur, directeur technique.

Depuis plus de 2 ans, Evelyne et moi-même travaillons à la création de « Genesia Legacy » dont la sortie est prévue sur Windows, Mac OS X & Linux, puis un peu plus tard pour Tablettes iOS & Android.

Chérie ! On passe a la télé !

En octobre 2014, lorsque Twitch a annoncé l'ouverture d'une chaîne exclusivement dédiée à la création de jeux vidéo, j'ai saisi l'opportunité pour y diffuser mes « Live Stream ». Je me suis installé en pionnier sur la chaîne « Game Development » pour y partager mon travail et mon expérience. C'est l'occasion pour moi de répondre en direct à vos questions tout en dévoilant mon jeu en cours de développement : « Genesia Legacy ».

  • Sir Thomas sur Twitch

Pourquoi le financement participatif ?

Depuis le 21 janvier 2013, le développement de « Genesia Legacy » est entièrement financé par nos économies. Votre contribution va nous permettre de continuer plus sereinement la création du jeu et nous soulager dans nos frais quotidiens. En faisant ce geste, vous soutenez deux développeurs indépendants dans leur travail.

Partagez cette page avec vos amis

N'hésitez pas à partager cette page sur vos réseaux sociaux, de nos jours, pour les développeurs indépendants c'est important, et ce sont de petits gestes qui peuvent nous aider.

Il est temps de voter !

Retour en haut de page

Back then, having a computer at home was unusual, and we didn't really know what we could do with it.During my career as a developer, I have held various positions such as game designer, programmer, graphic designer, animator and Technical Director, where I could express my attention to detail and my creativity.For more than two years now, Evelyne and I have been working on "Genesia Legacy", which is scheduled to be released for Windows, Mac OS X and Linux in 2015, and later for iOS and Android tablets.Honey, we're on TV!In october 2014, when Twitch launched the Game Development category, I jumped at the opportunity to be a pioneer and to share my work and my experience during "live streams". There I can answer your questions live and show you the progression of the development of "Genesia Legacy".Sir Thomas on TwitchWhy a crowdfunding campaign?Since 21 january 2013, the development of Genesia Legacy has been solely financed by our own savings. Your contribution will not only allow us to keep on developing the game, but will also help us ease our daily expenses. By making this gesture, you're supporting the work of two independant developers.Please share on your social networkWord of mouth is the key to success, don't forget to share this page on social medias & forums, that will help us a lot!It's time to vote!Back to top

En 1993, Thomas Zighem écrivait le 1er chapitre d’un jeu qui allait « marquer » le coeur des fans de jeux de stratégie au tour par tour.L'année 2011 marqua la renaissance de Genesia sur iPad.Soyez prêts pour 2015 !L’année de Genesia Legacy !
Gestion & Stratégie au tour par tour dans un monde vivant !
Démarrez une nouvelle vie. Envoyez vos militaires explorer des territoires inconnus.
Développez votre territoire. Formez vos colons pour survivre aux saisons, et aux intempéries.
Bâtissez ! Ordonnez la construction de champs, jardins, casernes, tavernes, ateliers... Vos architectes possèdent les plans de dizaines de constructions.
Veillez à l’équilibre naturel. Allez vous détruire ou protéger l’environnement ? Vos actions ont un impact sur le monde.
Luttez contre les épidémies. Découvrez des remèdes, des potions. Faites progresser les sciences !
Rencontrez des personnages illustres William Wallace, Richard Coeur de Lion, Leonard De Vinci, Galilée, Blaise Pascal, Jane Shore, Marco Polo et bien d’autres...
Agirez vous comme un tyran ? Allez-vous plonger votre peuple dans la guerre, semer la terreur, pratiquer l'esclavage et développer des engins de destruction pour accomplir votre quête ?
Ou ferez-vous preuve... De sagesse et de bonté ?
Un univers procédural. 2 parties ne se ressemblent jamais. Une durée de vie colossale !
Un jeu complet. D’une grande profondeur, qui possède un écosystème cohérent.
Des graphismes rétro au charme indéniable.
Jusqu'à 3 joueurs. En mode « Hotseat ».
Le jeu sera disponible en français et en anglais
En accès anticipé sur Steam (alpha) au 3e trimestre 2015.
La version finale au format digital (Windows, Mac OS X & Linux) via Steam ou sans DRM est prévue pour la fin de l’année 2015.
Les porteurs du projetJe m'appelle Thomas ZIGHEM, j'ai 44 ans et je suis passionné par l'informatique et l'univers vidéo ludique.  Cette passion est née lorsque j'étais enfant, vers l'âge de 15 ans. À cette époque, posséder un ordinateur chez soi était considéré comme « curieux » et l'on ne savait pas vraiment à quoi ces machines pouvaient servir.Au cours de ma carrière de développeur, j'ai occupé de nombreux postes dans lesquels j'ai pu exprimer mon sens de la rigueur et de la créativité : game designer, programmeur, graphiste, animateur, directeur technique.Depuis plus de 2 ans, Evelyne et moi-même travaillons à la création de « Genesia Legacy » dont la sortie est prévue sur Windows, Mac OS X & Linux, puis un peu plus tard pour Tablettes iOS & Android.Chérie ! On passe a la télé !En octobre 2014, lorsque Twitch a annoncé l'ouverture d'une chaîne exclusivement dédiée à la création de jeux vidéo, j'ai saisi l'opportunité pour y diffuser mes « Live Stream ». Je me suis installé en pionnier sur la chaîne « Game Development » pour y partager mon travail et mon expérience. C'est l'occasion pour moi de répondre en direct à vos questions tout en dévoilant mon jeu en cours de développement : « Genesia Legacy ».Sir Thomas sur TwitchPourquoi le financement participatif ?Depuis le 21 janvier 2013, le développement de « Genesia Legacy » est entièrement financé par nos économies. Votre contribution va nous permettre de continuer plus sereinement la création du jeu et nous soulager dans nos frais quotidiens. En faisant ce geste, vous soutenez deux développeurs indépendants dans leur travail.Partagez cette page avec vos amisN'hésitez pas à partager cette page sur vos réseaux sociaux, de nos jours, pour les développeurs indépendants c'est important, et ce sont de petits gestes qui peuvent nous aider.Il est temps de voter !Retour en haut de page

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I'm Thomas Whitaker. I'm an entrepreneur and motorcycle technician. I started GrandShare to make people happy. GrandShare sends regular HD art-quality photo cards to loved ones on your behalf--with one click.

There's a generational divide: some of us love digital and some of us prefer paper. But that shouldn't make it harder to share all the joy that photos bring! That's what GrandShare does: we bridge this gap in a way that makes it easy for everyone. You click, we do the work.

GrandShare is an app that functions in the background of your life. 

  • Sign up with your address and the address of your loved one.
  • Take a great picture. 
  • Click on the GrandShare icon.
  • We'll do the rest.

We differ from other photo printing companies because of our simplicity. Here's what you do not have to do: 

  • edit 
  • design
  • print 
  • mail 
  • remember
  • worry

Your loved one gets a real gift in their hands and you get the satisfaction of knowing that everyone is included. They will be delighted that you thought of them--and thrilled that they got a picture without using a password, smartphone, or computer! It's so simple!

We're asking for your contribution to help finish our app, set up our printing center, and market our app to people who want to share. We've invested our time, money, and passion into this project. Your help gets us off the ground. 

  Thanks for your support!

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $34,000 to cover the following things:

  • App development: we are almost done with an iOS version, but we need help testing it, making adjustments, adding a secure pay system, and creating an Android version.
  • Marketing: we plan to market through social media campaigns, email, and print materials at strategic locations.
  • Employees: we need good help! We'd like to be able to hire energetic workers to print photos, screen photos, market our product, develop new ideas, and provide high-quality customer service as soon as possible.
  • Materials and office space: we've invested our own money in materials, but we will need more supplies and space as we expand.

Any amount of money will help us reach our goal. GrandShare is currently a company with five part-time employees. We will expand intelligently based on resources. 

With more contributions, we can offer more services to more people at a faster rate, including more frequently sent photo cards and international service. 

Any amount helps, though, as we have the materials and person-power to operate on a small scale currently.

We appreciate you! We are so grateful for your help! Any amount will do a lot to get us off the ground. We offer backers everything from personalized coupon codes to trips to Philadelphia based on your contribution. Check out our perks!

The Impact

GrandShare is a labor of love that responds to an important need in our society. What started out as personal--an ability to share paper photos of my niece with older family members--has become much more. We have met people everywhere who know someone who wants a paper photo, but they feel like they don't have the time or means to print it and send it. 

This is not just about us, but about making a large number of people happy, too.

It makes sense that so many people prefer paper--there's something so fleeting about a digital photo. Here's what's special about GrandShare photo cards:

  • They last.
  • They can't be accidentally deleted.
  • They don't require a password.
  • They don't require battery power.
  • They don't require internet access.
  • They don't become obsolete when the next version comes out.

People who want paper are right to prefer its durability and usefulness. 

People with smartphones who want to print pictures with ease will love this service, and there is a large population of people who will love the paper gifts they receive. These customers include:

  • people who like simply receiving a card in the mail.
  • people who are home-bound.
  • people who can't afford smart phones or who don't want to use them.
  • people who are incarcerated.
  • people with limited internet access.
There are a lot of folks who want to share and a lot of folks who want to receive! All of these are great reasons to choose GrandShare!

What's More

GrandShare is a company in good hands. The co-founders have decades of experience in finance, marketing, IT, and education. We care about people and about ways to make them happy. Our IT director has also run two other successful businesses. Our marketing specialists are professional writers and consultants. In addition to my experience working in finance, I've owned companies and am a certified Harley Davidson mechanic. I make things work. GrandShare is comprised of a team of dedicated and talented people committed to our work. Check out our story in The Philly Voice!

Risks & Challenges

As a small start-up family company, we acknowledge that we will face some challenges. Here are some of the strategies that we have developed to address potential growth and development issues:

  • Beginning small with sectional product distribution
  • Initial domestic service
  • Applying for patents
  • Establishing partnerships with local and national businesses
  • Finding and hiring highly talented independent contractors
  • Ensuring the appropriateness of all images sent
  • Developing new options as we expand
  • Using environmentally friendly materials

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute today? 

No problem! Get the word out! There are a lot of people out there who will be excited about our app. Let them know. Thanks!

Is there something you do that might be of help to us (coding, marketing, or legal advice)? We'd love to chat! 

Drop us a line: contact@grandsharephotos.com
