story:
Platforms : Windows / Linux . DEMO Available, Links Below

NOTE : To claim the perks for this game, you must click on the actual perk at the right side, on its CLAIM THIS PERK button.

For Windows : Get the demo on IndieDB

For Windows : Mirror at MediaFire

For Linux : IndieDB

For Linux : Mediafire

The demo is now also available on GameJolt and Itch.io

3:00am Dead Time is a single and multiplayer horror game involving a group of amateur paranormal researchers who won the casting for a one of a kind TV show that will send them to different haunted and mysterious locations across the United States, and later on, in different countries. 

This is an investigation, exploration and high horror game. We have made extra efforts to make sure that the full game won't depend on jumpscares to get you to the edge of your seat, but rather on a carefully crafted atmosphere and building tension with the stakes getting higher as you progress.

3:00am Dead Time is also a game of stories and people. During the different episodes you will interact and interview the witnesses and victims of the events, learn their stories, and see them through their eyes during the Flashback sections. Then, during the actual Episode, you will need to get ready and bring on all the equipment : cameras, recorders, motion trackers, small drones, EMF detectors etc. to ensure you capture the best evidence for the viewers around the world.

From the very beggining you will encounter many different kinds of phenomena, from ghosts and poltergeists to demons, aliens and ghouls, the paranormal world is big and complex, full of mysteries to explore and solve.


 

3:00am Dead Time is a game that rewards first and foremost the exploration. During the main Mission, you and your team are expected to search for evidences of the paranormal around the location, to identify them, and to document it all for the TV show, either with pictures, recordings or taking samples. In many cases, an investigation won't be complete until you manage to stop the current paranormal phenomenon, facing it directly.

 

The game is split into numerous Episodes, each one completely unique, with its own story, characters, creatures and phenomena. Many of them feature unique gameplay mechanics specific for them, and some occur even in broad daylight. Besides the main Mission, where the crew has to explore the place, document the phenomena (or even fight it), interview the witnesses and uncover the mysteries of the place, there are also multiple Flashback levels which further explore the story of each location. In each main Episode you will get a Rating based on your investigation work, and you can also unlock a number of secret items and collectibles.

 

In short, these are the game's main features :

  • Multiple Episodes, each one with different locations in the United States and across the world, characters, creatures and stories. 
  • Exploration and story based gameplay, where you have to uncover the secrets of each place, learn its story, and face the paranormal events that are present there.
  • Single and Multiplayer missions. Play with AI companions or make your own investigation team with up to 3 friends.
  • Flashback and testimony episodes to further explore (in playable form) the story of the different locations.
  • Branching stories. Each episode has multiple endings and turns along the way, to let you decide how you want to act. Do you want to explore quietly and just document any events that happen in front of you? Are you more interested in interviewing the local people to understand better the phenomena? Or should you force the situation, and try to provoke the entities? The decision is completely up to you.
  • Wide array of equipment. Unlock different pieces of equipment as you complete different missions. Better cameras equipped with nightvision and longer battery life, movement sensors, advanced recorders, small drones... use the best tools to get the job done.
  • Old school style. 3:00am Dead Time is a heavily atmospheric game. From the beggining we have made great efforts to make sure the scares come from the stories, the locations and getting you immersed in the environment rather than a gallery of jumpscares. 
  • Multi-perspective. No matter your preferred style of horror games, 3:00am Dead Time has something for you. First Person highly immersing experience, a Third Person horror adventure or an old school movie-style camera (as seen in the original RE titles), they are all included.

  • In-depth investigation system. Collect samples, document everything you see, record sounds, take pictures, interview the locals and the witnesses or even ask the help of an expert to protect the team from the paranormal forces, or to interact with them.
  • Complex and rich mythology. The game features dozens of different creatures, paranormal phenomena and events, all based on real testimonies and the folklore of many places around the world. The paranormal world is so much more than just ghosts and demons.
  • Mood and Behavior AI. Your character will get scared according to what happens in the game and your actions, and in turn, the game's behavior will also change to reflect that mood. Besides, almost every paranormal event is randomized and procedural, making the encounters different every time you play a mission.

 

With 3:00am Dead Time, almost every single piece of content has been developed from zero by ourselves. This has allowed us to greatly reduce development costs, but to improve the quality of the game as well as the speed of development, we need to upgrade both our tools and equipment. The money collected will be used as follows :

  • Tools and software for our 3D artist (ZBrush, Substance Painter, Substance Designer).
  • Upgrades to our main PC (Windows) to improve the quality and speed of our development workflow and reduce the time to build each new version of the game.
  • Upgrades to the secondary PCs (3D artist PC and Linux PC) to maximize the working speed of the content creation as well as the quality and performance of the Linux version of the game.
  • Plugins and Extensions for Unity3D. These are needed to reduce the development times and improve the overall quality / performance.
  • Voice Acting and Music. 
  • Further Localization of the game.

If the initial goal is surpassed, the extra funds will be used for, in order, each one of the stretch goals specified above. 

WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DONT MEET THESE GOALS

The initial goal we have set up for this funding campaign are the minimum we need to finish the game's development with all the content and ideas we've planned, and in a shorter development time. So far, all of the development expenses have been covered by ourselves. However, if the initial goal is not met, we will still finish the game as close as possible to our initial vision, but it will obviously need to be reduced in scale and scope, and the development time will be extended. The money collected will be used as specified above, and in that order, to help us improve the game as much as we can. Even if not all the goals are met, 3:00am Dead Time will be delivered. 

 

 

Every funder will be included in the game's credits, and if the goal is surpassed, we have plans to make additions and upgrades for all the perks.

 

Irreverent Software  is a small game development team of 4 members.

  • Jorge Pinal N. - Programmer / Writer / Game Designer / 3D & 2D artist. He is the level/game designer, programmer and one of the two 3D artists in Irreverent Software. He is also the main writer and designer behind 3:00am Dead Time. With extensive coding experience both inside and outside game development, almost every line of code behind our games is made from scratch by him.
  • Daniel Pinal N. - 3D Animator / 2D artist / Traditional 2D art. With several years of experience in both digital and traditional art as well as extensive work as freelancer, he is the one who makes all the concept art, sketches, base designs, drawings and wallpapers for the game, as well as most of the 3D animations. 
  • Manuel Pinal G. - 3D artist / 2D artist. He is the second 3D artist in Irreverent Software, and the one in charge of most of the high-quality character sculpting, rigging and retopology. WIth more than 20 years of experience in 3D and 2D design including extensive experience with CAD tools, he has contributed with many high fidelity artwork pieces.
  • Lydia Negrete T. - Creative Assistance / Financial Assistance / Quality testing. She gives the team financial, creative and story supervision with her experience in Language and Accountancy, as well as extensive bug tracking and quality test work.

 

And giving his help to this project to give it its very own and distinct Original Soundtrack,  the very talented Konstantin Shmyrev is the composer behind every track in 3:00am Dead Time.

 

As a team, we aim to achieve the highest quality in our work and provide the best experience to all the gamers. So far, thousands of hours have been put into the development of 3:00am Dead Time to make sure that both the playable demo and the full game reach the expectatives that we have planned for it.

This game is our dream project, an idea we have been working on even years before the first line of code was written, polishing the stories and all the features we wanted to include, putting all of our time and savings on pushing it this far.  Your help is very needed and will be extremely appreciated, to make 3:00am Dead Time a reality, and make it reach its full potential as a highly memorable and unique horror experience.

In the space below we have put a simple FAQ, but if you have any question or want to give any feedback to our team, you can easily reach us here in the comments,  at irrsoft@zoho.com, IndieDB or through Twitter , where we post daily updates on the game.

 

Thanks for reading, and for all your support!

The Irreverent Software Team

 

 

Q : Will the game be DRM-Free?

A : A DRM-Free version of the game is planned to be released along with the final Steam version of the game.

Q : Will the requirements change during development?

A : The requirements for the game are not definitive at this point of the development. However, they won't be much different from the ones used for the demo. To know if your PC can handle the game, we recommend you to download and try the demo version.

Q : Will 3:00am Dead Time be released for other platforms or VR?

A : Initial release of the game is planned for Windows and Linux. If there are chances to port the game to more platforms (including consoles and VR) we will make the corresponding update and share the news here.

Q : How long is the full game? How many levels does it have?

A : Right now we have six episodes (each one with multiple levels) planned for the full game, with heavy work in the first two episodes already going on. Additional levels might be added depending on if we reach the stretch goals of this funding campaign. Taking into account the pre-Alpha length of a normal episode, the full game will be between 8 and 14 hours long for one branch of each mission's story and only in single player. The game has high replayability value. The demo we released represents less than 20 percent of the length of a normal Episode.

Q : Will the game be available in X language (voice and texts)?

A : So far a release in both English and Spanish is planned, with additional languages depending on the success of the funding campaign. 

Q : Will the game be available on different stores?

A : The game has already been approved on Steam Greenlight, so a Steam release is planned and in the works. There is also planned release (including Early Access) for GameJolt. A release on GOG is also planned, but it will depend on their approval process. If you have any suggestions for more stores where you would like to see the game, contact us and we will research the possibility to send the game for approval there too.

This has allowed us to greatly reduce development costs, but to improve the quality of the game as well as the speed of development, we need to upgrade both our tools and equipment. Tools and software for our 3D artist (ZBrush, Substance Painter, Substance Designer).

Upgrades to our main PC (Windows) to improve the quality and speed of our development workflow and reduce the time to build each new version of the game.

Upgrades to the secondary PCs (3D artist PC and Linux PC) to maximize the working speed of the content creation as well as the quality and performance of the Linux version of the game.

Plugins and Extensions for Unity3D. These are needed to reduce the development times and improve the overall quality / performance.

Voice Acting and Music. 
Further Localization of the game.
If the initial goal is surpassed, the extra funds will be used for, in order, each one of the stretch goals specified above. WHAT HAPPENS IF WE DONT MEET THESE GOALSThe initial goal we have set up for this funding campaign are the minimum we need to finish the game's development with all the content and ideas we've planned, and in a shorter development time. So far, all of the development expenses have been covered by ourselves. However, if the initial goal is not met, we will still finish the game as close as possible to our initial vision, but it will obviously need to be reduced in scale and scope, and the development time will be extended. The money collected will be used as specified above, and in that order, to help us improve the game as much as we can. Even if not all the goals are met, 3:00am Dead Time will be delivered.   Every funder will be included in the game's credits, and if the goal is surpassed, we have plans to make additions and upgrades for all the perks. Irreverent Software  is a small game development team of 4 members.

Jorge Pinal N. - Programmer / Writer / Game Designer / 3D & 2D artist. He is the level/game designer, programmer and one of the two 3D artists in Irreverent Software. He is also the main writer and designer behind 3:00am Dead Time. With extensive coding experience both inside and outside game development, almost every line of code behind our games is made from scratch by him.

Daniel Pinal N. - 3D Animator / 2D artist / Traditional 2D art. With several years of experience in both digital and traditional art as well as extensive work as freelancer, he is the one who makes all the concept art, sketches, base designs, drawings and wallpapers for the game, as well as most of the 3D animations. 

Manuel Pinal G. - 3D artist / 2D artist. He is the second 3D artist in Irreverent Software, and the one in charge of most of the high-quality character sculpting, rigging and retopology. WIth more than 20 years of experience in 3D and 2D design including extensive experience with CAD tools, he has contributed with many high fidelity artwork pieces.

Lydia Negrete T. - Creative Assistance / Financial Assistance / Quality testing. She gives the team financial, creative and story supervision with her experience in Language and Accountancy, as well as extensive bug tracking and quality test work.
 And giving his help to this project to give it its very own and distinct Original Soundtrack,  the very talented Konstantin Shmyrev is the composer behind every track in 3:00am Dead Time. As a team, we aim to achieve the highest quality in our work and provide the best experience to all the gamers. So far, thousands of hours have been put into the development of 3:00am Dead Time to make sure that both the playable demo and the full game reach the expectatives that we have planned for it.This game is our dream project, an idea we have been working on even years before the first line of code was written, polishing the stories and all the features we wanted to include, putting all of our time and savings on pushing it this far.  Your help is very needed and will be extremely appreciated, to make 3:00am Dead Time a reality, and make it reach its full potential as a highly memorable and unique horror experience.In the space below we have put a simple FAQ, but if you have any question or want to give any feedback to our team, you can easily reach us here in the comments,  at irrsoft@zoho.com, IndieDB or through Twitter , where we post daily updates on the game. Thanks for reading, and for all your support!The Irreverent Software Team  Q : Will the game be DRM-Free?A : A DRM-Free version of the game is planned to be released along with the final Steam version of the game.Q : Will the requirements change during development?A : The requirements for the game are not definitive at this point of the development. However, they won't be much different from the ones used for the demo. To know if your PC can handle the game, we recommend you to download and try the demo version.Q : Will 3:00am Dead Time be released for other platforms or VR?A : Initial release of the game is planned for Windows and Linux. If there are chances to port the game to more platforms (including consoles and VR) we will make the corresponding update and share the news here.Q : How long is the full game? How many levels does it have?A : Right now we have six episodes (each one with multiple levels) planned for the full game, with heavy work in the first two episodes already going on. Additional levels might be added depending on if we reach the stretch goals of this funding campaign. Taking into account the pre-Alpha length of a normal episode, the full game will be between 8 and 14 hours long for one branch of each mission's story and only in single player. The game has high replayability value. The demo we released represents less than 20 percent of the length of a normal Episode.Q : Will the game be available in X language (voice and texts)?A : So far a release in both English and Spanish is planned, with additional languages depending on the success of the funding campaign. Q : Will the game be available on different stores?A : The game has already been approved on Steam Greenlight, so a Steam release is planned and in the works. There is also planned release (including Early Access) for GameJolt. A release on GOG is also planned, but it will depend on their approval process. If you have any suggestions for more stores where you would like to see the game, contact us and we will research the possibility to send the game for approval there too.

story:
Earth vs. Drumgore! Play online as either an Earth native or a Steampunk soldier from Drumgore (a member of Lord Anna's military). Experience a breathtaking first person shooter on the powerful Unreal Engine 4!  

- Steam Retail Price: $14.99 per unit (1 early access key) 

 - Save money by purchasing through Indiegogo

 

Stay involved with us through our official website (www.WrathOfAnna.com) and through Steam (http://store.steampowered.com/app/458520/) .  

We have two official Steam groups: 

Group A: https://steamcommunity.com/games/458520   

 Group B: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/WrathofAnna 

 

I am extremely meticulous in regards to how the gameplay needs to feel, the layout of the maps and all other aspects of the game. The 'Allegiance' plays defensively, whereas the Natives are the aggressor in regards to map control. More details about the specifics of the gameplay will be found below.

I grew up playing competitive games at the highest level, and I have been actively developing Wrath of Anna since July 2015 (utilizing Unreal Engine 4). 

My name is Michael L. Fiorentino Gutierrez (a.k.a. hamtaro in the gaming world) and I'm presenting to you a competitive FPS with brutal 5 on 5 competitive play alongside other small and large scale combat modes.  

I have self funded the game up to this point with a small amount of private assistance, and I'm here now to utilize Indiegogo to raise additional funds primarily through pre-orders.  

These funds are important and will help provide a more advanced multiplayer early access experience.The early access focuses on multiplayer gameplay; with additional episodic campaigns planned for later release.

The game has already passed Steam Greenlight voting and is listed on the Steam store for upcoming release! We need additional funding to make everything come together properly and with minimal bugs. This includes additional programming, design implementation, marketing and purchase of dedicated servers for online play.

 

 

This is an indie game that is truly unique and different from all other first person shooters. It is much different than the standard FPS not only from the Steampunk / post apocalyptic atmosphere perspective, but from a gameplay perspective as well. 

This game is prepared to serve the next generation of competitive FPS gamers.  

- eSports style 5 vs. 5 player competitive mode  

- 32 vs. 32 player battle mode  

- Modern & Steampunk weaponry  

- Unique, atmospheric post apocalyptic and steampunk environments  

- Two worlds: Earth & Drumgore


TWO FACTIONS:  

Team A: Natives

As the Natives, you will infiltrate intense environments in search of finding information about Anna and her whereabouts. You must unlock cases to find this information. A round win is designated by opening one case (found at either given Site on a map; custom maps might only include one Site at times).  


Team B: The Allegiance of Anna

Playing as a member of the Allegiance of Anna, you will do everything in your power to defend Anna, her Warcruiser and her whereabouts. You must prevent the Natives from infiltrating your compounds and attacking your faction; in addition to preventing them from unlocking cases and obtaining information. If you are playing as the Allegiance in competitive mode, you must hide your cases and information promptly at the beginning of each round and prevent them from being unlocked for the entire duration of the round.


There are a variety of both small and large scale multiplayer maps currently in rotation for testing. A few examples are spread throughout this page.

 

 


CONTACT:  

michael.g.fiorentino@gmail.com  

wrathofannagame@gmail.com  

© Michael L. Fiorentino Gutierrez

story:
“ One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure ” 
- William Feather


Hello! 

Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign page, let's get started!

  • Soulless is an atmospheric 2D puzzle platformer set in a world of silhouettes. 
  • You play as a cute creature called Elin whose main goal is to save his friend, but to do that he has to jump down the rabbit hole into a magical world which is unknown to him.
  • He is guided through the world by a light, that shines with hope, however the further he goes, he realizes the world only gets darker and darker and that he has to face his deepest fears.
  • Fight your fears in boss battles, solve the world’s many puzzles, by combining many different mechanics and learn the truth of the world you are in.

  • On the surface, it looks like a classical story of saving your friend, but if you scratch a bit deeper, it becomes more complex, and more personal.              
  • The mechanics of the game are never a constant variable, they will always change and combine from level to level.    

Among other things, yes.

The story is meant to be at the same time straightforward and abstract. Your goal is simple, save you friend. Who is that friend? Who are you? Why are you here? That's all up to you to figure it out, and we are sure everyone is going to have an idea of their own.

We did this so you can be the writer of your own story.

Elin is the main character in this game. What is he? That's for you to decide.


Elin doesn't have superpowers, he can't run at the speed of light, he can't lift a truck. He is fueled by his emotions, and that's what gives him power.

Throughout the game, he uses his intelligence to manipulate objects around him and use them to his advantage, be it small rocks or strange contraptions left behind that manipulate gravity!

He has a guide, a light that pulled him into this world. It guides Elin throughout the game and gives him hope in the darkest of hours.


Oh, also... Sometimes he can fly.


Frisky Fatal is a group of two young and aspiring 18 year old high school students with big dreams.

We have been in love with video games since we were kids, and that's what pushed us to start learning and creating.


We have a few smaller game projects behind us, through which we gathered our experience, so we could say this is our first game of this scale. 

Soulless also started as a small "for fun" project, but since we gathered many positive reactions to it, we decided to expand it, and turn it into something far greater than initially planned.

We plan on using the money to pay for all the fees associated with the game, and hopefully for our further education so we can become better.

The game is currently in development and is nearing completion. 



Now here's everyone's favorite part!

The perks are listed in the 'perks' section, here we'll go over some details regarding the designer perks.
Loyal - We will ask you what kind of an object you would like in the game, and as long as we think it is appropriate, we'll add it. This is limited however to not include extremely complex or animated objects.
Easter Egg Designer - We'll ask you what kind of an easter egg you would like to see in the game, and as long we think it is appropriate, we'll add it.
Puzzle Designer - We'll sit down and explain what kind of puzzles we already have and what we can do with the current mechanics, then you can sketch out a puzzle and as long as we think it works well, we'll add it.
Hopelight - Holy moly! You are considered our sponsor, you'll be constantly informed about the development of the game, and you will help us with choices regarding the game.

story:
What is a Gaming Cafe?

A Gaming Cafe is exactly as it sounds; a place where you can come in, get milkshakes, snacks, or some food, and play games from a whole range of the latest titles. Cyber Jacks is a social enterprise, which means we prioritise supporting our community over profit. Cyber Jacks will be a chilled place you can come to hang out with friends and play games you love on a high speed, lagless internet connection. 

What will Cyber Jacks Have to Offer?

  • A library of hundreds of games, with unlimited choice for £2-5 per hour per machine, depending which spec machine you go for 
  • A positive space to interact with friends and family
  • Snacks and refreshments
  • Power sockets and wifi to keep your own laptops and devices charged and online
  • Game gurus on staff to discuss games. Have a quick chat with one of them and you’ll be playing in no time
  • Swanky online community forums so you can interact online as well as offline, and have your say in big decisions that affect our members 

Why Do We Want to Open A Gaming Cafe?

  • As Southall residents, we think the place could do with a few more fun places for young people to hang out and play games socially. 
  • With 3 secondary schools, 1 sixth-form college and 30,000 residents in the area, we see a need for more community oriented activities where you can really have fun and interact with people in the community.
  • We love the idea of creating a locally owned space where people can socialise in person with local people and have fun without breaking the bank. We will also add value to our community through events and by creating fairly paid jobs for local people.

Why We're Crowdfunding

  • Opening a gaming cafe costs a lot of money in the beginning.  We're putting all of our own funds in, but we also want to give the community the opportunity to help us speed up the process. This will help us ensure we are making Cyber Jacks the best place possible, sooner. 
  • The £15,000 we're raising will help cover getting a lease, renovations, equipment (no dusty, slow old PCs here!), legal fees and of course, expanding our game library. 
  • Be sure to check out our perks- ways for us to say "thank you!" for anything you can contribute. 
Stay Updated
We'll keep all our contributors updated here on our Indiegogo page as we go, but you can also like us on Facebook to stay in touch. 

Risks & Challenges

Opening a small business is always risky. However, we've put in a lot of time and research and done every thing we can to meet with experts in all fields to ensure we’re on the right track and have done everything possible to make Cyber Jacks the best it can be.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute financially, it doesn’t mean you can’t help get Cyber Jacks open: 

  • Get the word out- share our twitter (@cyberjacks), instagram (cyberjacks), and facebook page (facebook.com/cyberjacks)
  • Join our forums (cyberjacks.co.uk)
  • Tell your friends!

Thank you!

story:
What is Favela Game?

Favela Game is a business which produces video games reflecting the reality of favela culture. 

“Made by communities, for communities”

We identified the lack of positive cultural representation of favela communities and created our first game, Passinho Dance. In June we launched a test version and in one week Passinho Dance (which you can download here in Google Play) was downloaded more than one thousand times on Google Play! Now, we want to leave the testing phase and develop the game even more - but we need your help. 

*See Favela Game on Globo News here and learn more about our efforts (only available in portuguese). 

Meet the Team 

We are three teens from the favela community of Rocinha who were selected by the non-profit Tunnel Lab to participate in the program Acelera Favela, where we attended workshops on entrepreneurship and technology. Using our knowledge of entrepreneurship and tech we developed business solutions which we believe will transform our community. We created a beta version of Passinho Dance and had more than 1000 downloads in one week!

Because of this result, we were selected by Estácio to participate in a a pre-acceleration program for businesses, Startup NAVE. Although the program will be free, we will have to cover the costs of transportation and alimentation, along with funds to create a complete experience and develop Passinho Dance. 


Financial Plan

We need US$2,500 to cover the cost of food and transportation for the duration of the Estácio Startup Program along with the registration costs in making Favela Game an official company here in Brazil. 

Long term goals: 

In the first year we are hoping to obtain 80,000 downloads. In the second year, we intend to obtain 500,000 downloads, develop a second game, and invest 11% of our profits into a free programming school for youth in favela communities so that they also have the opportunity to create their own game. 


This project is sponsored by Tunnel Lab.

story_txt: V
